title: L O C A T I O N!
text:
Location, location, location, location!
Unbelievably the best location you can ask for. Exactly at the famous stairs in Times square. Walking distance to all the shopping streets (Broadway, 5th). You are right next to M&M store, Disney store, Sephora and many more. 
The rooms are clean, good size, very comfortable beds. 
The service is O.K. , nothing more. 
We will definitely stay here again, whenever we visit NYC.

title: In the ❤️ of Times Square
text:
Stay here if you want to be in the center of Times Square. You’ll find yourself next door to the M&M Store and across from the Hershey store. 

The walkability rating is high being on 7th Avenue and 47th Street! We walked to Rockefeller Center, Macy's at Herald Square and Central Park. We made it to 4 different Broadway shows on foot too.

Our room was larger than other hotel rooms in NYC. There are few amenities at the hotel, but honestly you don't need them with this incredibly excellent location. 

The housekeeping manager and housekeeping staff, as well as the front desk staff, were all accommodating and provided positive experiences for us. 

We read the other reviews of this hotel and found that our experience exceeded expectations!

title: Absolutely recommended hotel
text: Strategic location behind the famous Times Square steps. Spacious room for my family of 4 with 2 grown children, very comfortable beds. Quiet and clean room. Excellent service via app, possibility to make requests for services (coffee, towels) accepted immediately. Friendly and helpful staff. Restaurant room with magnificent view. Price normal for New York. Very fast check in and check out. I would only remove the carpet and the bathroom curtain.

title: Incredible hotel, and incredible treatment from Tammy at reception!!!
text:
Incredible experience at Renaissance New York Times Square. The best is Tammy, she is one of the people in charge of reception and her treatment was incredible, very professional and very good people. When we arrived he came to the door to show us the closest places that we had asked about. And every day he was watching over us. The whole family would return, just to see it.
The hotel is incredible, very clean rooms and a very good buffet breakfast, with views of Times Square itself!!!!
I hope we can repeat soon, my children tell me to look at a new reservation!!!

—————-
Incredible experience at Renaissance New York Times Square. The best is Tammy, she is one of the people in charge of reception and her treatment was incredible, very professional and very good people. When we arrived he came to the door to show us the closest places that we had asked about. And every day he was watching over us. The whole family would return, just to see it.
The hotel is incredible, very clean rooms and a very good buffet breakfast, with views of Times Square itself!!!!
I hope we can repeat soon, my children tell me to look at a new reservation!!!

title: Well situated and reasonably priced Times Square hotel
text: Very nice hotel, friendly staff at entrance and valet area. Concierge Matthew extremely accessible, helpful and thorough. As platinum elite member, I appreciated the included breakfast buffet, as well as welcome-appetizer which we enjoyed carryout-style after returning from our evening on Broadway.

title: Outstanding service
text: The best hotel experience I have had in New York City!  The staff here is next level! Like they genuinely appreciate you being there and are so helpful and friendly. Room is very comfortable, clean and spacious. The lounge offers and amazing view of Time Square. Cocktails and appetizers are fantastic!

title: Amazing!!!
text: Located in the middle of Times Square. Close to everything uptown and easy access to the subway. Close to shows, restaurants and shopping. Rooms are super clean, staff is super friendly and helpful, nice beds and big bathroom. Amazing stay!!!

title: Poor service and lousy hotel
text:
Receptionist sucks! My key card didn’t work. Went to n fro from my room back to the lobby front desk twice and it is still NOT resolved. 

Receptionist boosted that her mechanical engineer will be at my room door by the time I come back up to my room.

Here I am waiting outside my room for more than 10 min and no one showed up:

And for all these inconveniences I didn’t even get a single word of apology from anyone in this hotel.

title: Location, location, location
text: The best thing about this hotel is its location, it is literally at Times Square, perfect location for anybody that has business or wants to explore that part of town. The rooms are small but functional, heater works well which was good considering the low temps in January. Check in and out was smooth although front desk staff not the most warm and service focused ones.

title: Agressive waiter at the bar !
text: Only one bad staff can ruin your Holidays. I went to the bar with my friend and had to go outside for a hour. So i asked to my guess to wait me at the bar and gave my room number to the lady at the bar entrance, to make sure everything my guess will order will be charged on my room number. When I came back they were harrasing my guess about the bill payment and told her she should wait for me outside! I have never seen that. Even an old waiter (with total grey hair) has been especially disrespectful, agressive and hater with us. When i asked to talk to his Manager to complain about his attitude, he told us he will call the security ! No apologize, nothing. I stayed in this Hotel for 1 week but the other positive points have been removed by this bad experience i had. I was shocked! How is it possible to hire agressive and disrespectful people like that?  Definitely don´t recommend this hotel !

title: Best hotel on Times Square!
text: We had the nicest room I've ever had in Manhattan, and the staff was great! The breakfast buffet in the R Lounge for elites was good and the view of Times Square is unmatched. I have stayed many times in this hotel for business, but having my wife with me made it extra special. We were there only one night - I wish we could have stayed longer. Thanks to the team for a great stay!

title: Great location and view for Times Square
text:
The hotel’s location is amazing! It’s close by yellow line of subway. The restaurant view for Times Square allows you to have an unique experience. 
The room is very big, considering other hotels in NYC. 
Only bad part is the bathroom, which it’s old with bathtub.

title: Great value for money for location and for those in the Platinum Bonvoy category.
text: Great location for those who like NY and want to enjoy Time Square. Spectacular view from the restaurant. Great service at reception and concierge. Clean room and good bed. There is no cabinet or drawers. Expensive breakfast due to limited food options. Bonvoy Platinum customer does not pay. I recommend.

title: AWESOME
text: The hotel was wonderfully located, almost everything was in walking distance. If needed there was a Subway station very close by. The staff was lovely and the rooms cleaned well. If I come to New York again I will definitely stay here again & recommend it to others who wanna go to New York.

title: Very good hotel
text:
Very good hotel, you’re close to almost anything, like stores, subways etc..

The breakfast is good, beds are very comfy and the staff are really nice. 

10/10 would recommend and go again.

I went with my mom and my sister and we highly enjoyed our stay there.

title: Renaissance Hotel
text: The hotel was amazing, extra clean, spacious, the staff were exceptional!! Everything in walking distance!!! Fabulous!!Great views all rooms have city view!! The bath tub was huge and you could sit and relax, and the area was safe!! Definitely recommend and will definitely stay there again!!

title: Thank you Tammy
text: Thank you Tammy! Tammy made our stay a success! Our initial reservation upon Checkin was incorrect and she worked it out for us! Everyday she had a smile on her face and called us by name! She had suggestions and good recommendations! She went above and beyond!

title: Great location
text:
We stayed at the Renaissance Times Square for a few nights right before Christmas. The hotel is in a great location, located right in the heart of Times Square.  The theaters, Rockefeller center, etc. are all within walking distance.
The checkin is on the first floor, which is small and dark, so not a good first impression or initial "wow' factor when entering.  The bellmen are very nice, and will hold your luggage, etc.  You have to take the elevator to the lobby, which includes a great restaurant (glass walls with surrounding views of Times Square).  The food was very good, including the breakfast buffet.  The restaurant (R lounge) is pretty small, so make a reservation for a dinner table, especially during the holidays.  The breakfast buffet is also at the R lounge, and there can be quite a wait, especially after 8-8:30 in the morning.  There is a bar, with good drinks and service.  Other than the room coffee maker, there is no where in the hotel that serves coffee.  It would have been nice to have a coffee/beverage service area in the lobby.  There is a Starbucks, Krispy Kreme, and Duncan within one block of the hotel however.  
The hotel was clean and decorated very nicely.  The rooms are large for NYC standard (300 sq feet).  We had a "king" room with a chaise lounge (advertised as "sleeps 3").  You really cannot use the chaise lounge as a bed (more like a "toddler" bed).  They did offer to bring up a rollaway bed, but my child and I just ended up sleeping in the "king" bed   The king bed is more the size of a small queen however, FYI.  The housekeeping was good, and we had no room issues.  All elevators were working, and arrived in a timely manner.  We were on the 20th floor, with a full view of Times Square down below.  Although it is right on Times Square, the sound proofing was pretty good.
The location is fantastic.  There is a subway stop "yellow line" right outside the hotel entrance.  Although I was apprehensive initially, it was very easy to use the subway.  The stop right outside the hotel goes to the Oculus, 911, Statue of Liberty ferry, Union square, Soho (Prince street subway stop), Brooklyn, etc.  You can now use a credit card, which made it very easy.  Central Park is about 6 blocks away also, with the museums about 2 miles from the hotel.  We also walked to Grand Central Station and the Bryant Park area.  Bryant Park was ok, but we much preferred the Union Station market and shopping area.
The location is also perfect if planning on going to the shows.  The "TKTS" discounted ticket booth is right next to the hotel.  We saw two shows, and purchased really, really good seats, at a significantly discounted price at the TKTS booth.
The location really made it easy to enjoy all of the NYC activities.  It is a solid 4-star NYC hotel with very friendly staff.  You will walk out into the heart of Times Square, right into the hustle and bustle of NYC.  If you are looking for lodging on a quiet street, may want to look elsewhere.
p.s. the Hershey store is right across the street, highly recommend one of their loaded milkshakes and tollhouse cookie sundae.

title: Optimal Location
text:
If you are aiming for the Times Square tourist experience, the Renaissance is perfect.  The restaurant and bar overlooks the square and has the high energy throughout. There was always a concierge ready to assist with adventures.  The reception, restaurant and bar staff were all friendly and accommodating.

Our room was not loud.  1807.  The darkening shades worked well because we slept in every day. 

Another reviewer noted a problem with the bar being open.  Not sure what the situation was but when we were there right before Christmas they had a full bar and we loved having a drink with that view after a long day. 

Big thank you to Alex at the bar who kindly took pictures of us and knew the best locations and angles.

title: Amazing location but at the mercy of the consideration of fellow guests
text: Being able to stay right in the middle of a location known world wide is quite remarkable. Everyone we met at the hotel was very nice and helpful. The hotel restaurant has a view that looks out over bustling Times Square and straight at the Time Square Ball. The hotel is pleasant. Parking is tricky and I recommend calling the hotel about ten minutes before you arrive for instructions. It will be noisy from outside activities like sirens because of the city life but I expect that must be true of most hotels in NYC. I had a problem during the night because someone in a neighboring room turned their TV on at 2:30AM for at least an hour. I had ear plugs and a white noise device playing but it was still loud enough to wake myself and my sons. I do not know if the noise reduction was just a problem in our room or typical of the rest of the hotel but I likely wouldn't return because of this issue.

title: Very smooth, positive experience
text: This hotel is centrally located in the heart of Times Square and is a convenient place to get to just about anything you want to see in the area.  We had a very positive experience from start to finish, with a smooth check-in process and an easily accessible layout.  Everything was very clean, and I appreciated the extra safety measure of using our key cards to utilize the elevators.  Our room was decently size, with a comfortable bed and modern amenities.  The view of Times Square was lovely!  I will add that since this hotel is in Times Square, there's a perpetual faint hum of noise from both vehicular and pedestrian traffic.  The hotel does a good job of blocking out most of the noise, but if you require complete silence, be sure to mention it to the front desk when you check in.  There's a restaurant here, although we didn't try it (the menu looked good, though).  The staff are very friendly and professional.  Prices reflect the central location of the hotel (Times Square is a coveted spot).

title: Front Desk
text: My husband and I just came back from a three night stay at The Renaissance Times Square. We have stayed there for many years and Tammy at the front desk has always been wonderful. Once again she made she we had a good stay helping us check in after a red eye from the West Coast.  She is always friendly, professional and helpful.  Always a bonus when she is working during our stay.

title: Localização e quartos grandes
text: Localização excelente, quarto amplo e confortável, à vista do bar para a Times Square é linda, o café da manhã é bom, mas a vista do restaurante é incrível!!!O único inconveniente é o barulho da Times Square, mesmo assim ficaríamos no hotel novamente.

title: Great hotel, be aware of noise and light.
text:
This hotel is centrally located right in the heart of Times Square. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, grocery stores, and attractions. As with most Renaissance hotels, this is typical with a hip and upbeat atmosphere. All staff interaction from front desk, security, and breakfast was great.

The breakfast offers a variety of options: Cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit, eggs, and self service Starbucks coffee. They have both caffeinated and decaffeinated as well as a variety of teas.

My standard room was slightly larger than your average New York City room. It was approximately 300 ft.² and perfect for my overnight stay. The room, as well as the rest of the hotel, has a modern and contemporary decor. The shower was great and offered liquid pump body wash, shampoo, and conditioner.

Anyone reading this review may be surprised by what I’m about to say, considering my 5-star review. The hotel is terrific, however, I won’t stay here again. I’m sensitive to noise and light. With its prime location right on Broadway, in the middle of Times Square, the noise can be irritating at times. The hotel is next to the main plaza where they have concerts. The thumping was annoying, but luckily, it ended by 9 PM. With the shades drawn, the flashing neon light can be seen. I also have a White Noise app on my phone, and unfortunately, I still heard the outside noise even though I was on the 14th floor.

If you’re sensitive to noise and light, you may want to consider another hotel. I didn’t want this to affect the rating of the hotel itself.

title: Very very Disappointed!!
text:
Starting with the few positives the staff in the hotel were really friendly and helpful. Additionally, the beds were extremely comfortable. Now for the negatives. On arrival at check-in, we were informed that the hotel had no licence to open the bar for the 4 nights of our stay. One of the reasons for returning to this hotel was to be able to sit in the big glass windows with a cocktail and watch the hudtle and bustle of times square below. We were so disappointed that this could happen in a so called 4 star hotel that was still advertising the bar on their website. There was an apology, but that was it ... no offer to compensate for the loss of service or offer any alternative. It was bad!!! On top of no bar seevice they did not even have a proper coffee machine to offer latte or capacchino. Again, very poor.
Secondly, the lifts were really slow, and sometimes only 1 out of 3 seemed to work. Being on the 20th floor meant we wasted loads of time just trying to escape the hotel.
The final straw was  on the 3rd day of breakfast. we had self-serve for tea or coffee, which we could cope with except that only paper cups we available. Then it was plastic knives and forks. You could not make it up!!!
So to sum up we will never stay here again. NEVER.

title: Bonvoy needs to remove this hotel from their offerings or hire new competent management.
text: I stayed at the Renaissance in Chelsea (which is exactly the amazing experience I would expect from a Bonvoy) earlier in the week for work and then planned on meeting family at the Renaissance Times Square for a Broadway show “Here Lies Love” (which was amazing!). I’m a loyal Bonvoy member and have never had such a bad experience as this weekend. The staff were not very knowledgeable about much (except for the bell desk manager who quickly and expertly got us a cab out of the city before the marathon started), the elevators barely worked and it took half an hour and an 18 story trip down the stairwell carrying our suitcases to finally get to the lobby after we had given up on the elevators, the rooms were not clean at all as there was mold all over the shower tile and to top it off, the hotel had lost their liquor license and were not able to sell or serve alcohol all weekend. They only told you when you checked in I assume so you didn’t have any choice but to stay there. We had to walk to the Marriott Marquis through the crowds each not to have a drink at their bar. I am soooo sorry I didn’t stay at the MM instead. This Renaissance needs a complete overhaul as I assume that faulty and dangerous elevators and losing your liquor license are indicators of very incompetent management. Please Bonvoy, do not let this place take down your reputation for amazing experiences. And please folks coming to NYC, there are other nearby Bonvoy properties that are 1000% better! You have been warned.

title: Good location but very expensive.
text: The hotel is old and really pricey. The room was ok , but comfortable. Location is good. We went to the lounge whic has a good view of Times Square. We dit not try the restaurant but it seens to be nice.

title: Great City Visit
text:
The staff was very friendly at check in and offered some additional services. 
Restaurant was very nice and accommodated us with seats by the windows. The large windows offered great views of Times Square.  The rooms were clean and well appointed. Concierge services were available and offered complimentary tourist tickets.

title: NYE 2022 experience
text:
Stayed here during NYE 2022, 2 adults and 2 teenagers, we had a room facing 7th Ave so we can hear the action but not quite see it as the windows only open outwards just a couple of inches but we did request a high floor and got it

The restaurant area were already closed since afternoon of Dec 31st and they cheekily put a black drape over the whole entrance to not let non table payers (very very expensive) able to see the balldrop

Location is as close to the action as you can get but this is also a handicap as this means getting a ride with uber takes a long time due to traffic almost 24 hrs a day

On NYE the few blocks around TS was closed but if you are a room card holder you can freely roam to and fro the hotel to the barrier, as long as you dont hang out in the streets for too long

Everything else is standard hotel stuff, nothing too amazing nor bad

title: Great location and friendly employees.
text: This is a lovely hotel right in the heart of the theater district.  We stayed here for one night prior to leaving on a cruise so that we would be close to the Neil Simon Theater, where we were seeing MJ The Musical (cannot recommend this play enough!!). The employee that checked me in was very friendly and efficient.  The first floor holds just the reception desk and then you take the elevator to the second floor, which is where their restaurant and lounge/bar area is, as well as the concierge.  From this floor you use your keycard to access the higher floors from a different set of elevators.  Our room was nicely sized, clean and comfortable.  Zero complaints.  While this area in general is very hectic (Times Square) it is central to many things. If I were returning to see a show I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.  Special shout out to the Concierge, Omar, who made us feel very welcome.  I was traveling with my 13-year-old son and they struck up a conversation.  Omar also treated me to a lovely bottle of cabernet since it was my birthday and gave us some recommendations on where to grab a bite to eat.  We did have a cocktail and birthday dessert, which was delicious, after the play but cannot attest to the rest of the food in the restaurant.

title: Outstanding service!
text:
We stayed at this hotel recently over a 4-day span.  Everyone at the hotel, from top to bottom, was excellent!  Since it was our first time in New York, we knew we couldn't see everything in four days.  
But, with the help of Omar, their concierge, we were able to see as many of the sights as possible.  We got stuck in the historic downpour, but even then, Omar had ideas for us. 
The view of Times Square was amazing!  We were also able to walk to see a Broadway show (we saw Moulin Rouge--not to be missed!)  We were also able to walk to nice restaurants.
The food was good.  My only wish was that there was a wider selection.  The hotel offers a daily food credit, if you pay for your stay up front.
We would definitely go back here when we return to New York.

title: Great Location
text: We arrived at the Hotel 2 hours before check in (which was at 4pm). No problem, the hotel took our bags and secured them, they gave us a ticket for each case so we could get them when needed. The hotel is in a great location, right in Times Square, there were plenty of bars and restaurants to go to, and the subway was 2 minutes away. We returned to the Hotel lobby, this was small and dark, however, 2 floors up via a lift was the actual lobby. Here you could find the bar and restaurant and it was light and roomy. You also got the lifts to your room from here. We inquired about when our room would be ready and was told someone would be up to the lobby to let us know and give us our room key. We managed to check into the room just after 4pm. We chose a Terrace Room, what we did not know was that each 'Terrace' room had a different sized terrace, we drew the short straw and got a small balcony that could just about fit 2 chairs. I was also a little concerned about the state of the artificial grass, it wasn't the cleanest. Still, the room was large for NY and the bed very comfortable. The shower was great and our room was cleaned to a good standard each day.  The gym is good, there are towels and cold water available. The equipment was in good working order although the air con could have been a little colder. Please note that your are in Times Square, so although the windows kept a lot of the noise out, it was not completely quiet, also, the blackout curtains had a gap at the top, so if you are sensitive to light, bring an eye mask. We had dinner in the hotel on our last day overlooking Times Square and it was great, a nice end to our holiday. Now the down part, when we returned home, we saw that the hotel had charged us $6 each for bottle water in the room, there was no notice indicating that this water was NOT free,  likewise, you can review your bill daily and at no point did this charge appear on it. They also tried to charge us $54 why? well they didn't know either. We had to check out early and there was no-one on reception so we could not query anything until we got home.  We never got a refund for the water as they implied it was clearly noted (hmmmm).  We love Marriott's and would stay in them again, just not here.

title: Ideal location.
text:
Our first trip to New York from the UK.
Had a room on 25th Floor and despite what everyone said it wasn't at all noisy. It's very convenient, not only for Times Square but also numerous subway stations within a couple of blocks.
The entrance and foyer are a bit underwhelming and very tight, but on taking the elevator to the lobby above it opens out.
The lobby has the R bar and Restaurant which are a lot smaller than in the pictures, but do have superb views over Times Square.
You need to take another elevator to get to the rooms, for which you need your pass key. These are slightly hidden behind a large column. The public areas were always clean and tidy.
The room we had, on the north east corner was fine, nice big bed, plenty of room, a sofa, a desk, hanging space and some drawers give you everything you need.
The bathroom is bigger than expected with a shower.
Certainly there were a few "maintenance" items that mean it's not perfect. Our room had a cracked corner to the bathroom mirror, the plug in the sink din't work, making washing difficult and there was rot in the door frame from the leak from the shower. Throughout the hotel there were little bit that needed attention, but nothing to cause a problem
We'd certainly book to stay there again

title: Still my Favorite!
text: Renaissance to the rescue. Tried a different Marriott property hotel and should have known better (not a good experience … different review). Thankfully they had a room left and even got us in our room before check in time. Always reliable. Perfect location and view! Cozy room, bed and great shower pressure. Check in and housekeeping staff were friendly. Giant pretzel in the restaurant always a hit! I’ll never book a different hotel in NYC! Thank you Renaissance for always being a reliable choice!

title: The best Times Square hotel by far
text:
Having stayed at many of the hotels nearby, I can say that this is my favourite.

The location is of course great, but the welcome/check in, hotel staff and room were exemplary.

We will come here for our next visit to New York.

title: Exceptional Hotel with Exceptional Service
text: From the moment we stepped up to the front desk until we checked out, our experience was fantastic! We were greeted by Justin C. who welcomed us and took care of every detail to assure that our experience was nothing less than great. Justin and the hotel staff were consistently warm, friendly, helpful, very nice and very accommodating. The hotel is beautiful, a quiet oasis, conveniently located in Times Square, exceptionally clean and modern. We could not have asked for a better experience! We will definitely stay here again.

title: LOOK NO FURTHER!! THIS IS THE PERFECT HOTEL!!
text: I am a self proclaimed hotel snob and this hotel did not disappoint!!.   It is CLEAN, the bathroom vanity and shower is big for NY,  loved the complimentary Aveda toiletries, the bed was comfortable,  staff was very friendly and helpful, and  the location is perfect!   We will definitely stay here again when we return.

title: Very good hotel at the heart of Times Square
text: Very good hotel, excellent location at Times Square, good size rooms and the restaurant is a hidden gem, with a spectacular view of Times Square, excellent place to eat something and enjoy the view without the crowds below at Times Square, we recommended the hotel.

title: Fantastic
text:
We stayed for 4 nights at the Renaissance hotel and had the best time. 
The staff was welcoming and helpful. 
We had booked a double room ( 2 double beds), we were on 9th floor. Not noisy at all, great views on Times Square billboards. Plenty of space in the room for 3 people and very clean.
We were celebrating 2 birthdays which I had flagged in advance and they put balloons and cake in our room, very thoughtful and greatly appreciated.

Very central location. Subway station outside the hotel which was really handy (we managed to get directly from there to Battery Park/ferry for Statue of Liberty in about 15 minutes).
Great lobby area and bar/restaurant. 
We had breakfast at the hotel most days and used our daily 30 USD credit.
Staff in the restaurant were efficient and polite although at times we felt a little bit rushed to leave. Small buffet at breakfast but with different options each day and all the basics available (sausages/eggs/bacon/waffles/fruits/bagels etc)
Diner menu is a little bit limited but the quality of the food was good.

Omar the concierge was absolutely wonderful and we regretted not having met him on our first day. He was so helpful and gave us lots of good tips and advice. 

On our last day we left our suitcases at the hotel after we checked out for a few hours. Gregory got us a taxi right outside the hotel when we were ready to leave for the airport, no need to pre book.

The only negatives : the reception downstairs is very small and unassuming. 
A bit awkward to have to get 2 lifts (1 from reception to the main lobby and from lobby to the bedrooms).
Bathroom a bit tired (musty smell, and shower pipe worn and kind of falling apart, we had to get that fixed during our stay).

All in all a great stay and my daughter wants to return to Renaissance next time we are back in NYC!!

title: Great Location and pleasant surprise
text: The hotel is in a great location, staff are friendly, rooms are spacious, and the beds are comfortable.  I travel a lot for work, and the lower tier Marriott hotel do not acknowledge tier status (which is fine) but we were pleasantly surprised to find a personalized note welcoming us and thanking me for being an Ambassador with welcome gift.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This place was amazing. Great location, easy to get to, wonderful staff. Great view from the bars at night. The open top buses stop very close, there are tons of restaurants. Try the restaurants on the top for food and drinks. Also, great workout facility overlooking Times Square. Very close to Broadway.

title: If you have to stay in Times Square, a decent choice
text:
First, as someone who has been to NYC many times for both business and pleasure, there's very little reason to stay in Times Square.  It is crowded, loud, dirty, and the novelty wears off very quickly.  You'll enjoy your trip more if you stay in Chelsea, SoHo, Gramercy, etc., even if you are, say, spending a lot of time near the Broadway theaters.  That said, we stayed in Times Square just to "say we did it," and the Renaissance was decent.  

Pros:
- Room was relatively large by NYC standards
- Housekeeping was great; daily service, plenty of towels
- Good location from a public transit perspective--i.e., close to almost all major subway lines
- Room had a modern feel and seemed remodeled recently-ish
- Good value (by NYC standards)
- The $30 a day resort fee does effectively get credited back to you through meal credits, tickets to attractions, etc.
- Close to a lot of cheesy Times Square attractions, which your kids might enjoy

Cons:
- No bathtub in our unit (showers only)
- Annoyingly have to take two elevators to get to street level.  Street level lobby is very small.
- If you are on lower floors (i.e., 14 and below), you will hear the din from Times Square  
- Restaurant is mediocre, and the staff pretty indifferent to your presence.  
- Agree with other reviewers that the pillows are terrible 
- The first floor and second floor lobbies seem a little tired
- Traffic (pedestrian and vehicular) is terrible in this area

title: Great place to stay
text: The hotel is in a great location. We always stay here when in the city time square is outside the door. Valet parking is fast and convenient, and customer service is awesome rooms are clean and comfortable.

title: Zen and Whimsical Hotel in a Prime Location
text:
This is a lovely hotel in the heart of Times Square with a great location. It's steps away from Times Square, a subway stop is right outside the entrance, and cabs are constantly coming down 7th Avenue. Every staff member we encountered was super nice. The vibe is very zen and whimsical thanks to the appearance of dozens of sheep, both 2-D and 3-D.  And our room was pretty comfortable despite facing the street. Blackout curtains kept the glow of huge TV screens outside at bay, and things quiet down nicely at night, so the lack of sound-proof windows was never an issue for us.

I have two critiques. First, the pillows were terrible. Both the feather and non-allergenic pillows collapsed to the thickness of a pancake when I put my head down, even when stacking them. I fell asleep eventually, but each morning I woke up with a stiff neck and shoulders. Also, the breakfast is okay but overpriced. It's a buffet with an outstanding view of Times Square for those who get a seat facing that direction. But $30 a pop did not match the quality of hot foods and danish available, even by New York standards.

title: Great Location and Views from hotel
text: Excellent staff - very professional and always there to assist! A big shout out to Mani who is always there to help with taxi’s and great service! Also great location in the heart of Times Square! Thank you to a great staff!

title: NY com crianças
text: Hotel super bem localizado, quarto muito amplo e muito confortável pra um casal e duas crianças grandes ( 15 e 10 anos), banheiro muito espaçoso, ótimo café da manhã - com uma vista incrível da Times Square! E do lado do metrô! Achamos perfeito em todos os aspectos.

title: Good stay
text: Not much to say. It was a good stay. The front-of-house staff was accommodating and friendly. We stayed through New years.  Only had one issue with a restaurant staff who literally tried to get rid of us mid-meal by giving us the bill as we are still eating. We wanted to order more but were turned off by his actions. We provided feedback to the food and beverage manager and she acknowledged the issue and apologized for the inconsistent customer service. She also gave us a complimentary breakfast the next day. That was nice. But otherwise, the stay was good. Very centrally located. A bit chaotic during the leading up to New Year's Eve, but overall we'd stay here again.

title: Absolutely fabulous darling! Totally recommend!
text:
The beds and pillows are soo comfortable!
The bathrooms are a great size!
The hotel is great!
The location!
The restaurant/bar 
The food!
The staff are very helpful!
We would love to come back one day!
Totally recommend this hotel!

title: R lounge was magical!
text: Our stay was excellent. Everything we wanted to do with our twin girls was within walking distance. Booked as a surprise bday trip for my husband and we all had the best time! Our room was decorated with a big balloon and a bottle of Prosecco was waiting for us on arrival which was truly appreciated. The best part of the entire stay was breakfast at the R lounge. The views are incredible. The way the light hits the restaurant in the morning was magical. Our two little girls loved sitting here and taking in all the views of Times Square. We enjoyed drinks at the bar in the evenings. The daily credit is also very easy to use for taking out food to the room (their is no room service). And the quality of the food was delicious! Wonderful place! Highly recommend it.

title: Well worth the money
text:
Fantastic location. Great staff. Very clean and well worth the money.
The view from the resteraunt over Times Square is superb.
Rooms were a great size, well decorated and kept.
I have no complaints after our stay there.

title: Buen hotel
text: Excelente hotel, buena ubicación. Restaurante sencillo. Muy buen servicio de todos. Problema que tienes que coger dos ascensores para llegar a la habitación. Aprovechad oferta de la tasa de estancia.

title: Great Stay At Renaissance Times Square
text:
Stayed 5 nights on cash rate $279, not bad for price for NYC.
While this hotel is in Times Square, it's on the northern edge and is a bit out of the madness of TS.  You can come out the front door, turn left on 7th Ave and be out of Times Square in a block or so.  There are numerous subway stations close by, but I was counciled by my NYC friends not to ride the subway.  Right or wrong I took their advice but Ubers & taxi's added up.  
Checked in at 2:30 and asked if I wanted high floor or low and opted for high, so FDA told me she had 2 bed room on 19th floor.  Fine, just me but 2 beds is ok, some place to put some of my crap.  I think they were 2 doubles rather than 2 queens.
She explained the “destination fee” (see photo), which I hate but actually provides some value.  I used the F&B credit every day and actually used the free Guggenheim ticket.  
Breakfast is provided during the week in the restaurant/lounge and was a decent buffet. You can get coffee and water there too.  I also got vouchers for a free appetizer for 3 of the 5 nights from a limited list that included cheesecake, pizza, pretzel and salad.   I got the cheesecake 2 nights and took to my room for a late dessert.  
On Saturday morning I had breakfast at Junior's a block away on 49th (not the one by the Marquis).  Sunday I just got a muffin from the little bakery next door.  
I am Titanium, no upgrade unless the upper floor is an upgrade.  Not a big deal, room was good and spacious by NY standards and had a view of the Edition across the street and some of the TS signs. It was not totally quiet of course but the noise didn't bother me too much and was mostly muted.  Those who are sensitive to noise would be better off elsewhere or bring earplugs. 
The room had a safe, fridge, standard Marriott coffemaker and desk.  Bathroom was a decent size and had a tub.  I prefer no tub, but it was ok.  Housekeeping was done daily.  I think the rooms could use a refurbishment but they were clean and everything worked and there were not signs of extensive wear.  
The only issue I had was the safe didn't work because the battery was low.  I called the front desk and within 10 minutes maintenance and security were there to fix it.  
The highlight for me was the bar and particularly the bartenders.  Raffie, Atikul and one other gentleman who's name I missed were great.  Very nice and super service.  I will also all staff members  I encountered were pleasant and helpful.  
If you want a decent hotel and don't mind a busy location at a reasonable rate I'd recommend this place.

title: Utterly superb hotel in a perfect location
text: Situated right on the edge of Times Square, with marvellous views of the whole space from the restaurant, the Renaissance is an absolute gem of a place. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out, every member of staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and valued. The room and bedding were spotlessly clean and although we were only on the 6th floor and in spitting distance of Times Square itself, we hardly heard a sound from outside. Instead of moaning about the resort fee, we made full use of it and opted to take breakfast and one evening meal at the hotel. The breakfasts were excellent, with plenty of choice. And dinner surpassed expectations - the cocktails even more so. I cannot fault the Renaissance and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it to anyone. It will certainly be my first choice for future trips to New York because of the location - it’s within easy walking distance of most places of interest in the city - the cleanliness, but most of all the staff who I made our stay so memorable.

title: nice experience, difficult warranty recovery
text:
Positives: room furniture, amenities, bathroom, breakfast, cleaning, position, nice stuff.
Negative: after 9 working days  from check out - still not receive the 500 $ guarantee.
very difficult to contact the hotel and impossible to have one simple conversation with them;
Recommendation; add some vegetable at breakfast.

title: Great place
text: Stayed 3 nights with kids 13 and 11. The hotel is located in the heart of time square, every place we looked up to walk was only 7 minutes away. Lively bar scene at night and great views, yet our room was quiet at night. Rooms are standard New York size but clean and nicely outfitted. Exceptional service. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: New York 🇺🇸
text:
Right in the heart of Times Square this hotel is a perfect location.
Hotel is stylish and the staff and very friendly. 
It’s €30 a night in taxes but you do get this back to spend in the bar/restaurant daily. 
One morning we decided to go for breakfast at the hotel, it was €30 each so we only paid for 1. Sadly is was very poor, the hot food was tepid and not that great at all. Not worth €30 for two people.
They do supply shampoo, conditioner, body wash etc which were good sizes and also replenished.
We had a coffee machine, I only drink tea so I was pleased to see they had a tea sachet option. The tea came out tasting of coffee so this wasn’t the best.
Overall though, I’d recommend this hotel.

title: Valentine’s Day get away
text: We had such an amazing time at this hotel. Is it a great location very clean and the staff was amazing to name a few when you’re greeted downstairs they have Taylor, Justin  and Valentino. All amazing employees very kind and went out of their way to help us …also the restaurant beautiful view good food (they have no entrées wish the menu was a bit bigger, but nevertheless,) we had Mohammed as the host and he was so wonderful We had a mixup with our Valentine’s Day reservation at a different restaurant and showed up at the last minute and he was able to adjust a few things and get us a spot at the last minute with a great view. Our waitress was Marlene. For dinner and we had Micheal in the morning for breakfast great time with both servers ..Food was delicious. The room was clean. The hotel was beautifully decorated with a great fragrance to it, and everyone just went out of their way to make it a great time. I will definitely be going back.

title: A Times Square Hotel that is actually in Times Square
text:
Unlike other hotels this one is actually right in the heart of Times Square so if you are wanting a central location then this is the place for you.

Having been to New York on previous occasions we came across this hotel and decided that on our next trip this would be where we would base ourselves. 

Prior to our arrival we had contacted the hotel with all of questions and request being answered promptly.

Check-in was smooth and hassle free which was appreciated after a long day spent travelling. Our room was also ready ahead of the guaranteed check-in time!

Our room was on the 24th floor with it offering the views you would expect from a New York City hotel.

The room was pleasant and provided all the usual mod cons although looking tired in places. The bed was superb, huge and very comfortable! 

The only facility we used within the hotel whilst staying was the bar, which’s offers an excellent view out onto Times Square, the service was good with all staff pleasant. The drinks were also well priced given the location.

On our departure day the hotel happily stored our luggage as well as organising a taxi back to the airport for our flight home. 

The hotel is clean, tidy and offers a nice vibe.

title: Left a Bad Tate in Your Mouth
text:
Dear Mr. Melvin Dore,

My name is Janine Ridley and a guest of your Renaissance Hotel on Broadway checking in on January 1st departure January 4th, on the morning of our departure I traveled to your restaurant as I did every morning to get two cups  of coffee, on the first morning I offered payment for the two cups of coffee and your hostess said it was complimentary so in the morning I would approach the hostess give my room number then retrieve my coffee but not the morning of departure your hostess was lecturing me on how it’s only complimentary if she wants to give it to me so then I responded yes please two cups, she said I didn’t understand and continued to lecture me very loud and abrasive, at first I thought what is wrong is she serious, I offed to pay for coffee not wanting anything for free and she said that your restaurant does not sell single items??? We have coffee in our room.  So as I was ready to leave one of the team members that waited on us at the breakfast buffet which we ate every morning (breakfast was very good) approached me and escorted me to the coffee station.
After getting my coffee I went to view your hostess name off her name tag and she covered it (Lana) and mentioned for me to travel to your front desk to complain and I did spoke with a nice young lady name Taylor and she had all the right answer as this was no way to be treated and was to leave a bad taste in your mouth We understand more then anyone about hospitality business we own a beautiful boutique hotel on the St. Lawerence River in the 1000 Islands Edgewood Resort and Conference Center,  We know it is in difficult times with staffing, and fragile on how to handle them, but this display of your team member always reflects the management My husband and I select your hotel whenever we travel to the city it is our first selection we will continue, just want to bring this issue to your attention because it was very embarrassing and abusive episode matter of you team members approach.
Regards,
Janine M. Ridley

Want to note the General Manager's Quick fast response 

Good Day Ms. Ridley

Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback and my apologies for the inconvenience you experienced this morning.

We will address this with the team. As our breakfast during the week is set up as a club lounge we do not have the capability to charge for individual items and we solely charge for the entire buffet or a continental buffet.

Our staff is trained to always prioritize our guests needs and are empowered to provide complimentary coffee as a delighter to guests who may ask. I will speak with the hostess in regards to this incident and use this as a training opportunity so that we can continue to improve the service we provide.

I have added an additional $30.00 credit to your account as a gesture of good will which will cover one of your breakfast charges for yesterday's breakfast.

We look forward to hosting you again in the future.

Warm regards,

Melvin Dore
Senior Operations Manager
Renaissance New York Times Square
714 Seventh Avenue, New York NY 10036
T  212.261.5103  F  212.765.1962
Renaissance Hotels

title: GREATEST NEW YEAR’S CELEBRATION EVER!!!
text: My experience at the New York Times Square renaissance hotel was the best New Year’s Eve hotel experience I received. I was here to celebrate the new year in Times Square which became the very first time I ever celebrated New Year’s Eve in Times Square in person. Everything here was great and the management was best. I also liked the fact that while I was waiting to bring food back to my room, I got to find a window so I could get a photo of myself to celebrate the new year in style. I totally recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a hotel to stay at during New Year’s Eve, and those who wanna stay at a hotel very close to Times Square. I am genuinely thankful for the opportunity I got to have. I hope to stay here again!

title: Great hotel in a good location if u want to stay in Times Square but be warned they charge $100 per night as a deposit
text: We stayed here on the 12th of December for 6 nights! It’s in a great location in Times Square and the rooms was always nice and clean with great views of Times Square! The food was really nice and the staff was all friendly!! The only one bad thing I experienced is that I wasn’t to know that they charge $100 per night as it didn’t state this on virgin holidays so we had to pay $600 plus the $30 plus tax per night so just be warned if your going to stay there and are on a budget!! Other than that it’s a really nice hotel! Also when stying in Times Square watch out for the scammers they are all dressed up and say take a picture but then demand money off of u

title: Nice hotel and great location if you want to be part of the crowd of Times Square.
text:
Nice hotel right at the edge of Times Square. I am a Marriott Platinum member and enjoy most of the  perks. My two issues with this hotel is that they don’t offer complimentary breakfast every day for Marriott Club Members, but only on the weekdays. My other issue is that they charge the “resort fee” of $30 per day, that you can use only in the restaurant, which is open from 7 pm to 11 pm. If you have theater tickets in the evening, it makes it very difficult to use.  Addendum- they closed the restaurant and bar one night for a private party,  so we could not use the bar/ dining room, which is the only one in the hotel
Very poor accommodation for the Marriott Club members.

title: Great second stay, love it here.
text: Lovely stay at the renaissance for the second time in NYC! Lovely room, staff are kind and helpful, food is delicious, atmosphere great and the location you can't beat! Rooms are spacious and come with all amenities. Would only stay here now when we visit NYC!

title: Very average at best
text: Traveled to NYC this past weekend for a couple nights and decided to give the Renaissance a try. The location and view of times square can't be beat.  It is a small hotel and the staff were nice and professional.. The display easel outside of the lobby elevators that listed the month's events had the month of November on there for our stay from dec 3rd thru 5th.  Not a good first impression.. We are a family of 3 with an early 20s adult daughter and decided upon the terrace room on floor 4. The room was very small and frankly not suitable for 3 adults. There was a small chaisse type thing that the 3rd person was to sleep on that was hard as a rock. No bueno for $800 + a night. The pictures on the site are deceiving for this room. We would up having to.purchase a 2nd room for $1200.. It is an updated room but the sink is in the room next to the bed and not in the room with the shower and toilet. The shower room had no exhaust fan.. There are no dressers to store clothes and very small area to hang clothes. Very disappointed in the room. The lounge was very small and crowded. Breakfast buffet was meh and at $30 per expected more. We were billed $12 for 2 bottles of Evian water in our room despite not touching them.  We.wont return to the Renaissance.

title: WORST HOTEL IN TIME SQUARE BEWARE !!!!!!!
text:
OMG ! where do we start !!
no room service, no mini bar they charge you 12 dollars for bottled water every day so you can have a horrible coffee in your room  from the nasty coffee machine WIFI is chargeable at crazy prices and no phone signal in the rooms 
the bar is closed all day in the hotel sometimes opens mid afternoon if your lucky 
the hotel bar / restaurant meals are dreadful no choice and again silly prices  
you need to go in 2 lifts to access the hotel rooms and they take forever 
some not all of the hotel staff were very rude at the reception and clearly not bothered about customer service or doing a days work 
sorry but the worst ever boring miserable hotel in a great location my honest opinion don't stay here it ruined our holiday

title: Location, Location, Location!!
text:
Generously sized room, great breakfasts with a fabulous view of Times Square, helpful courteous staff and an easy walk to anywhere….what’s not to love?!!
Clean fitness center on the fourth floor. 
As a long time Bonvoy member, it was a delight to find this Manhattan gem.

title: Perfect location for exploring NYC
text: This hotel is right in the hustle & bustle of Times Square and provided great atmosphere. Check in was great and Louis was very friendly and made us feel welcome. Not a major problem but my Daughters hideaway bed wasn’t in our room before arrival which was odd as booking clearly stated 2 adults & a child, however Louis promised it would be done pronto and it was.  I do feel though that rather than add an extra bed to the room the sofa could have been converted into a bed to save space. We were visiting from the UK to celebrate my 50th birthday so it was lovely to check into our room and be greeted with balloons, wine & chocolates compliments of the hotel. We were on the 11th floor looking out over the Morgan Stanley billboard. Some faint noise could be heard but not enough to interfere with sleep. Omar on the concierge team was fab. Always greeted you with a smile and more than happy to help in anyway he could. The restaurant has fab views of Times Square. We had breakfast at the hotel which was basic but plentiful. We also had dinner one night which was good. Our waitress was lovely but didn’t get her name. She highly recommended the new cocktail, R Blossom and after tasting I can also highly recommend!!! Overall we enjoyed our stay and think the hotel is ideally situated for walking uptown to Central Park & downtown to approx Madison Square Garden area. The hotel is not dirty as others mention (I’m a complete neat freak & germaphobe) and did not get any sense of poor hygiene or lack of cleaning. However, the hotel overall is perhaps a little tired in places and maybe due a freshen up but this did not distract from us enjoying our stay and we would definitely recommend this hotel and return for another visit.

title: Noisy disappointment
text: Although the hotel is well situated in the theatre district, its proximity to Times Square generates noise to its rooms that is beyond belief. Bands playing and lots of other noise from Time Square traveled to and through the rooms of the hotel. The situation may be different in winter, but it was terrible in 9/2022. The hotel is dated and the rooms seem "unclean" even though daily cleaning occurs. We'll make another choice of hotel for our next visit.

title: Family Vacation
text: First of all I like to  say what an exceptional staff starting with Jennifer who helped with my booking.  Jennifer also help make my granddaughter birthday very special. Then there was Tammy at reservations who went above and beyond to make sure my family and I had a great stay. I also would like to say the concierge was great and everyone at the hotel made my family feel welcome. I definitely would stay again.

title: Amazing staff!
text: The location is so great!  You can catch the subway or walk just about anywhere from the hotel.  The staff was amazing.  The Concierges’ helped us out multiple times with the best way to get to our locations.  They were friendly and full of great information.  The service in the restaurant was probably the best service we had in all of NYC.  The Server was funny and attentive (but not overly).  The ravioli was delicious.  Housekeeping was nice and checked in on us each day.  Overall, really wonderful experience!

title: Cómodo y agradable, lo peor la aglomeración de gente en Times Suárez en agosto
text:
Para muchos la ubicación es perfecta por que está en la mitad de Manhattan, sin embargo para nosotros resultó insufrible entrar  y salir con tanta gente en la plaza resultaba un horror. 
El personal muy atento y una vez dentro resultaba muy cómodo

title: Estadia em NYC
text: Hotel muito bom, excelente localização p fazer compras a pé, metro na porta (usamos o ir ao Brooklin e Meetpacking. Atendimento de todos muito bom, pontos q não curti, no site dizq atendimento é inglês e espanhol, e somente uma pessoa falava espanhol. Café da manhã ok, ficamos em dúvida se a internet cobrava ou não, não ficou muito claro os benefícios da estadia. Mas de todo modo, recomendo.

title: Pour l'emplacement
text:
Bon emplacement à proximité immédiate de Times Square et du métro.
Chambre spacieuse bien insonorisée (indispensable vu la localisation), très bonne literie, la salle de bain est correcte.
Le R lounge qui sert de salle de petit déjeuner ou pour prendre un verre le soir, a une vue spectaculaire. Toutefois nous sommes allés prendre le petit déjeuner ailleurs. Personnel aimable et efficace.
L'hôtel est un peu vieillissant dans l'ensemble mais ça passe, il n'y a pas vraiment de gros défaut à signaler. Si ce n'était l'emplacement, je dirais que le rapport/qualité prix n'est juste pas bon du tout. C'était sympa d'être à proximité immédiate de Times Square, mais je n'y retournerais probablement pas.

title: Beautiful hotel, beat up room
text:
Beautiful hotel. All but one of the staff were extremely helpful. Room had a cracked sink, tears in the wall, floor board lifted and the bathroom shower base looked like it was smashed with a hammer. When I reported this to the first desk, they told me that was terrible and I was only staying one night so did I really need to change my room?
Naturally when I got the survey at the end I filled it out appropriately. I did receive an email back thanking me for bringing this to there attention and they hope this does not deter me from staying there again.

title: Fabulous location with quirky decor. Just double check the details when they take a down payment for incidentals!
text: Spent a week in one of the most amazing rooms with a balcony overlooking Times Square. Great central location if you are exploring Manhattan. No issues with noise for us & we loved the quirky decor throughout the hotel. Didn’t have much interaction with staff as we were out exploring so much. A really lovely surprise on our anniversary when we got in to a bottle of bubbly & some chocs. Made our day.  The hotel takes a $100 a night deposit for any incidentals but they don’t tell you the amount at check in. This is capped at $500 per stay so imagine our surprise when we checked our pre-paid currency card to see they had taken a big chunk of our holiday money on check in.  We didn’t spend anything in the hotel and we have been home for over a week now and we are still waiting for our $500 refund. No email to contact the hotel who did say they would email us our final bill (they haven’t) so have resorted to social media to ask for our money back. If it wasn’t for this matter of poor communication /customer service we would have rated the hotel top marks!

title: Vacanza Usa
text: Vicino alla metropolitana,in centralissimo a Time Square,per niente rumorose le stanze per non essendo hai piani alti ,vista fantastica sulla piazza , polizza delle stanze adeguata wifi gratuito,camere spaziose

title: I got Bug Bites
text: I had a really bad experience at this hotel during the busy trip last week. I got the bug bites for two days,  but hotel didn't do too much about it besides change a room for me and kick the issue among front desk( African American lady but I forgot the lady's name), house keeping manager (Melissa), director of security (Jesus Ferrer). They didn't do the full scope pets control nor that I received an reports. The hotel said it's up to corporate center to send out reports and the corporate center said it's up to the hotel to send out report and corporate center doesn't has access to it. I wouldn't recommend stay at this hotel if you are concerned about potential bug bites.

title: Visit to New York
text:
Excellent service from top downwards. Left a cake, Chocs and non alcoholic fizzy drink prior to our arrival as it was my birthday. This was done by the Manager himself (Melvyn). Went the extra mile to assist. 

Really good location if you want to stay in the hub of Times Square.

Staff were all very helpful.

Would definately use again.

title: Amazing hotel with great service
text: It was our first time visiting New York, we picked this hotel based on location and reviews.  It was absolutely amazing, the location in Times Square was fantastic, service was great, from start to finish, including all the staff,  we always felt safe and welcomed no matter what time of day or night.  We stayed here for a week, it was fantastic. Room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable.  We drank and ate in the R Lounge, which provided fantastic views of Times Square.  Wadud was our host most nights in the R Lounge,  was so friendly and helpful and the service he provided was above and beyond anything we had experienced before, and he really made our stay. Food was amazing and would really recommend this place to anyone. Thank you again Wadud, you always remembered what we were drinking and for being so friendly, it really did make our stay.

title: Great location if you like hustle and bustle
text: If you want to be right in the heart of Times Square, with all the noise and action associated with it, then this is a great spot. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient and the room was very clean and a nice place to be. The restaurant has amazing views over TimesSquare, but be aware you can’t just go in and have a drink and take in the view, access is a little restricted to those wanting to eat and it’s not open all the time. Wi-Fi is not complimentary and were initially sold a package on arrival to include Wi-Fi and visits at over $30/day , but having reflected we didn’t think this was good value but the hotel were quick to cancel and give us free Wi-Fi anyway. Also be aware the water in your room isn’t complimentary either and we got charged $6/bottle! Overall a nice hotel in the busiest part of NY.

title: EXCELENTE UBICACIÓN Y EXCELENTE ATENCIÓN
text: Hotel ubicado frente a Times Square, los servicios son muy buenos. El desayuno impresionante: café de Starbuck y todo muy cuidado, con una impactante vista de Times Square. Lo recomiendo para pasar unos días inolvidables en MY

title: Do not expect to get any sleep here…
text:
Let me start off by saying the concierge and restaurant staff were very helpful and friendly during our 3 night stay. This hotel might be for you if you don’t mind bright lights in your windows or loud noises from the busy Times Square area. 

My 2 star review comes for other reasons:
- Our room 1602 was very loud at night with Times Square street sounds (cars revving engines at all hours, music, & garbage trucks)
- You have to take an elevator to the lobby the transfer from there to the elevators up to your room. We waited for 10-15 min for elevators upon arrival because not all of their 3 elevators were operating. We waited for these elevators almost every time we went up to our room
- The last two nights people beside us were slamming their doors until at least 1:45am. They had a screaming kid that we could easily hear through the walls. We called the front desk who sent up security. That did not solve the noise issue. We called the front desk a second time, and they offered to send security up again (at 1:45am) but said they could not switch our room bc the hotel was fully booked. We had to wake up at 4:30 to make it to the airport, so that was a torturous night. We paid a lot to stay here for an overall poor experience, and we are shocked the hotel did not offer to provide some type of reimbursement. 

To be honest the sleeping here was miserable. We got next to no sleep. Def would not stay here again for the reasons listed above.

title: In the heart of times square
text: Loved our 4 night stay at this hotel, right in the heart of times square, nice clean rooms, great views from window, great views for breakfast, breakfast was nice. Only thing I would say is the cost to use WiFi was  steep but probably same for most hotels in the area.

title: Interesting Hotel
text: Stayed at the hotel during Easter Weekend for a Staycation.  Room: Booked a terrace room on the 4th Floor.  The room itself was very roomy and very clean.  The bed and rollout were quite comfortable.  The layout of the room was somewhat strange with the glass sink outside of the bathroom right next to the bed.  The terrace was large but adorned with fake grass and "farm animals" on the terrace next door.  Great view of Times Square and area.  Large building A/C unit on 4th floor made for much noise on terrace, but the room was well sound proofed once terrace door was closed.  Common areas:  Strange.  Upstairs lobby resting area  adorned with "Q-tips" on the ceiling (see picture).  In one area there were two with yellow staining which I told my wife looked like Q-Tips with ear wax.  Each floor has some kind of design or art in the elevator waiting area.  Our floor had a chair made of old shirts. Another had doorknobs on the wall.   Some floors had the "farm animals" and I presume the others had some sort of "artwork."  Service:  Great.   Location:  Phenomenal!  Overall:  Nice unique stay.  We thoroughly enjoyed our selves.

title: Location
text: Once you get past the shock of the entrance, that the elevators are slow, that the AC isn’t really AC, that other than a nice breakfast the restaurant isn’t much to speak of you’ll realize that you chose this place for its location. If you want to be in the heart of Time Square this place fits the bill. But you can do so much better. I’m a loyal Marriott customer and it’s brands but this leaves a lot to be desired. Key features, the in room safe’s door won’t stay up that’s a safety challenge, the AC won’t cool any lower than 72 degrees and the elevators are slow.

title: Loved The Renaissance Hotel!
text: I came here with a friend for a girls' weekend in NYC.  We had an amazing time, starting with the hotel.  The Renaissance Hotel is a great place to stay,  in a convenient location, with amazing rooms and super cool views. It has a very boutique hotel feel with a modern, hip vibe.  We especially loved the bar and lounge areas on the 5th and 6th floors.  However, the very best part of our stay was our wonderful concierge, Duke.  He was thoughtful, kind, attentive, funny and gave us great recommendations for food, shopping and entertainment.  You definitely want to include a stay here on your next visit to the city and make sure you check in with Duke to round out your visit.  I am already planning my next stay here  when I bring my kids in a few weeks!

title: Nice Hotel in an Awesome Location
text:
Good hotel in a great location.  Overall the hotel felt safe in the middle of Times Square.  The rooms were clean and when housekeeping was requested they took care of our room early in the day.  

As others have said we could hear the street noise on the 16th floor, but using a white noise app resolved that issue easily. 

Only negatives were that we could not get the room extra cool but temperatures were in the 90s.   Also we could not get the hot water from being too hot at non-peak usage times.  Mornings and evenings things were just right with the water temperatures.

Some reviews complain about the $30 location fee per day, but they will take it off if you refuse the voucher.

We would stay again especially if we were going to Broadway shows.

title: Loud area but convenient to theaters
text: Room was nice but even on the 17th floor the street noise was quite loud. Luckily I am used to sleeping with the white noise app on my phone. I don’t like that there is a resort fee but it can be used as credit at the restaurant so we did that one night.

title: Pam Neal
text: Beautiful hotel in the middle of it all in Times Square. Staff was wonderful. We weren't able to get a late checkout but they will hold your luggage if there's anywhere else you want to go/see on your last day. They'll also hold your luggage prior to check-in which is helpful if you arrive early so you can start sightseeing immediately. Within walking distance to theaters/5thAve/Central Park/Empire State Bldg//Restaurants & Subways to Lower Manhattan for 9/11 Memorial & Statue City Cruises Ferry to Liberty/Ellis Island & pretty much anywhere you want to go if you're not able to walk a lot. I'd definitely stay here again!!!

title: Theatre lovers spot
text: We've stayed here several times, the rooms are pretty nice, though the dreaded sliding door for the bathroom is not my favorite.  We skipped the restaurant and bar this time, there are so many places to go right outside.  I love the location, you're a 5-10 minute walk to just about every broadway theater, and the TKTS half price ticket booth is a block away.  Times Square can get noisy late night Saturday night - now you've been warned.  It's close to most of the subway lines, so you can easily get downtown or to Brooklyn from here.  We'll be back.

title: Great location for theatre and dining
text: Marriott property with a great location for a theatre visit.  Within walking distance of several theatres and easy access to a variety of restaurants.  The entrance is on the lower level of the hotel with the lobby on the next floor.  Orienting oneself to different elevators proved to be only complication.  Nice dining area with free breakfast to Marriott Elite members.  I will definitely return for future events.

title: First time in New York
text: Our holiday went from last few days in April into first few days of May. We have never been to New York before and had no idea on the location of this hotel. We were not disappointed. The hotel exceeded my expectations.  Our room had 2 double beds because of our teenage daughter, the view from our room was amazing, even though we were only on the 11th floor. The hotel is contemporary and the bar and lobby absolutely amazing with stunning views over Times Square. We enjoyed an evening drink most evenings and the bar staff were very attentive and went out of their way to give our daughter an experience, making her mock tails etc. the security downstairs was spot on. All in all, a fabulous hotel and we would not hesitate in staying here again.

title: Great Location, Very helpful and friendly staff
text:
The location and view of Times Square from the breakfast room are exceptional, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms are adequately sized.
The only slight negative was the bar closing at 10pm, not a major issue as there are several bars within walking distance.

title: Convenient but…
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a three day weekend along with family in other rooms. The location just off Times Square is certainly convenient and the price was right given that we were paying the tab for the rest of the family. The front desk was friendly and helpful and housekeeping was done well, however, I’m not sure we would stay here again for several reasons.

First, there is no valet parking. In midtown Manhattan that’s a real problem, especially when their preferred (and discounted) parking is 3 blocks away. Second, the rooms lacked certain essentials one generally finds in hotel rooms such as a pad of paper and pen by the phone and adequate drawer space for stays of several days. Finally, the hotel’s bar closes at 10:00 PM. Really? Ever hear of after dinner/after theater drinks? Lots of people don’t want to hit Times Square bars at that hour. 

All in all, the hotel met the minimum requirements for taking the family to NYC but, in the future I’d probably look to book a better alternative.

title: Fantastic!
text: Best hotel in Times Square! From when we checked-in to check-out, everything was perfect! We celebrated our daughter's 13th birthday and the Renaissance made our trip so memorable! I booked the king-sized terrace room with a balcony and WOW!!! Best room in all of Times Square- no one had a balcony like this! We drank coffee in the morning and shared pizza at night all outside on our private balcony in the middle of time square- such great people watching. The Renaissance also sent up an amazing birthday brownie for our daughter's birthday- so very special! Love being a Marriott member and this just shows how much they truly care! Service was amazing! We will definitely come back to NYC and stay here again!

title: Price does not match the quality
text: Love the location. Love the staff especially Rafael. But the cleanliness could have been better. We paid over 1k and the hotel bedding was tattered and torn. The out dated bath tub/shower was so clogged, that it immediately collected water when you get in the shower. The rooms are amazingly designed. But, for what we paid for a 2 day stay was not worth it. There was an old balled up piece of tissue on the floor on the side of the bed, and there was other things on the floor that made it apparent it had not been vacuumed. The remote control had no back and it was not sanitized.

title: Better options in Time Square
text:
This is the third and probably last time we have stayed at this particular Marriott property in the last 8 yrs when visiting New York.  We love the location but this trip left a lot to be desired. While the staff was very friendly the attention to the condition of the rooms is lacking.  Does anyone ever check besides housekeeping coming in to refresh a room?

We stayed 5 nights and out of those nights 4 times our room card didn’t work either at the elevator to access our room or to get into the room.  It is a real pain to then have to take an elevator down to the lobby and then another down to the front desk on street level.  It is also listed in our profile to be away from elevators and vending and yet they put us next to noisy housekeeping room.  They were in and out of that room early in the morning slamming the door each time. There was also no do not disturb sign on the inside of the door. I asked 3 times for one and they said they would bring it but never did.  On three mornings we had knocks on the door from housekeeping waking us up.  

Finally, you have a bar and restaurant and it’s not open past 10 pm most nights. You are a large full service hotel but when one wants to come back to the hotel for a late night snack or beverage you are closed way past when shows let out.  

The hotel is not what it use to be and I think it’s time to look for a different Marriott property that is more focused on the guest.  Despite the great location and previous stays, something has changed with this property.

title: Great hotel!
text: Really liked this hotel. The location is fantastic. Modern and great bar area. My room was large and fully stocked. Bed was super comfortable. Bathroom was large and had great counter space.  Staff were all super friendly.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: In the Center of the Action
text: Hotel staff and service are friendly and helpful. We felt safe. Location is great, easy walking to everything around Time Square and Broadway. Rooms modern and clean. My only complaint was that we were so excited to eat dinner at the lounge that overlooks Time Square but they had only a few bar appetizer type items, not a full restaurant. We had an overpriced cheese board and wished we had picked somewhere else for dinner. The waiters were not friendly nor easy to understand. Everything else 5 stars. We would stay here again (when we can afford to splurge). Rooms are reasonable during week, more expensive on weekends.

title: DISAPPOINTED
text: First I want to say I have been vacationing in NYC since 2007 it's my favorite city to visit and I always stay at the Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel. I visited the hotel this last week and I was so disappointed. The staff was friendly but the room they originally put us in didn't have a working toilet and the sink was stopped up. The room was also not clean and dusty. I called the front desk and was moved to a different room which was almost better but wasn't clean. In the room you could see dust everywhere, the shower was questionable. The following morning I notified the front desk of the cleanliness of the room. We were gone for hours touring the city to return with the room being clean but not what you would expect. Also, this hotel has two levels to get to the rooms. The first set elevators are on the first floor near the street then you take elevators up to the lobby. Only two elevators were operating and both kept breaking down. Someone became trapped in one and the fire dept was called.  I have always loved this hotel for the location and quick access to the subways, Broadway shows but this stay wasn't worth the money. The hotel needs serious renovation. When you are taking a shower and take a glance up and the top of the shower you can see the extreme wear and tear on the hotel. I  did like the concierge desk they were helpful and staff was friendly but the hotel needs some serious work and better cleaning services.

title: March visit for Broadway show
text: This hotel was a perfect spot to walk to Broadway show and restaurants, very convenient.  Saeed and the entire staff were extremely accomodating and friendly the entire 3 days of our visit.  The rooms were very clean and roomy.  The staff at this hotel made our visit very special.

title: AmbassadorD
text: This is my first time with family at the Renaissance. Enjoyed the visit beautiful suite love the decor. The bar was nice appetizers great. Breakfast was very good and staff was very friendly. Would like to say thanks to Melvin( manager), Joy,. Everyone enjoyed the visit and will definitely be back again. Location was awesome still right in the middle of time square and all it has to offer. Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall etc.

title: Rooms have seen better days
text: Traveling for work, you see your fair share of the good, the bad, and the ugly.  I always try and stay somewhat objective because I am a neat freak and I know there is only so much you can expect from a room that's sole purpose is housing travels and gets beat to hell.  That said, just about everything in this room was disgusting.  The surfaces were sticky and not from a cleaning product but from soda that was spilled. The bathroom tub faucet was pulled off the wall and I could see behind the tile to the drywall.  One of the light switches had a 1/4 inch gap from the drywall where they clearly miscut the drywall and the putty they tried to fill it with overtime has punches through.  There is not enough light in the rooms to take a video call for work and not look like a serial killer holed up in a bunker.  Management needs to take a look at some of the rooms and get maintenance in to actually fix things vs slapping a bandaid them.

title: Excellent location
text: Arrived late afternoon quick check in. Small lobby area as the main area is 2 floor above. We had a room 25 floors good sized room. Bathroom basic but plenty of towels and clean bedding. Excellent location pleasent bar didn't eat here. Room always cleaned everyday. Hotel left chocolate and a bottle of wine nice touch

title: 3 stars for the suite but 5 for location and bar view
text:
We traveled to NYC for an extended weekend to celebrate my son turning 13!  He liked the glitz and nuttiness of Times Square so we decided to stay where the action is this time.
