Renaissance Times Square absolutely was the ideal location as you are within steps from restaurants, Broadway, and plenty of excitement including Gun Control demonstrations, Anti-Mask Rallies and Pro Abortion Rights demonstrations. We didn't mind the rallies -- it is part of staying in Times Square.

For the special weekend, we booked a suite. Concierge did help me with a treat bag and a few balloons to surprise my son -- I appreciated that!  The suite itself was underwhelming and really dark. The depressing lights in the living room either were broken or the room was meant to be that dark because it was just gray and totally drab.  Time for a LED upgrade perhaps??  Furnishing was quite dated as well, same with the bathrooms.  

The breakfasts were at the R Lounge and that perhaps was the best part of the stay. Options were plenty but the gorgeous view made everything taste good, and breakfast worth waking up for!  We also made a point to grab drinks daily at the R Lounge for the view!  It is truly one of the best central views of Times Square!

All is all, the hotel was fine and a great location for our needs that weekend. The suite was a disappointment and I hope it undergoes an update very soon.

title: Not one if the best Marriott properties
text:
We normally stay at the Marriott Marquis Times Square but decided to give the Renaissance a try this time. 

Rooms are okay and on the tiny side which is typical of many New York hotels. Even with Marriott’s highest level of status they were unable to grant us any upgrades. They only nice things was a room on the 28th floor with a view of Broadway. 

Unlike many high end Marriott’s they do not have a concierge lounge. Breakfast is only available some days of the week and the restaurant/lounge doesn’t offer complementary appetizers daily as you’d find in concierge lounges.  Unfortunately the lounge was booked for private parties two of the days of our stay which meant we couldn’t even get a cocktail those days. Had we known well in advance we would have booked another property. 

All in all a meh experience

title: Never again.
text: This place is an unmitigated disaster. Elevators run so slow that it takes 10 minutes just to get downstairs. Huge line at reception - they do not have the capacity to handle a medium flow of guests. Breakfast feels like I am at a 3rd rate motel. What a mistake to stay here.

title: Nice Choice
text:
I stayed here for 2 nights in September 2021 and was upgraded to an executive suite.  The room was well equipped and service was very good overall.  Bed was very comfortable.

The location is incredible for those wanting to be in Times Square and in close proximity to Broadway shows.

The check in area is on the ground floor and very small.  Then you go up to another floor to change elevator banks.  Elevators do get busy and there can be a wait (particularly from ground floor).

While not my top choice in Times Square I definitely wouldn't have issues recommending this property.

title: Buen hotel
text:
Es un hotel en el corazón de times square, con vista a todos sus avisos.
Habitaciones confortables, baños limpios, desayuno básico pero completo.
Puede ser ruidoso en la noche pero permite descansar. 
Estaciones de metro muy cerca, precio acorde a NY.
Me gustó, volvería.  Tiene uno todo nueva york a su alcance

title: Great experience and perfect location
text: The hotel location can't be beat if you want to be in the middle of Times Square. A nice boutique-style Marriott that has been updated and has great views. The beds were comfortable, rooms clean and modern. The room included a mini-fridge. Bathrooms were spacious.

title: Never Ever Again - Worse Hotel Ever
text: An absolute embarrassment to the Marriott brand. Lifts not working poor check in experience incorrect COVID-19 checks preventing access to the restaurant key cards not accessing the gym gym equipment not working rude reception staff I could go on but this not fit for purpose establishment doesn’t warrant anymore of my time. It’s Intercontinental Group for me next time - and I’m Gold Bonvoy!

title: Cute hotel, but terrible experience.
text: Ugh. Just terrible so far - and I’ve only been here two nights with three to go. Room is fine, but the shower doesn’t drain well and my bathroom outlet did not work. All elevators broke down - we had to take the stairs or go through the kitchen to take some staff elevator or something. And the worst part is that a low level of club music from The Edition nightclub seeps through the thin windows and it’s ANNOYING as hell - and they’re open till 4 am and earplugs don’t cut it. If they don’t move my room tomorrow, I’ll cancel the rest of my stay…never again at this place.

title: Ok…not great
text:
We stayed at the Renaissance this past week for 3 nights on the 8th floor. The room itself was clean and a nice size, but the bathroom. Oh boy…I wish I had taken pictures.  It was cleaned daily, but the walls had mold all over them. There isn’t any ventilation in the bathroom, so I assume the moisture is causing mold in the grout.  This mold is also causing a moldy smell in the bathroom.  In addition the tub drains pretty slowly.
We did call did call the front desk, and they offered us a room across the hall. I checked the bathroom, and it was the same - so we stayed in the original room and we received a $50 discount.
We had a colleague staying on the 26th floor at the same time who informed us that he did not have the same experience. I guess the 26th floor gets tilex and the lower floors don’t. 
This was disappointing to know that there is a discrepancy in the level of cleaning between the floors.

title: Happy Anniversary
text: Excellent stay. Good location. Concierge Matthew was very helpful and made our stay perfect with his recommendations. Staff was friendly. We had cocktails at the bar. Our table offered a great view of Times Square.

title: Avoid at all costs
text: Lifts that break down. No breakfast served in the hotel at weekends and a below-par breakfast when it is served. You can’t even buy a coffee in the lobby. Tired rooms. This hotel is trading off a brand name that is not justified by the experience; something has gone seriously wrong with this place.

title: Street noise
text:
The location is very convenient if you are after Broadway or Central Park. Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean and in good shape. TV is weird. Breakfast is ok for a 3-star hotel, but this is New York.

There was a horrible noise from the outside - someone can call it a nightclub disco, but it was rather a cacophony of sound that lasted well until morning. We could hear it very well from the top 26th floor and could not fall asleep until 4 am after driving into NYC. We changed the room the next day and it was much quieter, but one night was ruined. Not much excuse from the hotel as this must be a well-known issue. But, hey GM: i) inform about it on your webpage or ii) make windows noise-proof.

title: Customer Service is as amazing as the other reviews state!
text:
I chose this hotel for a three night stay at the end of August over W Times Square because their service seemed to have better reviews than the W, and I was not disappointed!

I had contacted Michelle Tracey from the reservations team about my stay the week before, because I had a 6 day and 1 day stay in Paris right before our stop in New York, and I would technically hit Platinum status during my stay at the Renaissance. Of course, I didn’t expect them to award me Platinum benefits until my elite nights posted, but Michelle was nice enough to offer us 4pm check out since we had a late flight home from New York and upgraded us to a high floor room with a better view, which was greatly appreciated.

On the morning of check-in, my elite nights from my Paris stays had posted and I was at 47 nights. I contacted the hotel via chat to ask if I could receive Platinum benefits since I would hit night 50 during my stay and they said they would be “delighted” to honor the benefits, which included breakfast in the lounge.

Our midnight check-in went smoothly and me hitting Platinum status was acknowledged, and the front desk agent (I believe Valentina) was very welcoming and gave us all the information we needed for our stay. 

The room was very nice. It wasn't the best view because of so much construction on that block, but it was a nice room with good amenities and very clean. Bed must have been comfortable because we had no trouble sleeping. I also appreciated the free Evian water bottles each day as a Platinum guest. 

The views of the Times Square breakfast lounge were quite amazing—they really have prime real estate and it was breathtaking. The breakfast food itself wasn't incredible, but it was decent enough and together with the views it motivated us enough to go down to have breakfast every morning. They had hot options like sausage biscuits or breakfast burritos and fried sweet potatoes, along with fruit bowls, yogurt, pastries, coffee, and juice. I expect food options may have been better pre-covid, but I wasn't complaining because I was just happy to be granted the free breakfast Platinum benefit.

However, the level of service I received before the end of my stay really helped ensure our visit was memorable and will certainly have me more loyal to this hotel if I stay in Times Square again. In the middle of my stay, to my surprise, room service delivered a letter, a bottle of prosecco, and a small box of chocolates to my room. It was a very sweet letter from Michelle giving me an early congratulations on hitting Platinum status! It was very much appreciated being acknowledged for my loyalty and definitely makes me happy that I chose this hotel for our short stay in New York!

Thank you again for your amazing hospitality Michelle, and thank you to the Renaissance team for a great stay!

title: EXQUISITE
text:
This Amazing Hotel located  In Times  Square is steps away from Fine Dining, Shopping, Romance  A Wonderful Opportunity to visit the Theatre. View Art,  Attend Concerts, Dance, Dine, Meet Lovely People  And Celebrating Life. 

My husband our Gorgeous Siberian Husky and I were warmly welcomed and offered a More Spacious Room to Accommodate our Service Dog.  Room is located on a higher level with Spectacular Views. A Request made for a late checkout after our stay for a week was granted at no extra cost to us. A Generous Caring Lady. Thank You precious Lady. We were ecstatic.

Grateful and Feeling Pampered and Enthusiastic to travel out, we called security for help as our room key had not been activated as yet. He stepped forward immediately. Escorting us to our room via elevator He made us knowledgeable about the use of the key card for use throughout hotel including entry into our Room. After assuring us of safety and with the knowledge that we were, He Thanked us for our Choice of the Renaissance Hotel .Wished us a Magnificent stay. A kind, Thoughtful Gentleman. Thank You Sir.

The Most Beautiful Heartwarming Time in my Heart Came The Moment Lady Maria Sanchez from Housekeeping walked into our Room. An Energetic, vibrant Marvelous  Employee Special Employee who not only Transformed our Room in Elegance ,  Cleanliness, Ambiance, Harmony. She stopped Tireless Detailed cleaning to  Genuinely Apologize to Co Worker (having Accidentally brushed shoulder against him) who had stepped into room to remove linen from floor. He accepted Apology and said said it was Fine. I saw a United Team Who wore their Closeness in Working Together. Showing Mutual respect for each other and Exuding this to me and Every Hotel Guest around them. Having watch Maria Change my Comforter, 
Covers, pillowcases, linens So Professionally I learned how to Dress a Bed Properly.

Our Room is now in Pristine Shape. Maria asks me to view the Bathroom which is Sparklingly Bright and Polished. She asks if there is anything She may remove or add
To make it more Comfortable for our family and Siberian Husky. My Heart Danced.

Maria SanchezYou Stole my Heart The moment you graciously walked into the Room because You Work Loving What You Do. not just working because you have to. You Care About, Care For, Have A Deep Loving Concern and Understanding of the Needs of the Hotel Guests . Because of Maria Sanchez Elevating our Hearts with Unbelievable Warmth, Understanding, Gentleness and Love Our Family Will Surely Be Sharing Many More Loving Hopeful Times Meeting Many More Beautiful Charming People Who Also Loved Their Stay at the Remarkable Grand Renaissance Hotel
Nolene Morgan

title: Stay away from the Terrace rooms
text: I am a Bonvoy Ambassador level.  As part of this leisure trip to go to the US Open, decided to use my Suite Night rewards for a room upgrade.  Big mistake. We were given a Terrace room with the weirdest bathroom setup I have ever seen in a full service hotel - tiny glass vessel sink (in the room, no less) and a toilet / shower area with a glass door that closed with a bang.  Went to speak to the front desk about changing rooms in the morning, clerk assured me that he would leave a message and block a room for us. Of course, the desk clerk on duty knew nothing about this and was rude "you booked a Terrace room" - I explained the hotel selected the upgraded room, not me.    Overall, the hotel was OK (we moved to a double room on 24) but I am going back to the Marquis on my next trip to NYC.

title: Highly recommend
text: I’m always nervous using my Bonvoy points for a NYC hotel as you never really know what to expect.   I’ve stayed at just about every hotel that Bonvoy has listed for NYC over the last 20 years and Renaissance is by far the cleanest hotel listed.   I was upgraded to a higher floor ( 25 ) ,  the room was spacious, very clean and quiet.    My room overlooked Broadway.    You check in at street level and then our taken up three levels to lobby.   The lobby is contemporary with a large bar and seating area.      I feel very confident recommending this hotel,  you are right in Times Square but once inside hotel you feel like you have escaped the hustle outdoors!

title: Bon hôtel , bien placé
text: Le point fort de l'hôtel est sa localisation directement sur Times Square. La chambre est grande et confortable. Réfrigérateur et machine a café disponibles. Salle de bain grande et fonctionnelle. Pas grand chose à redire sauf le tarif délirant du petit déjeuner pour le peu de choses disponibles. On paye juste la vue, certes superbe sur Times Square mais ça ne suffit pas à faire oublier les 80 dollars demandés. L'hôtel garde vos bagages si votre vol est tard le soir et le service de chasseurs vous trouvera en 5mn un taxi jaune pour l'aéroport ou n'importe où. N'oubliez pas de donner un tip.

title: Good location for tourists
text:
The location is right in the time square.  The staff is friendly.  Even it is in the busy area, it seems safe at night because there is security on the ground floor checking key card.   And the elevator from the 2nd floor to other floors needs room key to activate. 

I switched my room once because I could hear the next rooms talking from the adjacent door.

The breakfast room is very nice facing the time square. The breakfast is included for titanium member.   It is the buffet style with separate packaged food items due to Covid.

title: Mejor Mantenimiento
text:
La ubicacion del Hotel es buena.
La Manager Srta Divina es muy amable y eficiente, nos soluciono los problemas
de la habitacion y del aire acondicionado,nos cambiaron dos veces de cuarto.
Trataron de hacer agradable nuestra estadia .
El Hotel necesita mantenimiento, no hay relacion calidad-precio,

title: Renaissance right in the middle of all Times Square hustle
text: This is very solid option, if you like being right there, @Times Square. I personally try to avoid being right at Times Sq/Broadway as much as I can, but this time my other Marriott reservation got cancelled ( hotel hasn't reopened yet). The hotel itself is quite nice, friendly service, nice brand, good benefits for Platinum Members: nice room, included lunch in the Lounge. The cost was reasonable too, the room was spacious enough, with a good view from 26th floor. All in all, if not for location, it could be close to 5 star. Renaissance is a good Marriott brand/option  in large cities, as far as I noticed  in my travels. Worth considering in many cases in urban environment

title: Una experiencia maravillosa!
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado en el Times Square , cerca de todo ! Muy confortable , habitación perfecta ! Restaurante con una vista maravillosa del Times Square ! Súper recomiendo !! No he probado el desayuno, pero  el hotel está cerca de varios restaurantes con Desayuno típico americano .

title: Un hotel céntrico en el TS!!!!!!
text:
Es un hotel muy bien ubicado en la zona de Time Square !!! Además central de los diferentes puntos de interés, cerca a las estaciones de Subway. Sus habitaciones limpias y confortables !!!!  Además con todos sus amenities y caja fuerte, es un hotel solo para dormir y descansar de los recorridos, no incluyen desayuno así que se debe salir a buscarlo en la mañana.
El servicio al cliente es estándar ni por debajo o por encima de las expectativas.

title: Location and Clean
text: Excellent location. Room very clean. Staff welcoming and helpful (especially Divina, concierge and David, breakfast manager). I was in room 2208 and there was plenty of room and was quiet bc it did not face Times Square. I will stay here again!

title: muy ruidoso
text: Es un lugar en el medio de todo, no incomodo mucho hubiéramos preferido otra ubicación, y el personal era apenas amable, no grosero pero tampoco empático, si tuviera que viajar otra vez, no escogería ese hotel

title: Muy ruidoso y obscuro
text: Hotel en pleno corazón de Times Square, es obscuro y muy transitado. El lobby deja mucho que desear. Y para fumar te piden que te alejes a la esquina. El desayuno incluido es malo, las camas y almohadas lo mejor del hotel. Hay seguridad sin embargo son muy "secos" con la atención.

title: Hotel = Good... Leonard = Great
text: Hotel is great, right in the center of the action, good, newly renovated rooms. I stayed here twice, looking for consistency and they missed the point at first. Need to make all rooms have the same feel and quality, but the good ones are great, and the staff is SO kind. Housekeeping was really nice and helpful, and security was attentive. Above all else was Leonard. Leonard works reception in the evenings, and you can truly count on him. Kind, respectful, patient, accommodating, and thoughtful - this employee is a true gem. He deserves a bonus!

title: Nice hotel in the heart of NYC!!
text: Very nice Times Square hotel. Check in at street level and the lobby is up 3 floors. The room was modern with a nice shower and comfortable bed. We were on the 6th floor and there was some street noise. Would go higher. The bar had just reopened. No bell staff or luggage storage.

title: Great stay right in the heart of Times Square
text: Our family of 4 stayed here recently during a quick trip to the city.  You can't beat the location- directly in Times Square.  The hotel had a very hip vibe, with cool decor and a restaurant/bar that overlooked Times Square. Unfortunately, it was closed due to COVID, but we hope to return at a later date to experience that.  Our room was very nice, with modern decor.   The bathroom was extremely clean with a modern design and  Aveda toiletry products (my favorite). They do not have parking, but we were given directions to a parking garage that offered discounted parking. And although they were not able to hold our luggage when we checked out, they did allow us a late check-out time so that we could keep it safely in our room until we were ready to depart from our trip. Overall great experience.

title: Excellent customer service , nice clean rooms
text:
Location - no need for me to say much here ...

Rooms - fairly spacious by NYC standard , clean , modern, comfortable 

Service - very very good .  Guía was especially helpful and welcoming .  I appreciated the great customer service she gave .  I was granted a very early check in as just a lowly gold member - very helpful after overnight flight to NYC .. 

Would not hesitate to stay here again

title: Location is great
text:
Just returned from 3 nights at the Renaissance.  I'm a frequent traveler to NYC.  Prior to the pandemic I was visiting 6 or 7 times a year.  I usually stay at a hotel few blocks down 48th but it has not yet opened back up so I chose the Renaissance based on location.  I found things I  liked and things that really bothered me about the hotel.  First what I liked.  The location was great, 2 subway stations within 2 blocks and a short walk to the 42nd st station where you can get a train to almost anywhere.  The only downside to the location was that even though I was on the 19th floor it was very noisy as the hotel is in the midst of Times Square. The employees I encountered were all very friendly and accommodating.  I liked the fact that the Bonvoy app on my phone told me when my room was ready for check in  (it was available early which was great because i had an early flight in) and I was able to use it as a key to my room.  
Now the things I didn't care for so much.  The whole vibe of the hotel was very dark.  Dark elevators, the decor of the rooms was very dark with gray walls and the lighting in rooms was dark.  The only overhead light was in the entrance to the room.  In the room itself were light fixtures that did not give off much light, maybe this wouldn't bother some people but it really bothered me, so much so that I would probably not stay here again because I did not enjoy this at all.  The bathroom was much brighter and I thought the mirror was very cool with the skyline of the city on it.  The restaurants were not open but I understand the reason for this and there are enough places to get food in the area so this was not a big deal.  I found it odd that there was no pen and pad in the room.  Once again this is not a big deal but I am used to having this amenity in a hotel, luckily I had a scratch pad and pen with me but it just seemed odd that a hotel of this caliber did not provide this.  The thing that bothered me most, although luckily it wasn't an issue due to the help of the front desk clerk, was the fact that at this time they are not holding luggage.  I guess I understand why they are not during this time but I am very surprised I did not find out they were not doing this until I came down the day I was checking out to ask where to bring my luggage as I would not be departing the city until late in the afternoon and check out time was noon.  I have never stayed in a hotel that does not check luggage and if they are not doing so I believe they should have communicated that.  As I said the front desk took care of the situation and was kind enough to allow me to have a late check out and leave my luggage in my room.  If he had not done this I don't know what I would have done.  I had plans for the day before leaving the city and bringing my luggage with me wasn't a possibility.  Lack of communication of this policy was the problem.  Had I known in advance I probably would have looked at other choices of hotels that allowed for this.  All in all I had a good stay but was not comfortable in the room as it was too dark for me.

title: Location, Location and Time Square
text:
You pick this hotel because of the location and that is the reason you pay the high price. If you don't care about the Time Square feel than this is not the location for you. There are lots of other options for you to get the New York feel. So only book this this is the place you want to be. 

The good:
- The room is larger than some Time square hotel. 
- The hotel lobby and check in is on first floor (not all hotel are like this in NYC)
- Service is great 
- The breakfast room look onto the middle of Time Square, try to go early so you can sit by the window. For me this is the reason I stay here, enjoying a quite breakfast while over looking time square getting ready. From what I am told on New Years eve, the table by the window cost over $20k USD as it look directly at where the ball drops. 

The not so good
- When I was there... the restaurant was not open for lunch. 

Overall I would stay here again just to have the view for breakfast and be in dead center of Time Sq. However if you looking for luxury or comfort there are other options within time Square.

title: My Fiancé 50th Birthday
text: Where do I begin? The hotel is wonderful, very clean, beautiful decor and great staff! Relaxing on the beach in Far Rockaway with our family and friends made this trip even more memorable. Food, drinks and fun! Will definitely be returning 🥰

title: Plenty of better options
text:
I know everyone is dealing with a lot as we all try to get back to work and life, but given how empty the hotel was and my status with Marriott, I really expected more for this hotel. 

The biggest issue was the room. Neither the shower nor the TV worked properly. With all the vacancy in the hotel I was surprised we didn't have a fully-functioning room. It was late and our kids were tired, so I didn't complain b/c it wasn't worth switching rooms. I figured I would just let them know at check-out, but no one asked how our stay was.

We also weren't told that the restaurant was closed, so no room service or breakfast, which I had thought was included.

With all the available options in NYC right now I would stay elsewhere next time.

title: Great!!
text: The staff here are fantastic. I wish I could remember the girls name at the front it wasn’t a common one. She was so friendly that evening and checked us in and gave my niece a stuffed lamb. This hotel by far has the best customer service I’ve ever experienced in New York City!

title: renaissance time square
text: A magnificent location in the heart of time square .perfect for new years eve celebration great for couples families and teen ages dream. Friendly and helpful staff.cuty never sleeps.in center of everything you need

title: Outstanding location on Times Square
text:
A great option for those wanting to stay right off of Times Square.  The street level lobby is simple with only check in desks and elevators to    another lobby where there would be a restaurant (not open), business center, concierge desk (not open) and access to the rooms via another bank of elevators. 

I had an executive suite which had a living room with a full bathroom (tub and shower), a master with its own bathroom.  Amenities were great.

Service and maid service was daily.

Great location just steps from Tines Square and M&M store.

title: Great Location
text: Stayed during Christmas break.  Location is great, breakfast leaves much to be desired.  Average room so I rate this as a three star hotel.  Does the job if you need a reasonably priced room in NYC but don’t expect five star service. It’s an average hotel.

title: Time away from everything
text: So I came out from AZ to visit my wife who is currently working as a crisis nurse until July and wanted to get a nice hotel room to enjoy outside of her tiny studio and loved everything about this hotel and chose it. Many hotels were closed so this was my favorite option of the ones they were open (during the covid crisis) I had messaged the hotel manager sharing our story and Monet was vert friendly and helpful and even moved us into one of the most beautiful rooms that have a balcony looking over iconic Times Square. Between the bed, shower and fake grass on the patio it was the best. Going to get food and enjoy it while on the balcony is probably one of the most relaxing experiences we have ever had. I can’t imagine how much fun these rooms would be for the NYE holiday and when the world is normal again. The hotel was very clean and the front desk lady, I believe the manager on duty, and the security guard always made us feel safe and welcomed. They explained things may get rowdy outside from the protests and gave us a walk through of what to do in case we can’t use the front door. So much respect and appreciation for them! Will definitely be back to enjoy this hotel in the future!

title: Great hotel, nearly 5 stars!!
text:
Great boutique hotel located very well in time square. Good size rooms and it’s worth staying for breakfast alone with the great view out over Time Square from the restaurant. We had a disappointing view from our room but I should imagine some are spectacular.

I would give 5 stars but was disappointed to receive no recognition or room upgrade as a Marriott platinum member. Was told the hotel was full despite there being many rooms showing available on the Marriott website.

Overall a good hotel to pick and a great way to get away from some of the larger hotels with the hustle & bustle.

title: Great Hotel
text: This location is perfect in New York, the hotel was fantastic, clean , modern, staff was great! Room was big, excellent views.  Restaurant in hotel had great food I highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again. Right in times square close to shops and restaurants.

title: Take away the $30 fee and you have 5 stars
text:
Excellent location. Right in the heart of Times Square- which can be a problem with the noise. We were lucky enough to get a room on the higher floors and hence noise was not an issue. 
We had a king size bed. Room was quite large by NY standards. 
Breakfast was not included but then you can use your $30 voucher- this will cover only one breakfast. Your partner has to pay and the hotel has the stupid rule of not being able to accumulate your vouchers over successive days.. sounds like a money making racket to me. 
Showers are good. 
There is a coffee maker in the rooms but no spoons. 
The gym was good but then Central Park is 900 m down 7th Avenue. 
Nice touch having fresh apple daily.

title: Achtung: Finger weg!
text:
Checkin auf das Minimum an Service und Gastfreundschaft reduziert. Kein Upgrade als Elite Platinum und eher maga schlechte Zimmerzuweisung. Keine Wertschätzung!  

Auf Bitte war ein Late Checkout nicht möglich. Prompte Antwort: Angeblich sei das Zimmer für den Folgegast schon vergeben. Durch Zahlung von USD 100 ging es auf einmal doch. Abzocke! 

Zimmer direkt an einem 24h lauten Aufzugschacht. Ebenso keine Schlaf möglich durch Geräuschpegel von aussen und blinkende Leuchtreklame, keine Schallschutzfenster. Bei zwei Personen ein kleines Bett, kein Duschgel vorhanden, keine Slipper, kein Bademantel, kein Wasserkocher.

Katastrophe und echtes NO GO: Die Frühstücksdame mit dem Namen „LANA“ ist die frechste, arroganteste und unhöflichste Mitarbeiterin die ich als Platinum Gast jemals in meinen über 1000 Bonvoy Übernachtungen erlebt habe. Sie hat ihren Job verfehlt und hat definitiv nichts in einem Dienstleistungsunternehmen zusuchen.

Checkout freundlich. Leider Fehler in der Rechnung. Die Destination Gebühr, welche durch Einlösung hätte gutgeschrieben werden müssen, war fehlerhaft. Eine Korrektur war nicht möglich, da Buchungsnachtlauf abgewartet werden muss. Checkout mit nicht korrekter Rechnung.

Grundsätzlich hat das Hotel kein Dienstleistungsgedanke, freche und arrogante Mitarbeiter, endliche Ausschlussleistungen, verwirrende und komplizierte Regeln (weltweit noch nie so erlebt). 

Es gibt andere Hotels in der Gegend neben Renaissance & Marriott mit besseren Dienstleistungen und vor allem Wertschätzung & Dienstleistungsgedanke. 

Liebes Hotel bitte keine Rechtfertigung oder pauschale Standardantworten... 

Marriott steht nicht mehr für gute Hotels! 

Kurzum nie wieder!

title: My 75 th Birthday
text:
The location, staff and attentive caring is truly exceptional!

My wife and I stayed at your Times Square location Feb 22-25 this year
coming to New York to celebrate my 75th birthday.
On Feb 27th after arriving home I received a beautiful package of gifts from  the Renaissance Times Square
Hotel!

The gifts are wonderful, useful, and very much appreciated.
What is also greatly appreciated is the effort taken, the thoughtfulness and caring that came with it which 
will be long remembered

To all involved, those who signed the birthday card, as well as the complete staff at the Times Square hotel, 
I offer my most humble thank you and deepest appreciation.

Lastly, I want all to know our stay was wonderful and we will be returning in the future.
We will also be telling our friends your wonderful hotel and staff.

Thank you all again.
Sincerely,

Robert J. Mowery

title: Potentially awesome view....
text: The hotel was beautiful.  Quick check in, wonderful restaurant, great location, quiet (despite being in Time Square), and comfy.  The only downfall was (our main reason for picking that location) the view was obstructed by filthy windows.  The windows on the outside were disgusting.  Everything was seen through a layer of funk.  For the price of the room, the windows should be clean enough to see out.  We wanted to see Times Square!!

title: Loved this hotel so much!!
text:
I came with my daughter to se Hamilton and we absolutely lived staying here. Being a Marriott member we were allowed to check in early since our flight arrived in the morning. They definitely treated us well while we were staying and the location can it be beat. 
I usually stay at Renaissance Midtown but this hotel was just fantastic. 
Lobby bar was great and we enjoyed the Cheeseboard and wings along with the views.

title: Location is amazing, quality of services simply suck
text: Only one elevator worked (they have three) over a two day stay in a 26 story hotel....yeah that sucked.  Fitness center equipment is outdated and worn out.  Staff is a bit grumpy and need to attend charm school

title: Excellent Location
text: Don't miss R lounge which can give you an overview for times square. As a Marriott titanium member we can have free full breakfast in R lounge and appetizers during dinner time in weekdays. In weekend, the only choice is 1000 points in lieu of no providing free breakfast. Room was spacious, elegantly decorated, and comfortable. Air-conditioner worked quietly. Next to 42 street-times square metro which has a lot of access for metro lines.

title: Great hotel
text: Hotel is in a great location with great views and restaurants and makes NYC great experience  we found an amazing Italian restaurant 3 blocks away story cannot recall the name but love NYC visit the time square area and the open red. Bus tours and the Beatuax boat tour

title: Na Times Square ao lado da TKTS
text:
Essa é A opção pra quem quer ficar literalmente em Times Square! 
É um 4 estrelas padrão: confortável, silencioso, serviços de qualidade, porém sem tratamento exclusivo. Os quartos são amplos para os padrões de NYC. 
Recebemos café da manhã continental e snacks à noite gratuitos por sermos membros Platinum do programa Bonvoy (fidelidade da rede Marriot), porém não tivemos upgrade. 
O R Lounge (restaurante do hotel) tem a melhor vista possível da Times Square. Exatamente em cima do restaurante Olive Garden. 
Se você gosta de musicais, não precisará caminhar mais do que 5 minutos para assistir seu espetáculo favorito.
Será difícil encontrar opção melhor de hospedagem nesta região!

title: Best location
text:
When you plan to visit NYC, and you want a hotel at the heart of Times Square. This is the right place. Big rooms and NEW ,fantastic staff. Very clean rooms and bathrooms. Just a steps from everywhere in Times Square. 
Breakfast just ok, no choices and it’s 30$.
But no worries because you are in the location with more than 100 restaurants.
Special thanks for BRIAN, the reception staff. 
I recommend this hotel for families with kids. 
Thank you Ren New York at Times Square.

title: Amazing Staff
text:
My wife, 2 girls (ages 8 & 11) and I stayed here the weekend of January 17th. Team members we came in contact with throughout the hotel were amazing. Just to mention a few:  
• Joseph @ the front desk
  -> my 11 year old and I went down to have our keys reprogrammed. Joseph was empathetic to us for having to come down and engaged in conversation while providing us with new keys. My oldest daughter thought Joseph was super nice (which he was)! 
• Raffael @ the R Lounge
  -> over the course of our 3 night stay, we visited the bar after each day of exploring. Between wine suggestions, knowledge of local brews, Raffael was super attentive in ensuring the old fashioned he made was top notch & delicious. The last day we were there, we bought some “sweets” at a local bakery and took them back to the hotel to enjoy. Raffael brought the girls some milk to enjoy with their cookies and cupcakes. So thoughtful; girls were delighted! 
• Wadud @ the R Lounge
  -> our last night at the hotel, we ordered some snacks in the lounge. Tables are not that large, however Wadud was efficient with our order, delivery of items, ensuring our drinks were always full and clearing plates when we were finished to make room on the tables. The attention to detail was superb!

Although we never saw our housekeeper, the room was clean and always impeccable when we returned from exploring the city. Thanks to all of the team for making the hotel stay of my girls first trip to NYC memorable!

title: A Great Stay
text: On my first trip to NYC I wanted to stay right in the heart at Times Square, and this is smack dab.  The main lobby was nice and the lounge offered great views of the square. The cocktails were good but not some of the best at the bar, I didn’t get a chance to try the food.  Got a room on the top floor (26)  with some decent views, although it seems that only two rooms on each floor get actually square views.  The rooms were very clean and nicely appointed with the amenities you would expect from a hotel of this class.  I would stay again and recommend.

title: New Year in NY
text:
Nous avons séjourné une semaine dans cet hôtel pour le Nouvel An 2020.
Séjour quasi parfait s’il n’y avait pas eu ce couac à l’arrivée : chambre indisponible ! nous avons été relogés et ils se sont occupés de transférer le lendemain les valises dans la chambre finale, en offrant le petit déjeuner du lendemain en compensation.
Idéalement situé en plein coeur de Times Square avec le restaurant avec vue imprenable sur la boule ! 
On reviendra ☺️

title: Used to stay here frequently
text: Only stay here as a tourist I used to stay here a lot as it is close to my office. No room service anymore, mattress had a visible trough in it, really nice bar staff, rude waiter. I am Ambassador level with Marriott

title: Sleek, modern, comfortable.
text: We actually had a reservation at a different hotel to begin with but checked out moments after we checked in because it was so bad. The folks at the front desk at the Renaissance were overly friendly and a welcome change from our precious digs. The room was comfortable and we loved the design. I grabbed a drink from the bar which took a little longer than it should but it looked like maybe a shift change or something, not a huge deal. Overall, a great stay and a perfect location to feel like you’re in the middle of it all!

title: Nice surprise
text: Stopped by for drinks and snack. Nice view of times. Ambience nice. Awesome staff, friendly. My wife and I felt welcomed. So glad we stopped in. Our next visit to New York we are considering a weekend stay at the Renaissance.

title: Get a High Floor
text: Stayed on the 25th floor and I slept great! I heard no noise how some complain about and the curtains covered the bright screen lights great. The concierge was very helpful in the lobby level and answered questions regarding the area. Breakfast was great with real eggs and bacon!

title: 立地最高
text:
マリオットボンボイの会員です
1階のエントランスはこじんまりしています
チェックインもそこでします
16時からでしたが運良く11時に手続き出来ました
メインのフロアはエレベーターで上がった（たぶん3階）ところで静かで落ち着いた雰囲気
午後はタイムズスクエアを眺めながらドリンクとかがいただけます（有料だけどディスティネーションフィーで飲めるから実質無料!?）
朝食はメインのラウンジでタイムズスクエアど真ん前でテンション上がります
アサインされた部屋は最上階の26階でしたが部屋はいたって普通
シャワーは固定式でバスタブ付きでした
窓はほぼ全面ですがスモークが貼ってあるので室内はやや暗めでした
照明はそこそこ明るいです
窓が空きましたが怖かったですw
空の大きな冷蔵庫が使えました
アメニティはシャンプー、リンス、石鹸程度でバスローブは無し
テレビは英語以外のチャンネルはありませんでした
会員だったのでWi-Fiは無料でした
とにかく立地は良く雨にもほとんど濡れることなく地下鉄の駅に行けました

title: Frequent Traveler to Times Square
text: We have stayed at several hotels around Times Square when we've travelled to NYC to see Broadway shows and the Renaissance has been the best, hands down.  They accommodated our 4-hour early arrival and upgraded the room so we could have a roll-away bed...both at no extra charge.  Their fitness center is excellent and their hotel bar is very nice.  On top of that, you get great views of Times Square.

title: Great New York stay!
text: Thus was my first New York trip and the hotel was duper nice. All the employees were very cordial and accommodating. This was near everything so we walked to 5th Avenue, Rockefeller center, St.Patrick Cathedral,etc. I highly recommend!!!The views from rooms are outstanding and very spacious.

title: Poorest service I've ever seen in my life !!!
text: The staff is absolutely rude and will talk to you like they feel superior. We had some drinks with my friends at the lounge. When we arrived, no "hello", just the waitress shouting at us ''ID PLEASE'' like she was an FBI agent. She never smiled at us once for the whole night, neither being polite. I ordered a cocktail that tasted AWFUL and when I asked to change it (very politely) she shouted at me ''you chose it not me''. Then she came back (a long moment after) rolled her eyes and throw the cocktail on the other side of the table. Honestly the service is better at McDonalds.

title: New Year Break
text: Stayed over new year period.  Room was average,(slightly tired) however, price wasn't!   Whilst I expected and appreciated that we would be paying an increased price for the new year break, I actually think the room was extremely overpriced.  Whilst the location was good, it was actually a hinderance on new year eve's trying to battle the crowds again to get in and out of the hotel due to the ball drop.  In hindsight I should have thought about this before booking the hotel.  Postive note was that whilst we could not actually see the bands playing in time square we could hear them from the hotel room.  Breakfast choice was good and bar / lounge area nice and comfortable.  Overall, comfortable stay and staff helpful and friendly.

title: Breakfast (NO OMELETTE or EGGS made to order)
text:
Purchased breakfast with the stay. BonVoy website advertised omelettes and eggs made to order. No omelettes or eggs were available. The scrambled eggs that were part of the buffet were runny and did not taste like eggs. 

Stayed at the same hotel in 2015. The conditions of the room and the quality of the service is not what I remembered from the first stay. Such a shame because the location and the view from the RLounge is great.

title: Great Location
text: Nice, clean facility close to tons of attractions.  Great restaurants, Broadway shows, and shopping is within an easy walk.  Hotel staff was helpful and courteous.  Very comfortable bed and large walk-in rain shower made the stay even more pleasant.  Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Staff made my stay better. Great location!
text: We arrived at 6 in the evening after traveling all day and our room was not ready. I realize it's a busy time but was not expecting the room not to be ready. I'm very loyal to the Marriott brand as a Platinum member.  I usually stay at another Marriott brand in Times Square and this was our first stay at the Renaissance.  Kudos to Christopher for going the extra mile to quickly recognize me as a Platinum member and locate us a room within the hour. Christopher should be commended for making my first impression of the hotel which was negative and turn my experience into a very positive stay. Christopher is someone who provides the highest standard of customer service and treats you like family. The room was on the 17th floor and was extremely clean, comfortable and large by NYC standards. Even though it is located in the heart of Times Square, we never heard any noise. The location of the hotel is excellent and you can walk to Broadway shows and wonderful restaurants. The hotel was at full capacity but the elevators were always fast with no delays. Beautifully decorated hotel for Christmas. Bed and pillows were very comfortable, bathroom spacious and blackout curtains to ensure all the Times Square lights were blocked out for a good nights rest. I also want to give James a huge shout out for helping us with our luggage and getting us a cab. James is such a nice customer service oriented employee. Thank you again to Christopher for turning my first impression of the hotel to a positive experience. Mr Marriott would be proud of his professionalism and service. I would consider this hotel again when in the area.

title: Pricey but Excellent
text: You cannot get a hotel in any better location if you are doing a theatre week!  We were lucky enough to get a group rate, but the rooms are very expensive.  The rooms are very nice, large, and comfortable.  Well appointed, and the housekeeping staff is excellent.  In fact, every person that we came in contact with was wonderful.  We had drinks several times in the lobby bar, and looked out over Times Square

title: Mediocre
text: The location is great, but that is about the only thing great  this hotel offers.  Customer service is sub standard and the hotel is in desperate need of a face lift.  I'm a titanium level customer and it was a comedy of errors during breakfast with the hostess losing her stuff.   Another night I went down to the lobby lounge and after waiting for a waiter I went up to the bar and asked about service.   I was told the waited called in sick today.  Wow, I guess that means no table service for the entire shift, great management.  For the money they charge I would try another hotel in the area.

title: One of the better hotels in NYC
text:
The room feels a little bit dated, but the hotel certainly has a lot of character. super fancy lobby and lounges. The room itself still has relatively good hardware. the washroom for example has automatic lighting. It is also the only one place I stayed in NYC that actually has a heated mirror so it does not fog up. The windows are very good too as I can barely hear the sound from the busy Time Square.

Perhaps the best part of this entire hotel is its R Lounge. the restaurante has a surreally fantastic view of time square. You get an uninteruppted 180 degree view of TS, where the ball and the main billboard is right in front of you. The breakfast is a bit underwhelming in selection for its price ($30), but for the view, you really should treat yourself and try it at least once. You are fully sheltored from the elements while get a beautiful view without the insane pedestrian traffic.

title: Rude restaurant staff
text:
The staff in the R lounge are extremely rude both days we were there. The hostess was rude for breakfast, the wait staff is poor. Most things you ask for like Ice or a Napkin or a drink they disappear and extremely rude. This was the experience both days. If i wanted to be treated poorly i could of stayed at a motel 6. 
As a titanium member i wont be staying here again.  On a positive note the rooms have been remodeled.

title: Pictures and Looks are deceiving
text:
Checked into this hotel in July, 2019.  We planned staying the entire time we were in New York here, given my status and some reviews online I figured the hotel was a reasonable option over 4th of July.  Boy was I wrong.
I attribute this hotel as a hybrid between a motel 6 and a run down Sheraton.  
Check-in: The process was rather terrible in the cramped lobby entrance and no recognition for status...  Ok, thats fine.
Room: The room was run down and looks like they paid a designer money to try and make it seem "hip" - new flash it isn't
Amenities: Their lounge service is a drink coupon which covers absolutely nothing, quite disappointing

Now on to the terrible parts - after the first night I came back to the room around 4pm and found that the room was well over the set limit (at 77 degreed) and it was climbing.  I dropped the set point which basically rendered the room an oven. Called the front desk who told me that is how hotels in NYC are (complete bull) but that they would send someone to check the room.  I get a knock on the door and there is a man holding a fan.  That was the solution to this problem, a FAN?  It was almost 80 at this point and it was only going to get warmer.  Side note: the hallways and lobby were also VERY warm, I think their AC went down and they refused to say anything.

I called the front desk again this time speaking to a very nice woman who said she was the manager.  She basically told me they were sold out and that I was stuck in the room I was in.  I politely asked her to let me out of my reservation ASAP and I would find a hotel with suitable AC.  She did.  When I went downstairs to checkout we conversed and she apologized for the issues, etc etc. especially with my status and that she would deposit 45k points in my account as compensation for my troubles.  

Its been 6 months I never saw the points and well frankly I never really got anything other than a crapy experience in NYC.  
I moved to the Edition across the street and my stay in NYC was amazing as a result.  

I caution you with this hotel, given it's location they care very little about anything.

title: Beautiful!
text: Loved our stay at the Renaissance hotel in Times Square! It is placed at a wonderful location at the heart of Times Square, and our hotel room had a window facing down onto the street so we could see some of the theatres and restaurants from our room! The breakfast was also lovely, with a view which was also set straight onto Times Square. Absolutely adored the scenery and the staff were all very friendly too. Would definitely recommend it!

title: Great all around
text: Great service (bell service and valet were super nice and careful with our luggage), great (clean and comfy) room, great location (prime, central to everything. Very busy/congested area though.), great complimentary breakfast (for members), great views (of Times Square and the NYE ball drop). 2nd time staying here and we loved it.

title: We loved it.  Don't be afraid of location.
text: Just stayed here this week with two teenagers and my husband.  Rooms large for new york standards and the bathroom was plenty big.  I thought housekeeping was great as were the rest of the staff.  The bar staff was slow as other reviews mentioned.  If we sat at a table I always had to ask if we had a waiter or not and it still took a while.  The breakfast was ok, but I don't think anything was worth the 30 dollar a day resort fee.  That said, though, I would probably stay here again as we really liked the location.  Stayed on the 20th floor and heard none of the time square noise.

title: Potential to be a 5, but fell short
text: Over all we were pretty happy with the hotel.  The concierge was friendly as well as the front desk staff.  Bar service was quite slow.  This is a great location to see Broadway shows.  Though they do not have an executive lounge they offer guests that would have access to an executive lounge a free breakfast in the lobby restaurant.  The breakfast in the lobby was good.  We stayed in room 2617...we were told this was an "upgraded" room.  It was behind the elevators and though it was faint, you could hear motor noises from them.  The biggest complaint I have is with general housekeeping of the room.  I have been seeing similar issues in many Mariott properties lately, but we had mildew in the shower, shredded towels and the most disturbing a candy and flosser on the floor when we arrived from a previous guest.  I was curious if they would clean them the next day, nope, checked in on 11/22 and they were still there when we checked out on 11/25.

title: Prélèvements sur mon compte bancaire
text:
Bonjour , j’ai déjà payé le montant de mon séjour , taxes incluses pour un montant de 1570,65€ , 
Hier j’ai été prélevé pendant la nuit de 41€67 , mal justifiés par l’agent d’accueil , et là à ma surprise en pleine nuit , je suis prélevé , sur mon compte de 206,18€ ! J’ai déjà payé mon séjour toute taxes incluses , pourquoi se permets on de prélever sur mon compte des sommes non justifiées sans mon autorisation ?! C’est honteux et j’exige au plus vite une réponse et mon remboursement ! Actuellement dans la chambre 2306 je suis totalement dégoûté de ce moyen de fonctionner et j’estime être trompé , 
Cordialement

title: Best view, best location, best staffs, Clean, lots of space
text:
Room:
We were a party of 4 and stayed in 2 double bed room in the 11th floor which had a city view. Beds were comfortable.  The room was big enough for us, clean and bathroom was huge and modern. The only thing I did not like was the noise from outside and next to our room (I think it was a utility or housekeeping room). We could hear them talking and doors closing loudly. Early in the morning, someone started digging on the street like using a jack hammer which woke us up and it was impossible to go back to sleep.
Location:
Best location in Times Square. 6 minutes walk to Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick Cathedral. 1 min walk to the subway station. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Easy walks to broadway shows. 
View:
The Times Square view from the lobby is amazing! We loved hanging out at the restaurant and took a bunch of pictures. If we ever go back to NYC again with my friends, we will surely come back for this spectacular view. 
Staffs:
They have the most hospitable staffs! Their front desk and restaurants staffs and even those we interact with in the lobby (cleaning or setting up) were very friendly and exceeded my expectations for customer service. The guy at the bag storage even gave me an umbrella as souvenir since it was raining outside. 
It was a little bit pricey though but it was a great experience!

title: Too many other Bonvoy options for me to return
text:
While a spacious and comfortable hotel, especially for NYC, the Renaissance has some downsides that prevent it from being top-rated.

ROOMS
The Renaissance offers rooms at a good size – about average in national standards, but above-average for Manhattan.  I had a room with two doubles, not ideal but certainly not a problem.  The beds themselves are comfortable, but the sheets could use an upgrade – they are a bit rough.  I actually gave myself a “rug burn” on my elbow after rolling over in the night.  There are USB and AC plugs on the nightstands, plus an enormous TV that has a Netflix and Hulu option. There is a standard mini-fridge and closet, and the work area is adequate with a built-in luggage rack as part of the desk itself, which I really like.  Bathrooms are decent with plenty of counter space and a large tub/shower combo, however the plumbing could use some work.  My showerhead was coming out of the wall (loosely), the faucet was clunky and the sink drain was very slow.  It’s just not a good experience for the traveler and not up to par for the Renaissance brand.

LOCATION
I have mixed feelings about hotels in Times Square.  On one hand, the location is convenient for walking to several areas of Manhattan.  On the other, if you are on the Square side of the hotel, even with blackout shades, the monstrous lights on the buildings outside will creep into your room all night long.  You also have the problem of the solicitors and hecklers that are common in this area, so forget about walking in peace at certain times of the day, not to mention the immediate area has touristy, average-to-worse restaurant options.  Fortunately, it’s Manhattan and walking makes a lot of sense, so there are more options not far away.

SERVICE
This hotel had average service – front desk was nice and friendly, plus helpful.  I didn’t notice anything special, though.  It should meet expectations.

AMENITIES
There is a spa onsite as well as a fitness center, and the latter is certainly not bad.  It has a pulley station, dumbbells and benches, plus the usual compliment of cardio machines.  It also has kettlebells up to 45 lbs / 20 kg, which is always nice to see in a hotel.  The ceilings are also not low, which is common in urban hotels that I’ve seen, so another added bonus.

OVERALL
While the hotel itself is nice, it’s not overly so, and it has a few peculiarities, such as the elevator system.  From the lobby (which is tiny), you take an elevator up one level to what appears to be a full restaurant, then walk across a hall to get in another elevator that services all floors.  The location isn’t great, but it’s not terrible.  There are aspects of the rooms that I like but others I didn’t.  With so many other options in NYC, it will be a bit tough to get me to stay here again.

title: Perfect stay in an excellent location!!
text: A friend recommended this hotel for our visit to NYC for my daughters birthday and I couldn’t be more pleased! The concierge reached out to me a few days ahead with dining, activity and entertainment options. When I mentioned we were visiting the big apple for daughters 15th bday he asked what kind of cupcakes she liked and on our first day had balloons and cupcakes delivered to our room with a personalized sign! Every request was accommodated post haste and with excellent customer service from extra lotions and waters, early check in, earplugs for a friend of ours whose child was sensitive to sound and more. Our housekeeper was delightful often engaging us in sweet conversation as we came and went. She always asked if we needed anything or if she could do anything for us. Every single person from the front desk, bellman, concierge, restaurant and bar staff all made her birthday trip exceptional! The room was spacious and we loved the New York touches (mirror, snow globe etc...) Pro trip - plan to eat at the restaurant (we liked doing breakfast) and look out the window at the hustle and bustle of Times Square! You can’t beat the location and the prices were reasonable for sure! We will be back and tell all of our friends!

title: Do NOT valet your car
text: Once I got into my car after it was valeted for less than 12 hrs it was very clear to me that the car was taken for a joy ride. The passenger seat was in a lounge position with boot marks all over the dashboard. Coffee was spilled all over the console and the trip mileage was reset. I also had a very expensive vase in the back seat which was shattered all over the floor. Needless to say I’m quite disappointed. You would think that spending the amount of $ you do for a room on a hotel room at at location with a reputable reputation this would be the least of worries. I wasn’t even offered a refund for the parking cost. However it is an ongoing investigation as they need to check parking garage cameras. Not sure how that proves the car was driven around the city?? Do not trust the Renaissance to car for your care. You’re better off leaving it in the street.

title: Good for Times Square
text:
The good:
Fairly modern rooms
Very nice staff
New gym (not big)
Beautiful breakfast room with views over Times Square 
Plats/Titaniums get a free meal at the bar between 5:30pm and late. Pretty good value (got pizza one night and chicken wings the other)

Bad:
30 usd per day destination fee
It’s at Times Square...
Breakfast spread is very limited

title: Nice hotel, good location, but a few disappointments ...
text:
Overall this is a very nice hotel at the North end of Times Square.  Room was surprisingly large with good lighting and a comfortable bed and good quality bathroom/shower.  

I had only two negative experiences:

1.  I really don't like the automatic-off bathroom lights.  Not clear on what the timing is (no feedback, but clearly went off in less than 30 min).  I have no problem with visible timers, or with a card slot by the door for overall power control, but simply do not like automatic lights that go out without feedback or warning.  

2.  I had the unfortunate sense of being cheated the entire time I was in the hotel.  I was there as part of a group, and had been warned that there was a $30 "destination charge" that was part of our rate, and that we'd get $30 each day worth of food/drink if we used it.  I don't like these fees (does _anybody_?), but what was really troubling was how opaque it was and how it seemed they were trying to hide this (when checking in, I had to ask about it) and frankly cheat on it (when I did buy a cheese plate at the bar, it was charged to my credit card right away, and I had to deal with it at check-out; and it seems they were trying to double-charge sales tax, both on the destination charge and the food itself).  Similarly, they use obscure wording to make it less-than-clear on the water bottles in the room that they are included in the fee.  No one piece of this was hard to solve, but when you're paying several hundred a night for a room, it should come without the feeling of being nickel and dimed!

title: Surprennant ! Mais pas dans le bon sens.
text: Arriver correct bon mise a part d.avoir clairement deranger le personnel de reception qui etait en pleine conversation, juste 10 minutes ! Chambre correct un peu viellotte mais la base est là. Mais alors le top du comble c’est la partie restauration, on ai attendu au desk pour etre instaler, bon la personne ne semblait pas tres interreser par nous mais plus par son portable, donc on a voulu s’installer tout seul et la comble du tout cette personne en me hurlant dessus m’attrape par l’epaule. Vous imaginer la reaction de mon compagnon. Le super plus la barmaid qui est un vrais amour et qui est la depuis 15 ans et adore son travaille. Merci a elle.

title: Anniversary
text: The Renaissance New York Times Square is the perfect property for NYC! Close to the theater. Close to Rockefeller Center. And yes,  close to Times Square! Thank You EMILY with Marriott Vacation Club! Your Professionalism and sincerity with each guest is greatly appreciated!!

title: Top location
text: We stayed for 4 nights in room with a terrace and it was great! You can’t beat the location! The staff was kind and helpful. The breakfast had good options. Views from the restaurant are amazing. The rooms were well equipped and bed was comfy. Great choice!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: This is an excellent hotel in the perfect location for tourist trip to New York. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms have been refurbished since my last visit. It has an amazing view of times square from the restaurant! The only downside is the noise from the outside, especially the emergency services vehicles when they are passing through Times Square but u think it adds to the experience.

title: Great location but loud
text: I stayed here for two nights on the 17th floor. There was still a decent amount of street noise for the 17th floor but that’s what you get when you stay in Times Square. I was really surprised by the interior noise. I could clearly hear every person in the hallway and every door slam. It was incredibly disruptive since I was here for the NYC Marathon and was awoken several times in the night. Aside from that the hotel is very nice and has everything you would need including a nice deep bathtub for post run baths.

title: location is key...
text: this was our first trip to new york...staying in times square was perfect...so many things were walkable...taxi's were plentiful...our rooms were connecting and we had a small patio overlooking time square...very fun location experience...bedding was extremely comfy...we had a few problems like having to call 4 times for the roll away bed we requested and 2 times for the door jams we requested to keep the connecting room doors open...they have a confusing system of giving a credit daily but knowing what to use it on is difficult to understand even after asking for clarification...you are credited if the credit is not used...so i was fine with not understanding...there is a continental type breakfast offered but again it is confusing...the food on either side of the restaurant has 2 different costs, which was never explained at all, we just overheard it being discussed...the hostess lady was borderline rude...again revolving around the daily credit and whether the breakfast was included...there is a bar and the bartender gave us chips to take up to our room with our beer!  there is a concierge desk that came in helpful with maps...overall, it was a great stay...

title: Top of the Heap
text: A visit to Time Square is not complete without a stop at the R Lounge! The view is amazing....all the lights, sights, people! We have made this a yearly stop for the last several years. Very friendly staff, yummy apps, and large drink list. We look forward to our stop next year!!

title: Great Hotel - but ...
text: The Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel is a great hotel. Nice size rooms with a large bathroom (rare in NYC), great location, everything you could ask for EXCEPT there is a $30/day destination fee that is refundable against expense(s) incurred at the hotel (as well as some other items). What they do NOT tell you is that unlike some of the other NYC Marriott hotels that is a daily charge and cannot be accumulated throughout your stay. So if you spend $100 one day and nothing the next, you only get a $30 credit. Had they told us that, AND HAD THE RESTAURANT BEEN OPEN, we would have been able to recoup the entire $150 (five days) instead of the lesser amount we received.

title: Excellent!
text: This is a must stay when in NYC. Excellent location.  Excellent service and excellent accommodations.  Very clean!  The view from the R lounge is amazing.  Prime Time Square view.  The breakfast buffet is really good too!

title: Pour le restaurant
text:
Franchement un des lieux top pour dîner ou boire un verre à l’étage avec une vue panoramique sur Time Square imprenable. 
À faire absolument . Dîner pour tous les goûts à des prix pour toutes les bourses

title: Great until the last night. Pot smokers in the room next door!!!
text: The hotel was great until the last evening when we could smell that the occupant in the room next to us were smoking pot. The smell was so strong that it was coming into our room via the locked adjoining door. We called the main desk and the security guard came up and we heard him tell them that they needed to stop because he could smell it right when he got off the elevator. 2 hours later...same thing. Called the front desk to be told that they can't do anything because they didn't know for sure which room it was coming from...The security guard walked right to their door after the first call!!! I told them that I wanted to make sure that I wasn't charged for the "smoke" smell in my room because of them.

title: Friendly, Clean and Updated
text: I had a wonderful stay for 3 nights on a business trip. We were upgraded (using suite awards) to the executive suite. Anywhere you stay in Times Square I’d recommend trying to stay on a higher floor. This hotel is in the heart of Times Square and the bar seating has a nice view overlooking Times Square, which is amazing for people watching. The staff was friendly and rooms clean. I had an issue with the shower not getting hot and they came up immediately and fixed.

title: Avoid 4th floor
text: We had a lovey 20th floor room with a large bathroom, desk area and closet. . We were “upgraded” to a 4th floor “suite”.  The only redeeming feature here was a balcony looking out on Time Square. The closet might be 18” wide, one mirror over a tiny vanity and the strangest lighting situation I’ve ever encountered. Faux wood flooring, very poorly installed, made the entire room feel cold and uninviting. Granted, we didn’t spend a lot of time here, it being New York and all, but don’t spend your $ on a suite. Service is okay, but not worth the price. It’s Time Square so expect to pay, but a couple blocks off gets you a better value.

title: A Good Choice
text:
Yes, it is in a busy area, but this hotel  is a wonderful option for those who like to be in the center of the action. The hotel staff are friendly and accommodating, the rooms are nicely appointed, and the higher floors are surprisingly quiet. The fall decor in the entrance and the R lounge gave a festive vibe. We loved having the lights, colorful billboards, and people watching as the backdrop for cocktails or meals. 
It is in the perfect location for theater and restaurants. We plan to be back.

title: Girls trip!!
text: We loved the Renaissance on Time Square!! I was extremely surprised and pleased with how big the rooms were! Every afternoon we enjoyed a cocktail to unwind and regroup with our group of girls in the lounge! (If your a margarita drinker highly suggest a marg there)! The staff was friendly, hotel was clean and we felt safe at all times!! Would highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when we go back! Its in the middle of time square so perfect location to anything you want to do (subway, 5th ave, Broadway, Central Park, etc.). Also surprised that being on Time Square the lights and noise did not bother us or keep us from sleeping! Picture is the view from our room!

title: Experience time square
text:
In a sophisticated bar. Where a tree is centered the same time you see the hole show of time square through the window.
What a joyride. Can’t remember what I ordered I just cherished the moment of the loud energy that are pulsing in every corner of the area.

title: Excellent Customer Service!
text:
Here’s the thing, I didn’t end up staying here because I wanted to be close to my conference in midtown. I originally wasn’t able to book a room at the Renaissance midtown, so I booked here. I showed up the night of my reservation after already checking in online. I wanted to share how excellent the customer service was that was provided by Gloria at the front desk. She very patiently helped me switch my reservation to the midtown Renaissance (they now had availability). The process probably took 20 minutes where she was put on hold and also called the other hotel and reservations for me. I am very impressed with her patience and caring, especially since I didn’t actually want to stay at this location.

Thank you, Gloria! Better service than I could have expected, you’re wonderful!

title: Excellent service
text: We’ve been going to this hotel for years experience has always been incredible and always above expectation the staff is very caring and attentive to detail everybody from the concierge to the Bellman did a fantastic job

title: Stayed to go to a show
text: I’m a very frequent traveller with Marriott & used my points talking my family to a show.   I chose this property due to location & because it was newly refurbished.  It’s is beautiful & extremely comfortable.  The concierge (lady) was so helpful and was super sweet to my 9yo, asking him about the musical we saw.  The staff was very attentive and helpful.  Fantastic location & will look forward to visiting again.

title: Fun weekend in New York
text: The location of the hotel was great, right in time square next to the m&m store!  As a platinum member, we were upgraded to a room on the 23rd floor with a great view.  We were offered breakfast which was buffet style for the weekend and included everything.  While eating in the lounge area you are surrounded by windows and feel the vibe of the active city while relaxing in great decor with good service.  They had a table with coloring books and games to help keep children occupied. The beds were very comfortable and the room was modern and clean.  The concierge was extremely helpful and not only made good restaurant recommendations but made the reservations for us as well.  You have to take the elevator to the lounge area and then another elevator to the rooms, this provides an extra layer of security.  There is a $30 resort fee added each day but does provide useful extras and a credit to use at the hotel.  I definitely hope to stay here again.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: This hotel is hard to review. The rooms and lobby etc. are really nicely updated. The staff except for the restaurant were very nice. We did have issues with the noise from Times Square but we expected that, so if you have a problem sleeping with noise you might look elsewhere. The restaurant overlooks Times Square with a spectacular view. We only ate in the restaurant once and the waiter we had was very rude and condescending. It really put a damper on our trip and made us decide we would never stay at this location again!!

title: Excellent Service
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel a few times because it’s close to my office, and I like the feel of the interior rooms and the building.   It doesn’t have the “corporate” and staid feel of many Marriotts, but its rooms are roomy, comfortable, and well-done.  I’ve also always been really impressed by the staff on previous state - they go out of their way to be friendly and helpful.  

On this particular trip, however, I had an issue with some late night noise in my room, and although I could have walked away renouncing the hotel forever, suffice it to say that the Management (Ms. Monete Cockburn) handled it so well that I walked away feeling even better about this hotel than I had in the past.  She was responsive, empathetic, and professional.  She should be training all new managers on customer service if she doesn’t do that already.  Looking forward to my next trip (I promised to take my daughter next time), and in the meantime, here’s the view from my hotel room balcony.

title: Holiday
text: Worst hotel I have visited in a while. Horrendous service and disrespect from the staff. Was visiting New York for the first time and decided to go to the Renaissance for food and drinks due to the amazing view......... However we were placed in an average viewing position and once space came available in a better situation  we were not allowed to move as we already had  sat down apparently even though the spaces were not reserved.  Awful service from the young lady who as managing the seating.  No idea of customer respect.

title: Perfect Place for Times Square
text:
Normally stay at the W Times Square but wanted to try something different this trip and so glad I did.  The Renaissance is awesome and the bar which overlooks Times Square and the TKTS booth is amazining.

Makes you feel like your out in the action without being in the action.  Great for people watching.

Love the overall decor and vibe.  Definitely will stay here on future visits.

title: Great location but bathroom needs updating
text: The hotel appears to have been updated recently but the bathrooms were given a refresh instead of replacement.  The bathtub was stained so it looked dirty.  The staff were very friendly and overall provided good service. Marriott corporate should approve fully renovating the bathrooms.  Please note there is no club lounge and no room service.  There is also no market on site- when I asked about buying water I was told to go to the Duane Reade a couple of blocks away.

title: Great hotel right in Times Square
text:
This hotel is right in Times Square (it has the tall Coca-Cola sign on it!)
It’s very clean, comfortable with spacious rooms, and incredible views!
You have to ride an elevator from the street entrance to the lobby, where you catch other elevators to your room.  This was never an issue with waiting, and gave a little piece of mind.
We totally recommend.

title: Not a Business Traveler Hotel
text:
As many business travelers I arrived at 10pm wanting to just sleep in a comfortable bed to rest before heading back to work.  Upon arrival I check in and get sent to a double room (instead of a king I reserved) literally in front of the elevator bay.  The location of the room is a reminder Gold Elite at Marriott is not the same as when it was Starwood.  When I went back to the front desk they told me that they are sold out of Kings.  Clearly Marriott reservations and the front desk have a communication issue, that happens.  The thing that is unacceptable is the front desk not being upfront that the room is not going to meet expectations and sending a guest knowingly to a room that they did not request.

Advice to management, dont hope your business travelers won't notice.  We notice enough to know to look for another trustworthy hotel.

title: Nice spacious room
text: Sitting virtually in the heart of Times Square. Rooms are well kept. Spacious given the location. Very busy though. His hotel is among some of the nice ones in New York. Highly recommended. Note that there's a New York Destination fee of additional 30 dollars though.

title: Memorable stay!
text: We had a wonderful time at this hotel, staying one night on our way to Maryland. It was so perfect that on our northbound trip a few days later, we diverted out of the crazy 95N traffic to stay another night. Saeed at valet was so welcoming, he remembered us from earlier in the week. It was like returning home! The rooms are clean and updated with special details like the snow globe and NYC skyline mirror. the housekeeping staff was so friendly, explaining the sheep decor and how the hotel was on the once site of a sheep farm long ago. The breakfast was delicious and the view of Times Square from the dining room was amazing. For those complaining of noise, you’re in the heart of Times Square. It’s the city that never sleeps. Wear ear plugs! There’s nothing else to solve that. We have stayed many times a year in NYC and we have found our new favorite hotel!!

title: well located
text:
The best thing about the hotel is its location, it is right in Times Square.

The rooms are not very large, and the view from the restaurant is spectacular. It's great to have breakfast overlooking Times Square.

The staff is ominous, very unfriendly, especially the woman who manages the restaurant

title: $ 445 charge for no reason!
text:
I stayed for 3 nights from August 9th by booking a hotel through Expedia.  
For the accommodation, I paid the hotel through Expedia.  
When I checked into the hotel, I presented the credit card to the front staff for a deposit but, of course, did not sign the payment.  
I was not charged for any payment from the front staff at checkout.  
It's only natural that I paid for the hotel through Expedia and there was no extra charge (breakfast, mini bar, snacks, phone etc.) during my stay at the hotel.  Of course, during my stay at the hotel, I didn't scratch or break the hotel fixtures.  However, my credit card company charged me after I returned home.  
As a price from the hotel!  And that amount is $ 445!  I have been charged for an unknown reason, which I have not approved！
We can only think that we have been charged twice for the accommodation fee.  
For me, $ 445 is a lot of money.
とにかく、不明な金額の請求は納得できない。
ホテル自体は立地もよく、快適な部屋ではあるが、基本の信用ができなくなってしまった！

title: Motorcycle mayhem
text: Nice hotel, recent renovations. Stayed on 23rd floor. Excellent service and staff. Free buffet for platinum members was ok. However, there was god-awful motorcycle revving noises nonstop between 10 pm and 2 am. Forget trying to get a goods nights rest! I can’t blame the hotel. Sound proofing is decent, but WTH???

title: Stolen money from our room
text:
We had two rooms. This was a graduation gift for my daughter who just graduated from college. One morning she forgot to put the do not disturb on the door.
