While we were out for the day, someone from the hotel cleaned the room. Someone also removed $125 of cash from her purse wallet which was in the bathroom.
We reported to hotel management, and security came to “make a report”.  When the security guard came to us he was acting as if we were an inconvenience to him. 
Then we get a call on Monday from “corporate claims” and they advise that they did not find the money. Of course they didn’t find the money because one of your staff members stole it. No call back from the direct management at the hotel to apologize or advise what they did to attempt to look into the matter. Absolutely horrendous customer service from Renaissance.

title: Amazing Staff
text:
My stay at the Renaissance was very pleasant. A special thank you to Fleridana Sanchez from the concierge desk, who made our stay extra special! Thank you for the great hospitality, and customer service!! I will definitely return shortly :)

Rooms were clean
Staff were pleasant
Food was delicious

title: A Joke
text: Do NOOOOOOT stay here.  Rude staff  Unprepared.  Phone does not work. Are not able to locate packages. Rude attention in general.  Hallways smell like beef and like a restaurant. With so many options in NYC, choose any other one.  I am currently in the hotel and cannot wait to get out.

title: NYC with the kids
text: Way overpriced, but was kind of expecting it to get a room on Times Square at short notice. Rooms a bit cramped like other hotels in the area. The staff was excellent except for the check-in counter where they were always short and abrasive. There were some kids games/activities on the lobby level. U have to take two separate elevators to get to your floor. Did not appreciate the $30 destination fee.  Probably would not go back.

title: Great staff in the heart of it all.
text: We felt extremely safe considering the amount of people roaming the neighborhood at all hours of the day and night.  The area is loud and flashy so bring your earplugs and eye masks or just stay up all night.  Be sure to get a drink in the lounge that looks out over Times Square, the menu is simple but tasty. The rooms were surprisingly big and decor unique.

title: Frisch renoviert
text: In NYC bin ich immer auf der Suche nach neuen oder gerade renovierten Hotels. Da in der Stadt bekanntermaßen der Durchlauf an Touristen riesig ist, sind die Hotels in kürzester Zeit abgewohnt und dann auch noch teuer! Der Ausflug war nicht geplant, da uns aber das Erdbeben in Kalifornien zu einer Planänderung zwang, ist NY immer unsere Zuflucht wenn es irgendwo nicht so gut ist. Das Renaissance stand schon lange auf meiner Wunschliste aber bisher war es immer sehr teuer. So kurzfristig hatten wir Glück und haben eine super Rate bekommen. Dazu stand auf der Marriott Seite das es gerade frisch renoviert wurde. Als Bonvoy Member konnten wir einen Early Check in bekommen. Die Zimmer sind recht dunkel, sehr modern eingerichtet aber halt dunkel. Es ist alles da was man braucht, Kaffee Maschine, Kühlschrank, ordentliches Badezimmer mit sehr großer Dusche. Auch die Größe der Zimmer ist für NY Verhältnisse extrem groß. Es gibt einen Ottomanen am Fenster von dem man wunderbar das Treiben auf den Straßen beobachten kann. Die Lage könnte nicht besser sein. Was ich auch super finde, mittlerweile nehmen die meisten Hotels im Stadtkern eine Fee von ca.30$ p.T. was ich schon frech finde bei den Zimmerpreisen. Das Renaissance gibt diese aber an den Gast zurück in Form von Frühstück, Gastgeschenk und Ticket für die Big Bus Touren. Das Frühstück ist für ein hochklassiges Hotel ein Witz und in jedem Homewood oder Fairfield Inn besser. Auch das Personal im Frühstücksbereich war extrem uninteressiert. Ansonsten haben wir uns sehr wohl gefühlt.

title: Good north side of Times Square with rooms that are quite large for NYC
text: Traditional funky Renaissance - rooms were nice and clean with quality bath products.  Rooms were also larger than most in NYC I have stayed in the past.  The restaurant overlooking times square is a pretty neat feature as well.

title: Best in New York City
text:
We love NYC. What a fabulous town. Only one place to stay. The Renaissance Times Square has it all. Great location in the heart of the city. Fabulous breakfast overlooking Times Square!! You can feel the beat of the city.  
Tammy Brown at the front desk greets you with a smile!! What a nice way to start your stay. She is knowledgeable and so kind. She assures you that your stay will be memorable 
The rooms are a nice size and equipped with a fridge and coffee maker. Fabulous bar for an evening drink. Homey and warm!! 
Can’t wait to come back!!

title: Room Dirty/Housekeeping Requests took a full 24 hours
text: I booked this reservation the same day as checking-in as our flight was cancelled. Via the Marriott Bonvoy App I requested extra towels and pillows that morning. We checked in at 6pm, a room was ready- bellman was extremely helpful and quick throughout the stay but that's about it on the service aspect. Front Desk attendant was rude, made little to no eye-contact, gave no direction to the room. Checked-In to a room up on a higher floor, no view. I'm starting to wonder the purpose of being Platinum Elite. The desk and TV table had dirt and greasy handprints through out.  AC was not working well so I called the front desk and asked for a fan (figuring this would  be easier than switching rooms), was told it would be brought up. Asked about the towels again (as only 3 were in the room for a party of 4), was told all would be up shortly. At 10:30pm still nothing. We checked out at 9am and as we were checking-out the houseman showed up with towels (no fan). As we were checking out! Very disappointing. With the exception of the Ritz, I'm noticing a downward trend in Marriott properties especially since SPG was acquired. Service has gone down, cleanliness has gone down. Very sad.

title: Great Hotel in Times Square
text: My wife and I wanted to take our kids (9 and 5) to NYC for the first time on our anniversary.  We chose the Renaissance due to it proximity to Times Square.  It is indeed right in the heart of Times Square.  For little kids they love being able to look out the windows and see all the people and lights.  If you want to be in the busy area and see all of this, this hotel is for you.  If you don't like the crowds and lights I would not stay here.  Overall the noise and lights were not bad.  I actually found the room to be quiet.  The room had curtains so you could eliminate all the lights if needed.  The staff was excellent the entire time.  The concierge was very helpful along with the super friendly front desk.  We of course had them hold our bags when we arrived and before we left.  The hotel has recently been renovated and you could tell, it was very nice.  There are also great views of Times Square from the Lounge area.  Ensure you use your $30 entertainment fee.  We got drinks and also went on a bus tour.  The only negatives I would have:  Oddly the bathroom did not have a lock, which made sharing a room with my young daughters a little more difficult.  Also, again if a place offers early arrival/check in I wish they would let you know prior to the normal check in time that your room is ready.  Other than that, the place was superb.

title: Great location
text: This is a good hotel - service was great. They charge a $30 destination fee but got it all back by using their big bus and food vouchers. There is a bar in the lobby that is probable the best view of Times Square in the city. Really close to all the broadway theaters.

title: Practically Perfect in Every Way
text:
If you are visiting NYC because you are for any reason there is no need to look at ANY OTHER HOTEL other than the Renaissance Times Square Hotel.

There in simply not a better location.Out the front door it is a short walk to literally every Broadway show in New York, a hop on/ hop off tour bus and the subway,. 

The hotel has a really cool NY City vibe. A ground level small registration area and elevator leads up to the main lobby. The lounge overlooks the TKTS booth to the heart of Times Square itself. The drinks were PERFECT and the food was great.

Our room was large, with great bathroom, and a king bed. There was a fridge, a coffee maker, plus coffee and creamer. My wife would insist I point out there is good hairdryer and great shampoo and conditioner.

I had purchased a matinee and an evening broadway show as well as the hotel stay as her gift. This staff was among the most friendly we encountered ANYWHERE. They made every effort to make a memorable celebration for my wife. 

My wife ("she who must be obeyed") is one of the PICKIEST people ever. If she could, she would pack a blacklight to inspect the cleanliness of the room. She repeatedly said "This is just great". If you have are picky or have a picky partner, let her be your barometer.

The entire hotel is immaculately maintained. We valet parked right out front at 714 7th ave ($65 per day). 

We had such a remarkably wonderful experience that we have decided to make The Renaissance an annual tradition for us.

Best stay ever

title: Ottima posizione per visita New York
text:
Il grande hotel si affaccia su Time Square, vicino a molti luoghi di interesse, raggiungibili a piedi o con il Metrò (fermata a 50 m). Le camere queen (2 letti) sono spaziose e pulite, la colazione se non compresa costa USD 30 per persona. Nelle vicinanze molte caffetterie e ristoranti.
Upgrade package (offerto in hotel) camera di USD 30.00 al giorno, consente di avere WIFI gratuito, 2 bottiglie di acqua al giorno in camera, USD 30.00 (non cumulabili) da utilizzare al bar e ristorante. Biglietti selezionati per attività gratuitamente.

title: Wonderfully luxurious
text: A friend booked this for our trip to New York and I had reservations given it’s location on Times Square. I expected it to be noisy and small. How wrong I was. The reception is located at ground level in the lobby and smells divine. They use an amazing scent throughout the public areas. Once checked in, it’s a lift ride upto the floor where the bar and restaurant are located and the lifts upto the bedrooms. Our bedroom was located on the 25th floor with a side view of Times Square. It was a very spacious room, very clean and with a comfortable queen size bed. Larger than most rooms in New York hotels it had a coffee machine and iron and ironing board-a real plus after travelling hand luggage only with a small rucksack. The bathroom was compact with an over bath shower and nice artwork both on the wall and incorporated into the mirror. We used the bar on several occasions and the barman was extremely friendly and accommodating. As it was my birthday during my stay the hotel very kindly acknowledged this with a gift of wine and macaroons. It was a lovely gesture and made my birthday even more special. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

title: Correcto, pero el staff es muy antipatico en general
text:
Lo mejor del hotel es la ubicación. Estas en el mismo centro de Times Square, en especial las vistas desde el restaurante.

Las habitaciones son correctas y mas o menos limpias

Lo que necesita un cambio es el personal de recepcion y sobretodo el personal del restaurante. Todo lo bonito que tiene la vista desde el restaurante se estropea con el trato recibido por el personal del restaurante en especial una señora de color que esta en la puerta y que es la encargada. El trato es horrible.

La unica persona que nos ha tratado de forma muy amable fue la chica de las excursiones

title: Perfect location
text: We stayed 3 nights here, during our first trip to NYC. It is the perfect location! The rooms are nice, we were on the 23rd floor. The staff was very friendly and helped with any questions we had. We were here for the blackout and had front row seats to the chaos from the R lounge. We left our bags since our checkout was a lot earlier than our flight, with no issues. I would suggest ear plugs if sirens and horns bother you, even being high up, it was still pretty loud. But was expected also. I would and have already recommended this hotel to all of my friends, it is very nice.

title: LOVE ❤️
text:
I can’t say enough amazing things about the hotel. From the location, to the room, the drinks at the bar, the breakfast, the decor, the gym... everything was amazing! 

We got upgraded to a balcony on the 4th floor. Room 404 I think? Our balcony over looked the excitement. To our left was the ball :). In front was the HERSHEY STORE. I loved the hustle and bustle, noise and light coming from all of those enormous tv like billboards. It was my first time staying in Times Square... I must say... I may never be able to stay anywhere else! 

This hotel gets my vote! You can not got wrong!!! Great stay!!!

title: Perfect location and room
text: The room was great, clean and awesome shower. This is directly in front of the first on off bus.  Friendly staff and upscale hotel.  Enter in on first floor but rooms and bar on second floor on up.   Well worth the value!

title: Awesome staff and great accommodations!
text: One of the better Marriott properties with some of the kindest and most helpful staff....every staff member we met or interacted with definitely understood the concept of hospitality. And the accommodations were clean and plush!    The wait staff in the restaurant also were warm and friendly.  We just cannot day enough good about our experience here.  We will stay here again!

title: They’ve changed
text: Haven't been here in over two years but they renovated and removed the restaurant, lobby bar and breakfast room. The rooms are still as they were several years ago so NO changes took place in the rooms. Furnishings, carpets and window treatments are all showing signs of wear.

title: Mitten in New York
text:
Für einen Zwischenstopp in New York haben wir dieses Mal ein Haus gewählt, von dem man alles in kurzer Zeit auch zu Fuß erreichen kann. 
Die Lage ist super wenn man mittendrin sein möchte.
Das Hotel macht einen modernen Eindruck und ist sehr sauber. Der Service ist wirklich freundlich und zuvorkommend.
Unser Zimmer war recht groß, modern eingerichtet und sehr sauber.

Einen Drink am Abend in der Bar mit Blick auf den Times Square sollte man nicht auslassen.

Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt und können dieses Hotel sehr empfehlen.

title: Location 10, Service 10, Restaurant 5
text: You can’t be any more in the middle of everything than at the Renaissance Times Square. The people were Uber-friendly, helpful and courteous. The room I had was nicely appointed, but street noise was surprisingly unruffled. I booed a full service hotel thinking that I might need to dine in, which I did. The options were much more limited for an upscale hotel than I would have thought. Though tasty, it was way too limited.

title: First time in NYC
text: We had a couple days booked and thought we would move hotels in case we wanted a more relaxed feel.  We ended up staying the entire time at this hotel.  I was surprised by the interior as it was fantastic.  People were nice and the breakfast buffet was pretty good.  I can’t imagine a better view of Times Square than this hotel.

title: So loud! Not recommended for light sleepers
text: I’m in NYC at least 1-2x a month for work and have stayed at several of the Marriott properties and thought I would give this one a try. The rooms are very nice. Recently updated and very comfortable. However, the noise is just unbearable here. I was first assigned a room on the 7th floor but the noise became unbearable around midnight when I was trying to sleep so I asked to be moved. They moved me to the 15th floor and unfortunately, the noise was just as bad. I’m writing this while I’m wide awake at 12:30 AM because I can’t sleep because of the noise outside. So annoying! If this hotel was quieter, I would rate it 5 stars because the rooms are great. Also, there is no way to fully block out the lights from Times Square so be prepared for loud noises and bright lights. Also, no room service. :(

title: Great location in the heart of Times Square!
text: We loved the location and our room!  We stayed in a terrace room on 4th floor and had a corner suite (407) which had a small corner balcony- perfect for 2 people- which looked out directly on Times Square!  Room was very large by NYC standards but is costly (approximately $700 per night).  Positives are : location to Times Square and theaters,  lots of restaurants in area, friendly staff, and large room - shower/bath tub “wet room”, comfortable bed and great views!   Things to beware of- even with heavy drapes, lights from marquees still came in from top of curtains, also, no room service.  My only complaint with the room is the mattress - way too hard!  There is a nice sized fridge in room.  There is a nice lounge on 2nd floor, pretty pricy as well. There are less expensive room options of course we booked another room king room for a family member and it was approximately $500 per night.  Valet (no in/out service) was $75 per day. We had a truck which is considered a large vehicle- small vehicles $65 per day.   Overall, great hotel and location!

title: Great Location !!!
text: Great Location, Awesome and very helpful staff, Real good restaurant with a GREAT VIEW.  Rooms were very clean with awesome views to 7th Avenue or Broadway.  Short walk to Times Square and surrounded by many stores and attractions.

title: We really enjoyed our stay.  Perfect location.
text:
We felt like we were in the center of NYC at this hotel.  We were able to cover so much by just walking.  It's perfect for anyone going to a play.  
We booked a large room with a private master bed & bathroom.  The living room had a queen size pull out couch.  The room was large enough for a roll away bed as well.  The best part . . . there was a separate second full bathroom!  The room was perfect for a family of 4 (with teenagers).  I will stay here again!

title: The BEST!
text:
We had a perfect NYC vacation partly because of this hotel.  It is centrally located, close to restaurants, Times Square, shopping and shows.  The front desk people were so kind, accommodating and helpful.  Please do not try any other hotel because when your hotel is centrally
Located, you get to save a lot on transportation expenses.

title: In the heart of Time Square
text:
This hotel located in Time Square, in the middle of busy tourist area. The hotel has just completed a 16 million dollar renovation. Beautiful hotel, friendly staff that eager to please you. We stay in an executive suite, the biggest room that have. Very roomy for NY standard, it has Time square view from the window. 
check in was very quick, the only minus is the check in area is small. Then we take elevator to Lobby level, cross over and take another one to the room.
This property doesn't have concierge lounge, but they give you free breakfast from 6:30 a.m to 11:00 a.m for titanium level members. Also, some free item from the bar in the evening.  Free bottle water and wifi. I believe the water bottle is $8 if you are not executive member.
We definitely enjoyed our stay and will be back again.

title: Perfect location.. great hotel!
text:
This was the best hotel I've ever been to. 
Amazing location, amazing staff and amazing room. 
I understand it was recently refurbished and they have done a fantastic job.

The location of the hotel is bang in the middle of times square.. don't get me wrong, its busy as hell but perfect if you want to be absorbed in the NYC vibes. It's right by the subway and loads of great restaurants within walking distance. 
The staff were just brilliant, from the moment we walked in we had many upgrades and 'freebies' without even asking. They couldn't do enough for us!
The hotel itself is gorgeous, smells amazing and is very trendy. We were in room 1117 which was ideal as it was around the corner from the main corridor so it was very quite at night (considering you're in the middle of times square!!) 

I cannot wait to come back.. whenever that is!! 

Thank you soooo much, my mum and myself had a trip to remember!

title: Middle of it All
text: This hotel is great for reaching all the areas of NYC.  Short walks to 5th Ave. sights, subway nearby.  If you don't like crowds this is not for you. Once you hit the streets packed.  The hotel has sound proof windows and they open up some as well which is nice to hear the sounds of the city.  AC was weak in our room but bearable. They do give 25$ credits which they add in the cost so don't forget to use these for small eats or the bar. Beds are fine no vent in bathroom so it gets hot after showers bath mirrors have a system where the mirrors don't fog over cool. Small fridge in room and friendly staff.

title: What A Delight!
text:
This hotel was a lifesaver when we missed our connecting flight to Greece due to weather in the New York area.  I called the reservation line and we were promptly booked for two connecting rooms (2 double/1 king). When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted in the most courteous and helpful manner.  In just a very few minutes we received our keys and directions to our rooms.  There was one elevator to the lobby and another elevator across the lobby used to access rooms. When we arrived to our rooms we were pleasantly surprised.  We could see Times Square from our window and my daughters (ages 12 and 15) were quite impressed.  

After a few minutes in the room, we decided to go check out the action of Times Square.  All of the night time action drew us back to the hotel and we decided to go to the hotel's restaurant.  We were promptly seated and enjoyed and the most spectacular view of Times Square from the restaurant.  Then, moments later "The Most Delightful" woman appeared.  It was Mrs. Marlene, the person who turned our disappointing day into a magical experience.  Mrs. Marlene had the best personality, the most giving spirit and she simply could not do enough for us.  Her positive words and helpfulness will never ever be forgotten.

When we went back up to the room, we all thought of Mrs. Marlene and how blessed we were for having met her.  Then, we proceeded to take showers and prepare for bed.  The bathroom in the king room was much nicer than the one in the double which seemed to have missed the last update.  There was noticeable hair on the floor and in the tub but water pressure and heat was just right.  The beds were super, extremely comfy with crisp white linens and pillows galore.  Our experience at this wonderful hotel will be cherished largely due to Mrs. Marlene but also due to the fabulous location, ease of booking and the courteous manner of each employee we encountered.  The porters were extremely helpful with bags and arranging our cab to the airport.  Superb service indeed at the Renaissance Times Square.

title: Great stay and fabulous staff in the Heart of it all!
text:
Can’t say enough about this smaller Marriott hotel in the center of it all! Have stAyed here multiple times over the years when we come to do shows and museums. Clean, easy check in and amazing view of Times Square from the breakfast room! 
Tammy delighted us with a special room for my sons first overnight. High floor with a view. (24) quiet and clean and a suite since we have been club members for years! 
 At the bell desk, Saeed made a special trip to the kitchen to get fruit for my 8 year old when he decided that fruit was all he wanted at 7:30 at night. A million thank yous! Alex made sure we were taken care of at the bar and Brian was a delight at the desk in the evening. Little things mean a lot to kids when they are out of their own homes. Grown ups too! 
Easy walk through midtown , theaters and Macy’s. Will continue to stay here! Thank you all!

title: Super centraal gelegen
text: Het hotel ligt super centraal en van de drukke straat heb je qua geluid totaal geen last. Zeer vriendelijke bediening en schone kamers. Je kunt er makkelijk met 4 personen op de kamer, dus voor gezinnen een prima oplossing

title: Great Location on Times Square
text: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Times Square.  Friendly staff, clean rooms, comfy beds, super views.  Interesting art in common areas and rooms.  Valet parking is pricey, as is the breakfast buffet, but, hey, its NYC...Try MIAs bakery right next door!

title: Great location, pleasant staff
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights on one of our semi annual trips to NYC. We arrived at 8:20 am after an hour long cab ride from JFK.  Luckily our room was ready so we had a bit of time to relax after our 5:30 am flight. 
It’s a bit convoluted to get to the rooms- you have to take one elevator from the main entrance/check-in up to the lobby and then go across the lobby to the elevators that take you to your room. 
Rooms are clean, bathroom a bit outdated but plenty of counter space for the three of us and our cosmetic cases. And always at least 3-4 bath towels (otherwise it’s annoying when you book a room for 3 and they just give you enough towels for 2). 
Location tight in Times Sq so if you dislike the noise and crowds it may not be the best location for you. But it was close to the restaurants and show we wanted to see. Easy walk up to Central Park or down to Hudson Yards. 
And we were able to get a late check out which was really nice.

title: Perfect NYC Vacation
text: Excellent room, 802, king bed, tub/shower combo. Nice large bathroom with soaking tub. Can’t say enough good about this staff: from valet/bellhop/check-in to waitstaff in bar and amazing concierge (Divina) and sweet housekeeper. We just had a perfect visit. The convenience of this location to all of lower Manhattan by subway (station is in same block for R, W, going downtown) and easy switches for Brooklyn/Chinatown/Little Italy.  Very centrally located for Broadway, Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City, Empire State Building, Chrysler Bldg, Grand Central Station.  Subway to 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park or to Central Park and Seventh Ave shopping!  Late night return after theater or dinner, take in the daily desserts in the lounge-OMGeeee. It’s vacation!  Worry about calories and carbs after you return home!

title: A Wonderful Stay because of some staff members!
text: We've stayed at the Renaissance many times.  This is the first time I felt the need to share our experience at this facility.  We truly appreciate the outstanding service received from Brian (?) at the front desk (checked in on May 9th around 6:30 PM?) , Mohammed at the lounge made us feel welcomed during our 5 days stay.  Jamie was great too.  The lounge is a fabulous place to eat, drink, and watch the crowed at Time Square.    The personal service we received plus the great location made it a great stay.  It is the staff that made the difference.  Thank you, Brian, Mohammed, and Jamie.  (By the way, some of the breakfast staff could use a lesson from these 3 staff members..Several of them were not service oriented at all). a Titanium member of the Marriott Bonvoy.

title: So nice
text: Stayed for 5 nights, we were on the top floor 26th. Fridge in the room along with standard iron and ironing board and coffee making facilities and safe. The room was comfortable, clean and spacious. The staff were great, we were right in the middle of Times Square - view from our hotel was stunning! Felt very safe in the hotel. Always staff at the front door. Would recommend this hotel to stay at. Went to Chelsea market - great place for food!

title: the BEST hotel on Times Square- Highly recommended
text:
We stayed here for the first time and loved every aspect of our stay.
The Rooms were spacious with lovely views of Times Square, level 18.
The staff were fantastic in every aspect and ever so helpful whenever we needed them

and the best aspect of the Hotel was the Dining area directly looking over Times Square where we spent most evenings with a glass of wine reminiscing on our days adventures. .Also pleasing was the very good prices to eat there.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
El hotel está situado en pleno Times Square. Limpio y habitaciones amplias para lo que es New York. Todas son exteriores. 
Las vistas desde el restaurante impresionantes
El personal, sencillamente impersonal

title: Worst Location and Worst Renaissance
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance for work during the week of May 6th-10th.  I was on the 20th floor with a 'preferred room'.  

To be clear, there are issues with staying in Times Square (not the hotel's fault) and then things wrong with the hotel.  I've stayed at the W and Algonquin in Times Square before and if you must stay in Times Square, I would highly (highly) recommend those this property.  

Why?:
1.  This hotel is on the exact busiest corner and the exact loudest part of the Square.  There was drilling setting up a new stage on 7th street from 10pm-2am!  This occurred for 3 of my 5 nights.  This is in addition to street noise that I could hear at 20 floors above.  And, lastly, any sign of a CVS/Walgreens/Duane Reed, etc was at least 5 blocks away.
2.  My room was facing the M&M billboard--no matter how hard I tried and how tight I pulled the drapes, you could still see the billboard flash through the drapes.  It was like something out of a waterboarding video or horror movie.  
3.  The room itself--dated in furniture (pillows were super uncomfortable).  The electrical power in the section where the coffee maker/light switch was wasn't working.  
4.  Construction--the walls of the hotel are razor thin.  There was a constant 'running water' noise from my bathroom (something from the other rooms?  building pipes?).  Anytime anyone left their room,the doors would slam and you could hear it as if you were in that room.  The lighting to the room was dark

I will say, in the hotel's defense--the staff is very nice, the turn-down service was great and the lobby is lively.

Overall, there are better areas to stay in in NYC--and if you must be in the square, there are better options.

title: La mejor opcion!!!
text: Hola, una maravilla de hotel por su localizacion en el corazon de times square,  desayunos buenisimos con las mejores vistas, esta muy bien conservado las habitaciones son muy amplias, muy limpio, todo el personal del hotel super amables, serviciales una maravilla de verdad, todo esta cerca desde aqui central park 8 minutos, la 5a a 6 minutos en la puerta tienes la parada del bus turistico, los mejores musicales de brodway a menos de 10 minutos realmente fantastico, sin duda si vuelvo este sera de nuevo mi hotel, lo recomiendo totalmente, saludos

title: Amazing hotel in the heart of Times Square
text: We booked a room at the Renaissance hotel on times square for 5 days. It could quite possibly be the most conveninet location for exploring this beautiful city! The staff was super friendly, the doorman - Said was very helpful and we had a great service from our concierge - Divina. She gave us an amazing recommendation on how to purchase discounted tickets without waiting on the TKTS line. She gave us a special card and they have a small ticket desk right next to the main entrance of the hotel. The desk was inside a currency exchange. With the card provided from the concierge, we were able to get the same prices as the TKTS prices but we didn't have to wait. The friendly staff at the ticket booth also gave us a complimentary ticket for the stand up comedy club across the street called LoL Comedy. Unfortuantely, we were unable to attend that show. We had a great time in New York. We will be coming back to New York soon and definitely be staying at the same hotel!

title: Perfect place to stay
text: This hotel is right in the perfect spot, easy to walk to any theater or restaurant in Times Square. The staff is friendly and helpful, we had trouble the first time we tried to get into our room. One of the staff who was in the hallway graciously showed us what we were doing wrong and helped us in. Really enjoyed our stay.

title: Convenient location
text: The Renaissance NY Times Square, as the name suggests, is literally in the heart of Times Square. It's convenient to several subway lines and all the theaters as well as, unfortunately, the Vegas like atmosphere of Times Square. But if that's what you came to NYC for, then you're in luck. I was on the 8th floor which I thought would be too low and noisy but it wasn't bad at all. The windows are extra thick. There was a giant billboard outside my window but the black out shades worked pretty well. Good size rooms for NY and large bathroom with walk in shower. They hit you with a $25 resort fee but the good news is you can use that for the Big Bus tour which normally costs something like $55. So if you are staying 2 nights, you can get two Big Bus tickets included. The one thing I didn't care for is the fact that you can hear people in the hallways and their doors opening/closing. Overall though, not a bad choice if you want to stay in this area.

title: Estancia perfecta!
text:
Nos alojamos en el hotel las 8 noches que duró nuestra luna de miel. Era una ocasión especial para nosotros ya que además de ser nuestra luna de miel, celebrábamos mi cumpleaños y el próximo nacimiento de nuestro primera hija.
Destacar y agradecer el trabajo y la atención de todo el equipo de concierge (especialmente de Jennifer, Fleridana y Divina) y de los camareros del bar (Jorge): Son profesionales, atentos, detallistas y cercanos. Fueron increíbles en su trato con nosotros e hicieron que nuestra estancia fuera maravillosa. Nos ayudaron en todo y nos hicieron sentir como en casa.
También agradecer a Jennifer, la reservations manager todas sus gestiones con nuestra reserva.
Tanto la habitación como las instalaciones y servicios de houskeeping fueron maravillosos. Nos asignaron una habitación en la planta 26 con excelentes vistas y todas las camareras de pisos que nos encontramos durante nuestra estancia lucían una encantadora sonrisa.  
¡Encantados con el personal del hotel! ¡Muchas muchas gracias! 
Fuimos usuarios frecuentes del bar-restaurante del hotel y la comida no nos defraudó en absoluto. Tanto la calidad como la presentación eran increíbles.
El único inconveniente fue que nos pidieron la tarjeta de crédito al menos 4 veces durante nuestra estancia, siendo que ya la habías facilitado en el check in y habían pre-autorizado y bloqueado el monto total de la estancia en nuestra tarjeta de crédito. A pesar de todo ello, una de las supervisoras o managers de recepción, creo que era Valerie, nos llamó a la habitación sobre las 22pm para hacernos bajar a recepción y reclamarnos el pago de la estancia. 
Aún así, nuestra experiencia ha valido la pena.

title: Fabuleux
text: Hotel très propre .chambre avec une grandeur très correct. À côté  des transports .personnels très agréable  surtout  James au groom service et Maryline au restaurant. Nous reviendrons  l année  prochaine  c est certain

title: Suprisingly exceeded expectations
text: I answered the phone and assumed it was someone from the hotel trying to sell me or maybe finally help me with to link my hotel points cash in and a AAA reso made on their site.  Alas it was the concierge not only linking the two stays but upgrading us to a terrace room with a king, small couch and a rollaway for our family of my spouse, myself and our 6 and 9 yr old kids.  I mentioned it was their birthdays and the phone call was a really great beginning to our stay.  We arrived and had a rollaway sent up.  I noticed no bedding for the couch and text a request through their app and voila, we were back from the show and all was in place.  Breakfast was great for us.  The view was the best in the city overlooking time square and the food was good.  The best thing, it was available until 11am and free with our status.  We came back from a day of enjoying the city to find 2 stuffed bears and 2 bags of cookies and a Happy Bday card.  Fantastic.  Just fantastic.  I realized I had forgotten to request our late check out and was told not a problem, it was taken care of.  We still arrived late coming back and still not a problem.  The final moment was arriving at the airport and realizing our beloved Pooh Bear had been left in the bed.  Despite sobs from its owner, I was able to contact the hotel through the app and plead the emergency.  By the time we were through Airport security, bear had been found and was on his way back via Fed Ex.  Thank you Marriott for always, I feel, taking care of us and for this hotel...for not relying on its location to slack.  I felt they cared and our experience was wonderful.  We will be back.

title: Posh & Amazing
text:
My 3 children and I stayed here for 4 days, We found the room to be wider than most 2 queen rooms so we weren't tripping all over each other. It was clean and comfortable & updated. We were on the 12th floor and surprisingly quiet, great view also.
Check in was a breeze and the staff were amazing and helpful with all my silly questions.
April 15-18 rm 1208, Our House Keeper was excellent!! I didn't get her name "Sorry", so if it could be passed on.
Boasted to everyone in My Hotel I work at out here in Kananaskis Alberta.

title: Second visit
text:
This was our second visit to NYC and to the Renaissance hotel, lovely staff and the location is unrivaled! 

The rooms could use a bit of an update now (which I believe they are in the process of) and it would also be good to have a room service menu for those late nights!

title: Great hotel great location
text:
I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. 

Let’s start with the cons:
-bathroom sliding door is frosted so there is bright light shining through whenever someone is using it. That sucked at night.
-walls are thin, so it’s a big noisy. We heard several ambulances throughout the night.

Pros:
-location: located right behind the tkts booth/stairs where everyone sits and takes photos. A few blocks away from juniors, ichiran, ippudo Westside, and much more!
-service: checkin was smooth, everyone that works there greeted us and asked how our stay was, super friendly staff, they provide umbrellas if you forget yours.
-clean and comfy: even the lobby has a nice scent to it, the room, restroom, everything was clean. The bed was comfy. Water pressure was ok.

I highly recommend this hotel. I didn’t get to check out the fitness room but they have one. A couple blocks away from the metro.

title: Convenient location
text:
This hotel is convenient due to it location, but the wall are very thin and you are able to hear the neighbors. It is located in the middle of some of the most brilliant screens in Times Square, nevertheless the room lacks of a full black out what makes sleeping less pleasant.
The breakfast buffet is very basic but pricey.

title: Great Service
text: I am currently not staying at the hotel, instead I am staying at their sister hotel in Times Square. But I stopped by this evening because a friend of mine is staying here. Let me start of by saying. This hotel has one of the most professional and polite employees. We came across Jennifer in the concierge desk, who magnificently helped us plan out our whole itinerary in the Big Apple, giving me the right resources, discounts, dinner reservations and kindly assisting me in every way possible. Thank you so much once again, I cannot wait to return to New York and stay at this property. I am bummed for not staying here currently.

title: Perfect location
text: This was my first time to New York City so we wanted to stay right in the middle of it all. You cannot find a more convenient location to everything. All of Times Square and Broadway is right at your doorstep. Central Park is within walking distance. The only time we used transportation was to get to the Statue of Liberty. Plus the "resort fee" or whatever this hotel calls it covers the bus tour pass to get to wherever you need to be in the city. The hotel itself was beautiful. Renaissance is our favorite Marriott brand and this one did not disappoint. The rooms were beautiful. The staff was always very friendly. The restaurant has the best view of Times Square. It's only on the 3rd floor though so if you're looking for higher up views, this isn't it. We would absolutely stay here again.

title: "Excellent location, even better staff."
text:
My parents came to visit me from Chicago last weekend and stayed in the hotel. I joined them for breakfast Monday morning since I work close by. It was my first time in the property and must admit I was gladly please with the view of the restaurant but even more with the staff working there, specially the host Jorge, he gave good recommendations were my parents could visit after breakfast and made sure we had everything we need.
In general, they enjoyed their stay since it has a great location, nice and clean rooms and great staff. That's going to be my to go spot for drinks after work. Highly recommended.

title: Exceptionnel comme d’habitude
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel pour la nouvelle année. 
Emplacement idéal 
Hôtel propre, moderne, confortable 
Les chambres sont agréables et propres. 
Le personnel est charmant et compétent. 

Le petit-déjeuner buffet est simple mais suffisant et surtout la vue depuis le lounge sur Times Square est exceptionnelle. 

Pour la nouvelle année, cet hôtel permet de voir aux premières loges la descente de la boule de Times Square. 
Idéal 

Proche des boutiques de broadway et la 7 eme avenue, il est notre hôtel préféré mors de nos séjours à NYC.

title: Venu juste pour le petit déjeuner
text: Sans mentir le petit déjeuner est très banale , 19 dollars une partie du petit déjeuner ( mini viennoiseries , fruits , pain de mie .. ) si vous payez 30 dollars vous avez en plus bacon , œuf brouillé .. pour ce prix le petit déjeuner n’est pas fabuleux . Nous sommes venu en réalité juste pour la vue qui est INCROYABLE. Vue sur Times Square .

title: Newly Renovated Rooms
text: I had a remarkably good stay here in February 2019. Check in was friendly and personalized. The room wasn't quire ready, so she offered a comp. small bite in the lounge. The lounge overlooks Times Square, and I visited --  and enjoyed it -- twice. The newly designed an renovated rooms are quite good. New beds very comfortable, and the "fresh" modern feel is great.

title: 朝食を摂りながら、タイムズスクエアを眺める心地よさ
text:
ここは、マリオット系のホテル。
このホテルの特筆すべき点は、朝食レストランからタイムズスクエアを見下ろすビューポイントが存在していること。その一点だけですがこのホテルには、充分なバリューがあると私は感じました。

title: Excellent location
text: It was our first trip to NYC and not knowing what to expect we opted to stay at the centre of everything. We chose this hotel for it's great location and as we were celebrating my daughters 21st birthday we went all out. We were visiting New York for a hectic 5 day sightseeing trip. The location was right in the heart of the action in Times Square, well-placed for sightseeing and easy walking distance to the Rockefeller Center, Saks and most of the theatres. There is a subway right outside the front door for those attractions further away. On entering the Hotel you have a concierge desk on the left with security and a lift up to a very nice lobby, then you take a different elevator to get to the rooms. The room size was reasonable for Times Square, the decor is a bit dated and in need of upgrading but it was clean and the beds were really comfortable. Soundproofing could have been better, even though we were quite high up there was a disturbing amount of noise from the street below from sirens at all hours. The bathroom was quite modern and bright with a combination Bathtub/shower, with complimentary toiletries were topped up every day and a good hairdryer. The bedrooms had air conditioning, a mini fridge, ample room to store clothes, a safe to store any valuables as well as tea and coffee making facilities but no kettle. Also, a Remote Control TV with Premium movie channels, Cable/satellite and International cable/satellite but we rarely used it. Beware there are two bottles of water in the room but they are not free. In the R Lounge area you get a great view of Times Square, seeing all the billboards lit up, lovely photo background, but this what your paying for to stay here, so use it. If you are planning to go to New York I would definitely recommend staying here. The Hotel is clean, a fantastic location and rooms with great views. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and always there to help.

title: One of the best locations
text:
Went there for the new year eve. Reaching the hotel was tough due to tight security for the ball drop however, it was worth. Just come outside of the hotel and enjoy the ball drop view and get back. Environment was energetic and they made us feel festive. Good breakfast at the lounge. 

They missed 2 stars because of the service (for ~$900 per night) -Torn towel in the bathroom :(, hair not cleaned from the table.. etc.

title: Great hotel
text: I stayed at the renaissance when visiting New York for a 5 day trip. If you are planning to go to New York I would definitely recommend staying in this hotel. It is located in the heart of Times Square, right next to M&M world. You are right in the hustle and bustle and waking up in the morning to see taxi going past, the streets filled with people is something you just never get bored of. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and always there to help with anything you need. One morning I went down as said that I felt cold when sleeping the night before and when we got back to our room there was a blanket left on the bed which is great to see that staff are reacting to your needs. We had breakfast at the hotel a couple of times and this was very tasty and there was plenty to choose from. Food was always being put out so if something was running low they would replace it immediately. In the restaurant area you are slightly higher up so you get a fab view of Times Square, seeing all the billboards and the lit up screens. The bedrooms themselves were great, everything that you needed. I would say hopefully they could do with some updating as the furniture: wardrobe, cabinets are a very dark brown which gives an old look compared to the rest of the room as the bathroom was quite modern. There were toiletries in the bathroom which were topped up everyday, a hairdryer to use which is good because we had brought our own hairdryer and it wasn’t as powerful as the one that was in the room. Theres also a safe to store any valuables as well as tea and coffee making facilities. There are two bottles of water in the room but beware they are not free. We assumed they were free because in the middle of the night I needed a drink and my just naturally opened a bottle of water without realising that the tag around the bottle’s neck said that its was $8.50! We made sure we drank the whole bottle, haha. If you fancy some drinks in the bar area of an evening it is a great place to be. One evening they had a DJ playing and the atmosphere was great and the music was really good. Make sure to remember about tipping waiters etc, as I know for us Brits this is a difficult thing to do / get used to as it’s something we do not naturally do but they thrive for tips. Overall we had a good stay at the hotel and would definitely stay again if we were returning and would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of New York.

title: Absolutely perfect location
text: The Marriott Renaissane Time Square is a very nice and moderately priced hotel located in the heart of the action in Times Square. The R bar and restaurant is a great place to have a drink or a bite to eat while taking in the magic and lights of this iconic location.   For those who want to be in mid-town, there is not better choice because you are in easy  walking distance from not only Times Square and Broadway but also 30 Roc, 5th avenue, Bryant Park and the NYC Public Library as well as  the subway hub at Times Square .

title: Comfy Beds, Outstanding Location to Times Square, Excellent Service
text: All I can say is that the beds were super comfy, we were in the center of Times Square and the service was excellent. Walk to most of the theatres. Dinner was basic - nothing fancy. Go to other restaurants if you are looking for a nice dinner. You can get half-price tickets to the bus tour from the concierge - a worthwhile excursion and I never take a tour bus!

title: Excelente opción!
text: El hotel es moderno, con muy buena atención. Está muy bien ubicado, cerca del madison square garden y a pasos del time square y el empire state building. No contratamos desayuno pero hay un montón de opciones cerca. Subte cerca también. Viaje con mi familia y estuvimos muy cómodos. La calefacción andaba perfecto al igual que el wifi. La limpieza muy bien, y el descanso también, no me molestaron los ruidos y los colchones cómodos. Volvería sin dudarlo y lo recomiendo. Si tengo q decir algo, me resulto un poco incómodo las transparencias en los vidrios traslúcidos del baño, pero nada grave. Excelente hotel.

title: Fantastic stay and wonderful location.
text: Great hotel, very clean and very friendly staff. The R lounge is such a great spot for breakfast. i could sit there all day watching people in times square. We all really liked the hotel and recommend it to all.

title: Go for New Years Eve
text:
The location for ball drop was spot on.
We were able to stand outside of hotel with hotel canopy overhead. I would recommend staying right in Times Square that way you can go in and out of your room. 
The hotel was nice. Staff helpful.
Put on bucket list to go to NYC for ball drop! Unbelievable!!!!

title: Weekend of broadway and SNL
text:
I will give the Renassiance hotel and average score that I am conflicted about.  
Staff: great, helplful at check in and the concierge was great anytime we had something to ask.  
Bar staff though seemed as though we were interrupting them when we came back after our show for a nightcap and snack.  That’s always disappointing after a great show. 

Plus side: the location is fantastic for what we wanted to do however for the same price range there are a couple other hotels I think would of showed better considering the room size.  King corner suite was smallish for what was advertised. The door has a 1/4” gap on the bottom and a crack large enough on the sides to allow all the hallway light in while sleeping (towels on the floor fix that but why am I being a handy man) don’t forget hallway noise. They advertised this as larger than many of the other average hotels.  

All in all average but so average that I would try another average place first.  Unless of course you want to walk outside and be right in the middle of it all.  The pictures are from our room and in front of the hotel. 

Oh one more thing.  We booked on hotels.com and there was no mention of resort fees which they decided to add in without our agreeing too.  This is also where the staff failed.  At this point your leaving and they stop caring.

title: Christmas in New York
text: Hotel well-placed for sightseeing and access to subway travel and tour buses.  Clean rooms and VERY  good bathroom space - actually had room to put wash bags etc.  This in not always true in other hotels!!  Check-in a bit late at 4 pm but we coped.  We had a table booked in the restaurant with a window - or so we thought - but when the time came, it was not available which was disappointing.  The waiter was less than helpful, in fact was quite curt.  Overall though, it was a pleasant stay with probably the most comfortable beds and pillows that I have experienced for a long time...

title: Great Hotel, Room Needed Updates
text:
The hotel location is great if you are working/playing in the Midtown area. The subway line options were abundant- you are literally in the middle of almost all of them! The staff was great and the rooms were large. Our room was in need of updates- beat up furniture and carpet. The floor with the gym appeared to be renovated, so maybe they're getting to it. 

The lobby breakfast was great- cool views even for someone (like me) who doesn't love Times Square. I would stay again.

title: Great Location
text: Great location and good sized clean room. We arrived early and had requested an early check in - this was only a request and the hotel was very busy and couldn't accommodate this so asked us to come back around an hour before check in time and they should be able to help. We waited until check in time and when arrived was told we would still have to wait for our room, after a long flight this wasn't what we wanted to hear but thankfully we only had to wait 15 minutes. Hotel is clean, perfect location and rooms give great views of the city. Breakfast was buusy but plentiful and refreshed regularly. Would stay again if visiting new york.

title: Awesome stay
text: We enjoyed our trip and so did our little girls. Great mommy/daughter weekend! The view from this hotel is wonderful. We had breakfast and the girls enjoyed the view, taking pictures and people watching.

title: Ok hotel but did not exceed my expectations!
text:
Me and my partner have just returned from a weeks stay here. 

I booked this hotel (and paid a awful lot) a year in advance as we would be celebrating a special birthday while here and went all out. 
Expecting luxury and celebrations in our eyes this did not happen! 
On arrival we had asked for a upgrade only to be told straight away, no! Didn’t even check for us. 
We had notified the hotel prior that we would be celebrating a birthday and that we could upgrade on arrival but this was not to be. 
We had mentioned to the guy on reception that we had a special birthday coming up and he had asked when so we replied, thinking we may of had a complementary bottle or even a note...no nothing whatsoever! 
I was disappointed as for a hotel of this class you would think it wouldn’t be a issue to make their guests have a happy & enjoyable stay. 
In all fairness the guys on reception are very friendly and helpful apart from the ‘upgrade’ ‘no’ incident. 

So the room...yes the size was reasonable, bathroom was nice and the bed was very comfy. But that was it! The decoration is very dated in need of improvements, our head board was ripped in places with marks visible and electric wires exposed all around the floor which looked very messy and can be dangerous. 
 
Our housekeeper was sloppy at times, emptied the bins and through the sheets over on the bed and that was it. 3 days without coffee had to ask in the end and to top it off a item of clothing that I had left on the bed (same colour as the sheets) which we believe had been caught up in the laundry when changing the sheets. I had spoke to reception staff about this but nowhere to be found. I know this is my own fault but as a housekeeper you would be more careful.

Another thing which really annoyed me was the amount of private party’s going on in the hotels bar and restaurant. So therefore guests cannot use these facilities then. I’m sorry but I’ve paid so much to use a hotel bar when I like to be told I can’t as a (sweet sixteen party) is being held!!! 

The view from the restaurant at the R Lounge is fantastic and he location is spot on here. But I suppose that’s what your paying for to stay here...the view! 

We did enjoy our stay here at the Renaissance but they was too many issues for us to probably not return. 

We have visited New York many times before and have experienced much nicer & cheaper hotels. 
Don’t get me wrong I don’t mind paying for quality I expect but for the amount we payed I expected a lot better.

title: Unbeatable!
text:
Wow. 
Thank you to Monet & her team at the Renaissance for making my 40th birthday one I’ll never forget. 
From the moment we booked, to the moment we checked out-the care and attention we received was incredible. 
We received an amazing upgrade to a terrace room-literally overlooking Times Square. 
We were made ‘guests of the day’ too-which entitled us to complimentary breakfast each morning of our stay, along with appetisers in the R lounge (also beautiful and comes highly recommended for both drinks and for food too. The views are unbeatable). 
We were given a lovely bottle of red wine and some nibbles in the room-a lovely touch. 
All staff were personable, friendly and knowledgeable-with the reception staff even remembering me by name!
The room, view and staff were astounding in equal measures and the memories will last a lifetime. 
Thank you, thank you, thank you.

title: Not bad at all
text:
The location is perfect right center Times Square yet not loud at all.  You take the elevator to a very nice lobby.  No lounge but they give you a free appetizer from the restaurant and free breakfast credit.

Rooms are not fancy but some for sure nicer than others.  Our King room had a nice walk-in shower but not the double bed room.

Price is not bad for time square but the do add a $25 daily fee that it’s OK as long as you use it but it does effect your plans.

title: Great hotel location with awesome bar
text: This is our goto stop whenever we are in NYC. We like the location of the hotel and the bar has a fabulous view of times square. Highly recommended. Best hotel in the Times Square area in our opinion.

title: Nice Find!
text: After checking into the Fairfield Inn and Suites Central Park and the rooms were so small you literally had no room to sit down and the only place you could sit was on the bed, my husband and I had to find a new place to stay for our trip as I am having back issues and sitting on the bed is not good, we called around to other Marriott properties and found availability at this hotel. Will not stay anyplace else when I go to New York for fun!!! The staff was great, the breakfast AMAZING!! The good is great but that view over looking Times Square is the BEST!!! When the front desk lady found out it was my hauband’s 50th birthday, she made sure we were taken care of. There is a subway right outside the front door, they serve cocktails and apps in the same 3rd floor observatory as they do breakfast and the place is such a cool place to hang out after a day of sight seeing around the city. Yes the bathrooms are in need of a makeover, but the price was about the same as the TINY hotel we first were booked into so that’s why the Renaissance got 5 stars! Don’t pass this place up!!

title: Excelente localização. Café da manhã fraco!!!!
text:
Hotel muito bom! Excelente localização!
Vista do café da manhã espetáculo, da pra ver a Times Square inteira! As camas do quarto double bad sao super apertadas. 
Café da manhã não é aquele super café da manhã do Novotel da Times Square.... deixa muuuuito a desejar.

title: Non si puo’ puntare solo sulla location
text: Siamo stati con tutta la famiglia per capodanno, prenotando due stanze, spendendo la “modica” cifra per il solo pernottamento per sei notti di 10.000 dollari, piu’ altri 1000 di colazione, purtroppo l’ unico aspetto positivo dell’ hotel e’ la posizione, per tutto il resto, è stata un’ esperienza totalmente negativa, le stanze e i bagni decisamente sporchi, addirittura in una stanza, appena arrivati abbiamo dovuto far cambiare le lenzuola perché erano sporche, e i pavimenti dei bagni erano pieni di capelli, non c’è servizio in camera e la colazione si poteva fare solo nella lounge, ad un prezzo fisso per la “modica” cifra di 40 dollari a testa, ti aspetteresti almeno un servizio all’ altezza, invece in alcuni giorni il servizio al tavolo era inesistente, non era possibile ordinare neanche un’ espresso, peccato perché la location e’ perfetta e meriterebbe un servizio all’ altezza.

title: WOW!!!!
text: Amazing Hotel and Staff to match!! We just took our annual trip to NYC from Dallas and this was the first time staying here. Carol Pernot and Chris Guardino treated us like celebrities!!! this is a MUST STAY hotel!!!!

title: Christmas in Times Square
text: We arrived before Christmas and the hotel seemed busy but the day before, during and after Christmas were very light.  Then the crowds started arrived for New Years.  During our stay, the hotel was quite nice.  We've stayed at other hotels in the area during this time of year, but we really liked the feel of this hotel.  The staff was super nice, from the reception staff, the doorman, and especially our room attendants.  They made sure we had everything we needed.  Our room was overlooking Broadway, which was wonderful,  except for the last night when outside the noise from the equipment setting up for New Years was fairly loud.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.  It has most of the amenities of the larger hotels but really not as crowded.  I've waited 10+ minutes for an elevator at the Marriot Marquis but here was only a minute or so.  We wished we didn't have to leave.

title: No Room Service!!!
text: I've been staying at Marriott properties for years, and couldn't believe they don't have room service.  Certainly reason enough never to stay here again. There are so many nice hotels in the area,  take this one off the list.

title: Love the view from the lobby, great location!
text: Well, if you're going to NYC for the first time, or taking folks that have never been I'd strong suggest this hotel.  It's in the heart of Times Square and the views are amazing. The lobby sits where the ball drops on New Years Eve.  They've done an excellent job in the lobby area creating plenty of seating all around the windows and my kids loved looking at all the lights.  The food at the hotel was okay, not great, not bad.  The room are a bit dated but still clean and a good price for the money. But they will need to update the rooms soon.

title: Really disappointed but please read on....
text: I stayed here in 2011 and the experience was awesome (see my review) and the best part was the bar which sat proudly over Times Squire where you could watch the world go by at an incredible rate of knots. We visiting NY this time we were staying at a hotel nearby so decided to pop in and have a drink one pre lunch time and were disappointed. First of all the bar has moved and is now a restaurant so the bar doesn't have the same amazing vista. Secondly, the bar didn't open until 1230pm so we couldn't get a drink - it was 1215pm and isn't this a hotel?, Thirdly, we were told in a rather unfriendly tone that we would have to vacate the area in which we were sitting as a large group would soon be arriving. We left and had a drink elsewhere

title: Great People , Great Location!
text:
I have read the lower rated reviews for this hotel and am rating it 5 stars anyway. I stay with Marriott over 100 nights per year and really appreciate the effort it requires to keep everything in perfect working order for a hotel. And with regard to the expense of things, remember it is in Times Square - Manhattan.  
We think two things make a hotel great - its people and its location. 
The people are great - from the Reception desk (David), to the bellmen (James and Mani) to the Restaurant manager (Sylvia!!!) to our waiter (Muhammad); they all worked very hard and went out of their way to make our 2 day stay as enjoyable as possible. A lot of credit for the gracious attitudes of the employees goes to the hotel manager Germaine Shepherd! What a great guy.
And location - boy does this place have it. Easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Saks and its beautiful windows, Sardi's and the theater district and then there is Times Square itself! We attended a concert at the Beacon Theater and it was an easy and inexpensive ($16) Uber ride there from the hotel.
We stayed here 2 years ago and had similar experiences. We are already looking forward to our next visit.

title: Great Birthday Present for my Wife
text: Had a blast. Reserved this hotel and tickets to Wicked. She loved it. Close to everything in NYC you need. The R line subway is right there which takes you North and South of the area. The Theater District is just a couple of blocks away. Rockefeller Center is about 3-4 bocks away. Time Square just 1

title: Great stay!
text: Beautiful hotel! Rooms were spacious (for NY), clean & quiet. There’s a beautiful lounge with perfect lighting just above the lobby that was very lively. And it’s in the heart of Times Square. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

title: Great 4 day Girls Get-away!
text: Four women went for a 50th birthday celebration!  We loved the Renaissance.  The rooms had plenty of space, the bedding was comfy, and we have no complaints about the service.  You are right there on Times Square among all the hustle and bustle.  We enjoyed drinks in the bar a few nights.  They were expensive but went toward a credit we had anyway.  The view from the bar/restaurant is one the best views of Times Square available! One day, we were only given one bath towel, which was odd--but that we quickly rectified.  The lobby being above the ground level floor is odd at first but you get used to it.  To get to the rooms, you have to take an elevator up to the lobby, then take a different elevator to get to the rooms.  We enjoyed our visit

title: A+ in taking care of the guest!
text: We recently stayed at the Renaissance Times Square for the first time.  We found the hotel to be surprisingly intimate and a nice retreat from the busy city.  The lobby was warm and friendly, the restaurant excellent!   The elevator got stuck but the staff was quick to respond and did everything in their power to make a positive out of a negative.  As a past hotelier, I am very sensitive to customer service and empowering your employees..this property excels at both.  Two super stars were Melvin the General Manager and a woman named Monet who I believe was a front office manager.  My husband and I will definitely stay at this lovely hotel on a future trip.

title: Excellent location
text: My daughter and I went to New York for her birthday and stayed  here and it was amazing. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were beautiful, clean and The large window of our room overlooked time square. We have stayed in several different hotels in time square  and this one by far is our favorite.  The room was large and very roomy and like others that we have stayed in. Highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

title: To be avoided
text:
My worst experience in many many hotel nights in NYC
The hotel is old, the lobby is tiny, the rooms are old and dirty, the shower have no pressure, the breakfast is terrible, the service is bad (20 min to get a cup of a very bad coffee at 6:45 am)
And a ridiculous price: 1000 usd/ night!
Even at 250$ it would have been overpriced
Strange way to treat your ´elite ´ card holder
I Would definitely NOT recommend this location

title: Great Pros and Bad Cons
text:
This review is difficult to write because the benefits entitle it to a five star rating, but the drawbacks make it a two star.  So, I gave it three stars on average.  Its pros are also its cons.  

1. Location
Pro: the hotel is located smack dab in the middle of Times Square.
Con: the hotel is located smack dab in the middle of Times Square.
The location is great for access to everything and is in the heart of the "action".  This also means that it is very crowded outside the door, the lights and the noise also filter into the rooms.  Just know this going in.

2. The lounge
Pro: the lounge in this hotel is the reason that we chose to stay here.  It has the most incredible view of times square and you feel like you are literally floating in the lights of the square.  Just gorgeous.  The main reason to stay at this hotel.
Con: we stayed for four nights and the entire lounge area was completely closed to hotel guests for two of those nights due to private parties. Our first night there when i wanted my husband to see the view, the hotel staff would not even allow us in for one minute just to see it.  We were told that "people paid a lot of money to book that room" so we were not allowed in.  Well, we paid a lot of money to stay at this hotel just for that room that we were not allowed to enter.  Ironic.

3. Breakfast
Pro:  breakfast is served in the lovely lounge with the great view of Times Square.
Con: despite being told as Marriott Executive Elite members that breakfast was included, it is not included on weekends and costs approximately $50 per person for soggy eggs.  The food was not good.  Very little choice (small buffet area) and there was literally water running through the scrambled eggs.  Also, always a  long line to get in.  From what we saw, a lot of that delay comes from staff inefficiency.  We watched one hostess single handedly move tables around, clear dishes etc. while we waited to be seated at the free tables that were just sitting there.

4. The Rooms
Pro: good size, clean, nice big bathroom with lots of towels and amenities.
Con: walls are paper thin so you can't actually sleep if your neighbours chose not to.  We were kept awake almost the entire night for 2 nights of our 4 night stay. Our room had a door to link the room to the neighbouring room (if you needed a double room for a family I guess).  The door did not block ANY noise and we could hear the entire conversations of our neighbours at 3am.  Room tip: ask for a room that does not have the adjoining door.

6. WIFI
Pro: Free WIFI
Con: Free WIFI didn't work about 60% of the time.  We are in the center of the American universe.  No idea how the hotel does not have reliable WIFI.

This hotel has some really great aspects, but after paying to stay there twice over the past month, I am not sure it delivers on all fronts.

title: A+
text: Great hotel, conveniently located AT Times Square, nice rooms, Very comfortable beds and an awesome shower with good pressure.  Only downside is limited views of the square because rooms face to the sides.  Staff was great, very personable.  Nice bar and guest area on 2nd floor.   Would definitely recommend.

title: 5 Star hotel - would recommend
text: Staff, rooms, Service, location...everything is amazing. We would definitely stay again and recommend. Location is right in Time Square. Had a wonderful trip for 4 days with the front desk staff giving recommendations on local attractions. The restaurant is expensive but delightful food.

title: Just OKay
text: Service is good but hotel rooms are in need of an update; chipped paint and woodwork, outdated, shower water trickles, not water pressure. Just not memorable. The hotel has no place to have a meal, especially breakfast.  If you are a member you can have a $32.00 buffet breakfast, but you can’t even get a cup of coffee otherwise.  There is no place to sit if there is a function going on.  Decor is very strange, not warm and welcoming.  On a positive note, if you are seeing broadway plays, the location is great.

title: Nice midtown Manhattan hotel.
text: Our anniversary weekend stay at the Renaissance New York Times Square was very nice. The hotel is a comfortable facility with a contemporary design. Of course, it's location couldn’t have been more convenient. We were in walking distance to so many New York City highlights.

title: Maybe the best Times Square Location in NYC
text: Eat inside the hotel restaurant  which overlooks Times Square.  Great site for shopping, theater, Madison Square garden,  etc. Not cheap, but excellent location.  Security present.  Staff mostly pleasant.  Would repeat stay.

title: Drinks
text: We had been recommended to visit the bar area by a waitress who we got talking to . We had been looking for somewhere for a bit of r and r whilst pounding the streets of NYC . This hotel is nestled above the olive restaurant smack bang in the heart of Times Square , it was just what we’d been looking for with amazing views of the hustle and bustle of the city . Very friendly bar man and a complimentary shot of some kind which was a nice touch and went down very well .

title: Great place
text: Everything about staying here was great,. The service  at the front desk( especially Sergio),was pleasant and accommodating. Clean and spacious rooms, and a fine breakfast buffet with something for everyone. We had a great view from our window.

title: Spectactular Views of Time Square - enjoying a cocktail
text: The Renaissance hotel in Time Square has a spectacular lounge where you can enjoy drinks after a show and observe the activity of the people from a perfect vista.  It is lovely and they have great nibbles to accompany a great cocktail list.

title: Incredibly noisy rooms & car damage while valet parked with ICON parking
text: I stayed with my family on Columbus Day weekend 2018 for what was to be a relaxing & an affordable family vacation.  We are long standing Marriott platinum elite members & were offered a package by Marriott Vacation Club confirmation # 71787500 for what was supposed to be a $199. package offered to Marriotts best customers to evaluate their time share package.  Shockingly, the $199 bait switched to $698 for 3 nights @ the Renaissance.  Although we booked a king bed, we were assured by hotel staff that we'd receive an upgrade to 2 beds as we are 2 adults & 1 very tall teen, which never happened.  On both my husband's & my Marriott membership profiles we both requested a quiet room away from elevators which is apparently "Marriott speak" for "put my directly across from the elevator shaft as has happened my last 3 Marriot stays. Our room faced Times Square & was so loud that all night long we heard street noise, ambulances & sirens.  Our daughter who slept on a very tiny cot near the window didn't get any sleep, nor did we.  We complained loudly & were given a room on the other side of the hotel that was much quieter however, still didn't receive our upgrade to 2 beds for our teens b-day weekend.  The second surprise came when our valet parked late model Lexus 350 was returned from valet parking by ICON with a long curved scratch across the gas tank on the drivers side after paying $300 & never taking our car out of the ICON lot used by Marriott.  When we noticed the damage while filling up crafter leaving the hotel, we immediately called Marriott staff to report the damage.  It's been over a month & the only thing I've been told by Robert Nichols of ICON parking was the ridiculous statement that ICON was refusing to pull the CCTV footage from the day bc "it was a curved scratch & my men would only be responsible for a straight scratch. Buyer beware, the hotel is loud & never ever park your car with Marriott or ICON parking.  Oh and that $199 Marriott Vacation Club package - that's a total hoax!

title: Be prepaid for the $25 per day fee
text: Have stayed here many times. The rooms are nice and location is great. But now the hotel charges a $25 + tax “destination fee” per day. What a great way to raise rates without your guests realizing it. They tell you that you get all these great services with these fees. How many times can I do the bus tour or eat at your terrible restaurant ($30 for the worst breakfast buffet I have ever seen)? Shame on you and Marriott for treating your customers so poorly.

title: A comfortable stay in the heart of the big Apple
text:
The hotel is perfectly located if you want to be in the heart of Times Square.
The room was comfortable although a bit small and dark.
The restaurant/bar and the terrasse give an amazing and magical overlook of Times Square.

title: Dear owner…we paid a lot for this room
text: I struggled with writing this review because I think that the manager who showed us three rooms sincerely tried to accommodate our issues. So, this review is in no way about the staff but is directed to whoever owns this property and continues to charge outrageous prices while it is awaiting a renovation. The first room had dirty areas in the shower and a headboard which was worn down to the backing due to age. The second room had the same floorplan as the first with some lesser issues with the headboard and bathroom but, as we exited, my husband cautioned the manager to watch out for the doorstop at the top of the door which then actually fell off into the manager’s hand when he touched it. The third room was on a renovated floor but the closet space was only adequate for a one night stay and had limited counter space.  We chose the second room because it had the largest closet space and was the least dilapidated. The maid service was below par…skipping emptying our wastebaskets and replacing the coffee on the second day of our stay. We were compensated with free breakfasts each morning we were there but I could have eaten better at a Holiday Inn. We were told that we already had the lowest price because of our senior discount. Our experience here was a total disappointment. The owner should conduct a room by room evaluation to determine which rooms really match Marriott quality and the price to charge based on the merit of each room at this time.

title: Intimate retreat
text: This hotel is a small boutique hotel that is on the corner of 48th and 7th in Times Square.  The decor is rich and filled with textures, copper accents in the elevator etc.  The lobby area is small but warm. At the time of my visit, it was decorated for Autumn. The staff is wonderfully helpful and extremely solicitous.  The room was decorated in warm tones and rich wood accents.  I did appreciate the design of the bathroom, with the lighted makeup mirror but the counter space was a bit small.  The bathtub was a plus, it is a soaking tub. I did notice that the backsplash/tiles were peeling away at the corner in several places. In one area of the wall, it actually gaped.  The bed was comfy and plush and led to a great nights sleep. I did visit the lounge for cocktails. The view of Times Square was fantastic.  We visited on a Friday night, there was a DJ playing an eclectic mix of hits, this was not a lounge for a romantic and quiet evening.  This hotel was a welcome oasis of calm and warmth on a cold, rainy New York day.  The location is great and the hotel is small enough that you are not overwhelmed by numerous people and noise.

title: Our experience was not a Luxury Escape – we would definitely not recommend
text:
Our 7-night stay at Renaissance Times Square was booked through Luxury Escapes, however this hotel provided anything but luxury! 

Some of the issues we encountered:  

We had a Seventh Avenue (Times Square) facing room – this should have been fabulous, however there were no blackout curtains and a multi-storey high 24 hour flashing red billboard is not conducive to sleep.  The Duty Manager we spoke to after the first night promised blackout curtains would be provided, however it took visits to three more Duty Managers and four more days before one blackout curtain was finally installed.  We were told that the curtain had to be taken from another room as there are no spares.  We agreed to have felt taped to the other half of the window so that we could get some sleep.

The rooms (2 couples, 2 rooms) were very old-fashioned.  The furniture was more motel than 4-star hotel.

Breakfast in this “luxury” hotel was a farce – you are provided with paper cups for your coffee and tea. (After our complaints, on Day 3 a few crockery cups appeared, but were again hidden away outside the restaurant door the next morning!)  Only one four-slot toaster is available for the whole restaurant, and two of the slots did not work during most of our stay.  From the second morning on the toaster kept tripping the electrical circuit, however staff insisted it was not a problem.  On Day 5, the toaster was finally replaced.

With one stand out exception (Guia, who was friendly, polite and efficient), we were extremely disappointed with the service we received from staff.
