The Duty Managers appeared very sympathetic to our issues when speaking with us face-to-face but failed to live up to any promises made.  Staff in the restaurant were quite unfriendly – on more than one occasion the breakfast “greeter” did not even look up from her list, just asked “Room number?”  When we requested to speak to a supervisor about the toaster and coffee cup issues, we were given a name and told she worked in the reception area.   When we spoke to this lady she just laughed and said “Why would they send you to me?  I can’t help you.” – no offer to find the right person.

We spent 45 nights in hotels during our recent USA holiday.  Instead of being a highlight of our holiday, and despite its luxury billing, Renaissance Times Square was by far our worst experience.

title: Great location for Times Square and Theater District
text:
If you want to avoid the crowds at the Marriott Marquis, this location was not as crazy as a Disneyland hotel and pretty modern.  Check in is on the bottom floor but the main lobby is on the second so you have to always take two elevators to get down or up to your room.

The bar/restaurant area is very modern and provides great views of Times Square.  For any Marriott Platinum members, there are is no concierge lounge so no free water except for the two Evian bottles in your room.

The breakfast in the lounge is $30 but the offering was not that great and no omelet station etc so we passed and decided to eat elsewhere for that price.  Although the bar food we ordered late night was tasty, we split an Angus burger with seasoned fries but at $25 with tip!

The room was nice, large 50" TV and bathroom with walk-in shower.  I would have given this hotel 5 stars if not for the cleanliness in question.  We found an eye contact probably from the previous guest right on the bed night stand which means if the maid service missed something as obvious as that what else did they NOT CLEAN?   

Other than maid service, the bellman were awesome, did a great job of taking care of our bags and getting us a cab on checkout.  Overall I would probably return as we liked the less crowded scene, great location, modern look and rooms were definitely roomier than the Marriott Marquis.

title: Nice location
text:
You pay dearly for the fabulous location. Perfect for going to theater, restaurants. 
Other than that, the room was of LaQuinta quality (but better and more towels). Breakfast was very poor and very overpriced.
It’s an older hotel and I would guess that’s why there was so much street noise. Our room faced Times Square which was way cool in the daytime but no way to keep out the flashing lights at sleep time.

title: You pay for location, location, location
text:
If you plan to spend time at the one of the theaters in New York this is a fabulous location. We saw three shows and was able to walk to all of them including restaurants. No need for cab or Uber. The rooms and bedding are clean and the maid service is excellent. Front desk people are great and the bell men are also great and offer free umbrellas if it rains.  That is all the good. The not so good is as follows: Do not bother with the weekday buffet as it is $30 per person for some marginal product (no omelet or egg station) and coffee is in Styrofoam cups (bluch). The bar area is interesting but service in non existent with a rude manager.  If you want to go in on the weekend make a reservation (the view in to Time Square is awesome (only reason to go in). The hotel is dark and gloomy and they try candles to brighten the look. 

Would I stary there again? Yes, only because of its location, location, location. PS: get water at the bar as its $8 bucks in the room (really?)

title: Modern and contemporary hotel in the middle of Times Square.
text: You cannot find a more nyc central location than this.  This hotel is right in the heart of Times Square.  If you love the action and the lights, you want to stay here. The room is quite large and clean. Although it can use a little update, particularly the bathroom.  The hotel bar/restaurant offers one of the best views of Times Square.  The decor in the lobby is fun and classy.  The staff is friendly and reponsive.  They addressed my concern in a timely and professional manner.  I wold comeback and stay again for sure.  They are also pet friendly!

title: Restaurant has incredible views
text: We stayed at this hotel for just one night. The lobby and restaurant areas were very nice, with these panoramic views of Times Square at the restaurant and bar area and a cute setup in the lobby. Aside from that, there’s nothing super special about this property. It’s right in Times Square so its super crowded and hard to just leave the hotel. Everything costs a lot of money, down to the water in the room, and they charge a $25 destination fee on top of the rate you pay per night. Overall, it’s a pretty nice hotel if you want to stay in the heart of  Times Square...but personally I preferred the Marriott Marquis over this hotel.

title: Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel
text:
I thought this hotel was great!  The best part of the hotel was its location within Time Square, so if you are going to visit the attractions there, I would stay at this hotel.  The rooms are beautiful and maintained well.  

The hotel provided free breakfast, so we had chance to eat at the open space area with a view of the streets which was absolutely beautiful.

title: Where do I start...
text:
A Renaissance Hotel. In the middle of the biggest city in the US...

No Concierge Lounge.
No Room Service.
Let me say that again...They don’t have ROOM SERVICE.
I was told by the front desk, “Our guests have told us they don’t want room service.”
Seriously?
The restaurant doesn’t serve food during the day and the bar  closes at midnight...in a “full service” hotel in the middle of Times Square. 
I have stayed at a Marriott property 160+ nights so far this year.  This was by far my most disappointing stay to date. 

Oh...and when requesting a late check out, I was admonished that wasn’t an option...rudely...until reminding her that I was a Premier Platinum.  Never, ever again.  What a truly unexceptionable experience...

title: NYC CANDIA BRAGA FAMILY
text: Excelente localização: próximo a compras, metro, Central Park. Camas maravilhosas, banheiro c toalhas novas e mimos todos os dias.Visual do restaurante: Impar, comer ou happy hour vendo a Times Square, ñ tem preço. Limpeza - 10 E cafeteira no quarto, p mim fez a diferença.

title: First time in New York
text:
Renaissance NYC Times Square New York, New York: Unforgettable Times Square Stay - 7 NIGHTS - SUMMER SIGHTS 2018: Seven nights in a guest room with daily breakfasts.
     We had never been to New York, and we were looking forward to this stay. Again, the Hotel was a staggering disappointment. It was old, the carpets in the room were old and worn, the people were lazy and uninviting. The so called Restaurant, 
     Was cold and uninviting. Several times when we came down for breakfast, normally, around 9am – the hot food was all gone and we had to ask if it was going to be replenished – then had to wait some time before it was topped up! 
    Tea or coffee was self-serve in paper cups from Starbucks!! The staff wore jeans and looked like they were dressed to go to an informal BBQ, and any request for anything that may not have been there was met with an attitude of – oh OK when I 
    can get around to it. 
    The hotel is certainly right there on Times Square, however it is far from being 5 star or even 4 star.
    I am a member of the Marriott Hotel chain, and until this trip with, our stays at the AC in Paris and the Renaissance in New York, have never experienced such poor Hotel with very poor facilities.
   My opinion of this, is that in their quest to be the biggest Hotel Chain in the world, by Acquisition – some of the lower level hotels they are acquiring, do not portray the level of excellence we have come to expect from the Marriott Group, and,
   If Luxury Escapes offer these Hotels to your clients as “Luxury Escapes” you will soon, loose your faithful customers – like us!!

title: Tired and noisy old hotel
text:
I stayed in this hotel 3 nights, apart from the lobby which is nice and welcoming everything else is just NOT what you would expect from a Marriott hotel. Rooms are very very tired, cleaning is not at its best, they have completed forgotten to clean my room on my 2 day, due to the location almost all rooms are very noisy especially if you are in lower floors. 
Breakfast : basic and super over priced (30$!)
After a couple of days I checked out and paid the bill I found an addition charge for something I have never consumed... are you kidding me?
I definitely not suggest this hotel until it gets a total refurb so much needed.

title: Testé que le restaurant
text: Nous avons été au restaurant Lounge de cet établissement. Repas correct, on y vient surtout pour la vue. Nous avons eu la change de pouvoir dîner juste en face de Times Square. Super panorama, nous en avons pris plein les yeux. A faire

title: Location and views
text: Decided to stay in Times Square for my daughter’s first NYC visit and she still talks about the sheep all around the hotel and the great Times Square views from the R Lounge.  Our room was above average quality and size for the city, but could use an update. Property could offer better dining options and an executive lounge

title: Was pleasantly surprised by this property - not sure why I was alway leery
text:
I have stayed in many hotels in New York, for both business and pleasure.  I have seen this property on my searches, have walked past it almost every time I've been in NY and for some reason, always seemed leery to book a stay.  Maybe because it was RIGHT SMACK DAB in the middle of Times Square (too loud?; too busy?) or that it really doesn't look like a typical large hotel?  or maybe because Renaissance is not one of the more known brands for Marriott?  Regardless, I chose it this time as there was a very limited supply of hotels that week and even fewer in the Marriott/SPG line that had not been jacked up to the $600-$800 per night range.

Let me say, I was pleasantly surprised in so many ways.  Yes, you have to take an elevator up to the lobby floor (after check in) to access the room elevators but that happens at lots of properties. For my experience, check in was fast and easy.  I went up to my room which I found to be more spacious than the rooms at the Marriott Marquis or the Sheraton NYC and the overall service more personal.  Everything was clean, nicely appointed and very quiet.  I was on the 23rd floor, in the middle of the building so the view was not much to talk about,  but I imagine the end rooms would have been very nice.  The bathroom amenities are Aveda (nice) and the bathroom itself was quite large.  Even thought I have platinum elite status I don't believe I got any special room or recognition other than the points at check in (very typical of Marriott properties).  Given the location in Times Square, I expected it to be noisy, but I hardly notices any noise.

I did not eat at the restaurant or bar, but did have a cocktail there both nights, once meeting a colleague and the second after a long work day. Service was very prompt and friendly both times and the prices for a Maker's Manhattan was reasonable if not typical and the portion was generous (I paid almost double, for a version half the size earlier in the evening at Zuma). 

So given the opportunity and a reasonable price, I would definitely recommend this property and I would certainly stay there again

title: Best Location - Times Square
text: The best location and excellent accommodations to theatre district, fine dining, shopping and entertainment. I would highly recommend staying at this wonderful hotel. The staff and rooms were wonderful.

title: Location, location, location
text:
Right in the heart of Times Square. Our room looked out onto Times Square. The dining room has views of Times Square on three sides. The room was comfortable and the bathroom spacious. You need to take two separate lifts to access your room. 
The only let down was the very basic breakfast.

title: Couldn't ask for anything else in NYC
text: This hotel does everything you need and more. The location is perfect right on Times Square with a wonderful view from the restaurant right over the Square. The communal areas are quirky, modern and welcoming. The staff are all very helpful and patient. The rooms are clean and spacious (I shared one room with my mum and sister and we had plenty of space). Good functional bathroom with decent shower that doesn't soak the rest of the bathroom! Extremely comfy beds. Extra bonus in that we got a free hop-in/hop-off bus ticket for the uptown and downtown loops with Big Bus Tours worth $60 each for each night we stayed (we stayed 3 nights and there was 3 of us so worked great but you should check with the hotel before you go if this is still offered) plus a $25 credit for the restaurant which had a great menu and was reasonably priced. Tip for breakfast/lunch nearby is Juniors just around the corner on Broadway, true American diner feel with amazing cheesecake selection. Ask at reception for directions, it's a 2 minutes walk if even. All in all I wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel or recommend it.

title: Wonderful stay in times square
text:
I loved so many things about this hotel. They use Aveda products (plant based formulary) for the bathroom amenities ( I personally use Aveda), the rooms are more spacious than other midtown hotels I've visited and I love The elite member benefits. I'm platinum and I received a daily coupon for an appetizer at the hotel restaurant open from 5pm to 11pm. I also received free breakfast, buffet style, which was good. I loved the decor on the lounge floor. There is a fridge in the room and 2 complimentary bottles of water. Also located 400ft from the 47 and 7th Ave Subway station.
The only thing I didn't like was the bed. It was so soft and springy that it gave me back pain.

title: Hussle bussle hotel!
text: The hotel was located in a superb spot! We had panoramic views of times square during breakfast which was lovely! The food was really nice too, however, times square is VERY very busy and if you are not interested in high noise, ample amount of tourists (not locals) and bright lights then this hotel is probably not for you. We enjoyed our stay as we are adaptable to most environments.

title: Very run down, do not recommend
text:
This hotel is advertised as a 5 star luxury hotel.  It is far from that.

The room was is terrible condition.  The headboard was ripped and torn.  The mattress was ripped open.  Carpet is dirty and stained.  The safe needs maintenance.  Several of the outlets were loose and lights would go on and off if the cords were moved.  Staff of hotel was friendly, but that is as expected.  

The lounge is horrible.  The staff is stuffy, pretentious, and rude.  They get the drinks made correctly 75% of the time, if you are lucky.  But don't complain or they will call security on you.

They have a great location, that's it.

title: Location great, but small rooms.
text:
The location is stellar, the R lounge restaurant in the lobby is maybe the best view of Times Square in the whole area, but boy, the rooms are small here.  

On the plus side, unlike other hotels, it is really quick to get from the room to the street!   I’ve stayed here so many times and i enjoy it, but i switch between here and the Marquis.

title: Not up to par
text: Hotel is very run down. Air conditioning barely worked, room was hot. Breakfast opens later than scheduled. No room service at all, so difficult to use the 25$ surcharge. My online request for a foam pillow, which was confirmed on check in, was not there. Tv was old.  Curtains didn’t close all the way. I am Marriott lifetime platinum, fan of the chain, but not this one.

title: Great location
text: The location of this hotel was perfect for us - sightseeing, theatre, food, subway and not overly expensive.  I would say it is an average hotel - clean, nothing exciting.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The bar is very cool overlooking Times Square.

title: Stay Away
text:
This is one of the worst Marriotts I have ever stayed at. I am a Marriott platinum 
member, (love the brand) and am overly frustrated with my stay. At 45,000 points or $400 a night, it’s a rip off.  The rooms are outdated, by 15 years. They don’t even have plugs on both sides of the bed. They still have CD players in them. The AC didn’t work in not one but two rooms. It does not get colder than 74 even though you set it at 65 in the room. The fridge Leaked in one room. The towels are like sandpaper, the shower has the lowest water presser ever.  The service isnt any better either. Once they get you in they don’t do anything to make you feel special or try to help you out. They did not confirm a dinner reservation I had and it was canceled. I didn’t get to eat there, they do have a good view. For a Marriott, I am evetremely disappointed and would never recommend anyone stay here. I can name 3 Fairfield inns that I recommend over this place that have better service, friendlier and are updated.

title: great location, not much else
text:
Was a mistake to stay here -- the Marriott Marquis was a little more (but they charge more for parking)

The bell staff was really great -- friendly and courteous.

They charge $25/night for "extras".  That includes "internet access" (which elite members get anyway) and F&B.   But they have NO room service -- and the R Lounge is the only restaurant.  Its not open all the time -- and I went there at 11:55 PM (its supposed to close at midnight), they told me "too bad, last call was 11:45".  I complained at the desk, they said the manager would cal the next day -- they never did.   But the food is very good (we had a number of items and they were all good).  Maybe the $25 "destination fee" should be a "gonif fee".

The in-room safe door is held open by an air strut -- which needs to be changed.

The headboard (material) is scratched and dirty.   They are better when they're wood.

My wife has a broken ankle so we got a handicapped room with a roll in shower.   Maybe the room is ADA compliant, but the placement of the rails were difficult for her to use.  The shower fixtures are really cheap (I have better ones at home).

When I tried to look at my bill on the TV, the guest services menu did nothing.

The vending machines have nothing but problems.   One doesn't take credit cards, the other says "network problem" and won't take credit cards.   One night the machine wouldn't take dollar bills -- so I had to travel up and down floors to find another vending machine (ended up calling the front desk to know where the machine was)

title: Brilliant location.
text: The location of this hotel at the top end of Times Square would take some beating. I was exiect By the room to be noisy because if this but we were high enough up not to notlet Vegas the traffic and crowd noise at all. We had a suite with out boys sleeping in a sofa bed in the lounge. The room size was great and two bathrooms were a real bonus but the decor it’s starting to look a little tired. The views from the restaurant and bar are pretty awesome but we ate elsewhere espy ally for breakfast since there was so much choice on the doorstep.

title: IDEAL
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé qui permet d'avoir accés à tout en un minimum de temps : 
Métro juste au pied de l'hôtel
Times square à 20 mètres
Restaurants et boutiques au pied du building
Vue superbe depuis les chambres et surtout depuis la salle de petit déjeuner
Proche des avenues typiques
Quartier idéal

Rien à redire
Y aller sans hésiter

title: Great hotel, amazing location
text:
Located in the heart of Times Square; close to subway, shops, restaurants and attractions. My family and I spent a week here. Rooms were spacious and clean. 

The R lounge - where breakfast is served and where the evening restaurant is -overlooks the lights and was a highlight of our stay. The hosts, Katisha and Anthony, were super nice and friendly! 

The only issue we had was bad water pressure in our room but we called down on our 2nd day and they immediately sent someone up to fix it right away.

Highly recommend!

title: Excellent Experience
text:
Came to Renaissance to see Springsteen on Broadway. Couldn’t have made a better choice, literally steps away from the theater. From the moment we arrived, service was top notch. Valet came out quickly and parked car. The room had a stunning view from the 15th floor. Room was clean,modern and comfortable, with mini fridge. $25 food credit was a nice amenity. The room numbers are painted large on the walls outside- a great feature when you’re in a storage place.
Highly recommend.

title: Great hotel .. lovely staff!
text:
The best thing about this place is a) location and b) concierge staff! As far as location goes you are bang in the middle of Times Square and the lounge bar boasts the most amazing views over Times Square. The staff are amazing... especially Divina, Matthew and Brian on concierge. Divina gave us the best recommendations daily: from getting a New York bagel to diners and lovely walks. Brian... nothing was too much trouble! Make sure you go for a walk on the High Line snd stop at Chelsea and the meatpackimg district! The hotel breakfast was lovely and the rooms were lovely with amazingly comfy beds! Overall, cannot be faulted. We had a fantastic stay. Another recommendation is Del Frisco steakhouse but ensure you are hungry; we spent about 290 dollars and ended up giving half away to a homeless person even though it was the best steak I’d ever had!
Renaissance has the thumbs up from us!

title: Great location great views
text: the hotel is very well located the size and amenities of the room are also good however water should be provided the view from the R lounge of the times square is just amazing the destination fee includes food credit and big bus passes . the food is good service is fast in the restaurant  but overall service can be improved further better

title: Loved every moment!
text: We stayed at the Renaissance this visit to be on Times Square and we certainly were there!We had plans to visit a press release at the Warner Studio and see a Broadway play, both of which were blocks away.  The room was spacious, clean, a very comfortable bed, and a bathroom with beautiful blue tile.  The TV was larger than I have found in most hotels and offered great color and reception.  As a Marriott Gold member breakfast was included in the rate with a true full-breakfast variety of foods: eggs, bacon, sausage, danish, breads, juice and Starbuck’s coffee.  We enjoyed the view of Times Square from our room and when we slept the blackout shades darkened the room in order to sleep.  We ate at the R Lounge for dinners and had great barbecued chicken wings, hamburgers and salads.  All of the items we selected were tasty and well prepared.  At breakfast, we faced Times Square directly as we ate and enjoyed watching the people and the lights. Check-in was speedy at the desk in the small lobby on the ground floor, but access was quick to our room.  The housekeeping staff was wonderful, very kind and helpful. Also included in the daily rate was a Big Bus tour of both Uptown and Downtown Manhattan which was fun, even in the rain. I can not think of any complains on this visit.  We will stay here again!

title: Frühstück mit Blick auf den Time Square
text: Wir waren 6 Tage in diesem Hotel, direkt am Time Square ( seitlich ein kleiner, fast unscheinbarer Eingang) und kleine, aber feine Lobby! ! Per Lift geht’s in die oberen Stockwerke, dort ins Restaurant ( für Frühstück) und dann in einem Bereich weiter hinten sind die Lifte in die Zimmer, hier alles modern und neu gestaltet ( auch 2 Stockwerke mit neuen Zimmer)! Die normalen Zimmer sind groß, Badezimmer eher klein und „schon ein wenig in die Jahre gekommen“ , aber sauber und gemütlich! Aber das Beste ist die zentrale Lage inkl. U Bahn Station, Bushaltestellen etc. , auch Abends idealer Ausgangspunkt für die verschiedenen Quartiere.  Der Frühstück Bereich ist der Hit, nicht wegen dem durchschnittlichen Angebot sondern wegen der Traumaussicht  : direkt auf den Time Square , es gibt unglaublich viel zu sehen, staunen ... unbedingt Tisch an der Fenster Front ergattern!! Die Mitarbeiter sind überall hilfsbereit, freundlich!

title: Inadequate Air & Elevator
text:
Checked in on a Sunday and out on Wednesday.
Put on 18th floor although my Platinum Elite called for a low floor.
Due to non-functioning Air Conditioning and Elevators I moved to a lower floor after many promises and inordinate delays. Senior Operations Manager went immediately in a defensive mode of taking no responsibility and not solving the problem.
One of the line people on front desk ( Justin)swooped in to save thew day.
Besides a complete remodeling job installation of a Club Room and  Operational Resturant. Replacing the Manager with Justin for example I would never stay here again nor recommend it.
In addition Marriott "Time Share" was being hawked in the lobby. Most unseemly.

title: Somewhat Disappointed 🙁
text:
First time staying at this property.  I have to agree with other reviewers that my main deal breaker here is *No Room Service* 🙁
Also, Check in area at street level is small & gets crowded quickly at certain times. Then, to access rooms, you must take TWO elevators.  One to Lobby, then a 2nd elevator to assigned floor. 🙁
Staff was very friendly, especially Housekeeping,  but for the price, there are other comparable hotels in the Time Square area that we will stay at next time. 
Also AC & mini-fridge could have been much colder. As another reviewer has stated, our thermostat never got below 76°. 😓☀️
 I am a loyal Marriott Rewards member,  but will not be staying at this particular Marriott property in the future.

title: Preis-Leistung das wahrscheinlich beste Hotel in Manhatten
text: Das Renaissance Hotel Times Square ist nicht nur an allerbester Lage, sondern (für New York) auch preisgünstig. In Manhatten kann man eine Besenkammer mieten für viel Geld. Das Renaissance Hotel hat sehr grosszügige Zimmer, ist sehr sauber und hat sehr freundliche Angestellte! Meine Frau und ich waren in New York schon in über 20 verschiedenen Hotels. Die letzten fünf Mal im Renaissance Times Square und das wird sich auch nicht mehr ändern!

title: Lots of pros, but one significant con
text: I stayed at this property in August of 2018 for two nights for business travel. There were many good things including the central location, ease of check in/out, an an overall modern look and feel. The room and bathroom were spacious for NY standards, both were clean and the tub was deep. I had dinner in the R Bar/Lounge one night and the food and service were very good. I was a little surprised by the lack of in room dining/room service - if the property does offer it, it was not made obvious by a menu being available in the room. The one huge downside was the window treatments. My room was facing 7th Avenue and overlooked many of the huge/bright Time Square digital screens. The darkening curtains were at least 6 inches shy of being wide enough to cover the entire window. The room was literally as bight as day at night making it incredibly difficult to sleep. My co-worker experienced the same in her room.

title: Yikes, the only thing going for it is location.
text: If you want to be in Times Square then this hotel will work. Otherwise, it's ok. Average room, ripped sheets and stained bedding. Did someone die here? No lounge so elite members get breakfast at the bar/restaurant. This may be my first and last time here. Good thing the company is paying for this one.

title: What a relief
text: I left the Moxy Hotel because I was so upset with their terrible service that finding this place for only a few bucks more was a huge relief. Amazing concierge, it's actually in Times Square and the service is up to Marriott standards. Thank you guys for taking me last minute and saving my trip to New York 😍

title: Spectacular Staff Needs Updated Facilities
text: We came to New York to see a few shows. This hotel is spot on for location. It’s in walking distance to all the theaters.  We were greeted at the front desk with a warm welcome.  The concierge, Matthew, was knowledgeable and made great restaurant recommendations. Housekeeping was pleasant and cleaned well. Our big disappointment was in the room. The rooms are moldy smelling. The leather headboard had rips. The furniture was scratched and worn. Carpet needed replacing. Hey Marriott,  give your rooms an update so that this great staff can be proud. They are the only thing making you look good!!!

title: Only a little off from perfect
text:
If you can stand the Times Square traffic, this is a great hotel. Great amenities and spacious rooms for mid-town. Easy check-in (once you get through the crowds outside). Check-in at street level, but elevator to lobby. Lobby isn't too bust with small restaurant where elite members can get free breakfast. And it's a great spread for breakfast with the best view over times square.

King room on high floor was spacious. Would be comfortable for couples. Good sized bathroom with huge shower. Plenty of closet space. 

My only complaint was AC wasn't working great. It was hot in NYC but AC wouldn't get lower than 76, even when set at 70. Asked front desk to fix, but don't think they did anything. Thought it was just my room, but colleague also staying there said he had the same problem. So seemed hotel limited AC in the summer. Have been in hotels recently during heatwave and didn't face this, so either they have technical issues or are just being cheap.

But otherwise, I really like the hotel. Can get great rates during the week and for midtown business and tourists, location is great. I also enjoyed the gym to myself which was a rare treat. Not a huge gym, but everything I needed. Plenty of new equipment.

Overall, a very nice property. But unless the AC is fixed, I won't stay again in summer.

title: Comfortable, Professional and Friendly!!
text:
We had a 5-Star experience during our stay.  We had a chance to speak with Michelle in advance of our stay where she answered all of our questions in a kind and comprehensive manner.  She is a wonderful Ambassador of the Renaissance name!!

During our stay, we had the opportunity to interface with many departments and in all cases, they were friendly and professional.  The bell-captain even remembered our name after we had been there for 3 days.  

The restaurant staff were friendly and helpful.  We enjoyed breakfast each morning in the restaurant that has an amazing view of Times Square.  

I am a Marriott Platinum member so there were many choices as we looked into our trip to Manhattan.  I can honestly say that we made the best choice by choosing the Renaissance

title: Great views, great staff
text:
Stayed one night at hotel.  Comfortable bed and layout of the room.  The bathroom had aveda products and an automated light.

We also had the breakfast buffet.   Eggs, bacon/sausage and pancakes.  Fresh fruit and yogurt and cereals.  Bagels and pastries.  The staff was a little slow.  
The view in the dining room has great views of time square.   

Lastly the staff here was very helpful and professional.   Most of the time, I don't mention staff in reviews as there are both good and bad wherever you go.  But every one at the hotel was helpful and most of all not grumpy.  Kinda weird.  LOL.

Hope to return soon to find it is not an anomaly!

title: Staycation
text:
I am a Marriott member and was going to see some plays. This hotel is right in the middle of Times Square and near all the theaters.  It is extremely crowded here and you have to know that going in.  
All the workers were lovely and accommodating. We had appetizers and drinks at the bar in the lounge and you need to order the cheese and charcuterie platter!!!! 
The room was big and clean and the bathroom was a good size.

title: Great business or vacation hotel!
text: I held two different strategic planning meetings at this hotel and found the room off the 2nd floor lobby to be the absolute best meeting room in town!!!  Floor to ceiling windows, great private lounge area for phone calls on breaks! In addition, I had my family come up for a week for vacation and the hotel was perfect!! Helpful staff, FABULOUS location— walk to everything easily!! A beautiful hotel since renovated!!!

title: Horrible hotle
text: Location of the hotel is amazing but very old property Ac does not work was told it’s a common problem in all the rooms so they gave us a fan to fix the problem there is no room service also so please think before booking

title: Very Nice Hotel
text: I wanted to stay in Times Square and experience the whole lights and glamour.  I chose this hotel and I was very glad with my choice. we stayed 4 nights in July. Everything was perfect. They accommodated my request for an early check in. The room was really nice, comfortable beds. I love the bathroom with its sensored lights and my boys loved the bath tub. We got complimentary bottle water every day in our room, $25 credit to use at the restaurant or bar, complimentary wifi, complimentary bus tour tickets and the service was friendly with a smile. we only had breakfast on one day because usually we were out  early in the morning. The R Lounge is very cosy and very good views of Times Square. The breakfast was good. Highly recommend if you want to experience Times Square. We got an okay view from the room and there were black out curtains to keep the lights out the room. Elevators worked fine, we had no trouble waiting. Lobby area very chic and trendy.

title: New York disappointment
text:
My family stayed for 1 week in July 2018 and what a disappointment it was. Excellent location and facilities but....
They had a large group of teenagers( from Brazil ) with their not much older chaperones. 
They were noisy rude and inconsiderate. Managed to break all 3 lifts, blocked entrances, exists and we’re so noisy that we had to call security on more than 1 occasion to tell them to be quiet so we could go to sleep. This was anywhere from 130-2 am in the morning. My family and I were on separate floors and we all had to complain.
Talking to other people in the hotel they all had the same experience. When the lifts were working it took ages as they had pressed all the floors and so we had to wait!
If you do decide to stay here I suggest you find out from management if there are any large groups of teenagers staying and then I would steer clear.
This was also the first hotel that we had stayed in on our month long journey round the States where we had to pay for wi fi!

title: BED BUGS!!!
text: I awoke at 4:30am and felt a bite. I saw something moving on my pillow and slapped at it. It made a blood mark. I saw another and same. I jumped out of the bed, turned on the light and the bed was crawling with bed bugs!  I called the front desk, the desk clerk came up and I showed him all the crawling nightmares. He offered another room on same floor. I told him no way. He did get me a room at the W around the corner. This has never happened to me and I am totally grossed out!

title: No control.
text: Sadly the worst experience in a hotel I've had to date. Checking in we thought wow, great location, great ambience, nice rooms, then the school kids arrived. Not just a couple, but 3 groups of about 30 each! Their chaperones couldn't handle them and for the next 5 nights, neither could the hotel! They were noisy, rude, discourteous and kept this up till all hours of the night. Complaints by us and many other adult and business patrons (we chatted with many) were given to both the chaperones and hotel but little happened to curb these kids. Add to this that the lifts acted up, most likely because the kids were tapping all floors and riding them mercilessly. Then these kids blocked the foyers and lobbies and again the chaperones and hotel did nothing to allow other guests access and easy movement in the hotel. Clearly they didn't handle it  and I would not stay there again for that reason. To add insult to injury the hotel also charges $US17 per day for internet in your room. But it's free in the lobby! Surely as paying guests it should be the other way around? The view from breakfast was great but due to size of space constraints the food was limited in variety and was not simply or logically laid out. A lot of issues for this hotel to resolve, but especially how to manage schools versus adult and business patrons. Not great!

title: Great Stay in the Heart of Times Square!
text: Friendly service from the moment we pulled to the curb.  We were immediately greeted and allowed to park for a few minutes while I dropped the family off.  Rooms weren't ready, but they stored our bags and gave us a call in an hour when they were.  We were given one free appetizer per room and free breakfast for being Gold Rewards members.  Rooms were nice, clean, and comfortable with decent views of the city.  The rest of the hotel was well done with upscale and modern decor.  At night, we had no issues with the noise from the street. We enjoyed our free appetizer in the R Lounge, which had an absolutely amazing view of Times Square and really friendly service.  Prices were otherwise reasonable there.  The location in Times Square really can't be beat if that is what you're looking for.  Our AC didn't work well, and they sent a maintenance man within minutes to check it out.  He said the blowers just weren't powerful enough to cool the entire room and were being replaced.  He brought us a nice fan to help cool it down, which was nice.  The room temperature was 75 and even though we had it set for 68, it only ever got down to 72 overnight--not a big deal, and I appreciate how they handled it. The free breakfast was nice and was really good.  Our stay was just about perfect, save for a huge school tourist group of kids from Brazil who were running roughshod over the hotel.  They were super loud in the hallways at night, pushing all the elevator buttons in the floors, shutting down the elevators a couple of times, forcing us to take the stairs.  None of this is the hotels fault, just a minor annoyance.   All in all, a great stay at a reasonable price.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Best Location in Times Square but everything else was average
text:
We don't usually stay in Times Square but if you want to be right in the middle of the Times Square action - this location is perfect. The view from their bar - which is also their breakfast area and dinner area is sensational.
HOwever the hotel is extremely BUSY with the lifts often full. Getting in and out is time consuming as the hop on hop off bus is at your door step and the line of people is huge.
Rooms are fine - the bathroon design is ridiculous with the toilet paper almost behind the toilet making it extremely awkward...... Bar prices are expensive - but no more than any other hotel.....
Our package came with breakfast and this is probably the biggest disappointment - YOU DEFINITELY WOULDN'T PAY FOR IT..... Same food everyday with very very limited selection. Scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes and toast. Whilst it sounds ok - it was very basic (3 star at best) and you were constantly waiting as the food was gone as soon as it came up from the kitchen.
Great location in Times Square - would not recommend breakfast. We stayed for 7 nights and they did not give us a complimentary late check out.
In summary, nothing to rave about and would not stay here again

title: Great hotel, perfect location
text: This is an amazing place. It’s in the thick of things, but rooms are quiet even on the low floors. Now, there are also some balcony rooms on the 4th floor that are extra special. They overlook Times Square. There are only about 5 of them, plan ahead. But they are worth the extra cost for a special flare to a trip to NYC.

title: great hotel, great loaction
text: First off this hotel was part of a Luxury Escapes deal so I didn't pick it as such. I was also conscious of mixed reviews and the general information that New York hotels were smaller than usual. Well I was really happy we stayed at the Renaissance. The location is right in Times Square, that may not be for everyone but it suited us really well to be able to get to all places we wanted easily and without any trouble. The whole of the square was open to us from the windows at breakfast and the electronic billboard landscape was there to behold. The room itself wasn't small it was a good size, very clean and better than I expected given some reviews and the information on New York hotels I had seen previously. I am sorry to say I didn't get the name of the great lady who greeted us at breakfast, just super friendly and made the morning just with her bright personality. Matthew at the concierge desk was more than helpful booking a couple of trips for us. The check in staff were efficient and friendly as were the porters. There was always a friendly wave every morning and a greeting at our return. Maybe the only downside the wait staff were a bit off hand.  Breakfast was included in our package and was very good with plenty of choices. The location may not be for everyone as it is right in the middle of everything but it suited us. I definitely would stay here again and  can recommend it as a place to stay if you visit New York.

title: Nice Hotel
text: The Front Desk staff were the best.  Very friendly, and always helpful.  All the great service was used up with them.  Door and Bell, although polite, seemed to lack personality.  Everything else was good...our room was spacious and the bed was very comfy.  I loved the easy to use coffee machines.  Just needed racks to hang towels.  Perfect location for someone who wants to be in the middle of the city.  There were great restaurants nearby and many theaters.  It was too crowded an area for me, but at least conveniently located near most subway accesses.

title: Another fun visit to this property
text:
My husband and I just stayed three nights at this property. July 17, 18, 19th. This was our 4th visit since July 2017. Love the location. Love the rooms and the overall ambiance. 

A few people stand out in our minds as outstanding employees: JJ and Manny are two people you may come in contact with when you pull up to the hotel. They are so friendly and welcoming. And greet you with a nice big umbrella when it’s pouring rain. ;-) 

Hosom Ibrahim, at the front desk, was extremely helpful in resolving a small room problem and he definitely recognized and appreciated my gold status, my husband’s life time platinum status and our frequent trips to this hotel.  Monet, although I didn’t have the opportunity to meet her, we spoke on the phone and she was also very courteous, professional and helpful. Tammy, also at the front desk,had a big smile every time we spoke or walked by. It’s this type of service, from the employees mentioned,  that keeps us returning to this hotel vs. going to others in the NYC area. With so many solid choices, service often sets hotels apart. 

Our one recommendation: we arrived at the bar for a nightcap just  as they were packing things up. It was a few minutes prior midnight. Based on our suggestion, our friends joined us and booked one night at the hotel  on the 19th. After dinner, we hoped to sit in the lounge. The staff was not friendly. Not helpful. And acted as though we asked them to fly cross country. There was no attempt to try to pour a glass of wine or even serve  a glass of water. This was unfortunate and it’s not the first time. I understand it, to a point. They still had lots of work to do, no one else was around. They could have tried to accommodate us somehow. 

That said, we are scheduled to stay on September 8th again. Thank you to the team who treated us so well. My husband is on The YES Network and this  is the second time we’ve elected to have a staycation during the All Star Break. Enjoyed it very much. 💕

title: Meal
text:
La vue est top mais les serveurs du restaurant ne sont pas compétents. Se trompent de plats, renversent de la sauce, oublié de venir nous servir ..
Vraiment dommage pour un si bel hôtel et un si bon emplacement !

title: Great location
text: This is my 2nd time staying here and once again, it did not disappoint.  Beautiful hotel. Best thing is the location. Walk out the door and you’re in Times Square. As a Gold elite rewards member, I received daily vouchers for an appetizer and free breakfast.  Had to show room key to get through the lobby at night.  No complaints and will come back again.

title: Very disappointing - after many visits, I won’t be back
text:
This has been my favorite Manhattan hotel for several years and I have stayed here whenever possible. Unfortunately, this will be my last stay. I checked in a few minutes early and was given the room type I requested - kind bed. As I settled and started working, I reported that the air conditioning was not working and the room was warm - nearly 80f. Nobody came to check on it. When I went out for a dinner meeting, around 6:30pm, I spoke to the staff again, this time at the middle floor - she took notes, said she’d look into it and get back to me. I returned back around 10:30pm to find nothing had changed - still not air conditioning and no information about what was going on. I went back down the middle floor lobby to find nobody there. Went down the the lower lobby and was told first they had no record of the issue and that they could offer me a fan. Then, the clerk found a record of the issue and told me she could offer me a fan, again. I found it ridiculous that, after reporting the issue several times, I was offered a fan! I asked to change rooms for one that had working air conditioning (in July!) and was told they were sold out. When I groaned about the possibility of sleeping in an un-air conditioned room, the clerk magically found a room and gave me keys and sent me on my way - no offer of any assistance to move rooms, etc. The room provided was dirty and smelled. I asked for a manager this time and was told about the same by him - they are so busy, and he really seemed like he couldn’t be bothered by a guest who didn’t have air conditioning and had to ask for the issue to be looked at several times over the course of about 8 hours!  I asked to be moved to a nearby hotel and was told he’d work on it and I’d go pack my things. No updates for a while, so I finally had to call Marriotts customer care and express my frustration. The agent apparently was speaking with the manager, who lied and told the agent that I’d already been in three rooms and that he had personally walked me to one - neither of which were true! The manager admitted he didn’t know what was going on really and that he’d just started his shift. Eventually, and magically, they found a room with working air conditioning. 

This experience has ruined my perception of the hotel, which had been very strong. I am a lifetime platinum member at Marriott rewards. I was offered a boatload of points, which was also somewhat disappointing inasmuch as I really just wanted a simple experience and a room with air conditioning and a king bed, like I reserved and paid for. Instead, I got a world of hassle, exhausted, a shortened night of sleep, sweaty clothes and the “privilege” of ironing twice.

title: Great Location
text: What a great hotel in all areas. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms were spacious for being in times square, and the staff was great. If you are going to see a show they are all just minutes away which was great. The view at the R Lounge is amazing. A special thanks to Matthew in concierge.

title: Location
text: Renaissance New York Time square is right in the middle of everything.Time square is only a block away. Broadway shows are very close to the hotel. A lot of restaurants near by. Great location. Subway station close by

title: A good night sleep
text: This hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Times Square and the Theatre District. We chose it for convenience to the Theatre. We were on the 26th floor which made the street noise level very acceptable. The room was clean and adequate for our 1 night stay.  I could see the Hudson River from bed between two buildings.  That was a nice unexpected surprise.  Room 2601 for reference.  The bed was very comfortable and we slept well. A/C blew right onto the far right side of the bed which was a bit uncomfortable but I just moved towards the middle. Ceilings in hallway and room had some black spots on them which were troublesome (mold?). Staff at check in and Valet parking very friendly and helpful. Overall a good night.

title: Not bad...
text:
We stayed at the Renaissance for 7 nights on a Luxury Escapes package. 
Firstly the location right in Time Square was obviously very central, which was great but as soon as you walk out the front door your smack bang in the middle of people lining up for the Big Bus tour, people everywhere.
The hotel room was nice, the bed comfortable, room was nice and clean. I don’t know why you can’t offer free WiFi???
The restaurant was nice, and the view was amazing. The only thing I thought was a let down was the marble shelf along the big windows overlooking Time Square. It looks really dirty but I think it’s stained or something. Anyway, I would get it replaced or something, it looks really dirty.

title: great hotel at a great location
text:
stayed only one night first week in July. First they had an available room at 11 am the day I checked in. This is unheard of in NY and I was pleasantly surprised to say the least. The front desk girl whose name I forgot was amazing and so nice and helpful...whoever was there at 11 am on July 1st was her and THANK YOU!

as for the elevator situation I saw I other reviews this is not a problem. Yes you have to take two separate elevators but it was very easy and not a big deal at all. People will complain about anything. The room was great with a great view and it opened a little crack which I like as well to get the whole NY experience!!

Large room for NY and very comfy with nice amenities. Ate at the restaurant overlooking times square and what a nice view!! Thee food and cocktail were average but I didn't care was just grabbing a bite on my way to a matinee. Only complaint was the numbers I the elevator that goes to the rooms was very dark and hard to see the floor numbers but this is a very minor detail on what was otherwise a very lovely stay in NY.

would definitely stay again. 

HEADS UP...there is another renaissance hotel close by....very confusing.

title: Superrrrrr Recomendado
text: El hotel es divinoooo, la ubicación no puede ser mejor y las habitaciones bastante amplias teniendo en cuenta el sector, la atención y los servicios increíbles. No dudaría en tomar este hotel como primera opción para quedarme.

title: The worst Experience Ever in NY
text:
Well where to start, from the check in “Tami” from the front desk I think she was tired or had a problem back home because she was with the worst attitude when we arrived around 9.30 am, didn’t explain anything at all about the room charges she just assumed we knew everything charging without explanation, even got mad when we told her that it was going to be in to separate cards very rude from beginning, Then breakfast it has a lot to say, a holiday inn express has even better breakfast than this one, The rooms extremely old and dirty, the carpet really disgusting and what can I say about the cleaning service ? Awful  really bad!  
But that wasn’t all, when we did the check out a couple of minutes ago it was one the worst nightmares with GLENDA at the front desk the rudest person I have ever met !!! I was charged with something extra that didn’t understand the reason of it so she didn’t want to explain she was only saying that everything was on the paper but I couldn’t understand the meaning o asked her to explain it and omg it was a real nightmare, I explained her that when I did the check in the lady at the front desk didn’t explain anything of that but this lady Glenda was even worst a little bit racist on the part that we are from Latin America and saying over and over that in our country is different but here in America is another thing and if we didn’t understand it wasn’t her problem. 
That was my experience at this horrible place, I will add a picture of the things I didn’t understood about taxes and all the charges.
It has a great location but worst service ever, go to another Hotel !!!!!i

title: Great location, needs updating
text:
We stayed here with our 9 and 13 year old children during the first week of July. 

Pros:
- location right in Times Square 
- Lounge has cool furniture and design
- friendly staff 
- Aveda bath products
- decent sized rooms for NYC
- gym was smaller but good enough
- R Lounge has good food and views 

Cons:
- rooms are getting old and worn down
- stains in mattress and carpets in room
- needs better bed linens (bedsheets kept coming undone as it barely fit the mattress)
- bathrooms needs some fresh paint 

Overall it was a nice stay as it was very convenient to everything. I would probably check out another hotel next time we come unless they renovated the rooms.

title: 4th of July in the big apple
text: This hotel is in a good location. Next to the subway and right in Times Square. Water pressure was ok, but the room uses a water cooling system so our room never went below 72 degrees and we were here during a heat wave. You have a fantastic view of Times Square from the lounge restaurant.

title: Terrace
text: The location of this hotel is perfect. It was a close walk to Hell’s Kitchen, Broadway, Grand Central Station, Central Park, etc. There are some rooms on the 4th floor called terrace rooms. These overlook Times Square. It was great to sit on our balcony in the middle of NYC having a drink and watching people. I highly recommend splurging for this! These are pictures I literally took from our balcony!

title: Renaissance Times Square
text: The staff was attentive and professional. Location unbeatable for those attending Broadway shows.  Has many places to eat nearby.   Sightseeing buses out front.  Will definitely being staying there again.

title: Not Aging Well & Service In Decline
text:
Recently visited for both work and leasure. I stayed there in the past and must say that this property is in serious decline compared to what I experienced in the past. And I can say that as a Platnum with SPG/Marriott with somewhere around 150 nights a year in hotels, that property probably ranks last among others in LA, Dallas, Atlanta, New York and Chicago.

The Good Stuff:
- Love the bar/lobby area for its eclectic design
- If you want to be in Time Square ... you are in the middle of Time Square

The Not So Good:
- Bed linen far from what I would expect in a $400 room (Motel 6 kind)
- Had to get desk power fixed as none of the outlet worked
- Had to get the iron replaced (looked like somebody toasted bread with it)
- Bathroom not the freshest with on top a cracked toilet 
- They forgot to get our laundry done ... luckily we stayed one more day :-)
- Room furniture showing its age
- Fairly noisy at least in lower floors
- Some of the staff is far from properly representing the brand

Also watch out if you are staying during the week end, even as a Platinum you will not have breakfast lounge service. The restaurant where they serve breakfast during the week becomes a buffet during the week end and does not cater to lounge guests anymore.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel in The Middle of Times Square
text: The Renaissance Times Square is convenient to uptown and downtown, and if you like being in the middle of the Times Square action, then you cannot beat this location. The staff members are beyond accommodating and knowledgeable. Standard  rooms are nicely appointed with awesome views of Times Square.  While they are small by normal standards (but not small for NYC), they are filled with enough drawers, shelving, and luggage racks to comfortably fit belongings for two people for several days.  The only problem we had was that the shower  pressure is low and the water never got quite hot enough (an issue we reported but never got resolved).  The hotel’s restaurant, The R-Lounge,  has a limited menu with food that is mediocre, music that is too loud, and AC that is too cold.  But the friendly wait staff and the unbeatable views of Times Square (at night when Broadway is all lit up) makes this restaurant  worth going to for the experience of feeling  like you are smack in the middle of a NYC video game. Bring your kids.  They will love the Renaissance and they will love the restaurant. Note to the Renaissance...improve the quality of your food  and the menu selections and I would bump you up to 5 Stars.

title: Smaller Boutique Gem in Concrete Jungle!!!
text:
This property is an understated gem. We had a large room on the top floor which was absolutely fabulous. Spacious, comfortable, well appointed. Very nice.

Other things that we appreciate about the hotel:

	Reception Staff is great and extremely helpful
	Bell staff is alert and polite
	Lobby area is cleverly appointed and very relaxing
	Restaurant area is nice with an unprecedented view. Staff is great especially the hostess, who prepared a coffee for each of us while we were waiting to check in.
	Housekeeping was very attentive. We requested some extra items and they were here within 15 minutes and quite late in the evening.
	Breakfast this morning had a good selection of self-serve items. Enjoyable.

We had a chance to interact with Michelle Barry-Senior Rooms Operator Manager prior to our stay and she was nothing short of incredible. All of our requests were met and then some. Thank you Michelle!
I’ve not been as impressed with Renaissance properties here in the USA (except Seattle-great property) as I am in the Far East where they are truly fabulous. But the Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel is a hidden gem here in this concrete jungle!

title: Smack Dab in the Middle!
text: Times Square puts you smack dab in the middle of all the (tourist) action.  Great location if you want to see some shows, walk to Central Park, etc.  The Renaissance NY Times Square was a lovely hotel.  Check in went smoothly, rooms were nice size, and clean.  They have a restaurant that overlooks Times Square, so you can see all the craziness if you choose not to get in the midst of it all.  This floor serves as the Lobby, and is a nice place to sit and wait if you are meeting other quest.  The overall service was excellent.  The Decor of the Lobby was a bit of a mash-up!  It didn't quite flow, or have a pulled together look.  Lots of sheep!  Yes, sheep.  I asked about the sheep and was told the location of the hotel used to be a farm way back in the day.  I was there on a girls trip, we ate, drank and saw shows and this hotel served its purpose quite well, so it gets 5-Stars from me.

title: Great location
text: Although the rooms may need some updating, this is a great location right in the prime times square location.  Was very convenient to everything. The restaurant has awesome views of Times Square as well so I would expect it to be VERY crowded near Christmas and New Years. We did seem to hear more than usual in the room from the hallway (they may need better seals at the bottom of the door). Definitely a good place if you want to be right in Times Square.

title: Location, Location, Location!
text:
My friends and I stayed at the Renaissance in April.  FYI Best time to go because its after spring breakers go back to school so it's not as crowded.  You don't even have to go to time square because it's right outside.  All the department stores you need and want!  All the best places to eat in walking distance.  

I was a little disappointed when I first got their because they had some construction going on and I expected this modern entry.  But that's actually on the 2nd level.  It's not amazing but it's cute and they have the RLounge that has the best views of Time Square.  You can read a book or have a beverage while taking in the view.  We had a double room with 2 full beds.  It was spacious not your usual nyc hotel room.  The bathroom was a good size as well especially when you're sharing with a few people.  Everything was clean.  The noise outside wasn't too bad.  We got a $25 credit everyday we were there to spend on food or beverages which is nice because every night we would unwind in front of Time Square with a glass of wine or champagne.  We also got $15 credit to use at the NFL store across the street.  And we got  tour bus ticket everyday.  If you're there for a few days, you can get them all at once.  The hotel staff were very nice and helpful.  

I didn't think I would enjoy staying here but it turned out to be a good choice.  And you are close to everything. There is a subway station right around the building.  There's also a pizza place nearby that's open til 3 am.  Everything was great. Location was great.  More bang for your buck!

title: Just okay.
text: I really like the location of the hotel. Some amazing views. The staff is nice as well. However, the rooms need updating and a really good deep clean. It’s not filthy, but it’s definitely not up to my standards. As I’m typing this, there’s a huge crowd outside our room playing the bongos. So very very noisy. It will be awhile before we get to sleep. Bring earplugs and hope you don’t feel the vibrations of the drums. Also, the room doesn’t get past 70 degrees. We like sleeping with it cold. The AC is not working properly. Breakfast was just okay. It cost us $30/person for bacon, eggs and fruit. The view was impressive though. I’m assuming that’s what we were paying for. Finally, the water doesn’t get hot. Expect to take a luck warm shower. Next time we come back to NYC, we will be staying elsewhere. We love Renaissance, but this is just a huge letdown compared to their locations in TX.

title: Middle of it all🗽
text: We have traveled to New York every year and really enjoy staying at this hotel. The rooms are spacious- considering its New York. It’s right next t9 a subway station that can transport you to uptown and downtown in 10 minutes. The views from this hotel are amazing of Times Square. The bar and restaurant are are recently decorated; however the service is not the best.

title: Best Hotel In Times Square!
text: We recently spent five nights at the Renaissance Times Square and we cannot rave enough about our time there!  Our room was not ready when we arrived (noon), so the bellman graciously held our bags until we received a personal call.  When we arrived to our room on the 23rd floor, we discovered we were in a huge, corner King room overlooking the Times Square sign, and the Springsteen Broadway Show.  We enjoyed the large, clean bathroom stocked with Aveda products, roomy closet, and, at our request, nightly turn-down service.  The R Lounge area was the perfect spot for a nightcap.  The Concierge Service was incredible, as well:  very knowledgeable and professional.   The front desk staff and bellmen were always available to assist with quick recommendations and to hail cabs with lots of legroom.  The hotel is within walking distance to Rockefeller Plaza, Bryant Park, the Library, and Grand Central.  Bus tours load right outside (we recommend a sunset tour of the city!).  Convenient to the Subway, fantastic restaurants and Broadway.  Thank you, Renaissance, for making our trip to NYC extra-special!  We will be returning!  Until next time...

title: Disappointed
text: I stayed at this hotel frequently 10-15 years ago and expected more.  This hotel needs updating.  The marble floors are gone. the carpet is worn and stained, stains on the bathroom ceiling, ripped bedspread, etc. The area downstairs for dinner/drinks - closed for a private event.  I experienced the people attending this event on the elevator and was appalled at their "I'm better than you" attitude.  Not the hotels fault but definitely added to my less than impressed attitude.  Unfortunately I'm staying here 2 nights - I would consider changing hotels but can't.  I expect more from Marriott.  This hotel needs some attention.

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
We arrived in the ctiy and to the hotel at 6AM after a 12 hour flight and to our pleasant surprise our room was ready and we could check in.
From then on the stay only got better, and I can highly recommend this hotel - the location is perfect, the room was nice and big, and the staff was super friendly. 
They were very accommodating with any request that we had.
We will definitely be back and we only have good things to remember from our stay.

title: Great all around.
text: Currently staying here and couldn’t ask for better. Great location and next to subway. Rooms are big for NYC hotels. Beds are very comfortable and rooms were very clean. Prices are little high but you are paying for the location and a nice place to lay your head a night.

title: May 2018
text: Returned to the Renaissance and not disappointed. Feel one of the best spots to stay when visiting. Close to the action of Times Square and Broadway; easy walk to Rockefeller Center; close walk to Fifth Avenue; close walk to Central park. Staff very friendly and accommodating.

title: Right in the Middle of Everything
text:
We are native Long Islanders so we know our way around the city pretty well. We've passed this hotel numerous times but this was our first stay here (typically we stay out of the direct Times Square Area). 

Family friends of ours were using points to stay right in the thick of things for their first trip so we booked our (high priced) rooms to join them. The rooms were astonishingly larger than normal for a NYC hotel which was nice - we were in a Double bed room with 3 people and had plenty of space & a nice large bathroom with combination tub/shower and sliding bathroom door. Mini-fridge in room, large TV, coffee maker, and lots of outlets (regular & USB) to accommodate everyone. There are 2 lobby's, the street level is a very small space where you check in before being led upstairs to the larger lobby, restaurant/bar area, then another elevator up to your room. 

The decor is... interesting. More night-club esk lighting than anything, and oddly placed sheep everywhere. Seems like they're going for the cool, mysterious, chic vibe but it's a hotel, not a nightclub. Didn't interact much with the staff besides our Waitress at the restaurant. Certain Marriott rewards members qualify for $25 free appetizer coupons each night when booking direct - so we snacked there twice. The flatbread pizza & chips were very good. (The charge is placed on your room to start and then credited back at time of check-out with your coupon). 

It's location is central to just about everything; easy walks straight up to Central Park, Theaters, and regular tourist attractions in Times Square. The Times Square subway station is a couple blocks up for easy jetting around the city ($6 round trip out to Citi Field vs. $60+ UBER on game day). 

Location does get busy, and depending on your room location you will get a lot of light flashing from the display LCD's in Times Square. If you need to have absolute silence to sleep, you won't find that here - stree noise reverberates up the sides of the buildings at all hours. Because it's in the middle of Times Square, it's a very crowded area. 

Valet parking by the hotel will cost you $65 per day, and an additional $65 each time you take your car out. Better to get a Subway card and load it up if you plan to sight see outside of 34th (Macy's)-59th (Central Park Entrances) streets between 5th-8th Aves, or don't like walking that far.

title: Pris un repas au R lounge
text:
Déception.
On y vient pour la vue.
De là à être congeler par l'air conditionné (je travaille au quartier opératoire, il y fait plus chaud !!), supplier pour être servis... Recevoir ses couverts tenus dans la main du serveur à pleine main (bon OK mais qd même,  un minimum de classe et de politesse), on vous jeté une serviette, votre verre de vin rouge (toujours gelé sinon ça n'est pas drôle... Un pinot noir ça se boit tempéré...),...
Pour quasi 100 dollars ça fait cher le cliché.

title: Breakfast on Time Square
text: Hotel contemporâneo em uma mistura de bolas e ovelhas (não entendi a do decorador). Camas boas com ar central barulhento, cortinas não fecham por completo onde o friso passa a luz dos gigantes painéis de mídia, o café da manhã bom, mas nada além do esperado, o diferencial é que no momento do desjejum, você aprecia por completo a Time Square (privilágio de poucos).

title: Not worth the aggrevation
text: This is one of the times I can say I am loyal to Marriott to a fault.  I had a horrible stay last night.  I got checked in and they changed my room type and no one told me as my room type was sold out.  I went to print theater tickets but could not because the internet was down.  Went to watch the news in the morning but could not because the TV had no signal.  The front desk simply does not care.  The security guard at night is gruff and just barks out he needs to see your key in a very unfriendly manner.  Michelle, one of the managers was pleasant, but does it really matter if so many things of wrong.  If you love your family go to the Marquis across the street!

title: Great view and good stay on Times Square
text: If you want to be on Times Square, this is your hotel.  Their "R" lounge has the best view of the square in the city.  Given its location, its also close to shows and shopping and more.  The service is always really good.  Rooms are good and a good size for the location.  Its noisy because its essentially surrounded by Times Square and you definitely get light noise from all the signage.  So, if you want calm, dark, and quiet, find a hotel a little farther away.  If you want a nice, upscale hotel right in the middle of things, choose this one.

title: Just OK - had its Pros and Cons
text:
We decided to try the Renaissance instead of the Marque this trip. There were Pros and Cons. The Renaissance is a much smaller hotel so you aren’t fighting the masses. The room was very nice, large and more then expected. All the staff we encountered were nice and accommodating. 
The cons as a Platinum Elite there is no lounge or breakfast for elites on weekends.  While they offer 1000 points in place of Breakfast  this is no where near the equivalent to breakfast for two. Also the don’t offer room service of any kind. The 
Breakfast Buffet is $30 per person and it’s equivalent to a lower end breakfast buffet (eggs, protein, fruit, bread, fruit). 
The View is amazing from the RLounge. I’m glad we tried the Renaissance Time Square out but would probably go back to the Marque next time due to more amenities offered.

title: Residence Inns are better
text:
After staying in Marriott forever this Hotel came highly recommended.
Upon check in we were told that breakfast was not included, but they would give us a $25.00
Credit each day but we had to use it.
We were upgraded to a room that looked into a construction hole.
Very romantic view.
The hotel is under construction.
No notice given upon booking.
Only one elevator operable.
We used our $25 credit the first day as we had drinks.
Alas the second day the bar area was closed for a private party. UnAble to use credit.
We went to the Marriott Marquis for a drink Wd sat down at 8:19 after waiting and we were charged an $8.00 per person sitting charge.
Outrageous as a Platinum Elite Marriott needs to understand when one Hotel cannot perform ,
Don’t add insult to injury.
Will never go back to this property again.

title: Not Up to Snuff for a Renaissance
text:
While staff was friendly and some of the rooms are nice enough, I would not recommend this hotel based on my experience, particularly for business travelers.

My stay started on the first hot day of the year, and upon entering, my room was 76 degrees. I figured the AC hadn't been blasted yet, so it would cool down overnight. It did not. I woke up multiple times during the night. The second night, after a long day and night of meetings, I came home and found it still hadn't cooled down. They called an engineer in, who fiddled with my pipes, gave me a fan, and said if it didn't improve that I could switch rooms. No luck. The next night, again after a very long day, I packed up all my stuff and switched rooms.

While this room got down to 72 (though I prefer to sleep cooler), it was not as nice or clean as my original room. The carpet was loose (had a bump in it that almost tripped me), a worn-down tub instead of a nice shower, and there was a stray ear plug on the floor. But at that point, I was too tired to put up a fight and just stayed.

This hotel does not offer room service, and you have to use a 2nd elevator after passing through the bass-pumping lounge to get to your room.

Again, staff was friendly and attentive, but I just did not find this Renaissance up to snuff for the price paid.

title: Disappointing
text: I had heard good things about Renaissance, but was sorely disappointed. We stayed here instead of our usual hotel, and at first, this hotel seemed okay, since the lobby was very pretty. But when we got to our room, we were disgusted by the peeling bed heads, dusty table, and dirty room, We had to call up to change our room, only to be put back into a room only a bit better. Not only this, location is very bad. Right in the middle of Times Square, so it is very loud and hectic. Would not recommend.

title: Location & Staff Make It a Winner
text:
My friend and I came in from NJ to see Spongebob the Musical at the Palace Theatre (diagonally across 7th Ave & a GREAT musical) and the Renaissance is a mere steps away. It is located at the north end of Times Square on a little triangle of land bordered by Broadway, 7th Avenue & 47th Street. We took Lyft (under $10) from Penn Station to the hotel entrance on 7th Avenue. I requested a best view, high floor and none were available so they happily pre blocked me in a 23rd floor room (of 26 total) and we checked our luggage with the bell staff. The offer was made to call me when the room was ready-which actually occurred...kudos to the a Renaissance, so many hotels fail this simple task! The ground floor just consists of the check in desk, a few places to sit and the bell desk. You must take an elevator up to the “lobby” level. Late at night no one without a key can get up to there as a guard was present.

After a fantastic lunch at an Irish Bar (there are literally dozens in the area), we got the room in is ready call. Coming back to the hotel my key pack awaited me and my full Gold Marriott Rewards late checkout for the next day was added no problem. Our west facing room on 23 looked over a bit of Times Square, the Hotel Edison & Morgan Stanley WHQ. The room size was large by NYC standards and came chock full of conveniences. There was a laptop size safe, refrigerator and plenty of outlets both on the desk and on each side of the comfy king bed. USB ports can be found on the desk as well. WiFi on 3 devices worked well. There was a small sofa lining the window and street noise really wasn’t a problem. The large bathroom had a spacious vanity and a large glass shower only-no tub. 

The R Lounge and Restaurant has a stunning view overlooking all of Times Square-It is located on the lobby level (about 3 stories above the street). The bar wasn’t that large and on a Saturday night it was packed with people as was the restaurant. The view really is spectacular. The hotel does not provide Gold & Platinum Rewards members with breakfast-which I knew ahead of time. We get extra points (not a choice). It being Midtown you can easily find somewhere to eat as expensive or cheap as you like, so we didn’t mind at all. 

We returned in the late afternoon to quickly pack and checkout-the keys still worked-again, so many hotels fail on this as well! We were on our way in no time to Penn Station in a regular taxi that the doorman happily hailed for us. It may not be the tallest or newest Marriott flag in Midtown, but the location and friendly can do attitude of the staff make this Renaissance a winner!

title: Great Place to Stay!!
text: Our 2nd time to stay here and we will return again! Small hotel in a wonderful location! Friendly staff, delicious food and drinks make this a super hotel! A bit pricey, but worth it! Room overlooking Broadway is great!

title: New York New York
text: Lovely hotel in the perfect location in Times Square. The restaurant area looks out onto times square. Great for people watching. Room was good size, dated decor and the coldest bathroom I have ever been in however didn’t spend much time in the room. Subway located next to hotel and the R line took you downtown towards the World Trade centre area. Only 7 blocks from Central Park about 15 min walk, 10 mins to Rockafeller Centre. Plenty of eating places minutes away from the hotel. Would stay here again

title: Location great, but hated the entrance way.
text: You enter the hotel into a very very small lobby with the registration desk.  You have to take an elevator up to the floor with the restaurant then go across the room and get another elevator up to your room,  There was some mystery as the elevator actually goes up more than one floor and I have no idea what is located on those mystery floors,  There was only one of the two elevators working and I heard from another guest the elevator had been out for a week.  I was very concerned about my safety as there were not steps up to the restaurant floor with the main bank of elevators.  The room had a door stop at the top that only had one screw in it and was ready to fall off the door.  I called the front desk on Thursday and no action taken.  Next time I used their chat option and was told it was fixed, but it wasn't.  Finally got someone to look at the door late Friday and since we were checking out Sunday there was no point in fixing the door.  We called down to get some extra pillows and was told they would be right up but of course they never showed up in our room.  The customer services was awful.  You also had to pay an extra $25 per day that they called a "destination fee" which was just another way of getting more money from you for your stay.  Will not be staying at this hotel ever again,

title: Great location
text: Great location,  stayed here on family visit. Centrally located, close proximity to Times Square, Hell Kitchen and short distance to Central Park. Staff was super friendly and concierge lounge overlooks steps in Times Square. Rooms are spacious and beds comfortable. Great location for basing while visiting. Only complaint is parking, if your not used to NYC and are driving in have to park on street in front of hotel, feels like middle of traffic. Valet staff are quick and helpful, just a bit award nowhere to pull off. Definitely would stay again.

title: Bright Lights, Big City
text:
We were a family of four and enjoyed our stay at Renaissance Times Square. The location is definitely very central. At nights, it has the Vegas feel with all the bright lights.
