The room was a good size with clean modern bathroom. The noise level was very low on the 12th floor. The bar and dining area has a magnificent unobstructed view of Times Square. The lobby is not on the street level.
Breakfast was average, eggs, bagels and fruits. We were comp’d otherwise I would not pay for it if it cost more than $10, given the excellent choices minutes from the floor.

The only negative is the ground floor entrance which is being served by only one elevator to the main lobby. And no stairs (main lobby is more than one floor above ground, more like 4 to 6 floors but it’s not clear). The street level elevator can get congested during peak checkout/checkin time. 
I highly recommend the hotel if you like the hustle and bustle of Times Square.

title: Localização e estrutura execelente
text: A estrutura do hotel é novinha. O quarto é maior do que a maioria dos hotéis em Nova York. A vista é maravilhosa (ficamos no 32º andrar). Fica a meia quadra da Macys, três quadras do Times Square. Há vários lugares para tomar café, almoçar e jantar próximos ao hotel. A cama é grande e muito gostosa. O armário é grande, o banheiro é grande e com um chuveiro excelente. Os funcionários são muito atenciosos e a limpeza é nota 1000. A recepção do hotel não fica no térreo mas sim no 6º andar. Com certeza voltarei mais vezes.

title: It's All About Location
text: NYC has gotten so congested, that where you stay in relation to where you will be spending time is super important.  We were there to see a show, so the Renaissance is a great spot. We could walk to the theater. We could also walk to a ton of other stuff and/or take a taxi or uber to  a whole bunch of other places.  You just don't want to stay around Time Square if you have business or interests at Wall Street.  Way to far and way to much time to get there. The hotel is fairly typical of Marriots. The one thing they have at the Renaissance which is pretty cool is a 2nd story bar that has huge glass walls that look directly over Time Square. It's very cool.  I will go back for another show.

title: Great Tourist Hotel in NYC
text: This is a great hotel if you want to stay in the heart of the tourist center of NYC. It's within walking distance to all the Broadway shows, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and shops on 5th Avenue. The hotel is clean, the lobby is well appointed, the rooms are larger than usual for Manhattan hotels and the staff is friendly. And when inside the noise from Times Square is hardly noticeable.

title: Impresionante en el Centro de Times Square
text:
He visitado varias veces New York y este hotel es Espectacular, lo recomiendo al 100%, hay que visitar obligatoriamente el restaurante-bar en donde se aprecian todas las pantallas de Times, increíble el trato y ayuda hacia los huespedes, no hay lujos en las habitaciones, es normal, pero para ser Nueva York es increíble el espacio de estas.
Visitenlo, no se arrepentirán.

title: In the Heart of Times Square
text:
If you want to be in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of Times Square, the Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel is right in the heart of everything.  Great, great location if you're planning to see a Broadway Show.  

When you first walk in, it's a very small underwhelming lobby, but check-in was efficient, friendly, and they even upgraded me, which was a great start.  Then you take the elevator up to the main floor, where the bar area is -- nice atmosphere and a very cool vibe.  From there, you take another set of elevators up to your room.  

The room is fairly standard in size and decor, as far as hotels go (could perhaps use some refurbishment), but they did have a pretty good iron and ironing board in the closet, which I needed to use right away for the event I was rushing off to.  The king sized bed was extremely comfortable, and the sheets were soft and crisp. Restful sleep!

The rain shower was wonderful -- the shower was pretty big, but the bathroom was not terribly big and no bathtub.  

All in all though, I really enjoyed my stay... the only unfortunate end to my stay, was that the housekeeper kept banging on the door, every 30 minutes beginning at 8:30 am.  I had very politely told her after she first knocked, to come back in the afternoon, but she kept coming back and knocking quite frantically at the door, and I had to tell her over and over to come back in the afternoon! Perhaps I should blame myself for not speaking better Spanish...!  I finally put the Do Not Disturb sign on, which I should have done from the beginning.  

Definitely the number one plus is the location and the comfortable beds -- I will be staying again next month!

title: I really wanted it to be better!
text:
Perhaps I set my expectations too high...
Having stayed at other Renaissance properties in the past, I expected the same level of customer service and quality. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. 
The trip started on a high note when our plane got in early and we were able to check in at 10 am. The front desk staff was very friendly and checked us in quickly. The room itself was nothing to write home about but the beds were very comfy and the room was clean with a great view of Times Square. The rooms, and especially the bathrooms, could benefit from an update as it seems to be an older hotel. 
Be prepared to wait for the elevator on the ground floor as only 1 of 2 is working and it’s very slow. It was extremely frustrating with the elevator attendant would only allow 4-5 ppl on, and then got short with me when I didn’t understand why he wasn’t filling the elevator. It took 3 trips, and about 10-15 minutes before we were able to get on. The vending machine on our floor, 22, was not working and we had to go to 3 different floors to find a working machine to get a bottle of water. On the last night, I was finally able to get the stuck bottle free so we could use it. We requested turndown service and it was only done 2 out the 4 nights. All of our interaction with the front desk staff was pleasant. My son ended up forgetting some items in our room. Miguel worked with me to get them returned via FedEx. In terms of location, it’s wonderful if you love the hustle and bustle of Times Square and conveniently located close to the subway. Overall, I would not stay at this location again and would likely try the Renaissance Midtown.

title: Great location for theater! But service in bar is poor.
text: The Renaissance has a great location for broadway shows and close by subway stations.  The rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable. However, their service in the bar at night is lacking. We ordered drinks which were great then tried to flag down a wait person 3 x in the next 50 min. Wanted to order more drinks and some food but no one came back to our table and finally walked out.

title: Good value for money
text: Perfect location right in Times Square. Reasonable in terms of infrastructure and amenities, probably needing renovation. Rooms big enough, nothing terrific but ok. Super cool view just in front of ledwalls. After all, a good choice. Personnel very polite.

title: Best Service, Unbeatable Location
text:
This Renaissance hotel does not disappoint.

Location:
Right in the middle of the Times Square, even if you arrive late, there will still be plenty of time to shop and dine in the surrounding area. Some of the shops on the Times Square does not close until after mid night. The lounge on the 2nd floor is GREAT for people watching, with huge class windows on three sides

Service
Unbelievable! We left a jewelry bag with several necklaces in our room, the next day, we realized we forgot to pack the box. When I called the hotel, I was quickly transferred to the hotel’s list and found department. They quickly located our item, offered detailed help to get the box back to us.

title: Always a pleasure
text:
Stayed over the Easter weekend, 2018. I have always loved this hotel which has more of a European boutique feel as opposed to some of the nearby larger properties bustling with noisy crowds and convention attendees. The lobby continues to evolve - from formerly weird, it's now very creatively decorated and feels spacious even in a relatively small area. The bar has been shifted around and is more open and inviting. 

The Times Square location is a blessing and an curse. You have to plunge into the Broadway scene and crowds, but walk a block or two east or west and street navigation becomes way more manageable and enjoyable. 

Rooms are clean and of reasonable size for New York City. The corridor carpets are gorgeous, bursting with vibrant Latino-like colors. Check-in was efficient and welcoming, though it occurs in a pretty dismal, utilitarian, street-level lobby - but it's a trade-off, not having that activity with travelers and their suitcases hanging out upstairs in the more elegant lobby space.

I remember when this hotel opened when everything was new and functional. Now the hotel is aging, especially the elevators which were only working on and off (mostly off). Staff were cheerful, helpful and apologetic when we had to use the service elevators. But the elevators need to be replaced, and management should bite that bullet as soon as possible. 

But, as always, it was a wonderful stay.

title: Another fantastic stay at the Renaissance
text: This is my third stay at the renaissance.  Always very consistent with their service.  Our room was gorgeous and no outside noise but we were on an upper floor.  We did not get the chance to use the money at the food/bar.  I do wish they offered something other then the $30 for the buffet breakfast.  We just ran down to the deli down the street and for $24 had a huge breakfast for 2.  Also be prepared to pay $65 plus for valet parking.  They are all that way however so I can't fault them for that.  We wouldn't bring a car if we weren't heading elsewhere. You are really in the heart of it all there.

title: The rating depends, and could be higher
text: If you want to be in the center of Times Square, and have a breakfast view and bar view into the square, you'll be happier here than we were. That's the primary benefit, but was not the motivator for us (we just needed a room because of a flight cancellation). Breakfast is expensive, there is a "facility fee" which can be used to offset it, but you're still paying an arm and a leg. Rooms are fine and clean. Wifi is also fine. So if you judge based on normal hotel experience, to us it was average. If you want the views, go for it - the location can be magical.

title: Great service and location
text: From the bell hops to check in/out to the concierge and security, everyone was very attentive, pleasant, and willing to assist in any way they could. They gave us great recommendations for nearby restaurants, found a nearby location for me to buy some B&W cookies, got us a bigger cab for our small group + baby to get to the airport, etc. Also, the location was phenomenal (for a tourist on business, anyway). I would definitely stay here again.

title: Spring Break Getaway
text:
We came to NYC for Spring Break long weekend getaway and the Renaissance Times Square was the best! 

We were able to check in early via the mobile app since our flight got in at noon and drop off bags along with freshening up. The room was spacious for NYC standards although the beds could be a tad bigger (two doubles). The room was adequately stocked with enough towels and amenities for four people and was always refreshed upon return in the evenings. We were given vouchers for breakfast in the morning with Marriott Gold status and also two $10 vouchers for an item off the "bites" section of the menu. The RLounge has incredible views of Times Square (right where the ball drops) along with excellent service & drinks. It's worth stopping by even if you aren't staying at the hotel. The hotel is also walking distance to quite a few Subway stops. 

The hotel elevators that take you to "lobby level" did go down during our stay but the staff did a wonderful job directing people to the service elevators and had security on board to get people to their floors! I understand how frustrating that can be for the hotel staff but they did a wonderful job! I would not hesitate to stay here again!

title: Location - tick, Service - tick, price - tick!
text:
Central location for everything NYC!
We got a great deal through luxury escapes and we were not disappointed. The hotel was in a great location, literally right on Times Square. Breakfast was included and it was on offer until 11.30am daily, which meant if we had a late night we got that little extra sleep in. There was a large range of food on offer, fresh fruits, cereal, yoghurt, breads, eggs, bacon and lots more. The breakfast view is the best view of Times Square you will get.
They have a 24 hour reception desk with security on the door from midnight and you can only entre the hotel by showing your room key.  
Most hop-on-hop-off buses leave from within three blocks making it an easy transition.
Theatre's are located all around and the red ticket booth is located across the road, with daily deals saving you hundreds of dollars.
We had a great stay, clean, helpful and a fabulous bar to finish the day!
Do yourself a favour and stay here!

title: Have stayed several times and enjoyed every one
text:
You almost miss the Renaissance as you walk past its door. Entering on the ground floor, the hotel's bar and restaurant are located on the second floor and the rooms are above that. It's a smaller venue and lands you right on Times Square. I take a room facing the side on a higher and always find it quiet.
Don't miss a drink or after show bite in the hotel bar.The window faces right on Times Square and all its glorious action.You are literally facing the ball tht drops each New Year's Eve
Even if you don't stay here, put a stop at the bar on your must do list.WOnderful spot..

title: Fun weekend with the kids
text: we went into the city for spring break with the kids and had a tourist adventure. Of course, if you're doing the Tims Square thing, theres no better place to stay. We had a nice sized room on one of the top floors. Kids loved being able to explore and go done to the 8th floor lobby to get hot chocolate. Felt safe and secure. Housekeeping wasn't very responsive when we needed an extra pillow but all in all a nice, easy experience in a comfortable room in the best location for what we were looking for.... recommended

title: Great alternative to Marquis
text: Have stayed at the Marquis the last 4 or 5 times and so glad we tried the Renaissance which will now be our ‘go to’ in NYC. Has the cool Renaissance vibe going on from the minute you walk in off the street...staff are friendly, rooms adequate for New York and sitting in the bar/restaurant areas gives the impression of being in the epicentre of Times Sq. Great to have a decent, less huge alternative to the Marquis...and not have to spend ages waiting for elevators. Also, the Goodfellas cocktail is highly recommended!

title: Weekend getaway
text: Took my granddaughters to NYC for a weekend getaway. They are 8 and 11 years old. The hotel was perfect for our stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are adequate in size, beautifully appointed, and the beds are very comfortable. The view of Times Square from the restaurant (and our room) was spectacular! The M&M’s World is adjacent, which my granddaughters loved! The hotel is within walking distance of so many fabulous restaurants and entertainment. Our room amenities included 3 tour bus tickets and a $25 per night restaurant/bar credit. I highly recommend the Cosmopolitan martini, which was perfectly prepared. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again in the future.

title: FANTASTIC
text:
You know when things say position is everything well
The Renaissance New York Times Square has it all
Position, position, position
Looking straight at Times Square with the Tks theatre booking office straight in front on the hotel 
Views to die for
Very friendly staff
Great buffet breakfast
Hop On and Hop Off bus and subway right at the door
Great rooms
We've just had an amazing week staying at the hotel

title: Great central location. Trendy hotel. Paper thin bedroom door
text: Couldn’t ask for a better location - right In Times Square. Very modern hotel and comfortable. Checked in and it would have been nice for the guy behind the desk to smile at least once, but no. Didn’t feel that friendly but maybe he was having an off day! Upstairs lobby, restaurants and bar area very modern and nice atmosphere.  Had an interconnecting room with our 2 teenagers - beds very comfortable, but the bedroom door was as if it was paper thin, as could hear every small sound outside in the hallway - don’t stay near the elevators as they ping every 2 mins.  Would recommend parking around the corner from the hotel and walking as I waited 40 mins for my car when they said it would be 10-15 mins. Reason they said it had taken so long was that the driver guy had forgotten to get our car!

title: Fantastic location
text: We stayed here for a birthday weekend and were not disappointed.  The staff are incredible - pleasant, professional and always happy to assist.  We felt very welcomed and well taken care of.  The location was ideal for seeing all the sights, enjoying a show and wining and dining in NYC.

title: Entered our room despite Privacy tag and verbal request
text: As our family was leaving the room, staff in the hallway asked us to remove the Privacy tag so they could do work in our room. We asked for it to be done the next day, after we checked out, and left with the tag on. When we came back, the tag was still on, but they had clearly entered and moved our stuff around. It was only a 2-night, wknd stay, but they couldn't respect our privacy and security. Token points credit/apology and Times Sq location not enough to rate above 1.

title: Great Hotel
text: We really enjoyed our stay in Times Square. The hotel was clean and inviting. The food at the restaurant was very good. But it was team team that stood out. Fleridana the concierge gave us lots of valuable information. Brian at the front desk made us feel so welcome and safe. This is what makes the difference. We will definitely return.

title: Fab hotel
text:
Fab hotel right in the middle of Times Square. Terrific location. Very nice rooms, nothing 
special, but spacious and clean.  Very nice, accommodating staff. Bar overlooks Times Square where the ball drops on New Year’s Eve. This hotel has a very nice vibe to it & is less expensive than a lot of NY hotels. Can’t beat the location. Comfy beds. 21st floor room is very quiet. Aveda products in bathroom.

title: Has Dropped a Few Notches
text: As a lifetime platinum member of Marriott, I have stayed at more than my share of Marriott hotels over the years and have watched some get reinvented and others deteriorate.  I’m getting the sense that this fall one falls into the later.  Hotels in the ultra tourist districts can usually rely on their location to keep the rooms full and no doubt this Renaissance fits that.  The first issue was the room. It was a decent size and had a nice view, but the room itself was worn with stained drapes and old furniture.  On the upside, the mattress was very comfortable.  I had the same experience as many others with the lounge access issue and service (see my other review of the R Lounge).  It was closed for a private event and guest were forced to sit in a small bar area by the elevators.  And even the elevators were an issue, as we got stuck on them and when the doors kept jamming.  I have always stayed at the Renaissance over the Marquis for the same issue, but have heard that it has been renovated and maybe it’s time to give it another try.

title: Excepcional
text:
Excelente localização, à direita no coração da Times Square. A Vista do restaurante é fantástico. Lindíssimo.
Durante toda a estadia, a equipe foi muito atenciosa e cordial. O quarto é confortável tudo o que você precisa, a limpeza é excelente, o quarto é silencioso e calmo. 
Ele deve ser sem dúvida uma das melhores localizações de NY.

title: Was there for the boat show.
text: I thought the hotel was great, the room was very comfortable and clean.  It had a full kitchen, so for those who want to save money and cook, this is a good thing.  My only complaint is we had a late check out, that was great but when we came back to our room our stuff was gone.  As we were calling the front desk the cleaning lady came in.  They had our stuff downstairs, no one could really tell us why this happened.  About an hour later when we were waiting for our bus home someone came out with my husbands medicine, thank goodness we hadn't left yet.

title: Superior staff and location
text: We have stayed at this hotel on approximately 5 different occasions and now feel comfortable writing a review.  It has the feel of a small hotel in that the public spaces are, on the whole, rather intimate.  Adding to that feeling is the extraordinary friendliness of the staff who do everything with a smile and a great attitude.  Whether dealing with the front desk, the concierge, the bellmen, or those responsible for parking and retrieving one's car they all seem genuinely motivated to be helpful and pleasant.  One almost forgets that this is New York.  Nothing in hurried, rushed or offhanded in their manner.  I was there recently and had a number of things to do in through the afternoon but was anxious to retrieve my car and leave at the earliest time possible as a bad weather front was moving in.  I was able to simply call from my last appointment to tell them I was leaving and the car was ready for me when I arrived.  I have never been given the impression that anything I've asked them to do has been any trouble at all.  The exact opposite is true.  Someone asked me what the secret of effective management is and I responded that there is only one hard and fast maxim--hire good people.  Management certainly sets the standards tone and standards but execution always rests with the folks on the frontline.  The management here is obviously doing a great job but they can thank the rank and file employees for doing such a superb job and thereby making them look so good

title: Limitations on Hotel Amenities
text: I have stayed at this hotel many times, and one of the reasons I like to stay here is the great location and view from the R lounge. I would go to the R lounge for breakfast in the morning and every night after meetings in the city. I stayed there recently for a week and every day the R lounge was rented out and not available to hotel guests. This was very disappointing and if I knew that, I would  have stayed elsewhere. The breakfast was moved to another room which was very crowded and a similiar experience as you would get at a fairfield inn. In the evening, the alternative was to sit in the bar area with no view, which you can do at less expensive hotels in the city and which is what I will do next time I travel to NYC.

title: The Box Seats of Times Square!!!
text:
I have been to many functions in this hotel! I have entertained out of town guests, I have stayed here. 
Always, noting that the view from the Restaurant window is the best view of Times Square! The food, service, and, rooms, all very nice, making for a very memorable, New York City Experience!

title: Fabulous location
text: Location of the hotel was perfect - right on Time Square and very easy walk to both Broadway shows we saw.  While the carpet and furniture needed some updating the room was spacious, quiet and comfortable.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again.   Only piece of advice, get more details on what's included with the destination fee and elite rewards.   R Lounge drink and appetizer was good as was our breakfast Monday morning.  Would have been nice to have breakfast on the weekend also.

title: Boutique, quiet, and great service in Times Square
text: Times Square is busy, noisy, and crowded, but once you enter the Renaissance on 7th Avenue and just a half block from Tix to get discount broadway tickets, you are in a luxury oasis of calm and class.  The breakfast buffet was huge and fresh, and the service is outstanding.  We shall return.

title: Right on Times Square!
text:
Our room wasn’t a much updated one but the view was nice.. it’s right on TImes Square so you have access to a lot of city fun in walking distance.
The hotel gave us all day passes for the hop on hop off bus.. which was a great ride for us and our 3 year old. 
They have a beautiful lounge.. the bar is open till 12am and yet again.. it has an amazing city view. 
And not to forget the service was good too.

title: Top
text: Très bien placé au cœur Time square et proche centrale park. chambre grande avec matelasconfortable belle salle de bain bar avec superbe vue restaurant très sympathique et beaucoup de charme rien à dire j y reviendrais

title: Great Hotel - would stay there again
text: Loved this hotel.  While it does need some updating, our room was spacious and had a view of Times Square.  The bathroom was a nice size also.  Elevators were a little slow though.  It has a really nice breakfast buffet which was included in our room rate.  The bar was good and had some lite bites.  The breakfast room turned in to a restaurant at 5:00 pm.  It had a spectacular view of Times Square.  All the people that worked there were very nice.  Fabulous location!

title: Hidden gem for the bar!! Order the chips!
text:
Great location! Great drinks and great service!

Go early before your meal out for a beer and a bucket of potato chips for 99cents, yes 99cents!!

Get a great view of the Times Square LED billboards - can't wait to come again, long way for me to for a drink though, from Manchester, UK 😔

title: Just Ok
text: First, the location is amazing.  The Lobby and Bar overlook Times Square.  But the rooms are very small and very, very noisy.  The room was also dated and not as polished as other top-Marriott properties.

title: Excellence at its best
text: Excellent time at this hotel.In the heart of Times Square close to everything we did.The staff was very friendly and made checking in and out very easy.The room was very clean and had everything we needed.We will be coming back to the Marriot Renaissance hotel in the near future.

title: Didn't like the extra $25/night... added to my bill.. this is a scam
text: Location is perfect, room is quiet and clean... I love this hotel and I always stays and choose Marriott.  The thing I didn't like is adding $25 destination fee (enhanced wifi, bus tour, food/beverage discount)  which we never use.  I asked upon booking to remove this and I was told to deal this upon checkin.  At checkin I requested to remove this as we are not going to use any of this... nop they didn't remove this.  I think this is ridiculus to pay something you will never use... and this is per night of stay... Now I'm having second thought staying at Marriott in NYC. This $25 is a scam...

title: hotel normal
text:
estuvimos para fin de año y hemos debido pagar lo que no vale, por estar alojados en este incomodo hotel, que salvo su brillante ubicacion, no tiene otra virtud.
Subir por ascensor hasta un lobby insulso e incomodo, hace que esta eleccion haya resultado equivocada.
Habitaciones normalitas.

title: R Lounge
text:
We weren't staying here at the Renaissance but visited R Lounge as we fancied a cocktail on a freezing cold day in early January.  We were greeted by a friendly waiter and seated in the window with a view over Times Square; excellent cocktails and we thought a very reasonable price compared to most hotel bars in the area.
A pleasant escape from the sub zero temperatures, thank you!

title: Amazing Location for the New Years Eve Ball Drop
text:
Even though it was one of the coldest in history, we went up for three days to see the NYE Ball Drop and it was amazing.  This hotel's location was great for walking to places, we left the car at Newark Airport and rode NJ Transit into Penn Station.  Initially we were only coming for two nights but my wife convinced me to go up one day earlier, which was a great idea.  We got to see the city unmolested on Friday, then watched it tighten up as security was stepped up leading into Sunday night.  We had a great time and definitely recommend this hotel for your stay up in Times Square.  Shout out to NYC PD as they were very nice to talk to and interact with, we felt very safe and I recommend this experience should be on everybody's Bucket List.

Room was pricey but still was better when compared to others in this area for the NYE weekend.

title: Great Location, convenience and rooms comfortable
text: When visiting NY City, it is about finding a place to stay that is easy to get back and forth to. There are times I look for luxury and having a lot of amenities on site, but in the city, it is about convenience to getting to shows, activities, shopping and dining, this hotel was the perfect location. The hotel had comfortable rooms and  great views of the city. Getting to the rooms was a little odd, once you check in at the front desk, you take a elevator up then have to get off cross a lobby then get onto another elevator to get to the rooms. Not a big deal, just seemed to confuse a few people.

title: warning new "resort fee" charged
text:
warning. We are native New Yorker's  who regularly come into the City during January & February every year to see plays. Hotel prices are down & you get better seats at plays. Plus much less crowded. We have stayed at this hotel for several years & love the location & the hotel. We have always received great customer service & go to the lounge every night for drinks.

However, we are coming  Jan 17 for a number of nights but will no longer stay here. Why? There is a new $25 per night resort fee for "enhanced internet, bus ticket (no clue what this is) & 25 towards food credit & gym" HUH???? This is a new fee I was told for all full service Marriott's in NYC.

We are platinum elites so don't  pay for the internet, there is no concierge lounge, & we don't use the gym since we are here to see plays & museums. Therefore, I don't want to pay a resort fee for things I already get for free & things like the gym I never use.

So Marriott you lost us as guests forever with your new policy. Marriott change your policy!!!

There is a way to beat this- use the Residence Inn, Fairfield Inn or Courtyard & you don't have to pay this outrageous fee. That's what we are doing!

Although we would rather stay here, I am not going to pay a resort fee for some things we get free as a platinum member or don't use.

title: Excellent New Year's Eve hotel in Times Square!
text: The location of this hotel overlooking Times Square makes it perfect for that NYC New Year's Eve experience.  What amazed me even more was the service at the R Lounge on the third floor of the hotel. All of the staff we encountered there, both at breakfast and in the evening, were professional and appropriately friendly.

title: VERY RUDE HOSTESS
text: We stayed here for a weekend, it is convenient to Times Square, but that is about all I can say positive.  Walls are paper thin, and towels and linens were ratty.  The draw to the lounge are the windows that over look Times Square, they would only allow certain people to enter, we had been walking around in 12* weather and were coming in to get ready for dinner, and wanted to have a drink, it was 4 pm and we just wanted to have warm beverages and drinks. “The hostess” was extremely rude and would not let us enter, she stated we could sit at the bar, which he could only give us water or alcohol (not even a hot toddy), and as guests you would assume that you get to relax in your on hotel. The 4 tables that were there were only having drinks.....so I’m at a loss for why we were turned away. It certainly put a damper on our opinion of the stay. Thank you rude hostess.

title: Встреча Нового года
text: Великолепное расположение. Готовый помочь персонал. Хорошее соотношение цена/качество. Огромное количество достопримечательностей и возможность перекусить. Бродвей рядом. Возможность выйти на улицу при “ball drop”.

title: Coldest New Years on record; warmest experience!
text: Located right in the center of Times Square, this hotel took the 'chaos' out of the New York experience that everyone warned us about, especially on New Years. Check in was easy and check out at noon was nice! The staff was very welcoming, friendly and not to mention extremely organized during the New Years events. Special thanks to the gentleman managing the logistics, security, front/outside of the hotel on New Years Eve up until the ball drop. He was exceptional. The hotel itself is updated, clean, comfortable & quiet; even with all that was going on outside. Great view of Times Square from the R Lounge and an amazing view right in front of the hotel for the actual ball drop! My husband, 11 yr old daughter and I definitely had a memorable New Years experience at the Renaissance that we will never forget!

title: One of my favorite spots
text: No longer have room service but it’s NYC who eats in the room. It’s full of wonderful places to eat especially outside if Times Square. Clean and quiet. Will definitely go back. Restaurant lounge was great. View of Times Square from lounge was amazing.

title: Great location, subpar hotel.
text: Dining is not really an option in the hotel.  They rent out the dining area for events (e.g., weddings).  During our stay it was only open to hotel guests 1 of 4 nights.  Dining for breakfast is a similar challenge unless you've maintained your gold status.  Without gold status there is one breakfast option:  a buffet for $32.00 per person.  The daily hotel fee includes $25 per day beverage credit, but I didn't get to use it all because of the bar area closures.  The hotel is nice enough, but my rooms (had 2 of them) were run down with holes in the sheets and comforter covers.

title: Beautiful hotel right in the middle of Times Square!
text: This our second time staying at the hotel, but times we had great experiences! We recently got back from spending an extended weekend at the Renaissance this time. This hotel is luxurious, updated, clean, and the staff goes out of their way to help with whatever you need! Extremely quiet despite the hustle and bustle of the location.The lounge is beautiful looking right over Times Square. Highly recommend staying here if you want a true "New York experience!"

title: Best Location for Holiday Season
text: This is our sixth year in a row and we are totally satisfied with our experience each and every year. Overlooking Time Square between Christmas and New Years is a view that cannot be beat.  The lights, signs, traffic and people make it the best viewing area for watching the preparation of the City of NY for New Years Eve.  The rooms are adequate and the service by the   Staff is outstanding.  Check in is easy and check out at noon is certainly a reasonable time...it gives you another half day to do something in the City.  We can’t wait for next year!

title: Great hotel
text: My sister and I stayed here for 5 days and have no complaints. The room was comfortable (although we would have preferred a Times Sq view). The front desk was very helpful as was the concierge. The lounge is great!  Very good food & drinks. The location cannot be beat. A block from the subway and you can walk to Central Park and all the theatres easily. We stayed based on a friend’s recommendation and are glad we did.

title: 좋은 위치에 좋은 호텔
text: 타임스퀘어와의 접근성이 최고로 호텔입구에서 도보로 2분. 침대도 역시 메리어트 호텔 계열 답게 편안함을 느낄수 있다. 물론 가격이 비싸다는 문제가 있기는 하지만...

title: Great place to stay in Midtown
text:
Location: Hotel is ideally located right at Times Square. We were on the 26th floor on 7th street and it was very quiet given it is the city. You'll hear sirens no matter where you stay - that's NYC. Right in the heart of all the action. The major subway lines are a block away. You can get down to One World Trade or head over to Brooklyn for some great pizza. 
Quality: The room was very nice. Decent amount of space for NYC. The room was clean albeit the normal wear and tear. Shower and bathroom clean. Water pressure was a little low in the shower. The beds were super comfy. The elevators here were very quiet - no "ding" in the middle of the night like Courtyard. We had neighbors but couldn't hear them. 
Amenities: The cable TV really needs to be fixed. Most channels were fuzzy. You can get the major channels (ABC/NBC/FOX/CBS), cartoon network and 3-4 ESPN channels but the others are fuzzy. Safe & fridge were in our room. Plenty of towels.
Lobby: Check-in at the ground floor. Concierge, restaurant and bar on the 2nd level (main level). We thought the main level was very cool and the views from the restaurant and bar window are amazing at night. The bar area isn't huge and the bar can fill up in the evening but it's worth a try as the service was very good the night I was there (a Tuesday).
Price: A little more expensive than other Marriott's (Courtyard, etc.) in the area but you're paying for the location. There is a $25 fee but you get a $25 food credit which I used for a bar drink. I think it's worth the splurge. 
Security: We experienced no issue. There is security at main level and we checked our bags with the bellman on the day we checked out. An excellent experience with the bellman - very nice gent.

title: Great location
text: Located in the heart of Times Square, convenient to Broadway. Great view from the RLounge on the third floor. Great view of Times Square enjoying the complimentary breakfast. Comfortable rooms, updates and modern.

title: Perfect Location!
text: The Renaissance Hotel Times Square is a great property in the bustling capital of the world.  Outstanding rooms with unparalleled views of Times Square.  Plan to enjoy the hot breakfast as you take in the sights that only Times Square offers.

title: Great location
text: We came to NYC for a girls trip and this was a great location. Close to the theatre and subway stop so we were able to plan our days carefully. The rooms are average size for the city. We stayed on the 23rd floor and still could hear the traffic below. Check in was delayed as the rooms were not ready. It is a busy hotel and given the numbers they are accommodating. Would come back.

title: Great Location, but not much else.
text: If you want to be in the center of it all, i.e. Times Square, this hotel will meet your needs. If you want an upscale oasis from the hustle and bustle of the streets, this is NOT it. The checkin area is frequently a zoo with no room for people and their luggage. The lobby might be nice, but half of it was closed for a private event. This was made worse by the overflow from the checkin area. And amidst this scene that resembled an airport where half the flights had been canceled was where we were supposed to sit and enjoy our free appetizer that came with our room. Then we got to our room, one of the suites. The full bath off the living room had no heat making privacy a chilling prospect. No mini bar, no room service, no gift shop, no decent concierge (we asked for a recommendation for a bar nearby and they sent us to a restaurant with a counter). Breakfast was low quality and very few options. Add very little security and I think you’ll agree there are many better choices nearby.

title: Updated review
text:
Stayed here last year. Came back this year. This is a very nice hotel. Away from the hustle and bustle but directly facing time square. The breakfast room looks directly out at the New Years ball. Has a very funky vibe to it.
Modern rooms. Comfortable beds.
Nice lobby bar. Check in is down at street level. Then you're taken by elevator several floors to the lobby where are you are a different world. Away from the hustle bustle of Times Square. Concierge service is very helpful. Breakfast buffet is adequate. Great view. I would only use this if part of your room rate as it is otherwise very pricey.

title: Just WOW!
text: The location, the style and everything about this hotel was New York at its finest. Our room had a great view of Broadway, had a lovely bathroom with a spacious shower and a very comfy bed. I couldn’t get enough of the stylish lobby on the second floor. It was New York Christmas style at its finest: unique, stylish and glitzy. Would stay here over and over again!

title: Birthday Celebration
text: I rented a suite for my birthday celebration. Initially there was confusion about the type of room, however the team there made the modification and sent champagne to my suite for my birthday.  Excellent location and I would definitely stay there again!

title: Nice Location Good People
text: My wife and I traveled to New York for our annual December visit and chose Renaissance New York Times Square for the first time. Great location for theatre, subway and Times Square activities.  Check in is at the street level on 6th street and was flawless. Our room was ready although we arrived early. There was a nice expansive lobby on the 4th floor with restaurants on both ends. Unfortunately the south restaurant was closed for private functions on 2 of the 3 nights we stayed and the north restaurant was closed 2 of our 3 nights. Free coffee on weekdays but not weekend days. Front desk staff were great and housekeeping was outstanding. Room was small as usual in Manhattan but bathroom was more expansive with a large updated walk-in shower. King size bed was comfortable. Hostess at restaurant was not very pleasant and even kurt with us but maybe she was just having a bad day. The rest of the staff were all above average to outstanding. Be careful about the destination package. There is a $25 a day additional charge but includes a $25 a day credit in the restaurants and a free bus ticket. Would not recommend unless you are going to eat daily in their restaurants and there is better food nearby. There are no coke products available in the hotel and ice machines are not available on every floor....which seems to be the rule of thumb at my recent Marriott stays including JW Marriott. There is a refrigerator in the room which is helpful.

title: My go-to hotel, when being a tourist in Manhattan.
text:
While not luxurious, this property more than makes up for that with just enough luxe touches, and the best location in the city to do the tourist thing.

On the plus side: great check-in & bell staff; decent-sized rooms with sumptuous beds and stylish fabrics; well-designed bathrooms with deep tubs; and a truly gracious housekeeping staff that keeps everything immaculate. Then there is the lounge: an immersive peninsula perched just over Times Square -- high enough to be out of the crowd, but close enough to feel the energy -- with floor-to-ceiling views on three sides. It's THE place in New York to watch the ball drop.

So-so: The food is good but unremarkable and the breakfast buffet is barely adequate. Windows are sound-proofed, but the city's (sometimes literal) music still gets in.

Negatives: Wood furniture pieces are pretty dinged-up, and could use a refresh. Concierge and wait staff tend to tolerate guests, rather than offer genuine service. (This is such a constant, that I'm guessing the cause lies with working conditions in these departments more than with the personalities of specific employees.) And there's no room service, which I get is a trend at 4-star properties in NY -- where virtually any restaurant will deliver -- but I still think is a detriment in a hotel that purports to be full-service.

title: NYC December
text:
We visited this hotel for Saturday and Sunday night. The front desk and bell staff were outstanding. There is a 25 dollar resort fee which is more annoying than anything. They offer a few percent with that (bus tour, gym, and 25 off food/beverages)
The lobby bar is pretty awesome views of Times Square. The negative is on the weekend they keep up “reserved signs” ask you if you have reservation, and we didn’t ...the hostess was a bit rude and said you have to have reservations. We said we were hotel guest then she seated us. Service was slow for drinks both nights we stopped by for a drink/night cap.
I thought the room was a pretty good size for NYC Room. The black out curtains didn’t keep all the bright Times Square lights out and the bathroom light was motion censored and kept turning off while I was trying to shower. Internet use is costly and no free water in the room—-even for rewards members.
I’d have to say location is what makes this hotel if you want to be in middle of the Times Square madness!

title: Great location!
text: Very nice hotel with spectacular views in the upper floors!  The bathroom was smaller but there was a nice kitchenette and sitting area with a sofa, so still spacious. Nice complimentary breakfast buffet, with seats that overlook the street below.  Great way to start the day.  The location was great.  Times Square was right around the corner.  Easy walk to many major attractions, NY City Library, Grand Central station, one block from 5th Ave shopping, even Rockefeller Center is doable.  Subway station nearby also.  I really enjoyed my stay.

title: タイムズスクエアが絶景
text: 朝食はあまり種類がないがカウントダウン会場を眼下にする絶景です。部屋も普通ですが、立地を買う感じでしょうか。風呂は広めでまあまあ深かったです。

title: Descanso
text: Hotel bem localizado, funcionários educados, quartos bons e limpos, precisa melhorar o chuveiro, frigobar vazio , oque permite colocar água, frutas , uma cervejinha. Recomendo o Lounge bar do hotel , fui duas vezes. Vista de Times Square excelente, boa carta de vinho e boa comida. Fui atendido às duas vezes pela funcionária Madalena , que é uma pessoa extremamente gentil e educada. Recomendo este hotel e bar

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text: When I travel to New York if I don’t stay in Times Square I don’t feel I’ve really been there. The Renaissance Hotel is in the center of everything New York. It is close to everything...Broadway shows, restaurants, sightseeing excursions. Everything! The staff is very friendly! I love The Renaissance.

title: Perfekter Einstieg in die Vorweihnachtszeit - Aufenthalt im Renaissance
text:
Der Aufenthalt in New York - sowieso immer ein Erlebnis - wurde sehr aufgewertet dank der Eindrücke im Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel. Alle Erwartungen wurden deutlich übertroffen.

Highlight ist der Frühstücksraum mit Fensterfront zum Times Square. Gemütlicher Start mit Blick auf die atemberaubende Kreuzung von 7th Avenue und Broadway.

Daneben sind viele andere Annehmlichkeiten zu erwähnen wie die perfekte Lage des Hotels, der Zugang zur Metro gleich beim Hotel, die Broadway-Theater innert 5 Minuten zu Fuss erreichbar, sowie die Ausstattung und Dekoration im Hotel.

title: Nice hotel right in the heart of Times Square
text: Spent four great days here over Thanksgiving and it is a wonderful location.  We had a large room on the 24th floor overlooking Times Square.  The staff was excellent and accomodating.  The hotel restaurant was good and you are in close proximity to everything in the Times Square area.  One thing of note, I recommend the valet parking which is $65 per day if you have a car.  Definitely worth it.

title: Unbelievable Location
text: The Renaissance is a beautiful hotel right in the center of Times Square.  I have stayed at the Marquis many times, but it is always crowded and crazy busy.  The Renaissance has as good if not better location and is much more of a boutique hotel.  Breakfast is amazing with a view that is unmatched anywhere in the city.  The staff is excellent and the rooms though small are very well maintained and high quality.

title: Not a quality hotel
text: As a Marriott Gold member I am used to staying at Renaissance hotels that are mid to higher tier of the Marriott brand. This hotel is centrally located in Time Square but the rooms are dated and the lobby is basically part of the restaurant so there is no lobby. The only reason I stayed here was because I needed a suite and they had the biggest suites I could find in the area. There is no concierge lounge and the service is not very good. I take it they are used to out of town tourist coming and staying because of the location. There are much better hotels close by.

title: Location! Location!
text: The Renaissance Times Square has a fantastic location & awesome facilities.  If you are planning to visit anytime soon, keep this hotel on your bucket list of places to stay.  The view from each room is magnificent & allows you to keep your finger on the pulse of the city outside.

title: Easy to find, friendly staff, safe location
text:
We drove to this property, and while our GPS kept losing signal, it was still easy to find. It’s next to M&M World, so it stood out. The doorman/valet man was very kind and friendly. Our car was parked and no damage was done. 
The front desk staff was also friendly.  They allowed us to do early check in, but we ended up on the 6th floor, which was rather close to street noise. The street noise was to be expected, obviously, and we were just grateful for early check in.
The hotel is decorated with random sheep. I’m sure this is overlooked by most people, but my daughter’s favorite animal, is a sheep, so she was completely gaga for the place! The hotel lobby is dark and trendy feeling, it has a city vibe. There are four elevators that lead to the hotel rooms. 
The room is decent sized for the city. The beds were comfortable. There is a coffee maker and a refrigerator. There’s a closet, a desk, a comfy chair and a safe. The bathroom is stocked with Aveda supplies. There is no fan in the bathroom and the door is sliding glass door. Large vanity area. 
The housekeeping staff was great! The concierge staff was helpful. 
I would suggest earplugs in case you have a room close to the street. The noise is only an issue if the owners of fancy cars decide to pretend they are in a Fast & Furious movie. We witnessed a full blown drag race, smoke show and endless engines for almost two hours one night. Slightly amusing. 
Overall, it was a good stay. It’s within walking distance to most things.

title: Great location
text:
The entrance to the hotel is on 7th avenue. It is a small doorway and you might think you are at the wrong place. Rest assured you are at the hotel. Once you go through the doorway the front desk is on your left. It is well staffed and check in is a breeze. The elevators are located across the small lobby area. The elevators take you up about three floors to the main lounge area. Here you will find the concierge and the restaurant bar. The elevators to the other floors are across the large lobby area.
We were on the 15th floor and our room looked out onto 7th Avenue. You really don't hear the traffic below except one night when there was some type of motorcycle event on the street.
The room had two large double beds (we didn't want to wait for a king). The bathroom is also large and well appointed. There is a deep bathtub that would be great for soaking. My wife had to ask for a hairdryer to be delivered to the room other than that everything was perfect.
Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning up the room.
The windows had very thick drapes which came in hamdy for blocking the blinking lights from 7th avenue.
If you are eligible for the concierge level know that it is not available on the weekends. However lots of places close by to get a coffee and a roll before starting out for the day.
Nice staff, nicely decorated, not noisy.
I would definiotely stay here again.

title: GEM AT TIMES SQUARE
text: The Renaissance is a great family hotel in the heart of Times Square with probably the best views you could get. The staff is friendly, rooms are clean, elegant and spacious and the breakfast more than adequate to see you through the day. I would definitely stay here again.

title: A good Times Square hotel
text:
Generally a good hotel, first time staying in Times Square. Even though I've been to NYC 40 times in the last 5 years, I felt like a tourist.

Positives:

Downtown NQR subway right next to the hotel. Uptown right across from the TKTS booth. Easy walking distance to 42nd street to get the 123, ACE (via the underground walkway), or the S to Grand Central for 456 trains.

Friendly staff.

For a second I thought the first floor was the lobby, but soon found out that the real lobby is on the 2nd floor which had two computers, a bar and a restaurant. 

I had a red-eye from LA and arrived really early. While they did check me in at 6am, they didn't have a room ready till 10:30am which they provided a courtesy early check in.

So as a Marriott Platinum Elite, I was really worried having read online that there were no benefits at this hotel. However on check in I found out that there are benefits:
1) Free breakfast buffet. It was a pretty standard hotel buffet with scrambled eggs, decent sausage, pretty gross bacon, breads, waffles, danish, bagels, water, orange juice, coffee, etc. It wasn't the best thing in the world, but it was free.
2) Two free bottles of $8 Evian water that are in the room.
3) One free $10 appetizer per night in the hotel restaurant.
4) I'm sure they have room upgrades to higher floors, but that didn't apply this time because I took the first room available.

Mixed or no opinion:

They charge a approx 25 dollar per night resort fee. However, the benefits you get from this far outweigh the costs if you stay for a short amount of time. Those benefits were a $25 restaurant F&B credit and a Big Bus Tour 24 hour ticket (which is usually $50 bucks) and a day pass to Equinox (not sure value of that, but probably $20 - $25). I hate paying resort fees, but I can't deny that these benefits are really great for single person staying.

Negatives:

The carpet in my room was loose.

Blackout curtains didn't completely close all the way

Shower only, no bathtubs

No room service

No rooms actually face Times Square but either Broadway or 7th Ave

Oh if there was supposed to be another Platinum Elite benefit (like a bottle of wine) I didn't get one.

title: Great stay at the Renaissance
text:
Had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Renaissance NY Times Square which was perfectly located for us as it was a first time trip to New York and being centrally located made it a lot easier to get around the city and see all the different sites and tourist attractions! Another bonus of staying at The Renaissance NY Times square is the fact that it is very close to the subway which makes it easy to travel all across the different New York boroughs.
Now to the staff of the Renaissance NY Times Square, they were all amazing but I must hi lite 3 employees that were extra special and amazing with their attitude and customer service skills- Nate Belizaire who was was outstanding as well as Martha from the front desk who was great,very helpful, friendly and courteous and finally Daniel the concierge who always made time to help and was knowledgeable and a great help with deciding where to go what to see whether it was tourist sites, restaurants, lounges etc.
Places and locations are nice but the people that work to make your stay pleasant are makes things a lot better and that was my experience with The Renaissance Times Square.

title: Nice hotel, Great location, Friendly staff
text:
Pleasantly surprised at the size of our room! We stayed in room 2406 which was appropriately furnished with a king bed, desk & chair, chaise and 2 bed side tables. Appointments included a small fridge & coffee maker. The bed was perfect for us, not too hard or soft.  

Bath area included a large enough vanity area and shower with ledge seating (no tub). 

The morning buffet breakfast hosted eggs, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, breads (croissants to bagels), as well as an assortment of fresh fruits and yogurts and cereals for the kids.  Very tasty. 

During the evenings the breakfast area is converted into a lounge with wonderful views of Times Square. 

Housekeeping was excellent!
Bellhop and Doorman friendly and helpful. 
Check in and Concierge helpful.  

Location is excellent - right on Times Square and close walk into the Theater District. 

As a loyal Marriott guests, we will definitely repeat our stay at our next visit into the city.

title: Not too bad
text: This hotel was pretty good, and the room was actually a nice size for NY. Room was reasonably updated. Shower was very good. My room looked right out onto a big times Square TV billboard which was actually kind of cool. They play fairly loud clubby type music in the elevator which I suppose is to make you assume it's a cool place. I was indifferent towards that. My only negatives are that the walls between the rooms are thin, I could hear the guy next to me caughing and snoring and talking on the phone. No doubt he could hear my noises as well. Also they give you that really cheap, rough recycled toilet paper which was an unwelcome surprise from a $500 a night hotel.

title: 타임스퀘어 걸어서 10초~!
text:
뉴욕에서 이정도 방 크기이면 베리 굿~!!
위치도 나가면 바로 타임스퀘어라 너무 좋습니다.
시즌에 따라 금액이 차이 나지만 다시 뉴욕여행 간다면 재방문의사 100%

title: Excelente Hotel en Times Square
text: Hotel ubicado en pleno Times Square con estacion de subway en la esquina. Excelente ubicacion. Hotel moderno y con gran servicio. Los cuartos son amplios y agradables. El bar tiene una vista espectacular. Muy recomendado. Se puede salir a caminar a todos lados.

title: Renaissance NY Times Square Hotel ...Fantastic Stay
text: Recently stayed at the Renaissance NY Times Square Hotel in NYC with my GF..  This hotel is located in the heart of Times Square in the Theatre District at  7th Avenue.  This hotel offers Valet Parking.  Upon checking, we were greeted by Adinda who was friendly and professional.  Due to my gold elite status, Adinda checked for room upgrade and provided us with a fantastic high floor corner room.  Among other things, this hotel has a terrific club lounge with a fantastic view of Times Square.  This hotel also has a nice gym.  All of the employees with helpful, friendly, and professional.  Our room was very comfortable and clean.  I highly recommend this hotel to everyone without  hesitation.  An absolutely fantastic stay.

title: Great Place Downtown
text: RIght near Times Square and walking distances to great places to eat and theatre district. Nice size rooms, clean and comfortable beds. Stayed there for work. Breakfast buffet was also good, fresh fruit and fast friendly service. Stop in and stay.

title: Muy bueno
text: Muy bueno y muy buena ubicacion. Desayuno incluido. Muy bueno. Excelente vista al rio. Wi-Fi rápido y gratis. Buenas atención en el fronta desk. Ascensores veloces. Limpieza maso. Tiene cocina. Te cobran por los paquetes

title: Good but...NO ROOM SERVICE? WHAT?
text:
Location of this hotel is prime in the center of Time Square. We even attended a catered event in one of their full glass rooms overlooking Times Square. Food was good, service great but...try to get a bottle of water delivered to your room..NOPE. What? No room service? Upon calling the front desk to get room service, the suggestion was for me to go down to the street and go to one of the local delis. Personally, call me lazy but this would be a good enough reason to never stay at this hotel again.  I want to know that if I wake up at 2:00am and want a bottle of water or a plate of fruit that I don't need to get dressed and walk around Time Square at 2:00 in the morning. Aside from the lack of room service I found the ambience of this hotel basically standard. Nothing to shout about except for the location and view. 

TravelDivaDayna

title: Great location, incredible breakfast view
text: Usually hate Times Square but this hotel is great.  The view from breakfast is lovely, the rooms are nice.  My only grumble would be that the bar/restaurant had private parties on EVERY night so we never caught the view at night.

title: Great location downtown
text: Getting to the hotel was a pain driving or atleast for my first time in the city. They do have valet and is a must. Expensive but worth it so you dont have to drive around the city. Excellent location as its right downtown!  We had plenty of views from our room and rhe room was very nice. The front desk was very helpful and nice people. We were also able to get an umbrella when it was raining. There is an elevator that takes you to the main lobby where you have to transfer ro another elevator to your room. There is a full bar and resteraunt on the main floor and was always busy. It is a little load but ee sat at the bar each time. The view from the dining room to time square is really cool. Overall it was a great choice as we were able to walk anywhere or get on a subway from the hotel. Would stay here again for the convenience alone.

title: If you want Times Square, you'll get it
text:
I stayed here for a night on business. The location is perfect for anyone who wants to stay in (literally in) Times Square. For me personally, if I was going to NYC for pleasure I wouldn't stay here just because the location is so crazy. The ads go all the time and whenever they changed colors I could see the glow even with the blackout curtains. It's also not the most quiet.

However, the rooms were spacious, especially for NYC standards. The $25 resort fee is a pretty decent deal, if you take them up on their offers. WiFi is not free and is either 17 or 20 dollars per day. The lobby is modern and nice, and it offers a good bar.

Beds were comfortable and everything was clean. Overall I have no huge complaints, however if you are looking for another option, check out the WestHouse hotel. Still a great location and I think your money goes a bit farther there.

title: Classy in the Heart of the City
text: If you want Times Square, this is a perfect hotel; if you want any other aspect of NYC, you might want to look elsewhere. The rooms are standard Renaissance rooms with great views and people watching. The lobby is modern and spacious on the second level. Once you walk outside, you are smack dab in the middle of Times Square with its 24-hour tourist bustle. Great stay for broadway and tourist shops.

title: Good stay, a few problems
text: We took a long weekend in NYC to celebrate my son's 21st birthday.  This was a great location to be able to get to most things by foot (we like to walk).  You take the elevator to the next floor up, and then go across to go to another set of elevator banks to the room levels.  The room was nice. You pay a $25 resort fee, but you get coupons to get frozen yogurt and a $25 food credit which made it less painful.  A few small issues we had were that the refrigerator would kick on every half hour and wake me up (we just unplugged it).  We also got ice from the 9th floor and after it melted, we saw that there was brown "soot" in the left over water. It may be time to clean that ice machine! The pillows were very flat. All in all, it was a good stay.

title: September NYC Times Square Location location location...
text: It was my  65 th birthday and 35th anniversary,so we decided to stay at our  favorite hotel , the Renaissance Times Square.  We have stayed at this hotel numerous times through the years, and we still love it! Ideally located at Times Square the hotel offers easy access to all subways,theatres ,tours, night life, and restaurants. Check in is on the lower level, avoiding  noise and lines at the main level of the hotel. The staff was excellent ! Ingrid, Jennifer, and front desk person, Brian(?) were so helpful with questions or concerns . The room was well decorated and offered plenty of room for a nyc hotel. The fitness room was moved and updated.....very chic and modern. It  offers treadmills, elliptically, weights, yoga area,plenty of towels, headphones,and even apples! We love this property and will be the only hotel I would stay when in NYC .

title: Great Property and Location
text: I stayed here while my husband was in town for business and loved it! All of my interactions with the hotel staff were awesome, everyone was friendly, helpful and kind. The rooms are a great size and the decor is very modern. The entire property is incredibly clean and well taken care of! There are so many great things within walking distance around the hotel: The Empire State Building, The NY Public Library, 5th Avenue shopping, Madison Avenue shopping and it's a 25 minute walk to Central Park! Would highly recommend staying here!

title: viagem turistica com a esposa
text: A combinação da localização com as instalações faz do Renaissance  uma ótima opção para sua viagem para NYork, Facilidade de transporte, muitas opções de restaurantes, proximidade da Broadway. Os apartamentos são bons e o Staff é muito simpático e atencioso. Recomendamos tranquilamente

title: Nice Stay
text:
I stay in NYC midtown 50+ nights a year with Work. 

Long time Marriott member and have stayed at most Marriott hotels in manhattan.  It’s a block from Marriott Marquis, not as big of rooms and the bar is small and often closed for private events.  

With that said, the lobby staff are exceptional, the rooms nicer and larger than most of the Marriott’s in midtown.  Compare the prices of Marriott family hotels and this is well worth the money. 

15 min walk to Grand Central or Penn Station and a few nice midtown places to eat.

title: Always guaranteed a good stay
text: A great hotel from check in to check out.  Had a room on the 16th floor and other than briefly on the Saturday night, there was no outside noise.  The hotel is ideally located in the midst of Times Square and all the activities there.  A short walk will take you to many restaurants and theatres.  The room was nicely appointed and clean.  And if you’re thinking of a HOHO bus tour, check with the concierge cause the hotel has some special deals available.  Good service.

title: Can’t get any closer to Times Square!
text:
Talk about being on Times Square! This hotel is right at the heart of Times Square. 
The reception is very small, but get in the lift, and you come out into the amazing area of bar, restaurant and concierge. This hotel is funky and quirky and has a great atmosphere. 
We used the concierge services, and they were more than helpful and very friendly. 
Rooms were very spacious and very clean. The bathroom was also of a great size, with a huge walk in shower.  Toiletries, plenty of towels and hair dryer all provided. 
They have a great bar and can’t stain restaurant overlooking Times Square. Be sure to make reservations though! 
This was a great place to stay and would definitely return and recommend.

title: Horrible for a Marriott brand
text: Arrived with a party of 9, none of the rooms were correct. 2 rooms were changed to a "suite" for one night until the hotel could be cleared out the next morning. The walls in these 2 "suites" are paper thin, woke up at 6:30 am to what sounded like someone bowling in the hallway. Rooms were booked through Marriott, was told several times my third party vender didn't book the rooms right. We are Elite members, we use Marriott monthly to stay for business. Very, very, very disappointed. Never have left a bad review for a Marriott until now.

title: Great location for seeing a show
text: Great hotel if you enjoy the energy of the city. 1/2 block from TKTS. Many great restaurants in the area and all the Broadway shows are a short walk away. Comfy bed, clean, with blackout drapes to "turn off" the lights of Times Square.

title: Perfect location for our trip
text: I read another review that stated Very Impersonal.  We weren't treated like that at all.  But then again, I'm very polite and personable with everyone whether they work there or not.  In fact I can tell you that I walked in to the check-in on the bottom floor and was immediately told hello.  When the valet brought our suitcases up, he thanked me for staying.  We chatted with the bartender and servers.  The servers in the lounge were excellent.  Our room attendant wrote me a thank you note for her tip and left it by the TV.  We had an excellent stay.  I loved how modern the hotel was.  Our room was very clean. The food and drinks were great in the lounge.  For our stay, it was the perfect place because we were going to see Hamilton, the Big Bus stop was right out front.  It was very convenient.  I am definitely going to recommend it to my friends and family.

title: Very Impersonal
text: This Hotel was well located for visiting New York Times Square.  The whole stay was one of being at a fast pace, impersonal and not much politeness.  The room were great and comfortable and location being close to Time Square was great and convenient.  Comfortable stay but everyone is too busy doing their own thing rather than being polite and helpful..

title: It was just okay
text:
Positives-room was clean, nice roomy bathroom, comfy bed. Loved the coloring books in the lobby-the books and the cards.  After begging the maitre de at the breakfast, he FINALLY got us the head chef.  After explaining my daughter has allergies to wheat, soy, potato and wanting to know if it was safe for her to eat there, the chef said-let's not take any chances and I will make her a safe meal.  We were very grateful.  The maitre de wanted to charge me $30 to sit and watch my daughter eat, which after I swore up and down and right and left that I wouldn't touch a morsel of food, he let me in to sit with her.  

Negatives-Something triggered my asthma as soon as I walked in our room. .  It is not even my asthma season.  One daughter said she smelled something-like an air freshener, I didn't, but something got me.  We asked for 2 additional pillow Sunday morning  They never came.  There was no convenience store in the hotel.  We were in town for a wedding and went to visit our relatives in the Double Tree Times Square, and they had one-which was great, to get a snack and or drink.  Breakfast was $30 and it wasn't much.  Precooked eggs, fruit, danish.  It wasn't worth $30 even by NY standards.  

Would we stay there again????  Maybe because hubby wants the Marriott points and or for the location, but I would def look around and check out other options.

title: Great hotel, great staff, great location
text: We were in midtown for just one night to see a show. The hotel is extremely convenient to all the Broadway theaters, but especially the Walter Kerr, where Bruce Springsteen is doing a show. We were on the 4th floor over 7th Avenue, and I was concerned about noise, but we heard no noise from the street and the hotel was very quiet.  The breakfast buffet was convenient. Our room was huge, not something we are used to in Manhattan. As Marriott gold members, our breakfast and internet was free.

title: More of a boutique feel; better elevators than Marquis
text:
The thing to know before booking this hotel is it is not your typical large Renaissance Hotel. This property is small. It's in the island between 7th Ave and Bway at a very narrow spot. This is pretty much the opposite of the Marriott Marquis just down the block where the wait for elevators can often take forever because of the sheer volume of people passing through. This Renaissance has a decidedly boutique-y feel. The decor is a little strange but still pleasing to the eye. The lobby is tiny and there are only two check in desks. We ended up waiting a little while because a bunch of ppl all arrived at the same time. There was no one available to do mobile check in and hand you the keys. No biggie, it wasn't that long a wait. 

We stayed in a double room overlooking 7th Ave on the 24th floor. Nice sized room with plenty of space. It was definitely showing some wear, but it's NYC and these hotels get a lot of traffic.  Everything was clean. Water pressure is terrible and the shower head does not have adjustable stream so leave extra time to rinse the shampoo and conditioner out of you have long thick hair. 

One thing I wish they had was Netflix access on the TV because the channel offering is pretty limited and it takes forever to surf.  There's a very long annoying delay between when you press the channel button and the TV responds. There is no channel guide on screen so it really was a waste of time. These days it's pretty standard stuff to be able to hit the Netflix button and log in with your account.

There is no room service and no Concierge Lounge here.

Overall I liked that this hotel is smaller and easier to navigate the Marquis. However if you're looking for a full service experience, the Renaissance is not the hotel to choose.

title: Convenient Location, Room Cleanliness an Issue
text: This is a conveniently located hotel with easy access to the Times Square subway station. As a platinum member you have access to the "R Lounge" for breakfast and dinner. This is a valuable and enjoyable benefit.  My main criticism pertains to room cleanliness. The sheets were soiled and had holes in them. I included representative samples in my pictures. The headboard to the bed was also torn/stained.  I found these oversights to be perplexing - I really don't see what is so hard about giving your guests clean sheets.  I would consider staying here again but it is definitely not my first choice.  Marriott really needs to establish some baseline cleanliness standards for this hotel.

title: Just as i  expected
text:
I arrived in New York on the 9th September (1st time) and it was just as i thought it would be loud and very busy traffic was a nightmare!!!.
Our  room faced onto times square and we had a little balcony  which was cute, i would imagine the room we had would be one of the best rooms to have if your in New York for NYE as you can see everything without actually being in the crowds.  Hotel was nice and clean didn't have breakfast tho as there are tons of places to eat and lots of cosy Irish bars  very close

title: Old and dated - better options available
text:
The Renaissance is conveniently located in Times Square. The staff is friendly and the reception area and lobby is nice. The hotel is very old though. The elevators are clunky and malfunctioned when we stayed there. The room is old, although well equipped. Even my door was creaking like in my grandma's house.

I would much rather stay at the Marriott Marques again. The price is about the same and the hotel is much newer. Same location. 

Sorry but I would not stay again, for such a high rate per night.

title: A Week In New York
text:
Hi stayed here recently, couldn't fault the service from all the staff, we had a room on the 20th floor so not too much noise from Times Square.  The view from the R Lounge is fantastic overlooking Times Square, only downside is it gets booked for private parties, closed for 2 out of the 7 nights we were there, room was clean maybe could do with a bit of refurbishment as starting to look a bit dated but overall great location and hotel.
A bit busy a couple of mornings at breakfast.

title: Great Location but rooms are not worth the price
text: The Hotel is in a great location and very good for visiting all of Manhattan easily. The rooms are a little dated and light in amenities given the price being charged. Ask for a high floor room to avoid the noise and check that the blockout on the window actually blocks out the light.

title: Loud and overpriced
text:
Old worn down hotel in prime location. Spacious rooms with direct view on the broadway billboards (that can be hidden by light proof curtains). Poor isolation, street noise all day and night. Old furniture, typical ugly but functional business hotel bathroom. 
No green policy - towels are being exchanged though I hung them back on the hook.

title: Such a fun and convenient hotel!
text: We love the Renaissance hotels that we have stayed at before and definitely have high expectations. This one does not disappoint! Especially having breakfast overlooking Times Square! The room was cool, comfortable, and fashionable. The staff was helpful and friendly. If you are going to Broadway shows it could not be more convenient!

title: Great location & Friendly Staff
text: The location was perfect "The Heart of Time Square",  despite everything that's going on late at night when in the room you don't hear anything and rooms are very cleaned.  We were on the 16th fl. and the view was gorgeous. Beware that parking is $65.00 per day,  rather pay that amount than having my car ticket or towed and it would cost more.

title: Many great features
text: For our stay the location was great. It is in the heart of Times Square but the rooms are surprisingly quiet. The room size was generous for a New York room. Recently updated which was nice. Our room had a terrace which was nice to look down on the Square but it wasn't anything like the hotel website photos. Ours was much smaller and was not furnished like represented in the photos. If that's important to you call ahead and reserve a large terrace. The hotel staff was very friendly and the lounge on level 3 was fabulous. NOTE: There is not any room service so having to leave in the morning for breakfast was kind of a bummer. Plan ahead. Coffee maker was in the room. Walls in between the rooms were thin. Check out the library area on the lobby level.

title: Great location
text:
Great hotel and location, although it is located in the heart of the time square, when you are in the room you do not hear anything. 
The rooms are good with feather pillows, fridge and safe lock. The hotel location is great, close to many places and with subway station on the same block. 
The only down point was the members lounge that was close several times due to private events.

title: What's Going' on Here?
text: It's not like a regular Renaissance Hotel.  No Concierge Lounge; garish public spaces.  It's half a block off the north end of Times Square, so great for theater.  I t think the staff is a bit more focused on keeping the hordes of passing tourists out than helping guests, but they need to be.  The rooms are smaller than in a regular Renaissance but otherwise similar.  The decorator who chose the carpets and did the lobby lounge should be taken out behind the barn and .... .

title: Perfect location, spacious and quiet room ( for NYC)
text: Have been visiting NYC for 35 years at all different times of year. This hotel was one of the nicest hotels, with the best location for the West side/ theater district.  The room was quiet and very large for a standard room in NYC.  And I agree the view from the bar of Times Square is amazing.   Will be back!

title: Drinks at the bar
text: Still the best kept secret of Times Square. Drinks and snacks at the bar of the renaissance with perfect Times Square views. Go at a quieter time like mid afternoon. Decent cocktails and snacks, beer, wine, etc. reasonable prices.

title: In the heart of Times Square
text:
This hotel is right in the heart of Times Square and is one block from Radio City Music Hall.  Close to restaurants and shopping.  The M&Ms and Hershey stores are steps away.  Close to Broadway shows.  It's about 15 blocks to/from Penn Station/Madison Square Garden.  

Hotel was quiet considering it's location.  I couldn't hear any of the city sounds.  It's unique design made it different than any other Renaissance I've stayed in.  You enter the Lobby from the street level but take an elevator up to the R Lounge to get to the elevators that take you to the rooms.  Can be a little confusing at first.
