The lounge was very modern and had a nice view of Times Square.  You could sit outside and enjoy the sights and sounds (and lights) of the city.  There's a concierge service on this level also.

It's clean and well maintained.  Bed was comfortable.  Bathroom was modern with large sink and shower.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  There's security at this hotel and you must show your room key to enter in the evening.  I was pleasantly surprised at this hotel.  Most NYC rooms are small and don't provide very good views.  I would return here again and I recommend it.

title: Outstanding location with exceptional staff
text:
We spent an amazing 4 nights at this hotel.  The location right at Times Square is as good as it gets in NYC.  The clean updated room was a good size and very comfortable.   And what makes a great hotel stay ?  The people of course. From the moment we arrived  until we departed we were constantly impressed by the courteous front desk staff housekeeping security concierge doorman and restaurant staff. This was an anniversary celebration and Sylvia at the R Lounge made our trip very special. 
We will be returning to New York and look forward to another great stay at The Renaissance Times Square.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: This is a "medium size" quiet hotel right on Times Square. By medium I mean it is not a large convention hotel. There is a calmness and quiet inside. Kind of a modern feel inside. Rooms are good size for New York and well kept. While there is a lot of noise outside, it is muffled enough by the soundproofing that it has never interfered with my sleep and I am a light sleeper. Have stayed here many times over the years for business and pleasure.

title: Perfect spot for a Broadway weekend
text: We have stayed here a dozen times over the past 8 years. With or without my teenage kids, this is an optimal hotel for a weekend involving a Broadway production. The location can't be beat... walk to any theatre. The other awesome element of this hotel is the bar/breakfast room with 270 degree views of Times Square. You literally feel like you are on the bridge of a ship in this room. Rooms are good size, standard Marriott fare, though fridge in room is an appreciated touch. Of course the rooms are consistently spotless. Concierge is always helpful.

title: Best hotel right in the heart of town!
text: It's a very lovely and beautiful place set in the heart of town, right next to times square...with the most hospitable, courteous and professional staff. I loved that you could  take a walk to just about everywhere! Lots of stores around too.

title: Fantastic location
text: Fantastic location. Easily accessible from subway. While not on a direct line from air train it is an easy walk to the station. Breakfast was so-so but more than made up for by the view of Times Square.

title: Great Location
text: Right at Times Square you are walking distance to all the mid town sightseeing locations. The hotel is a little dated but the rooms are clean and very comfy. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We took Lyft from Laguardia airport and saved a lot of time not enduring the taxi line and it cost around $40.

title: Love the location, not the room
text: We love to stay in the Times Square area and decided to stay here based upon description as a boutique hotel which I do not feel is an appropriate description.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Website stated the lounge and lobby areas were newly renovated, but staff told us this was a few years ago.  If rooms had been renovated, we did not receive one and we are gold level with Marriott Rewards.  Bathroom was the best part of room.  This hotel also does not have a club level so breakfast was offered to us free of charge in R Lounge, but as we discovered only for Friday, not Saturday or Sunday - this was not told to us upon check in, in fact told breakfast in R Lounge with no qualification.  Funny, room costs were higher Friday and Saturday night.  Price was ok, but we have had much better value in this area over the years (this was our 18th trip to the US Open).  Love the Chicago Renaissance newly renovated property on State & Wacker, this one not so much.

title: Small but nice
text: Came for the Jay- Z concert and was surprised at how nice it was. For the price we paid it seemed we were hidden from the bad smells and hustle and bustle of times sq. With  a great view of times sq. from the lounges and so fourth. Rooms were not amazing and space is just not a thing in New York, but it's worth the price.

title: Been totally ripped off with a bill for £77.50 for 2 Gin & Tonics.
text:
Customers be aware. Have private messaged hotel 2 days ago - no response so thought would try this. 

I am sending this privately in the hope that this will be resolved. We have just returned to the UK after staying at your hotel on 29th August. As a Marriott reward member, we booked 2 rooms with our points. On check out, we had a bill for each of the rooms. Both had $2.22 & $1.47 for NYC Tax, which I was aware that we would be charged - no problem. We had purchased some drinks at the bar, our bill showed this and a $25 charge but also credited. The other room for our son, we did not charge anything to the room and this also had a $25 charge but no credit. On query, I was informed that if we had charged anything to the room this would have been credited. I was not informed on check on and was not happy being charged for something without prior knowledge. I was then told this would be credited back to our account. It now appears that not only have I been charged both of these bills, I have been charged again. I have a bill for £77.50? I would like to be reimbursed for this overcharge. Happy to pay for drinks and NYC Tax. Please confirm that this will get immediate attention. Rooms, 1807 & 1816. Regards

title: Location location location!
text: Fantastic location for Times Square, the Theatre District, MOMA, the Rockefeller Centre, etc. Tourist buses stop just outside. The staff were helpful hailing cabs, etc, and the concierge seemed very knowledgeable. The rooms had everything we needed and were surprisingly quiet. My only gripe would be the cost of breakfast, but then it comes with a view of Times Square, so what do I expect?

title: One Night Stay
text:
We only had one night to stay and were treated outstanding like we were going to be there a month We had an outstanding room with good view
We had spent 5 days here in December so new about the great bar over looking Times Square When we went in we were recognized as having been there in December and made us feel at home 
Great staff and outstanding location

title: Ausgezeichnet!
text:
Ausgezeichnete Lage! Mitten im Herzen von New York City. Vieles ist von diesem Hotel zu Fuss gut erreichbar!
Freundliches Personal, moderne Zimmer und nochmals: Perfekte Lage!
Die Zimmer sind super isoliert, sodass man vom Lärm am Time Square absolut gar nichts mitbekommt!

title: Enjoyable Second Visit
text: The hotel is located in the heart of Times Square, which was the main reason for choosing to go back to this hotel, for a second time. The location makes everything easily accessible, with everything you need right on your doorstep, especially the Gray's Line Bus Tours. The hotel is clean, and the staff are always friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned daily and to a high standard. There are little added extras which are a nice touch, such as the $25 discount each night in the hotel's restaurant, and the credit at the ChillBox located next door, along with the free Wi-Fi which is a good speed. Overall, another lovely stay. If I return to New York for a third time, I will certainly be coming back to this hotel again.

title: Location Perfect
text: Perfectly located right in Times Square where you walk out the door and your in the middle of New York hustle and bustle. The staff here are friendly helpful and professional we found the room to be very clean a decent size and the bed was comfortable. The view was outstanding

title: We will be back!!
text:
When looking for a hotel to stay during my visit to Manhattan, I had some criteria.  I wanted to be located close to the theatres (because I was planning on seeing as many shows as possible), I wanted comfortable beds, and I wanted to collect rewards points. After searching, I settled on Renaissance Times Square because of the proximity to the theatres and because I have some brand loyalty.
After I booked I read some trip advisor reviews. I was mildly concerned, but stuck with my choice because I had a gut feeling things would be okay!
Well, was I RIGHT!
Our flight arrived early (8:30 am), After a very friendly cab ride in, we arrived at the hotel shortly after 9:30 am.  We entered the hotel hoping to stow our luggage safely while we explored the city. How happy were we to be informed there was a room available for us!!??
We checked in, dropped off our luggage in a room that had two queen beds, a great view, a mini-fridge, and coffee maker. We headed off to explore and immerse ourselves in all that is NYC.
Our entire stay at this hotel was incredible.  The beds were REALLY comfortable.  The rooms very quiet.  The staff was warm, welcoming, and incredibly friendly. Everyone made us feel like we were family.
I loved the lobby level and the view from the R Lounge. I used the fitness centre. Although it was small, I was able to kick my own a-- with the equipment available. I shared many laughs with the front desk staff. I high fived the bell hop when he told me he was a Blue Jays fan.
This was my first real visit to NYC and it certainly won't be my last. My go to hotel will be the Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel for many reasons. But, the biggest reason will be how the incredible staff made me feel like family!

title: Abusive bar tender
text:
Bar tender verbally abusive and he threw the tip I left him at me, hitting me. 
 After speaking with management I was told that they are retraining him. This stay was a 50th Birthday gift from friends I hadn't seen in 30 years, I will never forget it. I'm absolutely appalled!

title: Gorgeous property, ill mannered staff.
text: Not sure if this is a "NY thing" or not, honestly don't care, but I've worked at hotels and would have never treated a guest the way I was treated at check in by the front desk agent. My bf and I were excited to get into the room because the property looked beautiful. There was a minor issue in regards to the reservation at front desk (which wasn't really an issue nor our fault but that doesn't matter) we were pretty much scolded for doing something the "wrong way" and she kept making unnecessary, sarcastic, and condescending remarks, it's truly not professional and really bummed out me and my bf for a while. I even called the front desk to speak to a manager and he basically "shrugged" and made me feel like an inconvenience. I would say it was just the front desk problem but my bf had the same to say of the valet staff. Expected a little better treatment for the price I paid.

title: Times Square excellence
text:
There are a lot of very average hotels in manhatten. This isn't one of them. 
The renaissance is in my opinion the dominant hotel in Times Square. It's in prime position. 
The cocktail lounge looks over every thing. That alone is worth 5 stars
Great staff. Big beds. In fact everything

title: Needs updating--badly
text: We used Marriott points for this hotel, and glad we did.  It's tired and needs updating.  The elevator from the entrance to the lobby is slow and dimly lit, and the music is LOUD.  Luckily there are only 2 buttons because you can't see them.  The rooms may have been updated, but not in the last 5 years.  Why they didn't put USB ports in places is beyond me.  And if you want to use the blow dryer outside the bathroom, you need to move the table so you can plug it into the wall, not the power station on the table,  It will blow the reset on the dryer.  The location is perfect.  Subway lines around the corner and within a block or two.  Theatre district is right there too, which is always a plus for me.  Some complained about the TV having lines, didn't encounter that in my room. The A/C certainly worked well, not a problem there.  Staff was always ready to help with any questions and restaurant recommendations.  Especially since our flight was early and needed a place to eat before leaving.  Their restaurant didn't open early on Sunday.  The deli 2 blocks away was great.   All in all I was glad I didn't actually pay for the room as it was paid for with points.

title: Vista inigualável !!!!
text:
Hotel situado no coração da Times Square; na esquina estação do metrô e o restaurante Olive Garden. Do outro lado, loja da M&M, loja da Hersheys. 
Entrando no hotel nos deparamos com a recepção, espaço pequeno, organizado, decorado. Neste espaço é necessário pegar um elevador, muito rápido por sinal, para chegar ao lounge do hotel.
O lounge chama a atenção pela decoração , pelo cheiro delicioso e pelo bar,  que possui a melhor vista da Times de toda Nova York. Vista inigualável !!! Bar nota 10, com atendimento nota 1000.
Para chegar ao quarto é necessário pegar outro elevador no lounge.
Quarto de tamanho bom, cama gostosa, banheiro muito bom, mas no esquema nova-iorquino de chuveiro em cima da banheira. Limpeza boa.
Como minha diária não incluía café da manhã , não sei dizer sobre.
Muito conforto, em um ambiente exclusivo.
Com certeza voltaremos.

title: Excellent hotel, but not entirely during our visit.
text:
We spent four nights at the Renaissance TS; August 9-12, 2017.  The room was comfortable and clean, however due to some unexplained issue, they shut the water off completely on Friday night from 11:30 to 6 a.m.and shut the hot water off on Saturday night from 11:00 to 5 a.m. Considering that Friday and Saturday are nights when people normally stay out late, this was an inconvenience, since it would have been nice to take a shower after a long day out and about.  It would have been nice if we had received at least an in room movie for free to make up for the trouble. We were also woken up very early in the morning by an alarm advisory from something happening on one of the floors, which I actually thought was great. It's good to know they have a way of letting you know when there is a problem. 
     They do have mini refrigerators, Evian water bottles ($8.00 each), and the view onto 7th Avenue is great.  The location is close to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, MoMa, Bryant Park, Penn Station, Macy's, Central Park, 5th Avenue, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and a lot more.  
     I highly recommend the hotel even with its water issues, as I am sure this was an isolated event during our stay. We were treated very well and would gladly return. One thing...when entering, you will enter a small lobby and then will need to take an elevator to the main lobby where the R Lounge is located.  The elevators that take you to your floor are across the first set of elevators.  
     Taxi's were waiting at curbside, and boarding passes were easy to print in the main lobby, and free as well. There was no street noise that could be heard from the 8th floor.
     Regarding our stay,  I will give Renaissance TS a rating of very good and not excellent simply because of the water issues we encountered. Overall, it is an excellent hotel and highly recommended.

title: Great location and the Rlounge is a must!
text: The location is in the heart of Times Square which is awesome.  We usually stay at the Marquis but the rates were better here this time and we wanted to try something different.  I am so glad we did if for no other reason, the Rlounge.  The view from the lounge is unreal!  We had apps every evening (3) before our shows.  The food was delicious and the drinks were great.  We had beer and wine and they have a very good selection of each.  Because they do not have a concierge lounge, we were given vouchers for 2 small bites for every night we were there.  We tried all of them and they were all great!  There is a small market for water and any snacks or incidentals you may need "across" the street.  Literally a 3 minute walk.  2 Starbucks close by (the one at the Marquis is very crowded so I would do the other one.  The only thing that was disappointing was the the room had a lousy view (and it was an upgrade) and was dated.  We are usually on the move most of the time so not a big issue but worth mentioning.  We loved the "slower" pace compared to the Marquis.  Mush more relaxing vibe here.  2 elevators not the maze at the Marquis.   Overall, we would definitely stay again and we will be returning to the Rlounge FOR SURE!

title: Location is Key
text: The hotel was decent. If you don't plan on staying in the room then this is a great place to stay. Mr and my family felt secured and the staff was okay. The cleaning lady was fabulous. She had towels and our room cleaned everyday, LOVED THAT!!!! We had a room with Broadway view which was great. Hotel is very clean and right in the middle of everything. Overall me and my family enjoyed our stay

title: Top !!!!!!!
text: A melhor localização de New york, literalmente você está dentro da time square, vale muito a pena o investimento, o hotel é super limpo, os quartos são amplos, ficamos em um com vista para time square, sensacional a vista a decoração do lobo e dos quartos são tops !!!!!!!

title: Too much wrong....
text:
First, kudos to The Renaissance for properly lighting the room! You CAN read in bed, see your work at the desk, apply makeup in the bath. And the elevated change/glasses etc trays by the bed are ingenious. The desk staff was friendly and courteous.

But. The lobby/ lounge music is unpleasantly loud and edgy. And during our one night stay, too much went wrong: there were a few late hours when there was no running water at all in the room. (We drank the $8 bottles of Evian.) There was a "wake-up" alarm broadcast in the morning (false alarm). The shower was warm, but not hot. And the bill included a double charge for our visit to the lounge.

title: Best view of Times Square
text: I got this hotel through a discount webpage at an incredible price. The hotel is obviously very good. Comfortable rooms and well located for people who loves to stay in Times Square, you are literally over the signs. The best by far is the view that you have from the restaurant of the hotel, it is unreal. The worst is the fact that you only get internet on the lobby and the absolutely long time that you have to wait for the elevators, never seen anything like this before. Anyways, we did have a great time in here.

title: Convenient, clean and good service
text:
Stayed one night at this property.  Check in downstairs off Times Square in relatively small area. The lobby level with restaurant, concierge and separate elevators to rooms were upstairs.  Concierge was friendly and helpful to give us directions and suggestions for taking the metro to get to our sites.

I asked for a quiet room and got the 11th floor. Thank goodness for the thick curtains, as the neon lights are 24 by 7 in Times Square.

Remember your Marriott loyalty number, or register for it to get free wifi for your room!

Room was clean and updated.  Nice uneventful stay.  
We stored out luggage without any problem for the day until 6 p.m.
Would stay here again.

title: Perfect Location
text:
It is a beautiful hotel overlooking Times Square. 
They have a very good continental breakfast that you can sit or just grab and go. It is busy and a bit loud but, it is New York. Will def. be staying here for future trips.

title: Fantastic central location, good room, ok service
text:
We stayed at this hotel on a luxury escapes voucher and were very happy. Big comfy king size bed; tidy 4* room including coffee machine! Breakfast buffet was busy, with one lady just waving people in. Service overall is average; concierge (navigator) service was very helpful. When asked about Internet, the hotel said they would provide it for free - great result, as this is usually standard in hotels of this calibre.  New York colouring in books (free) in the foyer were a nice touch! Strange that all the coffee cups are paper-at breakfast, and in your room. Better if they use real coffee cups, and offer paper for takeaway!

I bought one-day hop on hop off bus tickets via Groupon.com for Citysights New York at US$34 (US$59 from the street sellers outside). We bought tickets to Book of Mormon at the theatre - no online handling fee, and better choice of seating. Subway ticket is US$30 for 7 days. So much to see and do in the city that never sleeps!

title: Brian at Front Desk made our stay great from the get-go
text: Our connecting flight out of JFK was cancelled/rebooked 1 day later due to weather.  We flew all night from Maui and were exhausted, "stranded" in NYC. Brian at the front desk was friendly and professional (First Class service), and saved the day and was able to work magic: got us into a room early, offered breakfast and Lounge appetizers at happy hour.Breakfast was great with a terrific view of Times Square. Marriott Elite status was recognized. High floor room was quiet (some noise could be heard from people in the hall) and location for half-price theatre tix at TKTS booth right out the front door could not have been more convenient.

title: Central location, clean and comfortable but noisy
text: This is a very nice hotel with excellent customer service. We were lucky to stay on the 25th floor but were still disturbed by street noise (mostly sirens) in the night. Hallway noise is also very loud. We have stayed in a number of NYC hotels and not noticed any street noise so I assume this has something to do with the windows.  Otherwise the hotel was terrific with a convenient to theatre and time square location, good breakfast and excellent front desk service. The rooms are a good size for NYC and well cleaned.

title: Be prepared to be RIGHT in the craziness of NYC
text:
Great hotel with large and clean rooms although a little tired.

Front door is literally on Times Sq so be prepared to be faced with massive crowds every time you step outside.

Gym is excellent!  

Breakfast was included and was very limited but the view made up for it....it overlooks Times Square.  Great photo op.

title: New York Midtown
text:
Stopped at the Renaissance for 6 days. Room was excellent, large for a midtown hotel. Staff very friendly, all areas clean at all times. Great location for exploring Manhattan, Subway outside of the front door. We booked the room package via Luxury Escapes in Australia for 7 nights, but even though we checked out early it was still great value. Breakfasts had a great choice and overlooked Times Square. Evening dining, unfortunately was pretty poor, only counter type meals available, however with the huge amount of restaurants in the area I can understand why the dining options are limited. Sign up for the Marriott rewards (no cost) at check in and get free wifi for your duration.

I would definitely use this hotel again for future stays if the price remains competitive.

title: Timely Perfect Location in the Busy Streets of the Timesquare!
text: This hotel is located right in the busy streets of Timesquare! This hotel is very good for the first time NYC travelers. There is a lounge overlooking the Timesquare. My husband and I booked this hotel for a weekend trip and we totally loved it!

title: ESPECTACULAR
text:
El lobby de este hotel no está en la planta baja. Ascensor, segunda planta y recepción.
tiene todas las comodidades de un cinco estrellas que no vale detallar. en cambio su restaurante con vista plena a times square vale la estadía. es pec ta cu lar. y sirven una bandeja con dos docenas de ostras frescas del maine que ¡¡¡bueno bueno!!!. el bar encantador con pianista y música suave muy acogedor. una ubicación perfecta. atrévase este hotel lo vale

title: Great Location & Helpful Staff
text: We booked a quiet room which was advertised as 24th floor or higher, but we ended up with a room with a king on the 22nd, great view, very quiet and quite roomy by New York Standards. This place is close to everything, so it is a great location for doing the tourist thing. Funny entrance as the main lobby and bar is actually on the second floor, so the street entrance is not large, which works for them as they take security seriously. Staff were great, especially when we ordered a taxi to the cruise terminal in advance, they got us on the service elevator and straight to the front door.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Stayed in a Terrace Room, expect to pay a premium, over looking Times Square, The room is very small (Think cruise ship small) with no closet. The pictures on their website, as on most websites, are misleading the terrace is tiny. The location is Excellent and the staff are knowledgeable and friendly. Recommend for 1st time in NYC, but no Luxury Rating as this is not a luxury hotel.

title: Perfect Location!
text:
Nothing fancier than what you would expect from a normal Renaissance Hotel, standard, but really nice

Location
Perfect, on Times Square. From the lobby dining room window, you can look right into the TKTS discount ticket booth. The line is usually super long during the day. You can monitor the line through the window. I went downstairs one evening aroubd 7:10PM when there was only ONE person standing in line, bought tickets for 8pm show, had plenty of time to walk over to theatre

Nice places to visit
1. The Amazon boookstore at Columbus Circle
Very nice walk, especially during the weekend. The Broadway Street Market extends from 47th all the way to ~57th, 1-2 blocks before the mall. It's not a huge bookstore, but they only have the bestsellers on display. Great place to visit if you have an open reading list to fill with GREAT books

title: If you want to be in Times Square - You are there!!
text: I can't say enough about the location.  This hotel is right in the middle.  I enjoyed the view from the hotel restaurant every morning while we ate a buffet breakfast that was so filling and with so many choices.  We went for the quick Mother's Day weekend and it was so much fun.  It was a great family weekend and the hotel was accommodating.

title: Hotel sympa , Bien situé
text:
L'hôtel Renaissance est un peu vieillot mais sympa de part son emplacement en plein Time square, coin animé H24 ! 
Personnel assez sympa et très professionnel. 
Le Petit déjeuner est basique mais pas mal.

title: Nice Hotel
text: We stayed here July 17 through July 21, 2017. The hotel overall is very good, excellent location, staff nice and friendly and try to go the extra mile, and the rooms are decent sized. Usually with New York hotels you are in a crackerjack box but these rooms average 300 square feet so you don't feel like you're trapped in a small room. And once again the service is awesome. I know the rooms were renovated within the last few years but they are looking a little worn, they could do with a little sprucing up. But as far as size, service, cleanliness, and location this hotel gets a solid rating.

title: $20 for Internet
text:
Fantastic location for this modern Times Square overlooking hotel 
Views from The 1st floor lobby were amazing.
The breakfast was excellent serving Starbucks coffee included in the breakfast buffet 
Elevators are very busy 
The rooms were well equipped with a bed , a TV , running water and a toilet ... however it all stops there when it comes to everything you expect in a modern 2017 hotel room .... Internet Access is only available at $19.95 for decent speed access. $20 not $5 not $10 but $20 .... This hotel needs to rethink this 
This is 2017

title: Not bad
text:
I certainly liked the hotel it was i nice place people are nice there but the housekeeping was kind of rude we asked her if she can come back after an hour and she said okay quickly I need to leave so that was the bad thing good view of time square m and m world is next to you .you 
got  allot of stuff next I recommend going there

title: Go-To Midtown Hotel
text:
Stayed here three weeks in June, and 60+ other weeks the past few years, but never written a review.  This has been my go-to hotel in New York for a while. I know, it’s located in the very heart of Times Square.  But it’s like an old shoe for me, I’m comfortable here, the service is great, and the employees all know me.  And hey, it’s hard to match the view.  

Check-in is always fast and easy and they usually have a room for me even when I arrive at 9am on a Monday morning.  

The rooms are nice and spacious with adequate room to move around, place your luggage and use the desk.  Carpet and furniture are relatively new and in good shape. Have large TV’s.  Bathrooms are smaller but they do have a tiled/glass door walk in shower (if you read my reviews, this is makes a hotel golden to me).  Of note, the last time I had a double room, the showers were tub showers… Warning to folks who might have multiple people in the room, the bathroom doors are barn doors and don’t lock.  I have never gotten a suite at this hotel in my 8+ years staying there until I asked on week 2 of my trip.  Sure enough, week 3 they put me in a small suite. It was a normal king room with a little bit more space and in the corner of the building.  Really, the only difference was the extra room in the corner.  

The hotel does not have a concierge lounge for elites, but they provide you with a certificate for anything up to $15 on the food menu at the bar each night, and have a wonderful breakfast buffet for us in the mornings.  Breakfast location has maybe the best view in Times Square.  I might add, the flatbread pizza and the grilled cheese with tomato soup are very good on the bar menu.  The grilled cheese is a huge panini with bacon and very good cheese, I skip the soup.  The three guys that are always at the bar in the evenings are wonderful.  Always smiling and providing great service.  They know my order before I make it to their bar every night.  They also give out a free cocktail each night at 5pm sharp.  They mix a large bowl of a specialty drink and pour it until it’s dry.  If you aren’t there by 5:10pm you’ll miss it.  

Overall, solid hotel.  Great service, Times Square location, nice rooms, and good benefits for elite members.

title: In the Heart of NYC!
text:
Right in the middle of Times Square, the location was amazing, view whilst having breakfast, did not get tired of it even after a week. Hotel staff super friendly and helpful, everything is walking distance. Security good. Easy to jump on the Subway or grab an Uber out of the city, or hail a cab whenever.
Facilities great, room spacious and clean. Definitely would recommend and would stay again!

title: Decent for NYC, nothing special
text: We chose this hotel because it was close to our event we were attending. We stayed on a Thursday night. Our room had 2 double beds and was a nice size for NYC. I enjoyed the large vanity in the bathroom, perfect for 2 girls getting ready at the same time. The tub was a nice size too although it didn't drain well and I found myself standing in ankle deep water while showering.  I was on the 6th floor, right outside the elevator.  The street was loud but I drowned out the sound by turning on fan.  We arrived around 7 pm and wanted something quick to eat. We ended up at the hotel lounge that overlooks Times Square. They only have a few food options. We ordered the chicken breast and grilled cheese and both were very good.  I would stay here again if I could get a cheap price, but in my opinion it is not with spending >$300/night.

title: I'm not even there yet and they take such great care of us!
text: I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel! If I could give rating of 10 instead of 5!!! We have stayed here before and have an upcoming stay! They are kind and polite and so so helpful! Please don't change we love you!!! Many thanks! Kudos for great people who love their jobs!

title: Great stay @ Times Square
text: Hotel is very conveniently located less than a block away from Times Square. Rooms were very neat and bigger than what you expect for the area. You can enjoy free breakfast with your Marriott gold member with amazing view of the Times Square. If not then it's going to cost you $30/adult. The second floor bar area is pretty swanky and have good selection of drinks. There are no in-house restaurants in the hotel but there are tons of restaurants close by to choose from. Overall extremely happy with the stay and highly recommend the place.

title: Time square
text:
This hotel is amazing, right in the middle of Time square. The room was clean and spacious with a great view of the sidewalks of all the people on Time Square! The staff was friendly and very helpful on directions on navigate around the city for tourist sites. They offer a breakfast and the view was awesome! 
It located next door to the M&M store and Hershey's! It a block from ABC Studios and most of broadway theaters.

title: I loved the place!!!
text: The location is perfect. Light dinner at the hotel bar/restaurant is a must: gorgeous view of Times Square and good ambiance. the rooms are nice and comfortable; staff is very friendly and helpful. All you need in New York!

title: Super Central
text: You can't beat the location if you want to be front and centre of all the action and hustle of Times Square! Felt totally safe staying there with security at the door. Visitors enter from the street front to then take an lift to the lobby. From there three lifts take you up to the floors above. We are staying on the 14th floor and have experience light traffic noise. Nothing serious enough to effect sleep. Rooms quite spacious and clean, though a little outdated. Bed and pillows super comfortable!!

title: Location Location Location
text:
The best possible location for and Hotel in Manhatten. few seconds walk from all Subway stations, very safe feeling as the entrance to the Hotel is well guarded.
the Lobby concept is great with very good WIFI and view to Times Square.
Great Computing Center and the best ever guidance services wiating to help you in any need, turistic or any other.
DQINA was the one that helpd us most, but al the pthe team memebers are just great. 2 experst at any point in time from very early in the morning to late in the evening.

title: Great Hotel!!
text: We stayed at this hotel right in the heart of Times Square and loved everything about it! Friendly staff, loved the views from the upstairs lobby and being on an upper floor(#25) made it super quiet for sleeping! Very convenient to everything. Would definitely stay here again!!!

title: Great location and very nice rooms!
text: This location is perfect if you want to be right in the "thick of" Times Square.  But once you enter thru the doors, you forget about all the hustle and bustle going on.  It's a very nice hotel, nice bar and lounge area with a great view,  and good food. Rooms were perfect -not a thing wrong on our trip. And the staff is extremely nice. The lady who cleaned our room - Maria - was the sweetest and she made sure every time we saw her she was asking if we needed anything.  Super service, Ms. Maria!! I visited the fitness center as well and it was spacious, excellent equipment, free weights, and a few machines. Definitely good quality, very clean,  and nice size for a hotel workout.  When I come back to NYC, this hotel will be top of my list to stay at again.

title: Best location
text: Perfect location for going to the theater and of course being right in the middle of Times Square. We arrived early and were not  able to check in yet so they have a bellman stand who can check your bags until your room is ready. The room is large and so is the shower. Very clean and comfortable. Highly recommend eating a meal in the restaurant, food was really good but the view and the feeling of being right in the middle of everything is awesome. Staff was always friendly when we were coming and going. Also just an eight minute walk to Rockefeller Center.

title: Great Hotel, But Don't Drive Yourself There...
text: Wonderful hotel rooms, very modern and decorated very well. The bar and restaurant will not disappoint and I would recommend this for any corporate or couples visiting NYC as tourists. But note, valet parking is scary. You must find the hotel entrance, which is stressful in Times Square. Then there is very limited space to curb your car to unload and hand the keys to the valet. The pedestrians and taxi traffic makes you just want to arrive via taxi or Uber, leave your car at home. Great location to explore Times Square and offers you a premium hotel experience for sure.

title: Perfect location, Poor service
text:
The room was comfortable and spacious, breakfast view was fantastic,and the location was perfect.

However the cleaning service was poor. We had to tell them several times so that they would use the vacuum cleaner. We had the stain on the bathroom floor that was made on the first day last till our last day. Also the staff were not that friendly. They confused us with the breakfast fee as it was different each time we went, and they would just say "It wasn't me" and would not explain why we were charged more last time. The staff are not smiling and would not clearly answer to simple questions. It seemed they were lacking staff members especially in the morning during breakfast time because sometimes I could not even find one person that was present.

title: Great location
text:
This hotel could not be more closer to the convenience of action in and around Times Square. Moreover, one is also in the heart of theater district. The location is also great for people watching. With all the neons ablaze it is daylight 24 hrs.
The circular tour buses also start/stop just outside the front door.
The hotel room itself was quiet comfortable and had all the necessary amenities. Minimal noise is heard provided one asks for a high room. The windows are double glazed but New York has a  high level of activity from emergency vehicles that can be heard throughout the day and night. Not too much of a distraction though.
Curious entry to hotel though. One checks in at street level and then required to transit one level, in a very slow elevator, to the actual lobby and then transfer to another elevator to rooms level.
This lobby is very dimly lit and therefore provides a very curious welcome.It really could do with some brightening up. Off this lobby is also located an exra- ordinary bar with dramatic views over central Times Square. It has a most spectacular light show at night from the surrounding advertising neons.  
The only real disappointment is that this hotel still charges for wi fi use. Yet, but not advertised, is the availablity of free wi fi if one sits in either the lobby or bar area. I accidently found it when noticing so many people using their devices in the lobby.
Recommend the hotel for both comfort and convenience.

title: In the Heart of it All
text: The rooms are nice sized and clean. I really appreciated the black out curtains. Only minimal street noise could be heard from the room. Attentive staff. Second floor lounge, bar, and business center. The lounge also overlooks Times Square. Easy walk to Broadway, Rockefeller Center, and many, many restaurants.

title: Best hideaway in Times Square
text:
What a funky hotel. Great staff , big rooms for NYC. This hotel is right in the heart of Times Square. The bar has an extraordinary view that serves great cocktails and fabulous food. If you book the hotel early enough you may even grab a good price.
Would go back in a heartbeat.

title: Beautiful hotel and great location
text: My second stay. I'm a Marriott platinum owner so I used my points. Breakfast and appetizers at 5:00 were a bonus. Nicer rooms than the Marquis.  Wonderful staff and personnel to aid with all your needs.

title: Too cool for comfort
text:
I stayed at the hotel many times for business in the past and found it to be a great option for business and pleasure.  It is a beautiful hotel very much in the middle of Times Square.  The restaurant and many of the rooms directly overlook Times Square.  The rooms are nicely appointed and have large showers.  They have a very helpful concierge desk. 

That said, the A/C could not be adjusted below 68 degrees and felt warm some nights.  Check-in is in the lower arrival lobby.  After that, you're on your own because there is no desk in the main lobby.  The elevator from the arrival lobby to the main lobby is painfully slow and there is no other alternative.  In all elevators, the lights are so low it is difficult to see the floor button and the music is beyond funky.  Feels like management is going over the top to demonstrate the hip factor.  These changes since my last visit a number of years ago were not positive for me.

title: Perfect location
text: Centrally located in Times Square. The breakfast view of Time Square is out of this world!  Definitely a great Marriott property I would stay at time and time again. Safe and close to subway. Top notch rooms and classy

title: Not up to Marriott Standards
text: This hotel was ok. I was really disappointed with the service...having stayed at multiple JW Marriotts I expected this hotel to be comparable but was disappointed. The best thing about this hotel is it's location.

title: Right in the heart of Times Square
text: We stayed at this hotel for five days recently.  The rooms are quite nice and the bed and pillows are extremely comfortable.  The entry into the hotel is quite small - that is where you check in, but you take an elevator up to the Lobby and then you take another elevator to the upper floors.  I don't THINK the hotel has a restaurant, which is a little unusual (of course there are dozens of restaurants in that area).  It does have a lounge, though.  We would definitely stay there again.  Staff very friendly.

title: SUPERBE !
text:
Nous avons séjourné 1 semaine dans cette hôtel, une chambre pour 2 couples. Tout est magnifique, la décoration, le matériel, et l'emplacement est parfait ! Pour réserver, le faire très en avance et les prix seront《raisonnables》pour New York. La literie est génial, surtout après avoir beaucoup marché en journée, la salle de bain comprend baignoire et WC (seul point faible), mais est très spacieuse. Vu sur times square possible. Le métro est à proximité.
Pour conclure, ne pas hésiter ! :)

title: Hotel just OK
text: Location and the staff are about the best things this hotel has to offer. Found the rooms very tired and worn. Our room was particularly dusty. I was expecting a little more luxury from a 4* hotel. I was very disappointed by our room however I must say the staff that work here were very friendly & helpful. Also fantastic location but I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
Located in the heart of time square, this hotel is a perfectly situated oasis in the middle of all of the hustle and bustle.  Take a right out of the hotel and walk 50 feet and you are A five line subway station.

The hotel itself is adequate. The rooms are a little more than basic but the hotel itself is immaculately maintained.  The breakfast and lounge area or situated right over the top of Time Square and offer wonderful views of all gaudy ridiculousness below.

From this location you are a 15 minute walk from Central Park or a 20 minute subway ride from downtown.

title: Great location on Times Square with generally efficient staff
text:
Arrival experience: checked in on a Sunday about 4:30 p.m. Check in is handled in a tiny lobby on the ground floor. Gentleman that assisted me was efficient and professional. Also the checkout clerk that assisted me was very nice. 

Room (general): Spacious room (room 1917) overlooking the Hershey’s store. Overall room was clean, except for certain stains on the bathroom wall (more details infra). Standard appliances in room such as TV, iron, mini refrigerator, mini coffee maker, etc. Furniture was generally clean and in good condition.

Bathroom: overall clean, modern bathroom. But one wall near the sink had very unsightly stains. See photos. One another note, the glass shower enclosure is very nice but is scratched in many places, perhaps from a bad squeegee. The hair dryer provided is a good Andis model. Ample counter space.

Bed: Excellent bed and pillows

Housekeeping: Above average. Carpet was lint free, bathroom was properly stocked.

Restaurants: I had an hors d'oeuvre at the bar my first night, specifically the pot pie. It was edible but not very good. I ate breakfast both mornings at the complimentary buffet for elite members. The sausage was stone cold the first morning. Fruit was excellent. See comments infra concerning offer of dirty ice. The cold sausage and staff offering me dirty ice are red flags concerning food safety. 

Grounds: Location is literally at the top of Time Square. So there are no grounds separate from the building. 

Gym and Pool: Did not have time to view or use either. 

Parking: Valet available, but who drives a car in NYC? I took Uber Penn Station. 

Overall staff attitude: generally good. The breakfast “monitor” that checks elite member names was a bit surly. I arrived a few minutes before opening, and she made is very clear that nothing, including coffee, was available until precisely 6:30 a.m. Once admitted at 6:30, I noticed that the refrigerator that should have contained water bottles was empty. I asked her about water, and she firmly told me the refrigerator had water. I pointed out it was empty, and she seemed a bit peevish about that. Also, I asked for a cup of ice, and a “helper” setting up items for breakfast pointed to the ice keeping the yogurt cold. I explained that I wanted clean ice, not ice in contact with the exterior of the yogurt containers. Basic hygiene/food safety should be a priority for any eating establishment. Never offer a customer dirty or potentially dirty food or water. I perceive that management needs to conduct some remedial training with its food service staff.

Misc: photos are of room 1917. 

Tip: Ask for a room facing Times Square for a great view. Street noise near Times Square can be loud. I could clearly hear crowd noise and road work (at night) in my room. So if you’re a light sleeper, ask for a room as high up as possible.

title: Great Hotel
text:
I live in New Jersey. Each year we try to spend the night in New York City to celebrate my wife's birthday.  We try yo go to  a matinee, and evening show.

This year we chose to stay at the Renaissance Times Square Hotel.  It was an excellent choice.  It is a modern hotel, with comfortable rooms.  Because of our MARRIOT level we were entitled to evening  hourderves, and a buffet breakfast,

This was an excellent choice.

title: Nice stay
text: Well presented hotel bit pricey for drinks and food but there is plenty of restaurants close buy to match most budgets. if your looking to be right in the mix this hotel is definitely one to consider as your close to all of the main attractions. A little more guidance from staff upon check in would of been nice as in what there is on in and around during the stay and also where to get tickets for shows or sports events all in all tho a nice hotel to stay in

title: Beautiful view
text: I stayed here for two night this past weekend and the hotel was beautiful. The bed and pillow  was comfortable . The bathroom was clean. The  front desk and cleaners were all nice.  If you want peace and quiet while u are sleeping this isn't the hotel for you. Only reason I gave this hotel 4 star and not 5 is because the street noise.  Other then that the view of time square is amazing from the R lounge. Definitely the best view in time square.

title: Best location
text: Literally in the center of Times Square!  Lounge area has the best view of all sides.  Clean hotel. Nice bar.  Friendly staff.  They allowed early check in at no charge.  Location location location!!!!!!!!

title: Love it
text: I love this hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are comfortable. Wifi is brilliant. Views are exceptional if you get a room with a view. Breakfast room overlooking the square is to die for. Always disappointed though as only pork option available at breakfast, satisfactory otherwise. Excellent location!

title: Good Times Square Hotel
text: Not cheap but I went on my brother's Marriott points. Comfortable room, attentive staff. The buffet breakfast (free weekdays to gold and platinum members) is served till 11, so if you eat late you can skip lunch. Others complain of the lack of a hotel restaurant, but there are plenty of good places nearby.

title: espetacular
text:
localizaçao maravilhosa no meio do fervo. chegamos as 10:00 da manha e ja disponibilizaram nosso quarto. metro na porta. restaurante  com vista para a famosa escada vermelha. frigobar vazio o que possibilita que compre suas próprias coisas.
sem reclamações

title: Some good some not so good
text: Upon entering Tammy at front desk helped us to check in early. Nice!! She was very pleasant and friendly. She deserves recognition. Rooms were clean and fresh. Bathroom very clean. Very nice housekeeping they deserve recognition. What we did not notice was the hall light and bathroom lights are on a motion detector. So, at 1am to go to the bathroom, lights come on!! Need a sign on how to turn off the motion detection please. Breakfast is a "buffet style" at $25 per person for the first two then $30 for the third person??? Beautiful view of Times Square, relaxing and clean. Eggs, bacon and other foods were warm at best, not hot. Coffee is good but there was no milk or cream. When we asked the two waiters then argued who was suppose to help...not good in front of customers. Hotel is a great location in the city and near many sites. Cost is well, it is NYC and Times Square...

title: Great Hotel!
text: Stayed here for 3 nights, the hotel is in the ❤️of Time Square. My husband ❤️Time Square so he took this hotel for the good recommendations and the location. I thought it was going to be noisy and messy because of the area since Time Square is always a busy place and has no hour for sleeping. But I was glad that it didn't turn out that way. Since you enter you feel welcome, there's plenty security in the place and hotel lobby is gorgeous and smells great!. My room was very nice and spacious, the king bed was very confortable but I really hated the pillows, they turn out flat. Has plenty room for clothes accommodation and had a nice bathroom. No noise was ever heard, the black out curtains were a success never saw a thing and I had the M & M screen at my window which is huge! Thanks for the good times!

title: Meh - Not worth the Price
text: Average Hotel, No Room service, Bed's are NOT comfortable, lacks a restaurant and the bar on the 2nd floor is mediocre at best.  For the money i would stay across the street at the Doubletree Hilton suites.

title: Great Extended Weekend Getaway!!!
text:
Stayed at the Marriott Renaissance Time Square and had a wonderful stay and thoroughly enjoyed my time there.

My girlfriend and I had three nights in Manhattan and since we would be in a hotel for three nights...we wanted some where that had an upscale, but cool subtle vibe and the Renaissance did not disappoint.

The check in staff was great....especially....(and forgive me......I can't remember her name) but the very nice woman who was expecting with child,.....she was so nice and helpful.

And before we even arrived....Sarah in reservations was great to work with.....hat's off to both of them.

Our room was clean and the bed extremely comfortable, and housekeeping did a great job each day when we were there. The only issue I had with the room is that the pillows were so soft they were on the verge of being 'flat'. 

Now granted I have neck/ cervical problems and I prefer a pillow that provides a bit more neck and head support. But perhaps the hotel could have housekeeping keep a few "firmer/ more supportive" pillows on hand for guest to request if needed.

Again I know this is a subjective critique....but even doubling up the pillows really didn't help give any support to ones head/neck/ shoulders.

On our last night we were supposed to go out in Manhattan for dinner with friends, but it rained most of the day and evening, so we met in the 'R Lounge' with them for drinks and appetizers. Our waitress was great and friendly, as well as the food service was perfect for our party of six.

So all in all my hat goes off to the staff at the Marriott Renaissance Times Square....it was great staying with you and being your guest!

title: Tax Preparation/Notary
text: The hotel is walking distance close to most of the plays on Broadway. Times Square is right there. You can get up in the morning and eat breakfast looking out and watching Good Morning America! Central located to shops, restaurants etc.

title: Times Sq
text: We enjoyed our stay while in town for a theater trip.  Convenient location, comfy room, and bar with an amazing view out to Times Square.  We were just a short walk from everything we did, and we enjoyed our stay.

title: Outstanding!!!
text: This is the first time we frequented this hotel under the Marriott umbrella but it will not be the last.  The staff...I cannot say enough nice things about them.  We had a great time, this hotel is conveniently located close to everything.  If you want to be in the mix this is definitely the place. From the first interaction to last interaction the staff was always helpful and friendly.  Our family really enjoyed our stay here.

title: A Good Stay
text: This location is perfect if you are going to a Broadway show. The rooms are a bit small. The furnishings were not elegant, but they were very comfortable. The staff were friendly, and the service was excellent. One of the better options in the area for sure.

title: Great location for theatre!
text:
Have stayed at this property at least 6 times over the last few years.  Location for theatre is unbeatable. The rooms are comfortable and quiet. Common spaces are nice but hallways need new carpet and rooms need update. 

I believe it has been 10 years since it's last major renovation (not including the terrace rooms or refitting of the bar/restaurant area) and the property's age is showing. Wooden furniture is dented, fabrics are fading, and  the bedside lighting fixtures are just bad.

One of the two elevators leading from the front desk lobby up to the main lobby was out of service during our entire stay.

The front desk attendants were polite but not overly friendly. I have been a Marriott Rewards member for quite some time and am usually acknowledged somehow to the fact, even if only to let me know how to access the complimentary wifi. That did not occur during this trip.

Have had wonderful housekeepers during our visits but one weekday morning during this visit we slept in late and could hear the housekeeper complaining to her coworker that "they are still in there" . 

Bar service is hit or miss in the lobby. Not enough help when busy, fine at other times.

There are now many more options in the theatre district to choose from when deciding where to sleep. The Renaissance needs to step up it's game if it wants to hold onto those of us who have been repeat customers.

title: Vista espectacular
text: Lounge at Two Times Square, una forma especial de pasar el cumpleaños con nuestra querida amiga; las mesas, la iluminación, la atención, los tragos y los piqueos TODO muy bueno; ninguna queja ningún reclamo, todo lo contrario. Gracias a mi prima que me recomendó disfrutamos de este lugar, y volveremos siempre!!!  Definitivamente recomendado!

title: Perfecta ubicacion
text: Este hotel se encuentra ubicado en pleno corazón de Times Square, las habitaciones son confortables y limpias. Aprovecho la ocasión para agradecer y felicitar a la concierge Fleridiana Sanchez, sus recomendaciones gastronómicas fueron muy acertadas para nuestro grupo familiar.

title: Just ok
text:
Not my favorite place to stay in NY.  I came to the Renaissance for business meetings, otherwise I would have stayed elsewhere.  We got the "best" room which was very dated.  A large CD player in the living room.  Furniture and everything is ok but old and tacky.  Very disappointed they have no room service.  Took 2 elevators down to the street and got coffee down the street.  
I'm a Platinum member, over 3 million points and I don't get a paper in the morning?  I see papers in front of some doors, not sure what you need to do to get this.  Not a problem though, I picked one up at the store down the street when I got my coffee.

title: Excellent hôtel
text:
Une super semaine passée au sein de cet hôtel. 
Une très belle vue, un emplacement rêvé en plein Time Square, a deux pas des métros. 
Rien a redire, l'insonorisation y est top. 
Le personnel est accueillant, professionnel et de bon conseil. 
La literie est confortable.

title: Good
text:
I am a Marriott Gold member and I would classify this property as good - not great.
The entrance and front desk is very unappealing - small, unattractive lobby at street level and you have to wait to take a small, cramped elevator to real lobby level.
Rooms in need of renovation, bed linens are very worn, didn't feel clean, but rooms were large. Restaurant for breakfast had tremendous view but seating was a bit uncomfortable and service was spotty at restaurant. Management provided extra touches due to being gold member. I wouldn't not go back.

title: Enjoyed a 5 day visit
text:
First off I am Platinum and used points for my 5 day stay (pay for 4, get the 5th free).  I had checked reviews/locations, and this seemed the best fit/value for our visit.
The entrance is small and easy to miss.  I am glad we were dropped off by arranged car.  Bellhop was available for luggage, but we brought it in ourselves.  Checkin was fairly quick.  I also received two packages I had ordered/delivered to the hotel.
Then up one elevator, and then switch in the lobby (3rd or 4th floor) to the other elevator to the room.  We had a King, and also added a cot (no fee).  Room had a fridge.  Nice large window for a view of the Hershey or M&M store (opposite direction of the main Times Square.
Slept well except for hearing some street noise (on the 14th floor) from cars.  
We received complimentary breakfast buffet on the main floor.  Views here were of the main square (essentially what we could not see from our room).  Was really nice to take pictures here with the background.
Breakfast buffet was very nice - One side had eggs/BACON/potatoes/pancakes and the other fruit, oatmeal, and breads.
We used Uber to get around and the local area was $10 to $20 a ride.  
Only drawback is it is in tourist central.  I would come back again.

One minor item to note.  As platinum wifi is free.  I signed up for the basic first, but it limited to 4 devices.  I had to call support to get "logged off" to switch to enhanced which allows 6 devices.  I think it was $16 and $19 for those per day.

title: Very nice
text:
Great views on Times Square, very nice room and a wonderful bar. Location is excellent especially if your going to the theatre.

Plenty to do right out the doors including a ton of shopping. You can walk almost anywhere from the hotel

title: Good Location
text: First time here - hotel staff was amazing!  Hotel was nice and room was very clean and comfortable.  None of the rooms have views of Times Square on the side streets.  They really don't have a restaurant on site - no room service.  They have a lounge that has an amazing view of Times Square - but you can only get a very small selection of food maybe 10-12 things.  No other things in the hotel (shops or the such)

title: Vacation spot
text:
We just finished a 5 day stay at this Renaissance. We had a mix of experiences but overall we recommend this hotel. Normally I travel alone for business. But this was a vacation family trip, we have 2 children age 9.  There were not a lot of kids at this hotel but it wasn't a problem that it's not a kid focused hotel. The concierge was very nice and helpful with suggestions for all things to do, places to eat, directions and even special discount passes.
Staying in Times Square is quite the experience. Lots of great people watching from our room windows.  Most of what you want in NYC is within 20 minutes of this hotel. So the location is fantastic. However, be ready for massive crowds on the streets as soon as you exit this hotel. The views from the dining areas are fabulous!  The food is ok, overpriced for sure. Service is ok.  At breakfast we were bummed that they ran out of Cheerios for 4 out of the 5 mornings.  Our room was fine, nothing special. The furniture was quite dirty. And the cleaning service didn't change sheets, only refreshed towels, waters and emptied garage cans. The bellmen and luggage porters were very nice and quick.  The front desk staff was typical NYC attitude. When we checked in the solo guy at the desk seemed annoyed that we were there, not a great start. When we called the front desk on Sunday to ask why we discuss have hot water, they said "not our fault" and offered no assistance. And yet, each time we entered and exited the hotel they greeted us with smiles. 
Lots of opportunities to improve service, food and room cleanliness at this hotel. But it's a Marriott in busy NYC so they will sell out regardless.  I recommend this hotel and would stay here again, just know what to expect.

title: Great location
text: Perfect location for a long weekend in NY.  Couldn't be in a better spot to buy theater tickets (next door to TKTS), see shows, and "people watch" in Times Square.  The hotel restaurant/bar has a perfect bird's eye view. Windows on three sides, looking directly down on Times Square and straight ahead to the New Year's Eve ball that drops. Unbelievable!  Don't listen to the complaints about taking elevator to lobby.  It makes the lobby quieter when it is not on the bustling street level.  Had a wonderful time!

title: Great Location, Great Views
text:
Picked this hotel because of its location to Time Square and was a few blocks from the location I was there to visit. Room was clean, bed was comfortable and the view of Time Square at breakfast was breath taking. Decor is modern and Chic. Elevator to lobby from street level is a bit unusual but convenient. 

Elevator is being updated so only one elevator in operation up to lobby. A bit of a wait at times. 

Staff very friendly and attentive. Would highly recommend.

title: Great location and pleasant stay
text: What a location this hotel has. Right on Times Square with everything in close proximity. The property is old and you feel a little gloomy when you take the lift to the lobby. However, spacious rooms, decent service and location makes it up. The breakfast was part of my package and it was pretty straightforward with the usual offerings. There are some issues with the Wi-Fi and connectivity is not even. Overall a decent stay.

title: Idéalement placé mais c'est tout
text:
Nous avons séjourné en famille dans cet hôtel pour découvrir New York; il est très bien placé au cœur de Times Square.
Par contre les lits sont très petits (on nous avait promis des lits long size.....) et la salle de bains vieillotte.
L'accueil est fort désagréable les petits déjeuners excessivement chers (25 $ par personne alors que le choix est très limité) et il surtout il ne faut rien demander aux serveurs qui sont exécrables (3 demandes pour avoir un chocolat chaud au bout de 15 /20 minutes) sauf à "Daniel" qui a été très aimable et serviable avec nous mais il n'était malheureusement pas là tous les jours (du coup nous l'avons pris ailleurs à la fin du séjour)
Rien dans le frigo à notre arrivée sauf 2 bouteilles d'eau qui nous ont été facturées 8 $ la bouteille...
Pour terminer on nous avait indiqué le jour de notre arrivée que la Wifi était gratuite dans les chambres et au final nous avons payé 17 $ par portable...
Ils ont la chance d'être idéalement placé mais cela ne leur empêche pas d'être aimables et serviables avec les clients.

title: 5 Star!!
text: We loved this hotel. Everyone was welcoming right when we walked in the door. The view from the dining room is breathtaking. Kelly our waitress was wonderful, excellent service. The elevator was even spectacular. There was an event at the hotel and the staff went out of their way for us to use the employee elevator so we didn't have to wait. No hot water one morning but had nothing to do with the hotel and let us know when it was turned back on. The location was our favorite. We have been to NYC before with our kids but this experience was unforgettable.

title: Buen Hotel
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado en Times Square, el personal es amable, las habitaciones son amplias, con aire acondicionado, tv LED, frigobar y camas muy cómodas. Tiene un sistema de ascensores que no es practico para nada, hay que subir al primer piso por un ascensor que es muuuy lento, para recién ahí ir a otro ascensor que te lleva al piso de la habitación. Otro punto flojo es que había poca presión de agua en el baño.  El hotel tiene 26 pisos y las vistas a la ciudad son buenas. El Wi-Fi es gratis si eres miembro del programa Marriott Rewards, en caso contrario tiene un costo de 16 dólares diarios. No le vendría mal alguna pequeña remodelación para no quedarse en el tiempo.

title: Good Location, Mediocre Stay
text: This hotel is a perfect location for Broadway and tourist sight seeing trips.  It is in the center of all the activity of Times Square and accessible to many activities.  However, the staff is not terribly friendly or helpful.  We visited on Earth Day weekend, and the hotel could offer no information on how to get to parking due to road closures.  We ended up parking in a lot 5 blocks away and walking with our suitcases as to not miss our Broadway show.  The next morning we woke up to no hot water for showers.  While this was likely an unavoidable disruption, when we contacted the front desk the response was rude with no apology.  For the cost and reputation of this hotel I would expect better visitor care and service.

title: Très mitigé
text:
Si l'emplacement de l'hôtel est exceptionnel, et la vue du restaurant magnifique sur Times Square, il s'agit des seuls points positifs.
Les chambres sont vieillottes, le rideau de douche tâché, bref le confort des chambres est tres moyen.
Mais le plus grave reste le service de restauration que l'on pourrait qualifier de pitoyable : serveurs désagréables, mal polis, et totalement blasés par leur travail, ce qui gâche tout de même le plaisir de cette vue magnifique. On a l'impression de les déranger chaque fois qu'on passe commande ou on s'assoit a une table. Ils savent que les gens viennent pour la vue donc ils se permettent de faire comme ils veulent.
La restauration est toutefois bonne et la reception reste agréable.

title: Emplacement idéal et vue panoramique sur Timesquare
text:
Nous avons eu la chance d'être au dernier étage donc aucun bruit dans la chambre, la chambre pour 4 (2 lits doubles) n'était pas immense mais tres propre et bonne literie.
Rapport qualité prix élevé mais situation idéale pour visiter NYC.
Par contre éviter le Resto sauf pour la vue incroyable sur Timesquare.
Nous avons pris le petit dej (25$) 2 fois, buffet correct sans plus

title: Great location with OK standard
text:
The location is great especially if you are using the Big Busses to get around. The standard is OK but poorer than a similar hotell in Sweden, as expected.
The strange entrance with an elevator up to the lobby and then a second elevator up to the room is irritating, especially when there is/was only one elevator open from entrance to lobby due to renovation = long waiting time.

title: Buena situación habitaciones generosas
text:
El hotel se encuentra a un paso de Times Square, a 100 metros de Broadway. La entrada y recepción son muy pequeñas pero en cuanto pulsas el botón L de lobby accedes a un lugar confortable, con wifi, con un maravilloso olor, decorado con piezas de arte moderno y con una gran cristalera que mira a la Plaza. Enfrente del ascensor que te sube a este Lobby están los ascensores que te llevan a las plantas de las habitaciones. 
La habitación tiene una gran cristalera y ves la 7ª Avenida. La habitación tiene dos cañas muy grandes y confortables y un baño bastante grande, con todo lo necesario. Estaba todo limpio. Wifi gratis solo en lobby. Recomiendo el hotel, aunque  el precio es elevado y como suele pasar en Nueva York no incluye el desayuno.

title: Location. Location. Location
text: New York is an overwhelming and magically city. And this was my first time here so I was worried that I'd get lost in all the craziness. My friend and I traveled from Hawaii to spend Christmas eve and Christmas day in New York and every night we had to make our way back to the hotel, we never had to use google maps or ask for directions because all we needed to do was find times square. The room we got had more than enough space for 2 people. The whole vibe of the 2nd floor lobby area was hipster chic, there were random games like tic-tac-toe and chess near the tables. We missed our chance to dine at R Lounge, however, the waitress let us walk through the restaurant so that we could take a picture of the awesome view. Definitely would stay here again, if I get the chance. I just wished the wifi was complimentary.

title: Excelente!
text: Hotel Renaissance New York Square tem   eu minha família já nos hospedamos duas vezes por estar no meio da Time Square que fica numa excelente localização , os quartos são confortáveis e espaçoso e bem decorado .

title: Alison
text: Really enjoyed our stay in the Renaissance Times Square. Would highly recommend the location for being at the centre of everything.  Some reviews say the rooms are noisey but we found it really quiet even though we had a city view room.

title: Great location, Accommodating staff.
text:
Great location, Easy, friendly check in.  A boutique feel.  Quiet.  Great view.  Good sized rooms.  Clean rooms and common areas.  Breakfast wait staff and bartenders very friendly and helpful.

Limited food.  Wish they had Blanton's bourbon.

Would recommend to others and will stay on next visit.

A Marriott property with Marriott benefits, like free wifi for card holders.

title: Décevant ...
text:
Très déçue par ce 5*. Très  vieillot et basique.Litterie très usée et inconfortable. 
Très peu de variété au petit dej Aussi ! 
Il gagnerait à être rafraîchi / modernisé car sa situation peut être un atout pour les personnes souhaitant loger à Time square.

title: Really soundproof
text: Decor in rooms was a little dated as was carpet in halls but very comfortable rooms, bed and bathroom. Lobby area was nice and view from restaurant was pretty magic. Good value for a place in the heart of Times Square. I would happily stay there again.

title: Friendly Staff located next to Time Square
text: This place has the friendliest people I have ever seen in a city. Always smiling and willing to just have a conversation with you. Willing to give advice how the best way to get around the city. And the places to avoid!!! The hotel is close to Time Square so there are always a lively crowd.

title: Lively Location and Great Customer Service
text: I was a little worried about being right in the thick of the madness of Times Square, but the location was a perfect jumping off point for the musicals we were hoping to see and the breakfast room/lounge is awesome for people-watching in the square below.  Happily as Marriott Gold Members we were able to upgrade to a high level floor and asked for a room on the Broadway side of the hotel for slightly less street noise.  As most people will tell you no matter what floor you're on in a hotel that close to Times Square you're going to have street noise.  However we did have a problem with a weird ticking/clicking sound in the walls that was inexplicable and never stopped.  Possibly water in the pipes?  Once another high floor room was available the front desk was gracious enough to allow us to move rooms, but the weird ticking remained.  Additionally we could hear the neighbors in the adjoining room quite clearly.  Unfortunately because of this it is unlikely that we will return to the hotel in the future, but the staff did everything in their power to try to make things right.  Concierge was super helpful with maps and tips and helped to arrange our transit back to EWR.  Most people aren't looking to watch TV when they're in NYC, but be forewarned that there are only approximately 10 digital channels available with the additional channels in grainy low definition.  Enjoyed the Aveda toiletries provided.  Housekeeping was very attentive and helped with requests for more hangers and water when needed. (free bottled water in room one of the great perks for Marriott Gold level and higher!)

title: Located at the core of the Big Apple and Broadway is the stem.
text: I flew over NYC in fall 2016 and even though there was low cloud cover you can still see the intense pulsation of the light show that is Times Square, the center of Manhattan.  I spent a few weeks in the hotel in early 2016 and again in early 2017.  The staff is great.  A co-worker has known some of them for years and they are like family for her when she is in NY.  Her husband is a regular there too and it makes NY more pleasant to be in when the staff makes an effort to know you.  Many have been there a long time which is pleasantly surprising.  The lounge is a great place for the view of Times Square.  Cocktails or breakfast there is always something to see outside, even if it is bright.  The property does have some issues such as the lobby elevators.  One was out for the entire month I was there in 2016 and there were times when both went down.  Just one was working when I was there in February 2017.  Given that is necessary to use the elevators to enter the hotel this should have been reliably fixed long ago.  Rooms are fine and large by NY standards.  I found the housekeeping staff to be very pleasant and accommodating as was the facilities engineer when there was a problem.  For a long term stay the neighborhood can be exhausting but very convenient for many travelers.  The staff however makes the hotel.

title: Very clean
text:
As others have said, this hotel is in a perfect location in Times Square. The bedroom was very clean but small.  However, the bathroom was larger than I expected. If you want to avoid traffic and other city noise, you should reserve a room in the higher floors. 
Michelle McKay the manager listened to our concerns before our stay, and had them taken care of before  we checked into our room.  The concierges were also helpful with suggestions for daytime activities. 
Definitely recommend to stay here if you want to be in the heart  of it all!!

title: Best view of Time Square at lounge
text:
Price is higher than other nearby hotel, however they got best view of times square at their lounge. 
Room and cleaness is good. Staff was not too friendly, less smiling. 
They got vending machine for drinks near the lift in every levels. I bought a bottle of water USD 3. 
Surroundings are... hershey, M&M, gift store, hardrock, bubba gump, sephora, wallgreen pharmacy, many options of breakfast, lunch and dinner resto. Only 1 min walking distance to buy ticket for broadway performance and hop in bus for sightseeing. Good location. 
With expensive price they only have very few options for breakfast. Eggs (scramble or boiled), oatmeal, sausage and bacon, breads and fruits. No poridge, no fried rice, no noodles.

title: Great location
text: The location of this hotel is great..It was very convenient to restaurants, broadway shows, sightseeing  and shopping. The view of Times Square from the lounge was awesome.  The housekeeping staff and the front desk staff were friendly and attentive to our needs. The room was clean and large enough for 3 people. It was also nice to have a small refrigerator in the room. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Perfect Location
text: Stayed here for a couple nights, location is perfect with awesome view of times square. Hotel is clean and friendly staff. The bartender was great during the day, remembered our drink when we came down to visit. Enjoyed sitting in the lounge  area watching time square. Will definitely visit again.

title: 2nd time and better
text: This was my 2nd visit to this hotel. The service was better. I was recognized as Gold member and served with the level of what I think Marriot should be. The staffs were helpful. The room and the view was excellent. And the location of course is the best of all; right in the centre of everything in Time Square. Especially Broadway shows! This time we enjoyed 3 shows and tried a couple of different restaurants. All perfect for us! Overall, an excellent stay!

title: Great location
text:
We stayed there from 01/11/2016 till 04/11/2016 wth two children. Hotel location is perfect. Rooms size is ok for New York standard. 
Staff was very friendly and helpful, but the rooms need renovation. 
The room was quiet as we didn't have any traffic noise. 
I will stay again there.

title: Lovely stylish Hotel and Great Location
text: Very convenient to everything. Very clean and wonderful staff. The restaurant lounge area looked out over the hustle of time square yet offered a cozy intimate experience.  Great breakfast! I will visit again.

title: Great bar, bad hotel service
text: My wife & I often go to the bar here.  It's great with a view of Times Sq.  However she stayed here with a friend and the room was not clean, and the elevator got stuck and it took the staff 30 minutes before they called the Fire Dept.  So she was in the elevator with 25 other people for 45 minutes.

title: Excellent
text: Just returned from a 4 night trip to New York to visit the usual tourist sites and to take in the St Patrick's Day parade.  Stayed in the Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel on the recommendation of a friend.  I owe her a big drink as this hotel was in an excellent location for our needs, very friendly staff, very clean facilities, very warm vibe about the whole experience.  The only fault was that it cost $16 for a glass of Pinot for the wife, but we will definitely return, hopefully in warmer weather.

title: Repetimos
text: Ya en el 2011 nos alojamos aquí. Esta vez ha sido en navidad lo que todavía ha hecho más fantástica la estancia. Quizás se note un poquito el envejecimiento del mobiliario pero no para dejar de ser muy confortable en una ubicación única para seguir descubriendo la ciudad, a muchos sitios andando y si no en metro, puedes ir a cualquier sitio.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text: Every time my daughter and I come to NYC to see Broadway shows (2x per year) we stay at the Renaissance in Times Square.  The location is perfect.  The staff, including the front desk staff and concierge, are always friendly and helpful.  The rooms are large for NYC, the beds are comfortable and the bathroom is spacious and clean.  You cannot expect it to be quiet if you are staying in the heart of times square, but we always ask for a high floor and don't even notice the hustle and bustle of the street below.   Depending on the time of year this hotel can be pricey but for me the location and familiarity is worth it.

title: So so
