text: Location is great, bed was very comfortable, soft goods needs repair, the lounge was good mostly fringes food but with the great  restaurants near by that is okay. If your room faces 7th Ave make sure your curtains are closed good or the billboard lights will keep you up all night

title: Amazing views of Times Square
text: We would go back and stay at this hotel again. The room was nice, nothing over the top but very nice. The bed was amazing. The lobby and housekeeping staff were very friendly and a pleasure to talk to. The only thing that kept this from a 5 star review was the breakfast service, not bad but not great... it took some time to just get some water and you would have though we asked for something off menu when we asked for coffee. It wasn't a bad experience but we have had better for sure. Other than that the staff was very polite and easy to work with, bar tenders were great and the place is kept clean... elevator is crazy slow and only one was working at the time of our visit. The staff was nice enough to book us in a room on the other side of the building due to some construction on the other side of the hotel, very nice that they thought of that and didn't want to put us in that situation. Will definitely book here again.

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel is a great location and is in the hustle and bustle of everything. It is centrally located for walking anywhere..  The rooms and furnishings could use a huge update. Everything was very worn. 
The Staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Amazing hotel, in the heart of NYC!
text: We had the best stay at your hotel in August 2016 (Sorry just sat down to write reviews.) The hotel was so clean, the staff so friendly, seriously they went above and beyond. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will be back, and will for sure recommend to our friends! Thank you for making our time in NYC so lovely!

title: FEAST AND FAMINE
text: This hotel is a tough one to review. It has so many different aspects of awesome and not so awesome.  It is a 2.5 in some respects and a five on others so I will try to detail everything so you have a good feel for the hotel.  I was there because I was given tickets to Hamilton and this hotel was 2 blocks away so it was convenient from that respect.  We entered the hotel to an unimpressive lobby and valeted the car.  Checked in and got into a relatively small and extremely slow elevator to go up one floor to the restaurant area.  Then we crossed over to the room elevators.  We had a larger room with a sitting area and two bathrooms.  The carpets were dated and I actually stepped on a sharp object left on the carpet.  One bathroom was clogged and the speaker system didn't work nor did the TV in the living room.  It wasn't to the point of demanding a new room because it was sufficient for our one night stay. Also keep in mind I am spoiled because I have travelled extensively and stayed in the finest hotels in the world.  We went to the play, came back and had dinner in the open area of the restaurant because there was no room in the main area.  We had decent wine and a very good meal, the menu is very limited but the quality was very good. The waiter Mike was so awesome I left an exceptional tip. We went to sleep and the next morning went to breakfast downstairs. Well here comes the "feast"...we ate breakfast IN the restaurant...it faces the ball drop in Times Square.  We had the buffet and admired the view for over an hour.  I was interrupted by a call from Moscow but returned to finish inhaling the view and enjoying the serenity which is so very rare.  Bottom line is the location is awesome, the view from the restaurant is unbeatable (would love to be there New Years Eve), the rooms need a little help and care from the staff to make sure everything works.  Try it, I doubt you will be disappointed but lower your expectations a little.

title: Excellent room, with a very accomodating and friendly staff
text:
Location: Great location because it is off from the main stretch of Times Square so although it's busy, it's not nearly as busy as some of the other hotels which can be overcrowded at times. Personally, I thought it was central enough to everything that I needed to be close to (theaters, restaurants, bars, etc.), but also private enough that I didn't feel crowded out when entering/leaving the lobby.

Room: I managed to get a room on the 26th floor which was excellent. Although I initially hesitated about the noise coming from below, I could not hear anything. This may not be true for other floors, but honestly, it was the best of both worlds for me - the center of everything, location wise, but also isolated from the noise, hustle, and bustle in my room.

Staff: I traveled to NYC for the day to celebrate my 1-year anniversary. I had called the hotel to see if they could make a card to surprise us (read: her), but they went over the top and actually left a bottle of champagne in the room with two glasses for us. It was extremely unexpected, over-the-top, and was a very welcome surprise for the two of us.

Overall: I think that this hotel offers something much different from the other more business-y hotels in the Times Square area. Its location was great in that it was close enough, but not in the middle of everything, and the hotel staff made the stay extremely memorable. I hope to be back one day and hopefully have the same experience as my first trip!

title: Incredible location,
text: Nice rooms, quiet and Incredible location, great view of times sq. From the bar/breakfast area where you can get a breakfast and friendly staff. Convenient to everything you want in New York City. You'll like it!

title: New York
text: We stayed at this hotel on resent trip to New York need to be near time square and this is right there nice room big bed and good price will stay agin .very easy to get around and see the city from this central point.

title: Great stay
text: I took my son for a long weekend getaway and we stayed at this hotel. We had a room on the 11th floor. The hotel was very clean, and every single staff member we encountered was helpful and polite. The room was clean, well stocked, and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was clean. Location wise, you cant beat this hotel .It is right on Times Square, close to so many things to see and do. We would stay here again.

title: Best views of Times Square from lounge
text: This hotel has absolutely the best views of Times Square from indoors at the restaurant.   Just amazing.  Rooms were clean and roomy.   Only reason it is not a five is for a hotel the lobby, restaurant and common area is much more limited than most 5 star hotels.

title: Glenda and Tammy are ROCKSTARS!
text:
As a Marriott Exec Platinum I have my fair share of interesting travel experiences. 

I want to give a shout out to front desk gurus Glenda and Tammy who made my day just by being kind, happy, and accommodating as I checked in this morning.   I won't go in to the details but they went above and beyond. 

You can tell when someone is just punching in and out - doing their jobs in a mundane manner, you can tell when someone gives a mediocre level of customer service because it is a demand from above, and you can tell, because it truly stands out, when an employee really cares what the customer is experiencing and this is Glenda and Tammy. 

I did not meet their supervisor/manager but I would thing that they are more of a leader than a manager,  keep it up!.

title: Location location location
text: We have stayed in this hotel before and came back as it is in the best location as it is bang in Times Square with a jaw dropping view from the restaurant. In saying this, when we stayed before it was much more relaxed in the bar area, and by that I mean that after a long day you feel like you want to kick back and have a beer and chill out, but they have revamped the bar area and it is not that sort of environment anymore. Yes you can have a beer, but the atmosphere is definitely more expensive wine bar than anything else. The rooms were fine but we were on the 8th floor and you could hear a lot of noise from the street below at night, so definitely go higher if at all possible. The staff are helpful and I find it hard to criticise any of them, but really didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel other than sleeping. If we go back we will be staying at another hotel as we have stayed here twice, where we enjoyed the first one but not so much the second time. If you have booked I am sure you will enjoy it but we are comparing against 2 stays and just preferred it before the refurbishment.

title: First time to NYC
text: Myself and my fiancé came to New York for the first time this week, we stayed in this hotel I have to say everything was fantastic, the website says the rooms will be ready from 4pm to check in, we arrived just around 1 and the room was already good to go, we checked in had a wonderful 4 nights, the location is perfect! Right next door to Big Bus Tour, which I highly recommend, the only niggle I found was there was no free wifi in the rooms, however you can pay to get this which I did as I didn't mind some other people may not like that however, we spent the week including valentines, we had dinner in the R Lounge overlooking Times Square, we had lovely service, live music from a lovely guy, even had a proposal next to us which was really sweet, the staff gave my fiancé a rose also which was a nice touch, and then on checking out we had to wait for our taxi a little while but the staff were more than happy to help a gentleman called the taxi company and sorted it for us and we waited in reception, a lovely hotel lovely staff, I would recommend this hotel, location is perfect also.

title: Big Apple luxury
text: Had a fantastic 3 night stay at the renaissance in the summer of 2013 and had a wonderful stay. This is not a cheap hotel but it was worth every penny for the views alone. Every morning at breakfast we would gaze out of the window across Times Square and smile, the views are just breath taking. It's a great hotel for exploring the city with a subway and hop on off bus stop right outside the front door, and stardust cafe just around the corner (definitely worth a visit) We would definitely stay here again, if we can afford it!

title: Exhibitionism & Dinner
text: We booked this Marriott using our points.  We were so impressed w/this hotel.  The room was larger than anticipated.  Bathroom amenities were Aveda Products, which are pretty high end.  Bed comfortable & room quiet.  People were nice.  Right in the area we needed to be to walk to dinner and the train station.  Only thing we needed to do was use a taxi to the Village.

title: What Happened Here?!
text: Wow, this hotel used to be nice, I mean luxury at one time. I have no idea what happened.  The rooms are dingy and in need of some serious updating.  And the staff .. not impressed.  I get it, NYC is not the warm fuzzy mecca of the planet, but honestly, I am so tired of hotel staff treating guests poorly.  I interacted with the staff as little as possible, but when I did, it was just plain disappointing.  And the concierge lounge ... Marriott, I'm not sure why you even offer this benefit anymore.   Many of the lounges are awful, crowded, poorly staffed, and this one was no exception.  If you don't have the room to accommodate the club level guests, then don't offer the club room benefit.  In this instance they kept changing the location of the club, to the point where I stopped looking after the first couple of days.  There are MANY options in NYC and this one has been permanently crossed off of my list.

title: Christmas and New Years
text: First of all thank you Renaissance for looking after us we had an amazing time. This hotel has the best location for New Years in New York. We travelled with our teenage children and rooms were big enough for the four of us, staff is friendly and very helpful... will definitely stay there again when we return to New York

title: Highly recommend. Good hotel and super location.
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a week in June 2016. The location is excellent, hotel good, and the rate we got made it an outstanding value. The hop on bus is just a few steps from the hotel and Times Square. We were on the 9th floor facing Broadway and could not hear street noise. Our room was clean, well appointed, bedding and condition just fine. The staff were helpful and friendly - Divina, a concierge manager, especially so. She gave excellent advise on passes, shows, restaurants, and activities. 

I highly recommend this hotel for vacationers wanting to explore Times Square.

title: Good Hotel with a Few Caveats on the Location
text: Stayed her for 5 nights in January for a work event. The room is a good size for NYC as was the bath and shower. The room had a spacious closet, fridge and safe along with a good desk setting with plenty of power outlets (a must for any business traveler).   Housekeeping was great and most of the staff were very friendly. We struggled to get service in the bar/lounge on Saturday evening although they did admit they were much busier than usual.  The location really is in the heart of Times Square--which is good and bad. The good news is that you are close to all Broadway theaters and many restaurants in the area. The noise from the street is where things fall down for this reviewer. Every night, starting around 5 or 6, some guy across the street on 7th Ave was using a microphone and speaker to promote a comedy show. It went on for hours and was quite annoying as our room faced out to 7th ave. One night he was talking into the microphone until 11pm.  The hotel provided ear plugs on the side tables in the room; this should have been a red flag.  Please know I'm a fan of Renaissance in general, I think the circumstances of the surroundings were the issue for me for this trip. Maybe ask for a room not facing 7th Ave or a higher floor.

title: Great Location.  Needs a refresh.
text:
I love this property because of its location.  When I have business in Midtown, this is in the heart of it all.  The staff are friendly and the rooms are generally quiet, despite looking out directly onto Times Square.

The 2nd floor lobby/bar, fitness center and the entire 4th floor has been refurbished in recent years.  Perhaps they are working their way up.  My most recent stay was on the 8th floor and again, while the overall stay was acceptable, there are a few things I brought to management's attention.

1) wifi.  The standard Wifi simply doesn't work.  Not even to browse to Google.  That requires a $3/day upgrade to the "premium" service, which works and is relatively stable, but not particularly fast.
2) The channel selection on TV was almost entirely SD (perhaps 5 HD channels), and even those were fuzzy and demonstrated packet loss in the digitial reception.  I don't come here to watch TV, but it was almost impossible for me to find a national news channel that was in HD or didn't drop because of poor reception.
3) There was a particular odor to the room, which I determined emanated from the desk chair.  Body odor.  Bad.

Rooms facing Times Square do have some noise, and earplugs are provided on the nightstand if you need absolute silence--but you'll want to use the blackout drapes to dull the flash of LEDs from the Square outside.

I do not want to knock this hotel--I do love the location and the welcoming staff.  I just hope that the attention to detail that this hotel once enjoyed will return.  Soon.

title: Best hotel
text: Its the best place to stay. Subway, hop on hop off bus, shows all very close. Rooms are a decent size and there were 3 of us. 2 double beds, decent size bathroom. Friendly staff including the cleaners. Restaurant overlooks time square and you can even see the new years eve ball. I will book there whenever i go to NewYork

title: New Years Spectacular
text: Stayed here for NYE at the R Lounge - it is the best spot to explore Times Square and NY in general - a good hotel with nice views of the surrounding areas. A bit of a downer without a minibar or room service - makes it a bit lower than expected. However was here for NYE and the party was SENSATIONAL. Probably a shade expensive, however this is NY. It does get noisy here, with earplugs provided!

title: Surprised.....
text: ...that there is no Concierge Level and the comp for no weekend breakfast is Marriott points (not a big plus for a Lifetime Platinum member). The trip to your room involves two elevator rides. The room itself is standard Marriott fare. We were checked in to a room that had not yet been cleaned. Best thing about the hotel is the location in Times Square. Street/city noise on the higher floor wasn't an issue. Subway lines are a convenient walk away. Beware: a scam in the non-attended subway station closest to the hotel: two men jam the turnstiles so it won't take your ticket, but approach you to offer you "help" getting over the turnstiles. Creepy.

title: Busy Day
text:
I am a Marriott rewords customer and stay an average of 4-days/week in hotels.  This was my first visit to this location.  Its a great location if you want to be where the action is and love Broadway plays.

The hotel is clean, contemporary in design.  The staff were all very friendly and courteous.

Although they do not have an onsite restaurant they do allow you to order delivery and escort the food to your room so you do not have to leave.  This is very helpful.

If your looking for a full service Marriott this is not it.

title: Perfect!
text: I can't say anything enough about this hotel and it's staff.   Perfectly located in and around everything, this hotel offers comfortable and  scenic rooms that look over the city.  We loved our accommodations and were amazed by the staff and their mission to go out of their way to make sure we were taken care of and answer any question we had about local attractions and directions.  I will only stay here when we return!   LOVE!!!

title: Suitable if you have business in Times Sq
text: I'm rating this 4 minus. A nice and clean hotel in the heart of Times Sq. Some of the furniture seem to be dated but overall great comfort (love the Renaissance beds) and functional rooms. The restaurant menu is average even though famous for its amazing view over Times Sq. No room service which is strange. There is no lounge it seems and not sure if a platinum elite member would enjoy many benefits here. Higher floors are recommended to keep away the street noise. Personnel are kind and service minded. If you have business around Times Sq then it makes sense to stay here otherwise consider something else as this is a very busy area of the city. I would return for business.

title: Great
text: This hotel is right in the center of everything! The room was very large compared to regular NYC rooms. We were on 8th floor and didn't hear noise from the street. Close to subway. Very nice hotel, will return !

title: Fourth Stay - Very Disappointing
text: We have stayed at this hotel four times before and was always very impressed with it. The only good thing about the hotel now is the location, right in the heart of times square. On arrival to the hotel, when you enter reception there is no greeting from the receptionists, no welcome to our hotel, have you stayed before or smiles or any friendliness, they were just rude. No offer of help with our bags. Our room was very dated and due to this, the small light in the bathroom did not work, the toilet did not flush properly and kept blocking up, in the end we had to get the maintenance guy to come and unblock it, the paint on the light over the bed was peeling off, most of the sockets in the room don't work, the whole section of sockets next to the TV lifted up and didn't work, the TV had spots all over it and no matter what you did to the aerial it didn't work properly. The hairdryer didn't work properly, kept cutting out, the carpet was very sticky and the beds were incredibly uncomfortable and tiny. They are double beds and for two adults and 2 teenage boys sharing, it was not ideal. Each time we rang down to the front desk for help, they didn't greet you and then most of the time, they would just hang up with out saying goodbye, you could tell that it was inconvenient for them each time we phoned. I have a contact at the hotel and she always books the rooms for us, but it felt like we had just been stuck in this room (as if it was the only one left), the air conditioning was very noisy and not easy to use, it was always freezing in the room and freezing outside. The block out curtains don't work properly as you can still see the lights coming in from the buildings and the hotel is very noisy. We used to love this hotel, but I wish I had read some of the other reviews before I stayed there, because it would have been a better trip for us. Wont be staying there again.

title: GREAT LOCATION...EXCELLENT HOTEL
text: I chose this hotel because of its proximity to Penn Station.  I will definitely stay there again because it is fabulous!  The customer service begins before you get there when their Guest Relations Director, Justin, emails you and asks for any special accommodations you may require.  The room was ready, beautifully decorated (looks like a recent remodel), and the view was spectacular.  Our trip to New York was wonderful and we felt safe and well taken care of at the Renaissance.

title: awesome location!
text: very convenient location, clean and comfortable room, friendly staff, easy valet parking .. Our room was in the back of the hotel, so it was quiet.. don't miss the lounge which offers a wonderful view of Times Square.. highly recommend.

title: In the heart of Times Square
text:
A wonderful place to stay if you want to be close to the hustle of Times Square. A bit noisy. Block out curtains for when you need to sleep and get away from the bright lights of Times Square. Close to all the major shops and restaurants. Rooms are very spacious and nothing beats a comfortable bed like those of the Renaissance Hotels. 
Tea & Coffee facilities plus fridge available. 
Breakfast with the best view of Times Square!!!!

title: Localização Perfeita
text: Ótimo hotel. Luxo, mas nada espetacular. Parece antigo (mobília e etc), mas tudo limpo e com cara de novo. O lugar não podia ser melhor. "Coração" de manhattan, ao lado da Times Square. Saiu na porta do hotel, 10 passos e está na Times Square. Para 2 pessoas fica um pouco caro. Mas se tiver em grupo e puder ficar 4 pessoas num quarto, fica um valor espetacular.

title: Not Bad
text:
If you need to be right in the middle of Times Square and don't mind fighting crowds of people every time you step out of the hotel, this hotel is in the perfect spot.  It's convenient to theatres and right in the middle of all the action.  While I don't care for the noise, the location was such that we could walk out the door and be at our show in 5 minutes.
As for the hotel, the room was okay, though kind of dark and directly facing a giant flashing billboard.  Luckily, there are curtains. We were on the 11th floor and could still hear noise coming in from the street -- some sort of music, plus a little traffic.  It wasn't too bad, though.  

The TV remote wasn't working properly nor was the volume on the TV, which is a pet peeve, but that was the only malfunction.  It was nice having a refrigerator, coffee pot and tub. The hotel does not have room service, which came as a surprise, and the only real place to get food was the bar. It was noisy, but had a nice view.

What the hotel had going for it was friendly employees. Everyone I encountered seemed truly nice. Also, the free breakfast for Gold level members gave the hotel some more value for the money.  The breakfast and seating area were actually quite lovely.

I wavered between giving this one 3 or 4 stars, but went with 4 because of the nice employees and good breakfast.  I don't know that I would stay here again, but then I will probably never stay in Times Square again.

title: Great location and great service
text: Very nice hotel with a good location and wonderful view to Times Square from the upper lobby.  Good service and comfortable rooms.   A little pricey but what isn't in NYC?  The breakfast was included in our rate and the selection was excellent.  Nice bar service in the evening.

title: Beyond Expectations
text:
My wife and I were lucky to get tickets to see "Hamilton" on broadway and we decided to stay the night in Manhattan instead of driving home. The Renaissance was less than 2 blocks from the theater so it seemed to be the place to stay. Boy were we ever right!
From our first encounter with the registration desk and throughout our stay we were met by pleasant and efficient staff who seemed truly happy to see us. Whoever said that New Yorkers can be cold never stayed at this hotel.
We were given a room on the 26th floor far above the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Our room was stylish, large, and updated. The bathroom was equally impressive. On the day of our departure we enjoyed breakfast overlooking Time Square. 
If you are planning a visit to NYC consider the Renaissance for it's location, style, and wonderful staff. You can thank me later.

title: Everything was outstanding!!!
text: The location of the hotel is fantastic. I booked this through Dream Trips, and I received an excellent rate which included daily breakfast. The employees were all very friendly and we were greeted each time we entered the hotel. The internet speed was great. I would definitely stay here again because I had such a pleasant experience.

title: The good and bad
text:
We have stayed at this hotel many times before. We travel a lot and are platinum elite members so we stay at A LOT of Marriotts.  

First I will say this hotel does a nice job closing out the bustle of Times Square. The r lounge is great and the decor is fun.

We noticed this time that there was less of a personal feel.  We always loved that we felt like we were coming home when we stayed here. Staff would say hello, do you need anything? a good morning in the morning.. all that was missing this year. Staff seemed cranky and just going thru the motions.

Second, it is time to do a deep clean! The rooms are surface clean but when you look behind a desk all you see is dust. Our tv was not working- it seemed to be unplugged. I went behind to plug it in and I saw about 1/4 inch of thick dust and used water bottles. I think if management took a close look they would not be pleased. Maybe go room by room a day at a time and move the furniture and do a good clean.  For over 600 a night it should be clean.

Not sure we will return.

title: Great service, great location
text: We stayed two nights at the Renaissance Times Square as part of a family vacation to the City.  We were really surprised by how big our room was.  There were lots of outlets for phone charging, and the high speed wifi was excellent.  The cable service to our TV wasn't working correctly our first night, and maintenance came up to our room very quickly and - while he was unable to fix the problem - he offered us a free movie on demand for our inconvenience.  We also received exceptional service from all of the door men we encountered.  We had a rental car to return upon our arrival to the City, and the doorman gladly unloaded our luggage, tagged it right at the curb and took it into the hotel for storage while we drove a couple of blocks to return the car.  They were also spot on with restaurant recommendations.  An excellent stay!  I've rated "sleep quality" at 3 because you're on Times Square and it is never quiet there.  We stayed December 28-30 and there were preparations for New Year's Eve going on during the night so there were a lot more trucks, equipment, generators, etc. outside than there would be on a regular day I would think.  Earplugs were provided in the room but we didn't feel we needed to use them.

title: Short visit to NYc
text: We usually go to NYC in December to see Chris Botti at the Blue Note and to see a play.  We decided to go right after Christmas this year and found the crowds to be overwhelming, particularly in Times Square. The hotel was ok- rooms r small with very little bathroom counter/storage space.  I wouldn't stay here again because there r other hotels in the city that I prefer.

title: Promised so much, delivered very little
text:
I originally chose this hotel because of it's fantastic location, as a treat for my family. It is right in the heart of Times Square and within easy walking distance of many of the key attractions. However, my early enthusiasm was quickly extinguished with the very poor customer service - in the few days that we stayed there not a single member of staff welcomed or greeted us - if fact we may as well not have been there. The staff seem harassed and indifferent - to busy to care. 

The rooms are pleasant enough - with good views over the Square but the hotel had little charm or warmth. After the first day we actually didn't really want to spend any time in the hotel and found far better place to eat and enjoy. 

As a Platinum member, I had phoned ahead and been assured that we would be welcomed and that we would receive complementary breakfast, this was not the case and when I questioned this was very rudely informed that we actually made a mistake. 

When trying to arrange a taxi to the airport - I was recommended an expensive 'hotel' car by the front of house staff, as it would be hard to get a taxi Down Town. I walked out the front door and hailed one of several passing taxis without any problem - I ended up loading the car myself, as the staff were too busy to help. 

Overall - very under whelmed by what promised to be a lovely hotel.

title: You pay for the location
text:
If I was rating this on location and front desk staff I would give 5 stars. 

Front desk was welcoming and very informative. You can't beat the location. It's right in the middle of Times Square, perfect for someone who isn't familiar with the area. 

Concierge was nice and very helpful.

The room (1010) was disgusting. The bedding had hair, stains and who knows what else on it. 

I am not someone who usually complains as I know they have thousands of guests that come through here and every room will have some wear and tear but that shouldn't mean housekeeping shouldn't be up to par. I was so disgusted I ask the front desk to move rooms.
- see pictures below

The second room was better but still had the feeling it was as clean as it should be. 

Sorry to say, but I won't stay here again.

title: Hotel na cara do gol
text: Excelente localização. Atendimento muito bom e atencioso. Restaurante com vista para Time Square é imperdível. Os quartos tem uma cama king de bom padrão. Televisão tem o básico da programação o que não prejudica pois vc só irá usar o quarto para dormir. O grande barato é ficar passeando pois o que não falta são atrativos.

title: A Blast!!!
text: The hotel's lounge faces Times Square and overlooks the "Red Steps" where the famous New Years Eve show is hosted. Great Location, only a few blocks to Rockefeller Center and many other great places!!!

title: Nel cuore della Grande Mela
text: Ottima la posizione proprio su Times Square. 4 notti senza colazione. Una mattina ci siamo sognati di farla in albergo...... sconsigliato vivamente per il prezzo se non la si prende nel pacchetto. Una vera e propria rapina! Camere non troppo spaziose ma ottimi i bagni. Servizio nella media. Incredibilmente non c'era Wi-Fi nella camera ma solo nelle sale comuni. Consiglio camera nei piani alti considerata la confusione che regna a tutte le ore a Times Square. Al 24 piano stavamo bene.

title: December 2016
text: Our first stay at The Renaissance Times Square. Very impressed. Staff was so friendly. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Location perfect for Times Square area activities. Easy walking distance to Times Square; Rockefeller Center; Restaurants we like; etc.Will stay here again.

title: Go elsewhere
text: Paid a considerable amount of money for an executive suite and was very disappointed in the size and set up. Was not the same as pictured on the website when purchased. Should have stayed at the Kimberly.

title: Christmas vacation
text:
We visited the hotel the first week in December to enjoy New York and all it had to offer. 
The absolute best experience we had during our stay was meeting and being hosted by Mohammed at the resturant and lounge. 
He was the absolute perfect host. 
Very kind and respectful. He is an asset to the hotel and Marriott and has earned our respect tremendously. 
Our room was beautiful with a side view of Times Square. We loved it. 
We stayed 3 days and our room only got cleaned once. No towels for two days. 
We were also overcharged by $240 on our bill and had we not checked it we would pay the upcharge. 
The front desk said ops it may have been an oversight 
Very disappointing the level of dishonestly and poor service with the exception of Mohammed of course. 
We would visit again because of location and your lounge host.

title: Great Location - can't go wrong
text: Stayed here 3 nights.  Went to Madison Square Garden, Wicked and The Color Purple.  Walked to all.  2 miles from 911, taxi ride was $25.  Walked to East side shopping.  Ate breakfast overlooking Times Square.  Would stay here again with no hesitation.

title: Ode to my awe...
text:
Times square is one of my favorite places in the world. I'm a frequent traveler, I go to at least two countries in a year's time and this time my adventure got me staying at this hotel and believe me I was sooo excited. First of all, the view from my room was a "sweet" delight being right across both the M & M and Hershey buildings!  Not to mention, walks from Broadway and having the grandest view from the hotel restaurant's window ... Time's square was our vista!    Having drinks or dinner with Time's square as your back drop was awesome!   This hotel is truly quaint  but most convenient and conducive to working as well.    They  have a  common lounge area that gives you free wife, books to read or simply "veg out" if you must.

Those of us who wanted to see the shows only had  to walk across the hotel and the tickets booking windows were right smack there!   The catch?  Well, all the convenience of a nice view, steps away from the Center of the hustle and bustle of course comes with a price.

Rooms were almost $600 a day I know just a bit more would've had us staying at a swankier one but hey,  it's modern -artish interior just blended really well with my "Times Square"and  living in New York experience.

Food was pricey too if in the hotel but hello... you're In New York, there's so much cuisine you can have and the Street food like hotdogs, and pizzerias and even Indian food was all around there.  One just has to use their legs and sense of adventure!  I saw School of Rock while my colleague was able to catch Hamilton.  Both shows were excellent.  Anyway, I loved the experience but honestly  there are other quaint hotels you may stay at  further from Times square  that next time around I  don't mind checking  out because the few hundred dollars you can save can buy you two tickets to a show on broadway... Hurray!

title: In the center of life
text:
I left there yesterday. The hotel first floor reception area is small. If you are with a crowd ask people to go the second floor lobby. Two elevators go to the the lobby. Get off the elevator and the  elevators to the rooms are across the lobby on the opposite side. View from The lobby bar of Times Square is amazing. Wine 🍷 runs around $15. Drinks are expensive. Check to make sure tips are not already added. 

The room I had was on the Twelvth floor overlooking 47th street. Large. Clean. Picture windows allows for a view of all the light and lit up billboards. If you are on a floor higher than 15 your view is the construction in the building across the street on 47th. 

The room numbers are very large. Almost blind, no worry you can locate your room. As you enter the room, the light inside turns on so one does not have to worry regarding seeing the room in toto. The black out curtains work. Close them and th eTime Square light show disappears..

They offer complimentary  Starbucks 'wake up' coffee in the lobby on the second floor lobby. I found this out one day too late. Concierge, all, were extremely helpful making theatre tickets  and restaurants reservations. They ar the hotel best asset along with the room division who supply more than enough towels, and washcloths. They are happy to please and really break their backs to make your room comfortable.  Bring you own shampoo, conditioner as the ones provided by the hotel are second rate. 

I did not eat the resturant. Next time. The hotel is about location, location, location....but don't forget the staff. Five star all the way.

title: Not really worth it
text:
I really wanted to like the Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel. The location was excellent. The view of Times Square from the lobby-level restaurant itself was worth several million dollars, if not more. 

Unfortunately, the hotel just fell short of my reasonably expectations. 

I stay a lot of nights with Marriott. As a result, I have the top-level platinum elite status. I received zero recognition at arrival. Elite recognition varies by hotel, but I learned from a colleague, who was also staying here, that he received vouchers for appetizers in the evening as well as complimentary breakfast. He also received a welcome amenity in the room -- some wine and chocolate. Not did I not receive the evening vouchers, but I was never told about breakfast. I also didn't receive a bottle of wine or chocolates in my room. If there was a concierge lounge I didn't find out about it. 

I specified a king-sized room on a high floor away from the elevator. I received a king room on a low floor while my colleague, with the same reservation specifications, received a room on the 25th floor (the second from the top). My other requests -- extra towels and extra pillows -- were not fulfilled.

The room itself was spacious, but a little tired. Furniture was visible scratched. Some of the cabinets were broken. One of the two phones didn't work. The TV was a few years old -- it certainly wasn't the 52-inch TV you see in most Marriott hotels these days. The decor didn't really work either. It was a mixture of modern or post-modern and classic hotel styles -- a mixture that came off more as mismatched and cheap than premium boutique hotel, which is what it felt like this hotel was trying to be. I appreciated having a morning newspaper delivered to my room. The bathroom was also spacious, but housekeeping didn't replace the soap. No slippers or bathrobe were provided.

On the plus side, the wireless internet was more than adequate and the fitness facility was excellent. 

No doorman was working when I arrived or departed (both times in the afternoon) to assist with luggage to/from the taxi. There was a bellman inside, but I never saw them venture outside to help arriving and departing guests.

The lobby on the street level is really, really small. The line from the front desk often blocks the entranceway and obstructs the foyer leading to the elevator. The area where the lobby should be on the second floor is cluttered with excessive boutique hotel-style decor. 

Most disappointing was the restaurant.

The breakfast buffet was pathetically limited. No menu service is available. In the evening, the menu is mostly dinner and appetizers for dinner. Very, very casual. My business colleague and I made a reservation for a window table overlooking Times Square. The reservation was confirmed. When we arrived we were seated at a table in the center of the restaurant with zero view whatsoever. More annoying than the lack of a view, however, was the music. Not only was the music excessively loud, but it varied from grunge rock and heavy metal to 1990s pop music. 

All things considered, I would not stay here again.

title: Fantastic Location in Times Square
text: Clean, well run hotel just steps from TKTS in times square.  There is always a lot of noise in this area of NYC, however if you have a high enough room it is not unbearable.  There is a small lobby off the street and then you take the elevators up to the hotel main lobby. You can check in at street level.

title: Do yourself a favor and stay in Midtown
text: After having a good experience at the Renaissance in Midtown, I was very disappointed at this hotel. I'll never stay there again. The windows have no insulation, so I was freezing all night under 2 comforters with the heat at the highest setting. Not to mention I came to a 62F temp setting when it was 20F outside. The room was very noisy, I could hear the nose and the sirens at all times, which had to do with sound proofing or the complete luck of thereof. The rooms need a serious update as the furniture is old and the carpet is stained and dirty. The service is nonexistent.

title: Great
text:
Stayed there from 20 Nov to 24 Nov 2016.

Booked online.  Reached one day late due to dysfunctional airlines from elsewhere.  They were sympathetic and refunded me the hotel stay for 19 Nov. 

Reception and Concierge were good.  The ladies at the reception were very good to my son and I.  I would go back just for their good cheer and professionalism. 

Room was on the 5 th floor on my request.  No sounds of traffic. Room was well appointed and spacious.  Toilet was clean.  

Bar was great as was their service. 

Right on the Times Square. Tube right outside the hotel as was the Hop on Hop off  bus tours start point. 

Overall a very good deal for the money.  

Would definitely recommend to my friends  and stay with them on subsequent visits.

title: Nice looking lobby but rooms are cramped
text: Decent hotel. The hotel is right on 7th Ave with little sidewalk space, so as soon as you step out, you are fighting a throng of pedestrians. There is an elevator leading up to the lobby/restaurant then another leading up to the rooms. Kind of inconvenient if you are in a hurry. The elevators are very slow, and I even had to get out and get on the one on the right because the door shut then opened again 3 times. I've heard enough horror stories about faulty elevators to stay on.

title: Very Convenient to Subway and Theater Districk
text:
Great staff and extremely helpful Front desk staff was accommodating to our every request and made stay very enjoyable
Concerige was always on duty most hours of the day and cordial and helpful
Subway entrance right next door and it was almost like it was in hotel as you never were in the open when weather was bad
Our housekeeper on 22nd floor room 2207 was outstanding
As New York hotels our view was not great but on Broadway and was ok and quiet
Breakfast was great with Times Square view
The bar has a great view but since it was Christmas party season it was closed most of the time we were there. Since the hotel calls this out as a plus suggest you check for availability if this is a priority
Overall great location

title: Very Nice
text: You are truly in the middle of Times Square, perfect for Broadway shows.   Having to take two elevators every time you come and go can be a bit annoying.  Nice, clean rooms, but the sliding door to the bathroom affords no privacy.  Great customer service and concierge staff.

title: Mr B Young
text:
On arrival we were greeted with a rather short but not so sweet "welcome to renaissance, name please! Followed by we need a credit card for incidentals" no small talk (1st time in new york, very excited) and then a finger pointed us to a lift with instructions on how to get to our room. 
Then on our 2nd night in hotel after being out & about we decided to ho back for a drink in the lounge with amazing views which we had seen many pics of on tripadvisor, we asked barman once we purchased drink if we could go through to sit, was told to ask the male "guarding" this area. Politely asked if we could go do as requested and was told in no uncertain terms "no" that this area was only for food, even though we could clearly see other people just having drink there!!! 

How can i put this, spoke to staff regarding smell from room , offered another room, however didnt think it meritted this as the air con unit only needed cleaned out, staff immediately called for someone to attend, we returned from shopping trip to find all room doors propped open and stale smell remained! 

And lastly, upon checkout, we were sitting awaiting our taxi to airport when lots of americans from other areas started arriving and their greeting couldnt have been any different from ours. Warm welcoming and informative! 
We were left feeling confused as to what we had done to receive such an abrupt check-in! Wouldve expected having travelled all way from Scotland, a tiny bit more courtesy. 

Since arriving home contacted marriot direct who put my complaint to the complaints advisor in NYC who apologised for this and stated that she would get something sorted and asked for my reward points number, i advised them by email that i do not hold a rewards account, since then 3 months have passed and still nothing heard! 

On the whole i feel this has diminshed a once in a lifetime trip for my wifes 40th birthday!!!

title: Loud, obnoxious lobby
text: Lots of unh-tis unh-tis music playing the lobby.  I couldnt find a quiet place to work.  Now realizing it's literally in the heart of Times Square (not in the outskirts), I'd stay somewhere else if you have to work.  If you want to play, stay there.

title: Annual Christmas Holiday weekend!
text: As always, my family thoroughly enjoyed the accommodations at this chic, upscale NYC hotel!  Service, room, location and awesome buffet breakfast were spot on.  Highly recommend the Renaissance Time Square!

title: Pure Luxury
text: I took my wife here for her 40th birthday to watch Wicked and Lucky Guy (Both shows were great, btw).  These rooms exude luxury, especially the bed.  For the City that never sleeps, this bed was incredibly comfortable!  We had so much site seeing to do but it took everything to get out of bed because it was so comfortable.

title: Beautiful Hotel with an AMAZING view
text: We had a girls trip early November and stayed at this hotel. The staff was incredibly nice. The view from the bar down to Times Square was so amazing. We spent a few evenings there having either a night cap or an about to hit the town cocktail. The staff in the bar were so sweet and after just a few visits new us and gave us a great table with a view of Times Square you just cannot beat! The rooms were clean and had wonderful views of the city. The subway was right around the corner and of course you can't beat the entertainment of Times Square at 1am. Price seemed pretty much average for all of the hotels we checked out before booking but the staff and views made it worth every penny!

title: Weekend trip - request a room NOT facing Times Square
text:
My sister and I stayed here in November.  We were visiting friends for the week for a family celebration.  We checked in around 2:00 PM on Friday and were able to access the room immediately.  We were on the 10th floor in a 2 bedded room.  We faced Times Square.  There is a tall building across the street with bright neon lights that change color.  The drapes did not close all the way, and so we had purple, red, orange, green and blue light flooding the room.  If you are a light sleeper or are disturbed by music and lights, request a room not facing Times Square.  We used a "white noise" app on our cell phone and that drowned out the music/cars/yelling in Times Square. 

The beds were comfortable and the room was spacious, especially for NYC.  There was room for a desk and wall unit with built in drawers, with a laptop size safe in the drawer; there was a night stand between the 2 beds, a small chair by the windows that had a TV tray type of thing in front of it (we used it as a suitcase stand) and the closet was an armoire built in to the wall.  There were plenty of hangers for 2 women, an iron and board and a mini-fridge.  The bathroom had only one sink but lots of counter space and a cubby system underneath to store towels, toilet paper, our toiletries, etc.  After the first night, housekeeping gave us 2 of each of the Aveda bath items, so that was very nice (we tipped $5 each night for housekeeping and got a thank you note from the housekeeper - nice.)

You check in on the ground floor, and then take the elevator across from check-in to the 5th floor, where the lobby is located, then cross the lobby to another elevator bank to reach the guest rooms.  There is a sign in the elevator saying that you need to insert your room key into a security slot to run the elevator, but we didn't have to do that the whole weekend, so I'm not sure why the sign is there.  The lobby floor has a nice bar/lounge.  It was convenient when we needed to grab something quickly after shopping all day, before heading to our late afternoon family event.  They serve small bites like hummus and crudites, and other noshy things.  The bar overlooks Times Square, though, and so each time that we were there, people had commandeered more tables than they needed in order to have multiple people in their party be able to face the view.  Pretty rude.  The front desk staff were friendly, the concierge gave good info re: which subway line to take to our various destinations and the doorman got us a taxi.  This hotel is a solid choice for the Times Square area, especially if you want a little more space than most NYC shoe box sized hotel rooms.  Full disclosure:  My sister and her husband are Marriott time share owners, so we used Marriott points to book the room for the weekend.

title: Great location and nice room
text: Hotel is right on times square. Rooms are much bigger than most hotels in Manhattan. Staff are friendly and rooms are clean. My room had a great view of Times Square. Food in the restaurant is good and walking distance to Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral and to a lot of restaurants in the area. Will highly recommend this hotel.

title: Superbe Hotel
text:
Super : Hotel et emplacement ! 
Chambre Propre , staff super sympa 
A 2 pas de Times square . Wifi gratuit au lobby , lobby très accueillant et chaleureux on s y sent vraiment bien !
Je le recommande vivement

title: Brilliant - Loved It Here!
text:
It was our first time in New York, and if you want to stay central, then stay here. We were a bit awestruck upon arrival as Times Square was a massive assault on the senses for us. You just say 'wow' when you see it - and the Renaissance is literally right on it. 

It's a brilliant hotel with helpful staff. Our rooms were very clean, tidy and had comfortable beds. We were high up on the 21st floor. Some reviewers have said that it is a 'noisy' hotel with traffic etc...Yes, it can be busy and lower level rooms may be noiser but we didn't find it particulary noisy despite it being Thanksgiving. But look, you are in Times Square after all and for us it was all part of the fantastic NYC experience.

The restaurant looks out over Times Square. The rooms don't, they face to the side, but the billboard views are still fantastic. We decided to have the breakfast at the hotel and it was very nice with plenty of choice. You may have to pay extra for it if not pre-booked though.

You can walk to most of the main sites if you don't fancy the subway. We walked to Grand Central Station, Rockefella centre, Empire State building, Chrysler building and Saks 5th Avenue and Macy's. Central Park is only a 20 minute walk away from the hotel.

We took a yellow cab from the hotel to go downtown to visit the 9/11 Memorial (approx $25-35 one way, including tip, as it's quite a distance). You simply have to visit this site, it is unbelievably humbling. 

The one hour Hornblower Cruises around the Statue of Liberty is just around the corner from the 9/11 memorial, from Pier 15. I would completely recommend the Liberty helicopter trip over the Hudson river. I have always wanted to do this. It's $199 for a 15 minute flight, but you will NOT regret it.

In summary; Great hotel, fantastic location, Brilliant place to visit. 

TIP 1 : it's well worth queuing for a table at Ellen's Stardust diner on the next block, just around the corner from the hotel. The waiting staff are all budding actors and singers who perform songs from famous musicals whilst serving the food. It's totally brilliant!

TIP 2: An approved yellow cab right outside JFK airport will take you in to the city for a fixed fee, plus a tip. This works out at approx $65 each way for approximately a 40-45 minute ride, traffic depending.  It's a great way to get to and from the airport and the fixed fee lets you know where you stand fare wise. Look for the official yellow cab dispatcher outside the arrivals terminal.

title: excellent location great rooms with excellent amenities.
text: I was their for the Macy's day Parade and this location was good , the service was excellent the rooms were nice and the amenities were good. It is close to everything in down town Manhattan. I would stay their again.

title: Boutique style hotel in the heart of Times Square
text:
We were in NY for 4 nights of Broadway shows and 4 days of sightseeing during the day.
This was the perfect location for experiencing  Times Square,  being within easy walking distance of every Broadway show, and hundreds of restaurants conveniently nearby.
The Renaissance Hotel was all about location, location. Once you enter the lobby, the hustle and bustle of the Times Square scene is immediately replaced with a relaxed and non-stressed feeling. The professional staff is very attentive to your needs and makes every effort to do so. The rooms are fairly large for New York standards but renovation should take placesoon.

title: Choose Another Location and Hotel
text: We generally love Renaissance Inn Hotels, It is supposed to be the premium of the brand. This hotel is shabby, right from the front lobby. The  sofas are ripped and OLD. Our bathroom was clean but the headboard and duvet were dirty-The noise in this location is loud and 24/7. We will not book this hotel again.

title: Perfect views of Time Square, centrally located
text: We wanted to stay in the center of all the attractions and right in the middle of Time Square.  The views from the restaurant of this hotel are second to none.  Check out the photo attached.  The views of Time Square from the Marriott Marquis is a side view, but from the Renaissance, it is squarely facing the square, located right behind the TKTS platform where everyone takes pictures with the buildings in the background.  I would reserve a seat by the window for dinner, otherwise, we simply went down there around sunset to take pictures in front of the window.  The location is centrally located and right next to the theater district and walking distance to Rockefeller Center as well as Hell's Kitchen for restaurant row.  Otherwise, Empire State Building, Central Park area, and anything south of midtown is easily accessible by the subway system.  The room was decent and didn't really have any views, but next time I would pay the extra cost to get a room with a balcony.  It is also worth paying the extra cost of getting a room in the higher floors if you cannot sleep with any sort of city noise.  I would stay here again!

title: If you have to stay in Times Square...
text:
...You could do a lot worse than the Renaissance.  Street level check in and concierge, then up one floor via elevator to the rest of the lobby and the lounge.  Walk 25 feet to the elevators to the room floors.  Cool, dark decor.  Strips of what looked like copper made you feel like you were inside a steamer trunk, or a bathyscaphe.  Rooms are typical Renaissance.  Was in a double twin (traveling with the kids), and it was frankly larger than many hotel rooms in NYC I've been in.  All the right amenities.  

It's loud on the street, but it's Times Square.  You shouldn't be expecting quiet and secluded.

Nice hotel.  If you HAVE to stay in Times Square, you could do a lot worse.

title: Times Square
Great location!
text:
Very nice hotel. Great location right in Times Square. Super comfortable bed. Modern bathroom with walk-in shower. 20th floor with minimal street noise.
Fast elevators.
Restaurant/bar with awesome view of the heart of the square.
Close to everything.
Unassuming entrance and check-in at street level.
The lobby is up a few floors and very modern.

title: Tired hotel in need of refurbishment
text:
The hotel is centrally located right next to Times Square.  Strangely, the very small reception is on the ground floor and you have to catch one lift to get to the lobby on the 3rd floor and then change the life to get to your room. The lifts are slow and inefficient.  On Wednesday evening i waited 8 minutes for a lift to collect me from the 16 th floor.  On the way the lift bumps along and doesn't inspire confidence.  
The bed is very comfortable but the room furniture has been well used and the hotel has a tired feel.
As with many large hotels it was not possible to open the window - it was completely sealed.  At well over $300 a night just for the room and a steep $30 for a fairly basic self serve buffet, it did not represent good value for money and i would not stay there again.  Wifi was also an extra - with best service at an extra $20 a day  -whew!

title: 旅行
text:
友人二人と滞在しました
モダンな作りでお風呂場のタオルの補充も沢山あったりアメニティーのクオリティーが高かったり、言うことなしです！
ジムのマシンの数は少ないですが、新しい器具ですし、掃除も常に行き届いていて清潔です
またニューヨークに行ったら利用したいです

title: The higher the floor, the better
text: Hotel is in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. We recently stayed on the 14th floor and we could still hear sirens and cars honking from the street. I can't imagine how loud it is on the lower floors. Therefore, ask for a high floor room when you stay there. They have 26 floors.

title: Awesome contemporary lobby... The restaurant for breakfast overlooks Times Square
text:
This is a nice hotel. The Lobby and common areas are all fantastic. My favorite was the morning breakfast overlooking Times Square, it's very picturesque. The platinum elites get breakfast free and it was pretty good! 

The rooms are small (what you may expect in Time Square) but it was comfortable and clean. For the price, I'd stay here again.

title: Luna di miele
text: Location perfetta per godersi la grande mela. Praticamente al centro del mondo. Camere accoglienti e servizio impeccabile. Sono stato per la luna di miele, ma perfetto anche per soggiorni di lavoro. Consigliatissimo.

title: Mittendrin statt nur dabei
text: Ausgezeichnete Lage. TOP Zimmer. Super Lounge und Bar mit Blick auf den Times Square. Ausgezeichnetes Essen und Cocktails. War sehr zufrieden mit meinem Aufenthalt. Auch kleine Tagungsräume vorhanden.

title: Great services makes a big difference
text: I stay here every January for work and visit periodically throughout the year. The great customer service that I get from all the employees here, bellmen, front desk, concierge, room services is phenomenal. The hotel is well kept, the rooms for the location are good sizes and the location is great - minutes for soho, minutes from the subway, minutes from great attractions. If you're looking for great services, great location and an overall great experience, you just found it =)

title: NO RESPETA LAS RESERVAS
text:
Teníamos una reserva confirmada por BOOKING.COM de una habitación superior con 2 camas dobles, planta elevada y vistas. Al llegar, no nos dicen nada y nos dan una habitación pequeñísima con 1 sola cama. Bajamos las maletas y en ingles, pues el único recepcionista no sabia español y no llamó a nadie del hotel para traducir, le dijimos que esa habitación no correspondía a nuestra reserva, la cual le habíamos mostrado por escrito. Sin decir nada, ni sorry, nos cambia la habitación a otra de un piso bajo. Al volver a decirle que nuestra reserva era de planta elevada, sin decir ni sorry, nos dice, en ingles, que el hotel está completo. Tuvimos que conformarnos con el piso bajo, donde no pudimos dormir por culpa del ruido de la calle, pues el hotel está en una zona muy ruidosa y está muy mal aislado del exterior.
Al dia siguiente, después de volver a reclamar tanto en booking como e el hotel, nos dieron, sin decir ni sorry, la habitación que tocaba, con las molestias de maletas de una habitación a otra, etc...
En cuanto al hotel seria un 3 estrellas en España (como mucho) está bastante baqueteado y precisa un plan renove. El principal defecto, además del energúmeno que nos atendió el primer fin de semana en el checking, es el aislamiento exterior que es malo, pues se oye bastante incluso en la planta 21 que fue la tercera habitación que nos dieron. El personal, que hay de todo, lo hay muy amable y lo hay sin educación. En la planta L general, hay personal que suele hablar español, pero el de recepción que nos atendió el primer día, no se molestó en llamarles para atender mejor nuestras quejas. El ultimo día en el checkout si había una chica que hablaba español y que fue muy amable y nos quitó algunos cargos de consumiciones por todas las molestias ocasionadas. De todas formas, en general, no recomiendo este hotel y la zona, demasiado céntrica y ruidosa, siempre está colapsada de tráfico, por lo que no la recomiendo tampoco.

title: Great location, Good rooms but a few 'little things' could make a 'big difference'
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights in October for our very first visit to New York.

The good points:

1.  Rooms are a good size
2.  The view from the bar/restaurant is amazing
3.  The service in the bar is good
4. Bathrooms are well equipped and housekeeping very good
5.  The location could not be better 

What could be better:

1.  Wi-fi should be free.  I am a Marriott Rewards member but booked the holiday via Virgin Holidays.  I called Reception and asked but I was told it was not included

2.  Because we had booked through Virgin Holidays, we were not entitled to breakfast as part of our package.  We were offered to upgrade for $50 PER DAY for 2 adults and our 6 year old child, which seems a lot of money.

3.  The service on check-in and check-out felt very impersonal.  There was no dialogue or offer of help (with directions/amenities etc) on check-in and no 'how was your stay?' on check out?  It just felt very transactional.  

4. The bar was closed for 2 of our 4 nights, due to private parties, which I think should be made clear to guests.  We used the bar for the first 2 nights so I was really very disappointed that we could not use it for our last 2 nights.   

So, overall.  It is a great hotel but I have scored it 'average' as I think a few small things could make a huge difference to the experience.

title: Times Square Special
text: Looking for a great hotel in the heart of Times Square, this Renaissance is a great option with subway stops very nearby, more tourists than you can imagine and loads of great amenities! The restaurant has an amazing view of Times Square and the food is excellent. The gym is great and the front desk staff was top notch!

title: Fab Hotel & Location
text: Great hotel in a superb hotel.  Room was modern, well equipped and clean.  Staff were a pleasure and nothing too much trouble for them.  Breakfast room/restaurant overlooks Times Square and is great to 'people watch'.  Perfect base to tour the city from and the sightseeing hop on/off bus stops right outside!

title: Great location, great staff.
text: I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience the "touristy" attractions in NYC.  Location was great - right in Times Square, with a good view from the hotel restaurant.  You have a subway station on the corner that will get you to a lot of the tourist attractions to the north and south of Times Square.  Staff was so helpful and great.  The rooms were good size for a NYC hotel.  The carpet in the room was a little dated, but everything else was fine.  Only issues - pay for Wifi in room (I know you can get for free as a member), no free coffee or small breakfast spread and drinks were pricey (but probably just a NYC thing in general).

title: Just Fine
text: I chose this hotel because it is 2 blocks from the Wintergarden, where I was going to see School of Rock with my grandson. If you need to be in the Times Square area, this Renaissance scores an "excellent" for location.  In addition, despite the always bustling Times Square, my room was quiet. I also found the staff to be pleasant and helpful, though I had to ask the front desk why I was being charged for WiFi even though I'm a Marriott Rewards member.  It turns out you have to accept one of the payment options, but then the charge doesn't appear on your bill because you're a Rewards member. I couldn't give this property the highest rating because the room furnishings are dated and starting to look a bit shabby.  I also found the music in the common areas annoying and loud.

title: Great location, mediocre hotel - nice staff though
text:
Right on Times Square. Location is everything. Our first time in the area, we were shocked to find the 5-star price didn't include breakfast, bottled water ($8 Evian), wifi ($17 in room). Small, ordinary hotel room, with a view of a construction site where the welding went on past 11:00 pm opposite our 19th floor room on a holiday weekend. 
Front desk staff and the concierge were very friendly and accommodating.

title: Service was horrible and rude.
text: I recently stay on 10/16-10/19/2016.  First off, I did mobile check in on the Marriott phone at on the day of arrival.  Room is ready. When I show up, the front desk said that I don't have a reservation, and it was cancelled.  I show him my confirmation number, and he said he'll try to get me in since there are plenty of room left.  I told him it's my first time at the hotel, but he didn't even bother to tell me where the lounge is or how to get to my room.  The host on the second floor lobby said I should join them in the R lounge for 1 free appetizer for elite members.  However, they all neglect to tell me that I needed a coupon from the hotel front desk because the front desk guy did not give to me.  When I show up at the R lounge to see what it was about the next day, they said I have to be an elite member and have a coupon from the front desk.  The guys was extremely rude about it too.  They call and check the front desk, and confirm that I was an elite member.  But then, they told me I still have to go downstairs to get the coupon.  I finally went downstairs to get the coupons, but then they said it was only valid for certain days.  So Monday coupons only works for Monday and Tuesday for Tuesday.  This is just silly.  Appetizer is like $10-$15 or something, but I was so tick off, I didn't even bother to go there.  From the vacant seating in the R lounge, they could have used another customer for the dinner time.  Anyway, location is nice, room is clean and comfortable, but the service is really bad.  I would not stay at this Renaissance.  NYC have plenty of Hotels for $370-$460 per night with much better customer service.

title: Girls Weekend with Mom and Sister
text:
This location can't be beat, you can see that from the address. Let's get right to it! 

Check in was seamless, and both front desk agents were super friendly and personable, even late on a Friday night. We booked with points, so sometimes since we're not bringing revenue in on the room side, that can lead to subpar service, not at this place! We were quickly checked in, told where breakfast and the lounge were and led to the elevator. Bonus points for that! 

You take one elevator from Ground to Lobby, then cross over to another elevator that takes you up to the rooms. This could have been a little better explained with signage, but not a deal breaker. The decor is just beautiful here, soft lighting, knick knacks and interesting things to look at everywhere. The lobby level even had a table with adult coloring pages and colored pencils! 

R lounge is the lounge overlooking times square with cocktails and a small bites menu. Great location, great drinks, bites were good, but service left something to be desired. We asked for waters, two beers and a cocktail. The waters came 10 minutes later alone. Then the drinks. Three ladies at the table in heels and makeup and they didnt offer nor bring glasses for the beers. Not a deal breaker, but it seems like the kind of place that should at least ask. Nevertheless! 

The room itself was typical, nothing really stood out....except the speaker in the bathroom. This was a funny moment that I'm sure we werent the first to have! We turned on the TV and couldnt hear anything....but it seemed to be coming out faintly from across the room. Could NOT figure it out...til we opened the bathroom door and the sound was deafening! There's a little slider in there for the TV sound! Had never seen that before, and it definitely made for a laughing moment. I guess if you're watching something you can turn the sound off the TV and on in the bathroom to not miss anything? Hilarious. 

Beds were comfortable, clean and pillows as well. Never bothered by housekeeping coming early, etc. timing was great here.

 Checkout was just as smooth, concierge held our bags through the day while we explored the city and picking them up was QUICK.

I think the most impressive thing about this property was the friendliness of every single staff member we ran into. I'm terrible with names but I wish I wasnt because they all deserve recognition. Kudos to the team here, you're doing an amazing job!

title: Excellent service and great location
text: If you are travelling to the USA and want to be in the hustle and bustle of New York then this hotel is perfect for you. Although the hotel is located right next to Times Square, as soon as you step foot into the lobby and your hotel room it is very peaceful and quiet - it does not feel like you are in one of the busiest cities in the world. Staff are very friendly and accommodating.

title: Renaissance midtown hotel
text: The location was perfect. Not in a noisy part of the city but close enough to walk into Times Square. The staff couldn't do enough to help us and were very friendly. A special shout out to Rannie on the 6th floor lobby who we absolutely adored! She helped us every night with things to do and see and gave us directions. A very valuable member of staff who deserves an excellent review. Will definitely be returning to the renaissance hotel.

title: Short 4 day stay in New York City
text: First of all the location of the hotel is great ! right in the middle of Times Square. Our room is very nice & clean . It seamed to be recently updated . The room had a coffee maker and a small fridge ,we had a view of times Square so it was a little noisy because of the construction across the street but our room was nice. We did not eat at the restaurant at the hotel or go to the lounge. There are so many options close by , you can walk to any play  or restaurant. Overall I would rate this hotel a 4

title: A great Times Square location
text:
Stayed at The Renaissance Times Square.  Room was big enough. nice amenities.
Loved location--if you are planning on going to the many theaters on Broadway, so many are in walking distance from this hotel. Also many restaurants, and fun places to visit like the Hershey Store, M&M store, restaurant with singing waitstaff.

title: Good Hotel
text: The staff at the hotel was very nice the only problem we had was that it seemed as if housekeeping didn't clean our well. Housekeeping never vacuumed our room and neither did they clean the bathroom well. Other than that the hotel was in a great location. Every one was super nice. If house keeping would have cleaned our room properly this hotel would have received an excellent status from me.

title: Great time
text: Rooms and decor was really modern and it was everything you'd expect from a New York hotel. Terrace room had weird views and the neighbor is an office building. So when you go to relax on the terrace you can see people working and they can see too. We had really great views of the city from the room without a terrace. We changed rooms because our second night we had more people. Restaurant and bar on sight was good. In the heart of the city. really close to all transportation if you're visiting other parts of the city. Really great restaurants in walking distance.

title: Rooms need attention
text: Stayed here for a Broadway show in October. Perfect location for Broadway. Hotel is good common areas nice but rooms need some attention. Our room was tired and in need of some attention. Also had an odd smell seemed to be covered with a sweet deodorizer. Stayed only one night but would not have stayed longer.

title: muy buen diseño
text: Cuando llegamos a NYC el primer día nos hospedamos en este Hotel y aunque estuvimos con mi novia un solo dia, la ubicación del hotel fue excelente, estuvimos en la mitad de Times Square con la vista hacia la calle. La habitación no era muy amplia pero el diseño dice mucho del estilo del hotel. Muy buen staff en el lobby y en el bussiness center tambien, nos trataron con mucha amabilidad.

title: NYC sites
text: Great property. Clean rooms, fabulous location to plays, restaurants, big bus, subway. Only suggestion is: get a room at the highest floor level-New York City is noisy. Very friendly bar that serves food and floor to ceiling windows that overlook the city.

title: Better than expected!
text:
My husband is Marriott Platinum and we stayed here for five nights on a family visit to see the sights of NYC with our two young children (ages 9 & 10). I wasn't expecting much because I know NY hotels are small and cramped.  This hotel was perfect and certainly exceeded my expectations!  

The check-in staff were so nice and gracious! I can't remember the gentleman's name at the front desk (blonde, from NJ is all I know) but he even personally walked us outside the hotel and down the block to direct us to the right subway (we were late for dinner and in a hurry).  The bell men were also so nice and gracious to our kids (Sayeed, I believe his name was).  On our arrival, he told my two children all the fun things to do that are within close proximity to the hotel.  This was their first experience to NYC and he made them feel so welcome and excited about their vacation! 

The breakfast was so amazing overlooking Times Square.  We could really sit down and just enjoy the views and city before we started our day. 

One night when we arrived back from our long day out they were offering a free glass of wine!  It's just the little things that are so nice to see.

I talked to several of the concierge and they were all so nice and very helpful! 

The only thing I think they could improve on is better mattresses.  They weren't bad, but they could definitely be better for Marriott standards.  It would not discourage me from staying here though.  

Thank you Renaissance Times Square for a wonderful home away from home!

title: Holiday weekend
text: My friend and I stayed here on Columbus Day weekend  to visit some friends in the city. I used the mobile app to check in and out. It was quick and easy and very convenient. I was notified that my room was ready far before my 1pm request, which was very nice since we did  arrive earlier than expected. The lady who checked us in was very nice and welcoming as was the gentlemen who was working security later in the night. The extra pillows I had requested on the mobile app were waiting on the bed when we walked in. The room was clean and comfortable and the bed was amazing. The location could not be more ideal. It made it very easy to get everywhere. I will definitely stay here again! Thank you!!

title: Best Beds Ever
text: Of all of the hotels I've slept in - these had the most comfortable beds and pillows ever. EVER! I should have asked what they were so I could buy them for home. The location is perfect. You can't get much closer to Times Squares. There was construction on the building across from us and I was worried noise would be a problem, but it wasn't. Front desk was very accomodating and decor trendy and fun. I will definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Absolutely amazing.
text:
We won a 3 night trip to New York in a competition and they put us up in this amazing hotel, we were treated like royalty. The Renaissance has THE best view in Times Square, it was awesome. Staff are really friendly and acommodating, they couldn't do enough for us what to see, do and where to eat at reasonably priced restaurants.
All in all we had an amazing stay, ordinarily the Renaissance is somewhere we would only be able to stay if we had won the lottery, thank's guys for a memorable enjoyable time.

title: En El Centro de Time Square
text:
Hotel excelentemente bien ubicado , si lo que uno quiere ver es luz, brillo,colores y sonido. 
Espacioso y confortable,con categoría en Time Square !
Buena atención en conserjería, personal con franca amabilidad , aunque con poco o nulo español. 
Limpieza y acondicionamiento de habitaciones , impecable. 
Buen lugar sin dudas.

title: Great location
text: Great location near the subway and attractions.  Very nice staff that had several suggestions for our group of six.  Bar staff was engaging and helpful.  Only downside was the constant outside noise 24 hours a day but it is NYC and you have to expect that.

title: Surprisingly below average for a Renaissance Hotel
text:
I've had such great experience with Renaissance Hotels in the past, I had high expectations for this trip, especially for the premium price of the room.  However, I was pretty disappointed with it.  This hotel spends so much energy being trendy, it forgets to be comfortable.

As a MR Platinum Elite member, I was promised a room upgrade but did not get one even when I asked for it.

Both of the room keys took 5 tries or more every time we wanted to open the door.

The ice bucket had disgusting orange slime on the inside of the lid. (see photo)

The king bed had queen sheets on it, so the sheets were constantly coming off whenever anyone was on the bed. (see photo)

The bed was hard as a rock.

The hotel has no room service!

There was someone smoking weed in the hallway outside our room multiple times each day three different days that we were there.  We reported it but the hotel did not do anything; so our room smelled like smoke for all three days.

This hotel is in a great location, but that doesn't overcome all of the negatives we experienced.  In the end, we checked out early and went to the Marriott Marquis for the rest of our stay.

title: Suprisingly Nice Times Square Hotel
text: We stayed here with kids who had never been to New York, so picked the Times Square location and prepared to deal with the crowds. The hotel is indeed directly north of the Times Square mob, but once inside the hotel is surprisingly quiet and relaxing. Check in was very smooth, and the rooms were small but nicely decorated and comfortable. The lobby lounge was also nice and quiet, though with sweeping views over Times Square. If you are going to stay in this area, this hotel is the best bet.

title: Great location modern rooms helpfull staff good value for money
text:
Very good location near subway stations,  modern rooms and very helpfull staff (ask for advice about resterunts).
Good value for money
