The only thing to improve is the number of lifts (only four)  3 mi nutes is  too long time waiting  for one

title: Stay somewhere else
text: I have stayed here several times.  I will not again.  This time, I wanted a very special trip so talked with hotel people several times. I asked for a high Broadway view near an Executive Suite, two of the more expensive rooms for 3 nights. Ended up they didn't have them on the same floor so I had to downgrade. The rooms overlooked a huge construction site across the street.  They can't help that, but be aware there are no rooms which overlook Times Square.  Broadway view is on the back with buildings, but that's better than construction.  I tried to get moved, but Customer Service seemed to care less. A good attitude would have made it a bit easier to take. The rooms are a bit tired; the towels are horribly stiff, no softener.  The Aveda products do not seem to be the normal quality, the keys of two people took about 5 tries to get them to work every time.  In short, it is not of normal Renaissance quality.  If you are going to spend the extra money, I recommend doing it somewhere else where you get what you pay for.

title: Location is great!
text: Gotta love the location of the hotel!!  Do not have to love how slow and inconvenient the elevators from ground floor to the reception area were.  No complaints about the room and FAR from the elevator!! The A/C unit worked overtime because it was stupidly hot and humid but the room stayed cool/cold.  The bar is very much designed to create more "private spaces" than a see and be seen bar but it seemed to have odd hours.  It's worth checking out the light fixtures in the lobby which are reminiscent of hanging sperm...odd choice!

title: Location can't be beat
text:
Spent 3 nights using points for a girls' weekend in NY.  Excellent experience from beginning to end. Able to check-in a bit early, drop our bags and head to the TKTS booth less than a block away for 1/2 price show tickets. Walked to theater, walked to 5th Avenue for shopping, took subway to 9/11 Memorial and Museum from station less than 1/2 block away! Concierge very helpful with directions, recommended wine bar for casual dinner, map - we found someone on duty whenever we needed help.
Breakfast buffet was very good, replenished frequently with hot, fresh food. Located in R Lounge, same as evening bar, with unbeatable views of Times Square. What a spectacular window on the world!
Room was plenty big and surprisingly quiet at night. Not disturbed by traffic sounds at all.
Would definitely stay here again - looking forward to next visit.

title: hôtel de classe avec des prix élevés.
text:
hôtel de classe avec des prix élevés.
hôtel très bien placé,  chambres, restaurant, lobby, bar et centre de conférence de classe. le personnel était toujours attentif aux besoins des  clients. le service est de bonne qualité dans tous les départements.

title: Great location and hip lounge area
text: We stayed for 1 night with our 2 kids ( 7 and 11). I thought the room was spacious enough for NY. Bathroom was large, good closet. The kids loved sitting on the window ledge. The valet guys are super nice. The concierge ladies were so helpful with helping my navigate the city while my husband worked. The breakfast was good- amazing view over time square. I loved the smell on the lounge level. Fun to have coloring for kids and adults! The rooms were clean and I was surprised- no noise! Close to everything! Subway station close too!

title: Superb
text:
I used my Marriott rewards points for a 5 night stay in August.  the service levels from reception, to bar and especially the concierge who spent what must have been over an hour booking us shows and excursions.

the location could not be better,  I have stayed at the Marriott Times Square but this place was so much better in every respect.

room comfort as expected from a 4 start Marriott/Renaissance property,  no disappointment,  i do like how they have pillows for everyone's taste.

Breakfast room was a little cramped and the selection limited but it what it did serve was fresh and tasty.

title: Location, location, location
text:
Location is fantastic. Right on Times Square (which is madness on steroids). 
Rooms are big and decor is modern.
Breakfast is ok but view from breakfast place is exceptional.
Wifi reception in room is TERRIBLE

title: Posizione centrale. buona accoglienza
text: Situato nel cuore di Manhattan , poco lontano dal palazzo delle Nazioni Unite, è stata un'ottima scelta per me che mi sono recata in città per la Climate week. Da lì potevo raggiungere tutte le location dove si tenevano le conferenze specie  quando il traffico si bloccava... e dovevo camminare a piedi. Camere ampie, con la dotazione per bevande calde in camera, personale accogliente, ai piani alti non arriva il rumore del traffico circostante

title: Renaissance is Beyond It's Time!
text: The Renaissance Hotel in Times Square is one of my favorite hotels in New York City! It is absolutely amazing! It is so modern and fresh looking. The views are unbeatable! From the rooms, you can see almost everything; but, the best place for a view (probably in all of Times Square) is the restaurant. Although it is not on a very high floor, you are able to see every inch of Times Square. (Tip: if you are a rewards remember there, they will let you sit at the table with the best view!) I went there three times in two days because you just have to see it at all the different times of the day! I recommend at night, but mornings are just as beautiful. Aside from the incredible restaurant, the rooms are very spacious and luxurious. The price is a little high, but it is more than worth it! I highly recommend this hotel for anyone; family, friends, business, etc. In my opinion, the Renaissance is the one of the best hotels in New York.

title: Great location
text: Great hotel. Right in heart of Times Square. Stayed 3 days. Free breakfast for Marriott silver or gold cardholders during the week, not weekends. Big bus tour half a block away and the discount Broadway ticket booth a short minute walk from the hotel. Walked with my son from Penn station / Madison Square Garden to the hotel each carrying our clothes in a backpack. If going to the Mets game or U.S. Open take the Long Island train across from Penn station. Taxi to that area is long and expensive.

title: Was there with my family and we all loved it!
text:
I visited for one night with my kids and my wife with the purpose of touring the Times Square area and the location of this hotel is excellent for doing just that.
We were able just to walk to so many different nice places within Times Square.
We had breakfast there and it is very nice that the hotel offers two different options for breakfast so we did not have to pay a full breakfast for everybody since my kids only wanted some eggs and juice. 
We also had some drinks and food at dinner time and the view is amazing without having to endure all the noise. 
I will return again as soon as we save enough to afford it.

title: overlooking Times Square, but not noisy
text: I stayed here for business due to its location to the office. The location is right next to Times Square (although for me it is too touristy). The lounge/breakfast spot has gorgeous views of Times Square. Breakfast was included for me because I am a gold member, otherwise it was $25 or $30. I would not pay for it! It was your basic bagels/toast/muffins, fruit, then three hot items. The rooms were a good size for New York and the bathrooms were updated and clean. I was worried about the noise since I am a light sleeper, but it was fine. If I have to go up for business again, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Great location but just a bed and bathroom
text: Yes it is the best location you could find to do Times Square. Our room overlooked Broadway and it was a 1 minute walk to Times Square and all that the locality has to offer. It was quiet in the room despite being so close. But don't expect any niceties. Not set up to feed people so breakfast was a frenzy and to not have cups is just cheap. If you wanted a coffee or tea you used a paper cup!!! But must admit we were there only to see Times Square so all good.

title: Heart of Times Square
text: Arrives early and the Hotel was very good in getting us a room after a short wait while we had brunch.   The view from the restaurant is amazing.   The room was super big, not used to that in NYC.   Bed was fantastic had a great sleep.   Staff very pleasant, concierge helpful.   Would stay again.

title: Fantastic location
text:
This hotel has location as a top reason to stay! Perfectly situated in Times Square it is right next door to where you purchase the New York pass which lets you skip the line and save money on sight seeing!

Also a few steps away you can catch a sight seeing bus, which is especially fun in the evening when the lights are stunning.

Catching the subway? You are literally steps away from an entrance.

In spite of being in Time's Square, which has to be one of the busiest and most lit places on Earth, the rooms in this hotel are dark and quiet. We were on the16th floor  and still were not bothered by the noise. Thank you room darkening shades to keep it nice and dark, too!

This hotel has a hip and cool vibe. The art is interesting and the view from the bar of Times' Square is really awesome. Great place for a photo without lots of people in the background! 

The sitting area has an amazing book nook. Even if you did not hit the big apple to read, you'll love this fun area for the decor.

I don't know who put notes in the elevators, but they have a sense of humor. In addition to the usual information on how many people can ride at once.....you know how many horses, pigeons, and eggs can ride, too.

This hotel has all the amenities you would expecting a hotel but there were some interesting and unexpected finds, too!!

The bathroom mirror has a large circle that must be heated and does not fog up like the rest of the mirror. Great when you are getting ready in a hurry or sharing the bathroom!

You can control the TV volume from a sliding wall switch in the bathroom. This was not immediately obvious to me. I kept thinking the switch was for dimming the lights. Meanwhile in the bedroom, it seemed the TV remote had a mind of it's own as I'm in the bathroom accidentally turning the volume up and down. LOL.

The staff was helpful and polite. All around this hotel is a great one for visiting!

title: Located in the heart of Time Square
text: The hotel is located in the heart of Time Square at 7th and 49th. If you want to be near lots of activity and attractions this is a great location.  We arrived by Amtrak into Penn Station and took the subway to 42nd, we should have stayed on until 50th as the walk is a short block and a half.  Hotel was clean and modern. The lobby, bar and restaurant are on the second floor overlooking Times Square and was a great place to sit and watch the action. We requested a room on an upper floor to avoid the noise.  You are one block from Radio City and across Times Square to Broadway and all of the theaters.  The room was clean and comfortable.  I will stay here again.

title: Hotel Rennassaince Times Square NY
text: Estuvimos en este hotel 5 días.La estancia fue muy buena.Nos dieron una habitación de 2 camas de unos 150,pues éramos tres.La habitación tenía vistas a times Square.Los colchones eran súper cómodos y las almohadas también.Las habitaciones estaban insonorizadas y la limpieza ,era muy buena y correcta.La cafetería que tiene vistas a times Square estaba muy bien.El personal atento y educado.Por supuesto la ubicación del hotel ideal y a mano de todo.Se hecho tiene una parada del metro al lado mismo.

title: Fantásticamente ubicado !!
text: El hotel está en todo el corazón de Times Squere , apenas sales del hotel estás en el centro del caos de NY , restaurantes , tiendas , teatros , bancos , souvenir , todo a literalmente un paso ,si vas NY por turismo o por primera ves el el hotel ideal , además de lo bonito , elegante que es , las habitaciones nuevas y amplias , limpias y bonitas , todo lo que pides en un Marriott , wifi gratis , 100% recomendado

title: Vibrant atmosphere , Comfortable rooms
text:
Overall I enjoyed my stay at Renaissance Hotel Times Square! 

Was there on business then leisure.  It's conveniently located in close proximity to many of the major tourist attractions. 

The staff is generally quite helpful - including Mikey the security guard who helped me navigate my way to the next leg of my trip. The doormen were also very gracious and polite.

(The reception staff was a little curt / snippy / stressed compared to another Times Square hotel I stayed at few days prior. So I found that behavior a bit surprising. But very little can get me off my NYC high! The city is amazing!

The rooms are nice - although it feels a bit like a time warp. Imagine a street entrance, lobby and restaurant that all look vibrant, edgy, classic, modern (albeit dimly lit) .... then you step back into the late 80's - rooms are dated with an awkward old sound system in the bedroom / bathroom. Weird.

Bed - very comfortable. 
Room - clean and decent in size with no view. I travelled alone so space wasn't a problem and I didn't care too much about having a view. 
I had no issue with the lifts - but perhaps I missed peak times - left super early and came back super late. 

FYI: 
No free wifi in the room - $20/day.
*Free wifi in the lobby & restaurant ;-)
Bottle of water - $8 each. Yup.
Breakfast - if not included in your package, will cost about $30 / day. 

Would I return? Ya sure ... As soon as renovations are done! 

Hope this review helps :-)

title: Great views, ideal for first time visit
text:
I took my sons, who are 21 & 18 for their first time to New York to this hotel as it appeared central.
The rooms were spacious, soft pillows, lots of towels. We merely sleep in rooms, we didn't get round to working out the coffee machine.
Most staff and check in was quick.
Breakfast bar had good coffee and croissants, fresh fruit.
Bar was expensive however the views are amazing.
We went early and always had a great view.

title: Perfeito
text:
Hotel perfeito excelente localização vistas fantásticas, pequeno almoço muito bom!
Valor enquadrado com o hotel!!!
Ideal para casais e amigos que adorem Nova York 
Aconselho a todos a visitar é magnífico

title: Horrible service/stay
text: Where to begin?  First of all, we are Marriott Members and it this location that means absolutely nothing. 1. First morning, woke at 8 AM to workers hitting the wall directly next door. Sounded like a bulldozer.  They were replacing carpeting. (At 8 AM). 2.  Air conditioner didn't work ... They don't care. 3.  USB connection on desk is broken...no charging devices. 4. The ONLY bar/restaurant in hotel was closed last night from 3-8 for a private event. Even though this bar is touted by Marriott as part of your stay. 5.  And finally, no free coffee in this hotel. So every morning we have been paying two dollars for a cup of coffee. This morning after using the gym I went to go get coffee and the price jumped up to three $. I explained to the woman at the bar the pricing difference and she told me I was wrong even though it is on our bill. We will never stay here again. I want to mention that when we reached out to the hotel manager yesterday and expressed our dissatisfaction about the bar being closed she advised that there are plenty of bars in the city. She also argued that there was no carpeting being changed in the hotel this week. (even though the front desk called us back to let us know carpet was being changed next door). Customer always wrong here. A $10 bottle of Prosecco does not fix things. (A gesture we returned to last night ). Thanks for reading !!!

title: Lovely hotel in the heart of the action
text:
The hotel's rooms are enormous, the hotel is clean and modern, we stayed on the 25th floor and could not hear anything happening outside. The beds and room are comfortable and the water pressure in the shower is really good, the hotel was a great price and all the staff were lovely; we were given a free upgrade to a high floor and free internet access because our shuttle took 4 hours to get to the hotel (through no fault of the hotel). We stayed a total of 11 nights. 
The only negatives about the hotel are the lack of room service, no dressing gowns in rooms, and the lifts are slow. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

title: In the heart of the action
text:
This is my 3rd or 4th time at this hotel. It is great if you love being right in the middle of the action. It is literally in the middle of Times Square. There is a subway entrance about 20 yards from the front door. The lounge and restaurant look out over TS and the view is phenomenal. The M&M store is across the street (and the Hershey store is on the corner (stop in for a free sample every time you walk by).
The down side of being in TS is that at night it is PACKED.  You can hardly walk it is so crowded. We always felt safe, but did worry about pick-pockets. Keep your wallet in the front pocket and hole your purse and backpacks to the front. 
Super convenient to the theaters. Staff is great and helpful. 
Weekdays have free breakfast - buffet - really good.
Teenagers complained about there not being enough plugs in the room to charge all their electronics...but I didn't see the problem.
From our room on the 24th floor, we rarely heard any noise from TS. The window would open slightly to let in the sound and let you feel like you are in the middle of all the action.

title: Renaissance Times Square
text:
If  you want a clean comfortable hotel right in the heart of Times Square then this might be the place for you.  It's a quick walk to the subway, numerous restaurants, and theaters.  However, the location comes at high price.  My room was decent sized and very quiet but no view to mention.

The staff at the front desk were particularly friendly and helpful.  I did find the restaurant suggestions of the Concierge staff to be somewhat suspect when on three separate occasions three different staff recommended the same overpriced restaurant for both breakfast and dinner even though getting there required me to walk by literally dozens of other restaurants that turned out to be much better.

title: Great location
text:
This hotel is in Times Square so a great location. You can hear the road a bit but this didn't stop us sleeping. Rooms were a good size and comfy. There were a few issues in our bathroom e.g. broken shower towel rail and door but we were offered a new room.

We ate breakfast at the hotel once but at 50 dollars for two it felt a bit overpriced so we went elsewhere for meals. 

The subway is nearby so was easy to walk lots and get the R line back to 49th street.

The hotel will store you cases if you check  out and don't fly until later which is nice.

Overall a good hotel.

title: Very good hotel at an extremely convenient location!
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance for one night on business and was pleased with the hotel. It is literally right in Times Square and only one block from where the famous apple drops on New Years eve. Very convenient walk to Time Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center and even Central Park.

The hotel itself is well appointed. I had a room with king sized bed. The room, for Manhattan standards, was spacious and had a nice view of the NYC skyline. Big screen tv, comfy big chair, spacious bathroom with walk-in shower that has a glass door and walls. 

The fitness room was nice, but could get crowded during peak hours. It has the usual cardio machines, elliptical, treadmill, stationary upright and recumbent bike, etc. It also had dumbells, medicine ball, universal weight system, etc. Again, pretty good space for a Manhattan hotel.

All in all, I was pleased with this hotel.

title: Enjoyable stay
text: I stay at Renaissance properties in North America and Asia. The staff are always friendly and accommodating and this was the case in Time Square. The location is central and walks to Central Park, the Rockefeller Centre and even to the High Line are completely manageable. Time Square is so busy and loud but our room, which was a reasonable size for NYC was very quiet - and we were only on the 9th floor. The hotel lobby is dark - it is on the 3rd floor with a nice view of Time Square from the bar/restaurant - but otherwise there is no natural light in that area and as such not. Place we chose to spend any time in. We enjoyed our stay - average price was $320/night for a three night weekend stay (without breakfast) - I felt we received reasonable value for that rate in NYC.

title: Stuck in the elevator - otherwise excellent!
text:
I stayed here in August with a large group.  The check-in was seamless.  The area right off the elevators smell terrific!  Not sure what scent they're piping in but I absolutely love it.  The drinks were good and strong and the bar has a nice view of the Times Square action.  All of the staff was hospitable.  My group had free coupons for one free drink and they were nice enough to honor the coupon after the allotted time period (some of us checked in late).  We were on the 25th floor and couldn't hear a thing from outside of the room.

The only bad part of the trip are the elevators.  They are slow.  We waited 15-20 minutes and that should've been a hint to take the stairs.  We didn't.  When we got on the crowded elevator (about 8 of us plus luggage) it stopped on every floor from 25 to 17, and then it got stuck.  We had to wait for about 30 minutes in that oppressively hot, claustrophobic space.  Some people became short tempered.  An older man became faint.  Someone kept calling us on the intercom every few minutes to ask if we were all right. They said the engineer was working on it.  After 20 minutes one of the guests called 911 for the fire department.  They arrived quickly and got us out.  I've never been so happy to see the New York fire department!  There were about 8 of them on the scene!  Management was there to give us free bottles of water (that they sell for an outrageous $8).  They were very apologetic.  My group had about 200 people and I guess we all descended upon the elevators at around the same time to meet in the lobby for a trip.  Still, it was a miserable experience.  At a later time during our stay, the staff on our floor (25) heard us by the elevator and let us (and other guests) onto the huge freight elevator which we all greatly appreciated!

Overall, would I stay here again?  Absolutely.  The rooms were clean, the staff was professional, the breakfast food was pretty good and the drinks (apple martini for me) was nice and strong!  Great stay except for the elevator mishap.

title: Great place to stay!
text: We Thoroughly enjoyed our Stay At the Renaissance Times Square New York. Perfect location! Very Convenient to everywhere. Located on 48th and7th Ave, step out of the hotel, turn you head to the right and look up- you'll notice the ball that's dropped on New year's Eve- Fantastic! Also relatively close to the Majestic theater on broadway-(Phantom of the Opera a must-see) Friendly staff, lovely atmosphere and most importantly, clean. I was concerned about staying there initially since they are a pet-friendly hotel and my son, and I are allergic to pet fur and dander. Totally unfounded. It turns out, the room was so clean, there was no evidence that pets were allowed. I was pleasantly surprised and will definitely stay at the Renaissance on our next visit to new York. Best Family vacation Ever!

title: Rooms are to freakin small
text: The rooms were so small and they still packed it with furniture. I also did not like how the washroom faces the bed directly. The location is convenient for sure and it is probably the only place you can eat a breakfast directly in front of the time square.

title: Time Square Jewel
text:
Traveled to NYC for a filming project and stayed here.  For starters, be aware that cab fare, Uber or even private limo services are going to cost you anywhere from $65-$85 one way from LGA to Times Square.  If you're paying more than that, you're either spending corporate dollars you don't care about, or you're not paying attention.  Find the right "black car" driver (as they're called) and he'll get you to TSQ faster than cabs by taking back roads to avoid traffic congestion and tolls.

When you first walk in to the Renaissance, it's not exactly impressive.  But wait for it.  There's a little ground floor "pre" lobby that can't be more than 800sf.  This is where you check in.  From here you take the elevator up two floors to the real lobby.  :-)   This is a beautiful area that has a modest lounge, a great bar and a dining area that looks directly over Times Square.  The view alone for breakfast is indeed full of stimulus.  You'll love it.  

The rooms are standard Marriott rooms; clean, good bed, and great views.  The 4th floor has balconies.  It cost more money, but is a nice amenity. 

Breakfast Buffet is $30 pp.  Pretty good.  There are however a half dozen mom-pop breakfast nooks within a 2 minute walking distance if you're looking for something with local flavor and atmosphere.

The staff is one of the best staff I've encountered in my travels.  They are courteous, helpful, conversational and excellent at what they do from the door man to housekeeping to conceirge to the staff that check you in. Treat them as you would want to be treated and it comes back 10-fold.  Tammy was my person at the front desk check in.  Extremely charming, accommodating and efficient.  She made me feel like i was returning home.  That's not easy to do but she did it well.  It's a very comforting feeling that makes any potential small annoyances (which there were none) easily tolerable. 

You're going to spend between $400 and $600 a night for the room.  But don't forget, you are in the very heart of Times Square which is the neon epi-center of tourism for NYC.  

Walk north a few blocks and there's plenty of NYC iconic deli's, irish pubs and other attractions.  South a few blocks is the famous Carmine's restaurant (on 44th) as well as Sardi's lounge.  

I would definitely stay here again.

title: Cannot beat the location if you want to be in the heart of Times Square
text:
I was in town to participate in an opening ceremony at NASDAQ and this was the perfect location for that event.  It's within easy walking distance of the NASDAQ plus it's close to many restaurants, bars, stores, etc.  It's loud at night and it's bright outside of your windows but the hotel provides black out shades.

The room was fine.  Clean, spacious, comfortable.  

Nice bathroom and good toiletries.

I always rate the gym and this one was good.

It's biggest selling point is location, location, location.

title: NICE HOTEL & GREAT LOCATION IN TIMES SQUARE!
text: We stayed here as a family in July and had a great vacation! The Renaissance is located right in Time Square with the Ball drop in Times Square as a view. Amazing! The rooms were nice and the décor very cool Renaissance! The L lounge was a great place to relax with a drink and an awesome view of the city. We would recommend this hotel for an NYC getaway! Cheers!

title: had good time in this  hotel
text: modern hotel located in city centre , Time Square. Our room on the 10th floor was large, clean and quite, with all  modern comforts. The hotel staff was friendly and professional. The room price was a little bit expensive.

title: Simply Amazing
text: I have to say, I don't quite get the negative reviews here, this hotel was truly amazing. Its located right on Times Square, my room on the 11th floor was never noisy and there was a lot happening down on TS, there is a subway station 49th street available a block away and also a couple of pharmacies 2 min away walking or less. The hotel once inside is simply beautiful and check in is NOT on the 8th floor like someone reviewed here earlier, you walk in and check in immediately, then take an elevator to the R Lounge/consierge area and change elevators to your floor (if that's too much for you then sorry). The RLounge is simply elegant and the décor is pretty nice, excellent views of TS, I was given a voucher for a free item there but I was too busy to cash it in, sucks because the food I saw people eating looked delicious, I did have breakfast on my last day there which was amazing, plenty of good protein and carbs to choose from, worth the money. My room was really clean and smelled great, clean with plenty of accessories in the bathroom and blow drier too, I enjoyed the cabinet space and the size of the Simmons bed which was really comfortable, I wanted to take the pillow with me on the plane. The curtains are huge and dark so it prevents any light coming into the room from TS, I loved it, truly enjoyable. Everyone was real friendly and when it began to rain one of the men downstairs in the lobby offered me an umbrella so that was cool too. I would recommend that if you are getting a Uber, Lyft or taxi when you check out, walk a block over away from 7th/broadway street because once you get on the car, you might be stuck on traffic for a while getting out to LGA airport. I had an 1115 departure, left the hotel at 0830 and barely made it because of the construction at LGA which is supposed to be bad for the next 2 years since supposedly they are tearing down Terminal B. Have fun, enjoy the Renaissance.

title: So Central and Comfortable
text:
We had a lovely time here. We arrived early and were able to put our bags in storage until our rooms were ready and were able to go and explore Manhattan and Brooklyn.

The front desk staff are really very good. We had an issue in that the rooms we were allocated hadn’t been vacated. When I went all the way back down to reception they apologised profusely and upgraded us to a room on the top floor. Not a big deal - A mistake which was rectified immediately, professionally and pleasantly.

I say “all the way back down” as the lift situation is the only drawback about the whole hotel. There are two lifts at the ground floor reception which take you up a couple of floors to the lobby with the restaurant / bars and lifts to the rooms. One of the lifts to and from the reception was always out of order and meant long waits (2 to 3 mins) every single time. The lifts to the rooms were fine.

The view from the R Lounge Bar is spectacular as it looks directly down Broadway. We managed to get window seats at breakfast one morning and at night for drinks after coming back from a show. Definitely worth a visit. We found all the bar / restaurant staff to be efficient and pleasant. The breakfast on the Friday we were there was very good and was free for Marriott Gold Members. However it is not free on Saturday and Sunday and is $30+ per person when you take taxes and tips into account. We ate out on our third morning and got great value for money. Cocktails are similarly priced to the rest of this area and are delicious.

You are at the centre of everything here. The red bleachers by the TKTS booth are just outside the door. You really can’t get any more central.

Loved our stay here and would definitely stay again. Sort out the lifts though please!

title: Need to improve
text: Stayed here for seven nights. Rooms pleasant and tidy. Breakfast is very poor standard. Toaster does not work properly. Takes ages!  Food selection very disappointing and not very good quality. Food and tea and coffee often cold. Lifts are terrible. The other day people got stuck in the lift and the management handled the situation extremely poorly. Manager on duty at the time was more interested in the other customers and not concerned for the welfare of the people in the lift.  Took ages to get them out!

title: another great visit
text: this was my second trip this year and I have been happy every time.  The platinum breakfast is excellent, with a beautiful setting over Times Square,  While there isn't a lounge, you are provided with a coupon for a food item from the bar - again overlooking Times Square.  Service is very good, and rooms are big for New York.  The location can't be beat.  Can't wait to return

title: a whatever room with screeching A/C
text:
My poor experience may have occurred because I used Marriott Points for this stay and the hotel did not appreciate it.

First off, Renaissance hotels are my favorite Marriott brand of hotels and I've been to quite a few of them. I've been Marriott Gold/Platinum for years and I appreciate the level of quality that Marriott provides across its' brands and locations.

The entrance and the lobby were wonderfully styled! That being said, I am not impressed at all with this Renaissance location and would not recommend it anyone. 

The first room was a handicap accessible room (I am not handicap), room was run down, and the A/C in the room was generating a high pitched screeching noise. I didn't notice the A/C noise when I first checked in as we dropped off our bags and then went out to enjoy the city. As we were getting ready for bed the noise was quite evident. Went down to the front desk and after showing them a video recording of the noise. They made it sound like they were doing me a favor by assigning me another room. They made two keys for the new room, went up to the new room and the keys didn't work! Leaving my family standing in the hall with our bags, I had to then go back down to down to the front desk to get the keys programmed, didn't even get an apology for the issue. But the desk did make a courtesy call up to the room after to ensure that we were able to get in.

Other minor issues:
Did mobile check-in but the room/key was not ready. 
Did not get greeted/recognized for Marriott rewards status.

title: Great Location right on Times Square
text: This is perfect location for being right in the middle of Times Square with everything conveniently walking distance. There are many restaurants and shops located close by. The hotel is nice and clean with helpful staffs.  Highly recommended!!

title: Fabulous!
text: The hotel was right on Time Square and central to everything. The reception staff were very friendly and checked us in quickly and efficiently. As requested we were given a room on one of the upper floors to have peace & quiet and we were placed on the top floor (26th floor!). The room was very spacious, clean and so comfortable. The R Lounge offered amazing views of Time Square in all its glory, it looked beautiful at night. We loved the entire trip, would stay here again and would happily recommend the hotel to everyone!

title: Acceptable, but not that great
text:
I stayed at the Renaissance Times Square for two nights on business.  The location is right at the center of Times Square.  People can disagree about whether Times Square is a good place to stay in NYC, so I will not dwell on the location.

You enter the Renaissance at the street level.  The entry is a small room where you check in.  It can be very cramped, dark and crowded at times, depending on how busy they are.  You then go to the lobby by two elevators that go no higher than the lobby.  The elevators are very slow, and if there are lots of people checking in, it can take a long time to get to the lobby.  The lobby is a long narrow room with a concierge and a bar.  You must cross the lobby and go to another bank of 3 elevators to get to your room.  Again, if there are lots of people wanting to get to their rooms, it can take a long time to get to your room.

I had a king room, and it was very small.  The headboard and furniture felt very worn, and the room felt very dark.  The bed was just fine.  Bathroom, soaps and shampoos were very good.

Over all, the staff was friendly and helpful.  In fact, the staff was probably the best part about the Renaissance.

We had food brought into our meeting at the hotel.   Like a lot of "meeting food" it was just ok.  The bar/restaurant has a GREAT view of Times Square, but one night there was a private event, and was denied access to the bar/restaurant.  To me, this was totally unacceptable.  As a hotel guest, I felt like taking the entire facility for a private party was not fair to the rest of the hotel guests.

Finally, the hotel did not have the "posh" feeling like I would expect at a Renaissance Hotel.  You expect above average accommodations.  At this hotel, accommodations and facilities were below average.  Stay there if you want to be ON Times Square.  But I expect that there are better options available in the area.

title: Really good
text: Stayed here for 5 nights while visiting New York. Our room was clean and fresh. We arrived at 9:30 in the morning after a red eye flight. They do not have check in till 4 but found us a room by 12 and we were able to have a good sleep. The hotel staff could not have been more accomodating from the check in throughout the stay. The concierge desk was excellent. They helped with everything and were very friendly. The doorman was excellent and helped us get taxis when necessary. I liked the way that the check in was on the street level and then only those who were staying at the hotel could go up to the second level. I felt quite secure in this hotel. For the location it was very quiet. We faced times square and that was a show in itself. But there were great black out curtains and we had undisturbed sleep. While out package did not include breakfast there is a new feature in this hotel. You were able to go to a little pick and go convenience centre on the same level. They had juice, yogurt, sandwiches all very reasonable and you could sit in the booths in the lobby and order coffee and tea. It was a great idea. My hats off to the lady running this section she was so kind and lovely. Every time we went she brought us extra cups of tea and coffee and was so friendly. I cannot really say enough about the staff from check in through exit. They were professional, friendly, helpful and could not have been more accomodating. I would stay here again! Thanks for a great experience Renaissance Times Square. Oh, yes and they even had apples on the check in desk as we headed off to the air port. Class act.

title: Good location - wouldn't stay again
text:
The location is ideal for first timers to New York as everything is on your doorstep, for me personally the crowds were too much near the hotel so I wouldn't stay here again. This is my second time and this hotel and it wasn't as great as the first.

Check-in was great really speedy and room was even ready a little bit earlier than 4pm, not by much I think we arrived about 3:30pm but still early! We were up on the 24th floor and had a nice-ish view out onto Times Square if you looked down and to your right a bit. We had a double double bed room which was quite spacious and the beds are very very comfy. It wasn't as clean as I remember it being last time and is definitely in need of an update. No free wifi in the rooms which is a bit of a rip off at almost $20 for 24hours and considering the price you pay for the room anyway I would think this should be included. You can get free wifi in the lobby, which is terrible. 

The only downside to having a floor so high up is the lift situation with only three lifts from the lobby to do the whole hotel which can be and was a nightmare at times. One day it took us almost 30 minutes to get lift to our floor and back down again. Also the lifts from the front desk to the lobby, one of them was broke three times during our stay.

Check-out was super quick as well and the hotel kindly stored our bags until our car arrived that afternoon. 

This is an OK hotel but I would not stay again, not only because of the crowds but because I do not feel this is a four star hotel.

title: Mcenaney
text: Great location.  The rooms are great although no mini bar or room service was a bit disappointing.  But the food options in the street  where great it was fine.  The elounge was a nice place to meet and they have stuff for the kids to do, which was nice.  The door man was lovely, really friendly.  I would stay here again.

title: 老旧的酒店
text: 傲慢的服务，老旧的设施，有年头的酒店了，建议大家选择紧挨着的万豪马奎斯酒店，紧紧挨着，价格也差不多一样价位，但是感受要差太多了，万丽的周围环境也没有万豪好。这是我第一次选择万丽这个品牌，以后看来还是老老实实住万豪吧。

title: Vey Nice Hotel In The Center of the Action
text:
Stayed at the Renaissance on a family mini-vacation last week.  Staff was very friendly at every encounter, which is somewhat of an oddity in NYC.

Location is awesome...literally on the north end of Times Square.  Walking distance to everything in midtown.

Had booked a standard double room, but we were informed at arrival that they were out, and they quickly (and without being asked) upgraded us to a suite.  Very appreciative of the suite, and even more appreciative of the way they handled this.

Room was ridiculously spacious for NYC, and the furnishings seemed up to date and higher quality.  A little wear and tear in spots, but that's trivial at best.

Dining room overlooks Time Square, for an incredible view. Ate breakfast each day while people watching...pretty cool.

Utilized the concierge for some help with transportation, was very thorough and clearly new his stuff.  Doorman also very attentive and gracious, helped us grab cabs a couple of times and was very friendly and polite.  A+ on the staff here.

Will definitely stay here on next trip to NYC!  Simply too many positives not to consider.

title: Muy buena ubicacion,  pleno Time square
text: Para novato en Nueva York, ubicacion inmejorable, ceraca de todo. Habitacion comoda en un piso 20, aislada del ruido y acondicionada. El desayuno no incluido, pero la vista del restaurante y sus productos son muy buenos. Internet de pago.

title: Location, location, location
text:
I enjoyed my time there. Awesome location. Not only are you in the middle of Times Square, you are also close to all of the theatres, subway, restaurants etc...
We took a hop on hop off bus tour and the stop was 10 steps from the hotel.
Even though you're so close to all of the action (but sometimes chaos), the hotel is quiet & peaceful. We loved the action of Times Square but equally loved the calmness of our hotel room. 
Room was a great size. I've stayed in a few NYC hotel rooms and this one was considerably bigger. Beds & pillows were comfortable. Room was clean. Mini fridge in there too. Able to control temperature in room. Free wifi in lounge. Staff was friendly. 
The gem of this hotel is without a doubt, the RLounge restaurant. Even if you decide to book another hotel, you must visit the RLounge. It has unmatched views of Times Square. Good food (we had apps), good drinks and INCREDIBLE views of Times Square. Having a glass of champagne and soaking in the views, was quite memorable. We were celebrating my Mom's 65th birthday while there, and the staff really took care of us. We were very appreciative.
I have two small disappointments as far as the hotel is concerned. One is that there is no way to email the hotel. Weird. It's 2016. We should be able to email the hotel. Secondly, I had informed them (by phone call) that it was my Mom's 65th birthday. I was hoping they would have done a little something to make her feel special. Chocolate covered strawberries? Or, perhaps a fruit basket? Wine? Something small to acknowledge her. 
This was not a huge deal and would obviously very happily book the hotel again. I have total faith in recommending this hotel to others. Enjoy.

title: Great Location-Hotel Is "Ok"
text: Great location.  A little pricey, but it's NYC-Times Square.  The front desk was not especially polite or helpful, however the doorman was very accommodating.  The rooms were clean, but nothing special.  We paid extra for a "view" and looked at a crane.  We did not eat at the restaurant.  There was a refrigerator in the room. The bathrooms had plenty of space, but the water pressure was low. I thought we would get a bit more for what we paid and for it being a Renaissance Hotel.

title: Prime location but could use some service upgrades
text:
Absolutely right in the center of Times Square. Awesome view over the square every morning for breakfast.  Rooms were clean and bright (with a little tattered carpeting).  Bed and pillows were wonderful as usual at a Marriott.
Things they need to work on:
1. No room service.  What?  No I don't want to walk down to the bar and order a burger in my PJ's and bring it back to me room.
2. Lack of rewards. As a Gold Member I was given a few coupons to use one per day for "Any one item on the restaurant menu."  Well, two nights the restaurant was closed for private gatherings.  So those coupons were worthless. The other night I ordered a drink off the menu and handed the waiter the coupon. "Oh, you can't use those on drinks."  Hmmmm....that is not what the front desk said.  I was out $15 bucks. (Note for rewards members there is free breakfast...which is very well done.)
3. Low water pressure.  Rainfall shower heads are trendy but not at all satisfying.  Replace them!

title: Разочарована
text: Отель находиться в самом центре Times Square. Очень шумно и много-много людей вокруг. Отель очень старый. Шумная вентиляция в номере. Холодильник отключали, так как тарахтел сильно. Завтраки ужжжасные!!! У нас был клубный номер у доступом в клубный лаунж. Пришли в первый вечер на ужин, а нам говорят, вам не положено! Пока суть да дело, разбирались, звонили на ресепшн, получили купоны, пропустили. Кухня и на ужин никакая, обслуживание посредственное. На завтрак в первый день нас тоже не было в списках, опять разбирались. Короче, своё нужно выгрызать у них зубами. Однозначно, больше ни ногой!

title: great location, friendly staff
text: The hotel was relatively quiet for the middle of times square. Check in is on street level -4 desks- then you take elevator up to main floor. Concierge desk is here and so is the bar and restaurant.  There is no big  fancy lobby its relatively quite . We had drinks and appitizers not dinner. The view is Great- you are looking right over times square.  The room was a typical king- shower only (they said Kings do not have tub, only double queens?) but clean and comfortable .  Staff was very friendly. Nothing bad about the hotel at all but nothing great.

title: Ordinary Hotel
text: We had a week long stay at this hotel .It has a very modern look in the main areas ,the view looking out to Times Square when having breakfast was amazing ,your right on top of all the action ,watching the early morning unfold was entertaining .But we found the do it yourself breakfast buffet annoying ,with no cutlery on the table and do it yourself coffee ,it seemed to us that it was more for business travelers than tourist .It did change on The weekend when we had cutlery on table and coffee served by waiters ,much better ,food was ok but was a small selection compared to other hotels we had stayed in on this trip .Room was clean ,but we had a torn side of our mattress not what you'd expect from Renaissance brand ,it wasn't cheap to stay in this hotel ,we did expect more for our dollar .Staff were nice and the girls that cleaned our room great !!!

title: Pricey, but great location and clean, quiet property
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights to see broadway shows.  Had stayed here last Spring as well, did note changes since last stay, particularly re: access to R Lounge on 2nd floor...It is not accessible for food/drink mid-day anymore - now opens at 5p.m.  If you stay on a club floor (or I suppose pay additionally for breakfast buffet @ 29.95), you do sit here for breakfast buffet which was included with our renaissance suite 25th of 26 floors) - staff extremely pleasant and helpful.  Food was tasty, but quite limited and pretty much the same each morning: rotated/either: pancakes/waffles/french toast sticks;   scrambled eggs; pork sausage; bacon; FRESH fruit; dry cereals; OJ; breads/bagels/muffins; coffee/tea.  Had cocktails here in the evening after show: VERY Expensive : $ 17.00 for a K1 on the rocks (YIKES); craft cocktails (e.g., mojito @ 15.50).  Bellmen were very friendly and engaging, apologized immediately for bags taking a "bit too long" to get up to our suite.  Suite had 2 full bathrooms (deciding factor in paying more for this vs. traditional room), though the "master" bedroom bathroom was handicap accessible, which meant that we had no bathtub, rather a wheelchair roll-in shower w/ hand held water wand - did not expect this.  Also, the bathroom sink was lower to floor, with a very small (12" in diameter at most) sink bowl, which resulted in water splashing down the front of vanity and on to the floor every time  you used the sink.  As with most hotels, and I still don't know why they do this, but there were NO (zero) wall hooks to hang clothes, towels, etc...I realize it's a handicap accessible bathroom, but NOT every guest who stays in this suite has a handicap. * There is NO view of Times Square from any (bed)room in this hotel, I don't think.. only views of side streets (7th Avenue- odd numbered rooms and Broadway  - even numbered rooms), so I would ask for even numbered room, better view of Broadway.  Though only 2 elevators from entrance lobby up to next bank of elevators to access hotel rooms, we never really had to wait too long for an elevator.  They did have a "mini convenience store" set-up on the 2nd floor outside the R Lounge during morning hours at least...bottled beverages, yogurts, fruit, sandwiches, etc. could be purchased (I don't remember them having this last Spring).
The location is AMAZING...Times Square is literally a walk across the street.  There is an Olive Garden right next door, same block as hotel; subway access as well.  I would stay here again, always looking for the best rate available of course !

title: just ok
text: I have stayed in a fair amount of hotels over the years and this was an unusual one. Staff were friendly enough. Room was ok but smelled musty. No exhaust fan in bathroom. TV was pay only movies. We had to have a roll away and it was literally a twin size box spring! That was truly annoying. The king size bed was great though. No info in room to help navigate the hotel or the city. I don't think they have a restaurant and the definitely don't have room service. They offer breakfast buffet or grab-n-go bags. It is nice that check out isn't until 12 noon. Good location right in the heart of Times Square but you can hear some street noise in room(we were on floor 22). Security lax. One night there was someone on street level door checking room keys as you entered but no one was there the next night. The elevators that go to the floors of the hotel has a card reader that is supposed to limit access to patrons only but it apparently didn't work. You could just get in and go anywhere in the hotel.

title: 敢えてここじゃなくてもいいかな
text:
どこに行くにも結構徒歩で行けてしまうという意味では、立地は便利だと思いますが、宿泊するにはさすがに騒々しい場所ですね。
サービスはかなり手慣れていて、何をするにもキビキビ動いてくれますが、いわゆる高級ホテルのホスピタリティのようなものは期待しない方が良いと思います。
一人で出張に行って、ビジネスホテル的に利用するには適していると思います。実際、そんなお客さんが多かったです。

title: Great Overnight Stay
text: Stayed overnight for my husband's birthday. This hotel was a real treat... There is construction in the area so it does make for a bit more congestion in the area, but as far as the hotel itself goes I highly recommend. Tammy checked us in when we arrived and she was absolutely pleasant. She was smiling and friendly the entire time. The room was very clean and comfortable, we had a high floor and decent view. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the view from the dining area was amazing. The waitstaff could be a little more helpful/enthusiastic one gentleman even ignored me when I asked him a question. Thank goodness it was a buffet I would hate to be waited by the morning staff for a  a sit down meal. If you are in the area and want a bird's eye view in the center of times square this is the place to visit.

title: Very disappointed !
text:
This was supposed to be an exciting fun trip for me and my daughter who just graduated from high school! It was a surprise visit at the end of our two week vacation across the northeast!
I'm so upset tonight I can't even go to sleep! The room and concierge service were great no complaints at all! But the restaurant service was so very disappointing ! For the second night in a row we tried to have front row seats by the big window and could not get in because people sit for hours! Then last night I asked if I could reserve a table for dinner by the window And I was told that was not possible ! So again tonight we tried and of course didn't get a window seat. We were assured once one becomes available we could switch ! Well that didn't happen ! So we finished our drinks and meal and got up 1045 pm to sit quickly at a front window so I could take pictures of my daughter with time square in the background and within minutes an employee came and asked me to leave that this table was now reserved ! I said I just wanted to take pictures and I was told earlier the restaurant closed at 11 pm! So a) why were we asked to leave? And b) I thought no reservations were possible for front row window? This was supposed to be a memorable trip for me and my daughter and it just got ruined! I will never return to another Marriott again and I have been a frequent visitor with this chain but this left me so upset ! Thanks for ruining our time

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Located in Times Square with the restaurant looking out the the iconic crystal ball that drops on NYE. Rooms were of good size with a nice sized bathroom with a large shower. The only negative was the breakfasts were fairly ordinary. Transport is easy to find with the Subway being only a few metres away.

title: Perfect location and hotel
text: Loved this hotel. It was right in time square and the rooms were so nice and even a pretty good size for New York. We went close to Christmas and its such a close walk to Rockefeller and good shopping! If you want a good view your going to have to request it, ours wasn't great but it didn't bother me. I would definitely stay here again!

title: We really liked the location and decor!
text: For a small room, we loved the decor!  It was so convenient to walk to Times Square and everything nearby.  And for the middle of NYC, a decent price.  You could try to request a better view but we were mostly out of the room anyway.  We were very tired after a long international flight and when we went out to get dinner, our son locked the security lock and fell sound asleep and we could not get back in.  We had to call hotel security and within 20 minutes, they got us back in.  Very nice and helpful.

title: Another Great Stay
text: We recently spent a few days in NYC.  I am not a huge fan of staying on Times Square - but when we do the Renaissance is our favorite place!  Very quite - even had a room right by the elevator - never heard it!  We had a high room with a great view towards Avenue of the Americas.  We actually arrived in NYC at 9am - the front desk said they would text me when room was ready - it was no more than 1/2 hour later that our room was ready!  Everyone was so courteous and nice - it is a great hotel to be in the middle of it all!

title: Great Location
text: What a fantastic location for this hotel....right in the middle of Times Square and easy commute to many attractions.  Hotel is boutique in its decor and rooms are well appointed and comfortable.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  Parking is off site and charged daily.

title: Oasis in Times Square
text: We loved this hotel for our quick family vacation. The price is high, but aren't most accommodations in NYC?  This site provided respite from the noise, heat and crowds in Times Square. The hotel concierge, Matthew, was very helpful with our arrangements. The lady assigned to tidy our room was friendly and efficient. The hotel bar/restaurant has a fantastic view of Times Square and interesting snacks and somewhat gourmet bar food. We enjoyed our stay immensely.

title: Anniversary Get Away
text:
Located in the center of Time Square but the rooms do not have a  view of Time Square.  Clean and updated accomodations.  Great lobby bar/restarant that does have a view of Time Square.  Everyone was friendly and helpful. I would stay at this location again.

If you want quiet this may not be the hotel for you. Concerts can be heard clearly from inside the room.

title: Excelente ubicaciòn!!!
text:
El hotel tiene una ubicación excelente, sobre todo si tu viaje es con el fin no solo de conocer New York sino que convivir con el ánimo de los turistas y habitantes de NewYork!!! No se necesita tomar taxi para dirigirse a los lugares emblemáticos de esta maravillosa ciudad.
El servicio de desayuno muy bueno además que el desayunador tiene excelente vista al Time Square. 
Las habitaciones y baños muy confortables, la limpieza inmejorable.
La única crítica que tengo es que tuvimos algunas dificultades con las tarjetas electrónicas de acceso a los dormitorios.
Sin duda alguna volvería a  este hotel!!!

title: Amazing trip to NYC
text:
It truly does not get any better in terms of location. Steps from Times Square, and very convenient to the subway. Rooms were very comfortable. We had a crib for our daughter and there was still room for the four of us to move around. Staff was also extremely helpful and quick with luggage storage pre/post check-out. 

One wish is that WIFI was available without charge, but I can understand why it isn't.

title: Decent hotel in the heart of times sq
text:
Location is in the heart of times square

The lobby is new and renovated.

The rooms need major care and had stains/mold in them.

Not what you would expect of the Renaissance brand, but apparently they are renovating in the next 2-3 years.

title: For a night of shopping/fun this ..
text: Is probably the right place ... All the staff we came in contact with were friendly and helpful .. Right on Times Square so perfect location if your headed there .. Room was spacious enough and had a great view (26th floor) .. Plenty of soft towels and did the feather free (allergies) treatment right off .. food, drink, shopping right outside the door .. Wish we had more time to enjoy the restaurant and bar view ... This will be our go to hotel in the city ..

title: Great service, though pricy
text: This property is fabulous.  It's in a great location if you want to be in Times Square.   Check out the view from the lounge on floor three. The service from all employees is very attentive.  But prepare to pay for the location and service.   The crowds outside are large.

title: Fantastic Experience at the Renaissance New York Times Square!
text:
Overall, we had an amazing stay at the Renaissance and will definitely look to stay there again. The hotel rooms themselves are pretty standard and maybe a little tired. In fact, we had to ask to change rooms due to some musty smell in our original room(it had been hot/muggy days in NYC, so perhaps this was part of the problem). The staff quickly accommodated the room change despite being almost full. 

As a Marriott elite member, the Renaissance doesn't have a dedicated exec lounge, but uses the hotel's RLounge, with impressive views overlooking Times Square, for the elite benefits in addition to being the main bar/lounge for the hotel. We did go to the RLounge on our late evening arrival for a glass of wine and some food. We were a little confused if the seating was just walk-in or if the seating was done by a host. It turns out there is a great hostess with mostest, Sylvia, that helped us get situated and took great care of us throughout our whole stay! We also had the privilege of being served two evenings in a row by Marlene, who is absolutely amazing - so attentive and personable. We really enjoyed getting to know both fine ladies (who work incredibly hard and long hours!) as well as the RLounge manager Dawson - they all really made our stay special. Please do ask for them when you go to the RLounge!

Housekeeping staff was friendly and thorough.The Concierge was friendly in helping us figure out subways/trains when we had a question. 

Certainly, we really enjoyed the central location and took advantage of the quick walk to TKTS right out front, the theaters, shopping, Hells Kitchen bars, and of course NYC Subway access to quickly get around town. 

We will look forward to our next NYC trip and seeing the great staff at Renaissance.

title: Best location ever!
text:
Pros: 
*location: sits right on time square, with a great view from the restaurant
*security( you have a small lobby with doormen and then you have to take a elevator upstairs to a larger lobby with a view of times square through the restaurant.)
*value (got an express deal on priceline paid 33% less than retail price)
*decor was modern, cosy and up to date. 

Cons:
Rooms are small, didnt have a double bed like we requested only a queen but still very comfy
*no shuttle from airport
*not the most kid friendly hotel. would prob choose somewhere else if I had kids with me.

Stayed here to watch Serena play at US OPEN and one of the best experiences in New York thus far Ive had. I stayed at the Marriott on time square a few years before on business but I really liked the intimate small nature of this hotel better. Staff was VERY nice and very genuine. Helped us find the best way to flushing meadows and hell's kitchen for some good eats. Overall I would pay full price to stay here again. My kind of hotel.

title: Great Location!
text: Best location if you want to be in the middle of action in New York - just a couple of steps away from Times Square and right next to a subway station. Rooms were clean and well decorated. Very comfortable beds. Don't miss the R Lounge for the views of Times Square - best there is!

title: The Best Staff EVER!
text: We checked into this hotel July 1 and the Customer Service Agent that assisted us was outstanding! Her name was Tammy! My son and I were with My Sisterinlaw who lives nearby but I was extremely nervous staying in a very large unfamiliar city without my husband. He and the rest of the kids were coming by car. She was funny and sweet helpful and very informative! She probably took one look at me and was like your not from here! Ha! We giggled and it totally helped. She made sure my kids room was connecting and NONSMOKING for us lol! She will understand that! Our checkin didn't take as long as I am writing but upon check out she was there and we were able to thank her and Manny I believe. We had the worst taxi ride from airport the arranged or us to take a private suv to airport neither of us got car sick and it was the most amazing trip ever!!We were comfortable at the hotel and they were so nice to us will stay again if we get the chance for sure! Thanks Renaissance! You are the very best hotel! Same at SeaWorld Orlando! They are the bomb as well!!! Thank you for everything!! You always hear the complaints we don't have any!! All compliments for all there ... They were all helpful...happy trip!

title: Impressive on all fronts
text:
Situated right at the top end of Times Square yet relatively peaceful - masterful! The small ground floor lobby/reception belies the much larger lobby/concierge/bar-restaurant above, helping to separate the madness of the street with the activities within. The lounge has a fantastic view over Times Square - but reserve a table for a drink (open to non-residents too) or get there early.

The rooms are very good for New York - spacious with decent bathrooms - and when we went, at a sensible price. I hear they may be refurbishing it for early 2017, but I hope they keep the same value and standards.

Service was generally very good (though a bit mixed in the lounge) - for example we had Internet issues with 4 of us and several devices, but it was solved in minutes, and the concierge  was always helpful.

I can't imagine you'd get a better value, central, spacious hotel than this.

title: Great experience at Times Square
text:
I have never stayed in / close to Times Square before so I have no comparisons to make to other similar hotels but my 18 yo daughter and I had a very positive experience here July 4 - 7. We paid what I think was a very fair price for our location that overlooks Times Square. The hotel seems very small, uncrowded, and quiet. I did not expect that with the hustle and bustle right outside its doors. Staff are nice and helpful but not over the top. 

I have never stayed this close to the theater district before for fear that it would be too loud, crowded, and I worried my family would be unable to rest. Fortunately we had those fears put to rest. For you theatre goers who wish to be close to the Broadway shows but are leery of staying right in the area, fear no more. I thought the few extra dollars spent to get a room "where it happens" was well worth it. I highly recommend staying here and I anticipate staying here again as well.

title: Nice
text: This is a nice hotel. Great location. Oddly it's very quiet. Once you walk off the street into the lobby it's like your in another world. Very quiet and cool. Nice staff. Large rooms. Clean.  Food was very good. No pool. Parking available and expensive but it's NYC. Great location for all your NYC adventures.

title: Nice Hotel Great Location
text:
This is a really nice hotel located right in Times Square. There is a lounge that over looks Times Square. It is a fantastic place to have a drink and an appetizer. 
The rooms are pretty big compared to other NYC hotel rooms. The rooms are very clean and up to date. 

The staff in all departments was great.

title: Such a wonderful experience!
text: This is a great and convenient hotel -- we really enjoyed our stay.  I must add that David and Melissa made our visit to the Renaissance Times Square a truly wonderful experience.  The staff is so pleasant, courteous and professional.  I will recommend and continue to stay at this wonderful location.

title: A Bit Disappointed!
text: I am a Marriott Silver Member and typically trust their brand of hotels.  We have stayed at this location before and were very satisfied. However this trip I was extremely disappointed with the housekeeping.  The 2nd day our hand towels were replaced with "clean" towels which had black and brown stains on all of them.  I cannot tell you how disgusted I was at this considering this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel.  It made me question the cleanliness of the bedding as well.  Unfortunately I do not believe we will stay here again in the future.

title: Location is best and convenient
text:
Just at Times Square . Rooms are very good and facilities are of good standard .

Variety for breakfast buffet is not that great though you can see Times Square while taking breakfast .

Being in New York space is a constraint and that's visible when you do check in on ground floor reception area which is very small .

title: Great location, rooms needs updating
text: This hotel is perfectly located in Time Square. It isn't in the middle of all of the action but off to the side but perfect for going to shows or walking to Rockefeller Plaza.  The only reason it gets 4 stars is because our room wasn't updated. The lobby is beautiful and the staff was great, they just need to finish renovating!!

title: Fabulous!! As always!
text: Location location location. Perfect! But this hotel is more than the location. The rooms are great. Very comfortable and it is very quiet even with all the hustle and bustle going on outside. We are Marriott Gold members and the benefits include free water (thank you), free appetizer coupons (new this trip) free internet, the breakfast is the #1 best we have had at any Marriott and the service was beyond perfect. Another perfect stay at Renaissance 2 Times Square. :)

title: Amazing Opportunity
text: Eating breakfast everyday over looking Times Square was awesome - there is always something to watch! Breakfast was a typical breakfast buffet: eggs, toast, coffee, bacon, sausage, cereal, etc.  The decor was interesting - very modern with some hidden meanings. Room was very clean, didn't have an issue with Uber picking up. The concierge was very helpful!

title: Nice location; Decent Hotel
text:
This hotel is well situated if you want to be right in the heart of Times Square.  I've been staying here on and off for several years, ever since it underwent its trendy renovation that includes vaguely human statuary and riveted copper clad elevator cars.  The hotel is beginning to show its age, but management has made recent updates to the main level bar area and fitness center.

This hotel is about location.  Beds are good, comfortable Marriott beds.  Rooms are quiet for Times Square.  You will need to use the blackout curtains if you want to shut out the glare of Times Square.  Will keep coming back.

title: an Oasis among the Times Square Chaos
text: While this is perhaps the busiest part of the city 24-7, the accommodations and the accommodating staff make for a wonderful stay.  Rooms are clean, views are interesting, the bar/restaurant offer a unique panoramic view of Times Square that seems unreal. Special kudos to the staff from our arrival to departure!!!  Very welcoming and extremely helpful.

title: Amazing Location
text:
When they say perfectly located they mean it.  The Renaissance is located at the heart of times square, only two block from 5th Ave, 6 blocks from Central Park, and within easy walking distance of many iconic places such as Carnegie Deli, the Russian Tea Room, the Plaza Hotel. I doubt that there is a better location in Downtown. The entrance is funky as the street is always busy and crowded so parking is a real bummer. The check in desk is on the first floor and then you take and elevator to the next level where the main lobby is located and the elevator to the rooms are across the lobby.  It is done up in modern chic which I don't really care for but it is passable.  The room themselves are very comfortable with European style bedding.  Very soft mattresses which are super thick laid on a board, no box springs.
The bathroom is a little dated and could use some work but otherwise is sufficient.
The staff is very friendly and helpful and I would highly recommend this  hotel as a great place to stay in the heart of the theatre district.

title: Best Hotel Staff Ever
text:
The Renaissance has the most caring, helpful staff I have ever encountered. After my friend injured her knees, I thought our Broadway trip was ruined. The hotel staff came to our rescue, had a scooter delivered, helped my friend learn to drive the scooter, and enabled us to arrive for the Hamilton curtain in plenty of time. Each night the staff made sure the scooter battery was charged for the next morning. This was service above and beyond!

A concierge desk is continuously staffed with advice on restaurants, attractions, and how to maneuver through New York. The Renaissance is perfectly located in the Theater District with proximity to many attractions and magnificent views of Times Square. The rooms are spacious by New York standards with comfortable beds, luxurious linens, and sparkling clean bathrooms.

I would not consider any hotel but the Renaissance for future trips to New York City!

title: Overpriced, but nice hotel right in the heart of New York
text: I was in New York with my fiance during May.  Since he is a Marriott member, we picked this hotel.  It's a nice hotel- small rooms, but then again everything is small in New York!  :-)  Nice rooms, and the location can't get any closer to Times Square even if you tried!  Just walk out the front door and you are right in Times Square.

title: A luxury quiet place amidst the excitement
text: This hotel is amidst all the excitement but a serene place to relax and enjoy comfort and luxury. The staff are pleasant and helpful. Hotel is situated near numerous amenities,restaurants,pharmacy,activities., transport etc. the hotel has spacious neat and tidy rooms to enjoy your stay. Staff are professional and welcoming.

title: Good Location
text: This hotel is in a great location in Times Square and the view from the restaurant is great. However, the hotel rooms need some updating and the low tables in the restaurant are not at all comfortable when trying to eat a meal. Difficulty trying to order eggs at breakfast as the staff repeatedly ask what you want and what your room number is. Another guest had to ask for honey several times before they understood what she wanted. Also for the amount the hotel costs you would think you could have pottery cups/mugs and not cardboard ones! One day they did not leave cups(again cardboard ones) in room for coffee  machine so I rang to ask for cups. On delivery I got coffee not cups!  Some staff seem to have difficulty understanding English. Another downside is that free wi fi is not provided in rooms only in lobby. We were staying here as part of tour but I would not choose to stay here.

title: In the Heart of Things
text: Our first visit to New York, so we were anxious to be close to public transportation, theaters, etc.  The Renaissance was perfect for us.  Omar, the Concierge, could not have been more helpful. He gave us information on which trains to take, places that were easily walkable,  Times Square is a big of a freak show, particularly in the evening, but the lounge on the 4th floor of the hotel is a great place to people-watch.  Our room was comfortable although the thermostat did not work, but fortunately it was a cool evening so we just opened the window.  Had we been staying longer, of course, we would have asked them to come fix it, but we just advised them of the problem as we were checking out.

title: Highly Disappointed
text:
After an amazing weekend in New York Times Square where I stayed at the Marriott Marquis, I was excited to try out a different Marriott location in NYC.  Very disappointed in the "lack of brilliant" service that was missing from the Renaissance New York Times Square Location from the check-in process to the restaurant only serves appetizer style items.

The one positive point is the manager David was very responsive to my complaint and in-person ratings about my experience.  This Renaissance has a long way to go to live up to the Marriott brand!

title: Location, location
text: This was my second visit to the Renaissance, even better than last year. This time there were no conventions going on so it was much easier to get elevators, and more peaceful. I came to see Broadway plays, it's so easy to walk around the corner to all the plays and many places to eat. It's well maintained, and the staff is helpful. It's a great place to stay.

title: exelente  hotel
text:
Hotel muito bem localizado , talvez a melhor vista de Times Square. Os funcionários são atenciosos e prestativos em especial Divina  do concierge e Margreth do 20 floor .
Existem alguns detalhes nos quartos quanto desgaste mas não atrapalham em nada a avaliação de excelente para o hotel. O café tem o necessário e tudo preparado com zelo e qualidade . Nos voltaremos ao hotel

title: Great Location, Not so good staff
text:
The location is good even though it's very busy outside.  The staff at breakfast were terrible only scrambled eggs available but you can request fried eggs which seems a bit beyond them. You have to ask several times and give your room number and also prove that you are eligible for a egg. We were asked numerous times how many eggs we wanted and after ordering the waiter must have asked us about 6 times what our room number was.  Then they got it all wrong and had to bring another waiter over to confirm our order( for a fried egg!!!).  Also the rooms in the hotel need updating, I would not pay the excessive room rates for this hotel but we were part of a tour and this hotel had been allocated through the the tour operator.  
On a good point the rooms were clean and the bedding was changed daily.  But if I visited New York again I would not stop here. Also No free Wifi only in the lobby.

title: Location, views and staff
text:
Very obvious as to the snack in the middle of the universe location!

Staff is seasoned and go above and beyond. I can site numerous examples.

The room was cozy but sufficient in size.

Bed was very comfy

They offer breakfast on the third floor with a good buffet selection and views.

Bar on third floor has world class views.

title: Horrible hotel with a perfect location
text: I spend 695 dollars a night and let me tell I could spend more if the place deserve it, but this worst hotel I ever been in New York, the rooms are old, small and they don't have room services or any interest to help any guess in this case my family and I, and there is more the lobby really smell like sh..., the food and restaurant bad quality and the waitress there really need a huge preparation to improve there service to their guess, any way, my advise don't waste your money in this hotel, when you have the four seasons, Astorias or if you need this exact  location you can choose a Hilton or W. I like to travel and I always try different hotel to check if what they said in there advertising is real o not.

title: Great location, but outdated rooms
text: Stayed here with wife and kids for 2 nights and we were quite comfortable.  Once we arrived our room was ready for check-in earlier then expected which was nice after a long bus ride.  The drinking glasses in our room were filthy and not fit for use.  Otherwise the room seemed clean and quiet.

title: Location can't get any better!
text: bang in the middle of times square. central park, 5th Ave, Herald Sq all within walking distance. Great location for tourists. the highlight of the hotel seems to be its location. but the entire stay was as good. nice clean rooms, comfortable beds. room size on the smaller side, but that you can expect from NY-Times sq hotels. lobby is nice, view of times square from restaurant is amazing. concierge, bell boys, all professional and helpful. overall great stay. showers need upgrading.

title: excelente lugar
text: Muy buen servicio, el hotel muy limpio y las habitaciones muy limpias, muy céntrico de fácil acceso y te puedes mover muy fácil desde ahí excelente trato de todos los empleados en cuanto a peticiones muy eficiencientes

title: Perfect place for touristy NYC
text: Centrally located, large rooms with lots of storage, quiet, great staff, reasonably priced (relative...it is NYC). The perfect location for a theater- and museum-centric stay ion the city. Close to subways everywhere.

title: Best NYC Marriott
text: Stayed with points.  Much nicer rooms, twice the size, same amount of points as Marriott Marquis.  Breakfast included for gold and platinum members during the week and appetizers during the evening hours. credit of 1000 points when not offered on the weekends. Fabulous staff and beautiful lounge. Will go there again. Wifi free for platinum and gold members

title: Renaissance Hotel - Perfect Hotel in Times Square!
text:
Walk into the Renaissance Hotel and you feel somewhat guilty! Why? You're in the center of Times Square with the marquees, stores, unimaginable cultural icons around you.  Walking out of the Renaissance Hotel, you almost don't know where to turn.  Sights and sounds of the city surround you - including those visitors, who don't have the convenience of this wonderful hotel!

A boutique hotel, the Renaissance has an inviting, comfortable lobby and seating area.  Check-in is a breeze, friendly and accommodating check in clerks make your stay just what you expect.
