Our room was smaller than we expected, but we should have anticipated a smaller room due to the fabulous location.  We loved our room with its black-out drapes and completely sound-proof windows. Our quiet room was cozy and the smaller size didn't matter.  Great room, wonderful staffers and the location make the Renaissance a winner!

We had prime hotel real estate in NYC.  We shopped, found the best restaurants everywhere, went to Broadway to see the show we had selected.  The 'red steps' are just in front of the hotel and its restaurant. I must admit we would look up to see 'our room' and the hotel's restaurant above the 'red steps' ticket line for discounted Broadway Shows.

On your first visits to NYC and Times Square, the Renaissance Hotel is the place to stay.  While visitors can't see NYC in a day or a week, this centrally located hotel will provide a base location, give you a starting point and exceed your expectations! Very highly recommended!

title: Amazing location, nice service
text: If you're driving in for a matinee show, what a great hotel.  Staff were above average--very good people.  So we checked in by 11, show was at 2, dinner, some great Irish bars near by---what can u saw. Greatest city on Earth and you're in the heart of it when you stay here.  Hope to go back.

title: Belle vue thats all !
text: Belle vue sur time square si vous êtes bien placés par contre la nourriture n'est pas bonne car pas de choix, les cocktails peu de choix.  Pour boire un verre et voir la vue à la rigueur... Pour y aller prendre ascenseur dans l'hôtel monter étage G et sortir le bar restaurant est à gauche.  Bon accueil groom et serveuse.

title: Excelente hotel in a wonderfull location
text:
You're just in Times sq !! no walking distance because your just IN!...very nice hotel, nice rooms, nice amenities, excelente service...everything is just perfect...But location beats all of them, only if you like staying in the middle of these wonderfull and very crowd area.. Theatres, resstaurantes, shops...everything is just there...
Being gold member of Marriott Rewards we got free buffet breakfast every day except weekends..
Very recomendable..

title: super emplacement
text: Hotel très bien placé à times square et bien insonorisé. Chambre propre. Le seul hic, un wifi payant. Par contre, il est gratuit dans le lobby et fonctionne très bien. Le bar offre une magnifique vue sur Times Square.

title: What a great location!
text: We stayed over Memorial Day weekend. Our king bed room was fine. Quiet and comfortable. Lounge area has great view over Times Square. Front desk service excellent! Super close to theaters. If you want to take a bus tour, the stop is right at the front door of the hotel

title: Memorial weekend
text:
Staff are the best! Everyone is always friendly,helpful and willing to go the extra mile to make your stay a fantastic experience. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable and the rooms spacious and amenities are good and of course the location is a bonus.
The breakfast certainly the place to get your day started with an awesome view and attentive staff and a something for everyone.' I can't fault anything the staff is what makes the place special. A really special team thank you!

title: Best Place to Stay in NYC
text:
I tried almost all of Marriott hotels (Courtyards , fair fields , Spring hill suites , Marquis) and without a doubt I can say that Renaissance is the best place to stay in NYC. Not only is it in the center of the major tourist attraction spot , you get to see Time Square view right from the Lounge . You get to see the NYC Time square red stairs(its actually the Broadway TKTS booking department below , but allows pedestrians to sit by having in as stairs above it - very smart way - and I absolutely love that place) and the awesomeness of the view cannot be described in words. Highfloor rooms are really amazing - it has these amazing sky scrapers view right from your very big glass pane - one side of the road facing rooms are completely made with glass allowing the beautiful view outside. The best part of Renaissance is its staff - they are really very sweet and friendly. I personally recommend Shamin who serves early morning in the Lounge. I have been noticing he is very caring with the people who enter lounge , give them water bottles , clean up the place and allow other people to be seated without making them wait long time and checks on you if got you all you need. I give him 5 out of 5 star. We need more people like that. the front desk staff is very friendly , down to earth and helpful with the queries you have.
No wonder it turned out to be my best place to stay if I am at NYC. Some very good restaurants around this place are  Indian - Pippali(129 E 27th st) ,Batti Grill , Sarvanaa Bhavan ,  Sake Bar Hagi(Japanese) , Toloache (Mexican) , La Masseria (Italian) , Tony's , Natsumi .

title: Restaurant/Lounge Changes not good
text: We have always stayed at the Renaissance on our trips to New York. When we were here last year, they were undergoing renovations in the lounge area. But we always enjoyed the restaurant which was still open for business. Great food and service. We came back the other day. The restaurant we ate in was gone. It was combined with the lounge area as part of the renovation. The menu was reduced to bar food in the evening and in the morning you could only get the buffet for $29 or Continental for $19. The food at dinner was just average. crab cakes were very dry. Nothing special. The morning buffet was horrible. For $29, the hot food selection was limited to very poorly cooked eggs, bacon, sausage, and potatoes. And, everything was cold. Worst breakfast ever. The table we were seated at was so low to the floor that I could barely get my knees under it . They were lounge tables for having drinks. Most uncomfortable. We felt really ripped off and most disappointed. We have stayed at the Renaissance for the last time.

title: Wonderful first visit to the Big Apple
text: Very nice hotel in the heart of Time Square.  Staff very helpful and breakfast was very nice.  Would definetly recommend staying here. Rooms were very quiet considering you are so close to Time Square.  We valet parked which was great, very quick with taking and retrieving our car.

title: 1st Trip to Renaissance Time Square NYC
text: My wife and I were fortunate to get tickets for the season finale of Saturday Night Live.  I always enjoy visiting Time Square and typically stay at the Marriott Marquis.  However, the Renaissance was less monies and decided to try someplace new.  In comparison, it is a smaller hotel, but it seems to be remodeled and more trendy.  Excellent service, and 2nd floor bar area.  The room and bathroom was very nice as well.

title: Walking distance to Times Square, great staff, good for a business trip or a holiday
text:
I was on a business trip to NY and having stayed at quite a few hotels in Manhattan, I really liked the Renaisance. Very few hotels can pull off as being appropriate for families as well as for business travellers.

Staff was fantastic. I arrived with a blinding headache but staff sorted me out with Advil. Got lots of help with directions and what restaurants are close by, shopping options. Very proactive and helpful. My office is located on Broadway, otherwise I would personally have preferred a quieter location - but in my room, I didn't feel the lights  and noise at all. Wifi worked great.

I dined  there once but I found it a bit noisy and not to my taste but I think that can't be helped, it's at Times Square after all. But would have liked a quieter dining option. That said there were many options to eat out around the hotel.

The main lobby area was quiet and staff were great at finding a taxi when required. Checkout was quick and painless. Overall a great experience.

title: Good Time At Times Square
text:
Location, Location, Location...Renaissance New York Times Square solidifies this rhetoric. 

It is in the MIDST of everything. Yet it is Intimate and private. Smaller hallways and a lobby that is located above the ground floor. 

With a Concierge/Navigator who is friendly; you are well on your way to Navigate the city. 

The rooms are a tad bigger than what you would expect from a New City Hotel. With Amenities and Views of the Vibrant Times Square. 

If you would rather not deal with the Hustle and Bustle on the streets you can Retreat to the R Lounge for a Panoramic view of Times Square. A drink or two and you can gaze at the lights, cabs, and thousands of tourist in the city that never sleeps. 

This is indeed a DELIGHT...

title: AMAZING
text:
If you are going to New York you must stay in this Hotel. Staff are wonderful and so very helpful.  Rooms are very comfortable & beds are fabulous. 
Location is just perfect for those wishing to get the full experience of Times Square. Close to theaters, restaurants, bars and atmosphere!  My new favorite   HOTEL!

title: Within walking distance of Broadway theaters
text: The Renaissance Times Square is a great hotel in the heart of Times Square.  The staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby is very modern. The bar and restaurant overlook Times Square, and the rooms are clean and comfortable.  Best of all is how close it is to great restaurants and theaters, so there is no need to use a taxi.  It is a perfect location for any theater goer or tourist.

title: "April in New York"
text:
Abbiamo trascorso 5 notti in questo hotel,ottima posizione! Le camere sono abbastanza ampie e sono dotate di cassaforte, frigobar, ,bollitore, bagno con doccia e phon. Noi avevamo una camera al 21' piano con ottimo isolamento acustico. Non abbiamo usufruito della prima colazione, ma fuori dall'hotel c'è l'imbarazzo della scelta.
Il personale è cordiale e disponibile.

title: Perfect Location
text:
Right in the middle of times square, perfect for theatres and anything in the midtown area.  Check in was efficient and friendly.  Corner rooms are slightly larger.  Rooms have a flat screen tv,  refrigerator, and coffee maker.  King bedrooms come with a sofa. Upscale youthful vibe.  Renaissance club overlooking Duffy Square and TKTS booth offers morning buffet breakfast and evening appetizers to elite members.  Service was personable.

WIFI strong.  Parking is valet only, and is $65 per night.  Allow 20-30 minutes for car to be returned.

Elevators are speedy.

title: mitten im pulsierenden New York
text:
Das Hotel liegt einen Steinwurf vom Times Square entfernt, mitten im Geschehen von Manhattan. Die Zimmer sind gross, es stehen viele Schubladen und ein grosser Schrank zur Verfügung. Die Betten - richtige Kingsize! sind gross und bequem. 
Die Möbel sind allerdings ein wenig in die Jahre geraten und der Teppich ist auch nicht wirklich ideal für ein Hotelzimmer.
Ich hatte ein Zimmer mit Sicht direkt auf die Strasse und die Skyline, allerdings dröhnte
der Strassen - und Baustellenlärm 24h ununterbrochen - leider waren die Fenster wenig Schall isoliert - also Ohropax mitnehmen falls sie wirklich zentral wohnen wollen.
Für eine Nacht stand kein Wasser zur Verfügung, die Zeitspanne verlängerte sich, doch wir konnten im benachbarten Hotel duschen und den Zimmerpreis reduzieren - das ist kulant.

title: Renaissance Times Square - an oasis in the heart of City
text: Clean, quiet, relaxing  oasis right at the edge of Time Square.  We could look out and see the flowing humanity, and choose to watch the show from the lounge with a glass of Pinot Noir, or slide out the door and feel the energy.  For theater goers everything is within a couple of blocks. No cabs, just walk.

title: in the heart of times square
text: very comfortable and spacious room and bathroom. good quality toiletries but skimpy with the complimentary tea and coffee. paper cups! well placed for the main attractions, Broadway, empire state etc. friendly staff and good service. expensive bar though

title: Unbeatable location and view
text:
Others have written reviews for the Renaissance New York Times Square Hotel and I have to say that if you're looking for a hotel that is located in the heart of Times Square where you can watch the diversity of the world go by, you can't beat it. For me, trading off the slowest 1 floor elevator ride in the world and rooms that are beginning to feel a bit dated is well worth the benefit of the location and ability to enjoy a meal or drink in the R Lounge with the most spectacular view of Times Square available. You don't have to put up with the costumed "performers" either! Rating based on the food is really unnecessary in my view because you have so many absolutely incredible choices right outside the front door of the hotel that eating in would really be a waste of the location.

If you're anxious to immerse yourself in the ultimate cityscape, crack open the window at night and let the pulsating noise of Times Square lull you to sleep. For some, it can't get any better than this if you only have one or two chances to experience New York and Times Square.

title: once in a lifetime chance
text: Nothing could have beat the location, right by times square. It let me be able to do all the normal tourist things as it's in the heart of everything. I didn't stay there to each much but when I did it was great. Definitely recommend it.

title: great hotel and great location
text: the location can't be beat.  This is a well run hotel right in the heart of the theater district.  I was concerned about noise, but my room overlooked Times Square and was as quiet as one could hope for.  The lounge was awesome

title: Situación inmejorable si quieres visitar Manhattan
text:
Está en la conjunción de la 7ª avenida con Broadway -el corazón de Manhattan- una parada de metro al lado (30 metros), la parada del bus GrayLine uptown enfrente. Si quieres ver teatro o musicales, la tienda de Tickets está al cruzar la calle.
El hotel por dentro está bien, sin lujos pero limpio y habitaciones espaciosas. Personal muy amable, cooperador, siempre con una sonrisa. Te atendrán en español, y si reservas con bastante antelación las tarifas son razonables para lo que es NY.

title: Great place to stay for midtown activity like theater.
text: Time square hotels are pricey so we used Marriott points to stay here.  Had a lovely room and got breakfast included, maybe due to Gold member.  This is very convenient with the Tickets booth right around the corner.  We went to a  matinee and evening shows, then a museum the next day.

title: Very disappointing hotel!
text:
Old hotel, small rooms, poor service! 

I would avoid it. I am loyal to the Marriott brand and always stay at Marriott hotels but I would not stay at this hotel even if it were the only Marriott in the city (thankfully that's not the case - the Marquis is right there).

This hotel is a little cheaper than the Marquis and has a nice bar that overlooks Times Square but you don't have to stay at the hotel to visit the bar.

Despite what I said above, if you're a tourist and you want to experience New York and Times Square in its full glory.. Sure stay at the Renaissance. Just don't expect a lot from the hotel itself.

title: A lot can be improved
text: Just stayed here for one  night. Check in was very fast. Got a very small corner room with a small window. All night strong lights shined in the room, making it impossible to get a good sleep. There is no room service and there is also no dinner served apart from snacks. Breakfast is a joke. All in all, a disappointment

title: Un choix guidé par l'emplacement.
text:
Le gros plus: vous êtes à l'ultra centre de Times Square. Le bruit extérieur est présent mais l'isolation phonique est plutôt bien faite. L'accueil est très pro. Le chambre est propre avec une bonne literie, la deco bof_bof, la SDB avec une baignoire et le fameux rideau que je déteste. 
En conclusion on y va pour l'emplacement, dans l'hotel rien d'extraordinaire mais aucune de mauvaise surprise. 
A noter, le bar au premier avec une vue extraordinaire sur Times Square. ....le soir s'est féerique.

title: hermoso hotel, super moderno y con diseño. ubicacion inigualable!!!
text: uno de los hoteles más lindos en cuanto a su decoración moderna y artística. Algo rebuscado el tema del ascensor para pasar de la recepción a los pisos, pero hermosa experiencia. Por las ventanas se ven las luces de Times Sq.! Espero poder volver si el dinero me alcanza.

title: Ótima localização!
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado, vale a pena, em especial se vc tem pouco tempo na cidade! O atendimento na recepção foi excelente, bastante cordial! A concierge também foi show! Os quartos estão merecendo alguma atenção mas nada que represente um impedimento à hospedagem. O banheiro é claro, amplo e bem limpo!

title: Conforto, praticidade e bom gosto na medida
text:
Estive hospedada no hotel por cinco noites e fui positivamente surpreendida. O hotel é limpo, cheiroso, moderno e seguro.
Os quartos são amplos, bem decorados e as camas são muito confortáveis com roupa de cama de excelente qualidade.
Os banheiros são modernos, as amenities e toalhas são trocadas todos os dias.
Fica no coração da Times Square, próximo de todas as atrações (teatros, restaurantes, lojas para compras). Muito pratico e acessível.
Recomendo e com certeza voltarei a me hospedar em uma próxima visita.

title: Great location wonderful stay
text: We loved the location of the Renaissance Hotel Times Square. It's ideally located in the theater district walking distance to all Broadway plays. The room was nice, staff wonderful and their bar overlooks Times Square. The beds comfortable, rooms clean and we would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Broadway.

title: Skip this hotel
text:
A lot has changed since I last stayed here and none of the changes have been positive. The rooms have a tired look, the carpet is worn and the furniture and bathroom are very basic. The location is still great. The restaurant overlooking Times Square has now been converted into a lounge. The food used to be great and I've even seen celebrities in the restaurant. Now the crowd there has changed too and looked more like group travelers on a budget. The rooms facing 7th overlook a construction site. On the first day, the television did not work but the next morning it began to work again. There is no room service. 
One positive is a lot of the staff especially in the lounge are the same friendly group and they still provide great service.

title: Renaissance Suite - Great Room for Double Couples
text:
Flew in from Doha via Abu Dhabi, arriving WAY before check in. After a short drive from JFK (just kidding), I dropped my bags at the desk and ashes for an early check in. The agent said she would do the best she could to expedite. Meanwhile, I'd take a walk around the block, grab a street dog, knock back a margarita and see a movie in RPX. 

Perfect timing, as when I returned, the room was ready. Now, while I'm not particular about being greeted as an Elite Rewards Member, I do expect to get everything that comes with the package. As I said, so far so good. 

You enter on the street, then go up an elevator to the R Lounge area then swap over to the other elevator. 

Since there were 4 of us, 2 couples, and rooms in NYC are known to be small and we didn't want a double double, I got the Renaissance Suite, room 2302, on the 23rd of 25/26 floors. It's like 2 rooms in one with. You enter into a spacious living room with sleeper sofa, TV, desk, bar, drawers, closest and full bathroom with a bathtub. Off to the left through double doors is a huge king room with chaise, plenty more storage space and huge full bathroom with spa inspired shower. The room was contemporary, clean, nicely decorated, great temperature and a city view. 

The price was reasonable, alas, but it took some time. Here's a trick. 

Tip: I booked this hotel in January for 4 nights through Marriott directly The rates varied each night. For all intents and purposes, it was about $2800. I was shocked, but comparing it to other rooms by location, square footage and style, it seemed reasonable. The only other room that came close was the Marriott Marquis. I also booked that suite to lock in and compare prices, it was a little smaller though and not as nice. I have a habit of continuously watching rates, so I checked the rates in February. The price went down, so I updated my booking, directly through the website. I checked again at the beginning of March and at the end of March, also updating each time. In the end, the price came down to $2000. All to say, if you book, anywhere, check back often as rates do change as demand changes.

title: Perfect Location
text: We've stayed at this Renaissance location in Times Square previously and have loved the spacious rooms, friendly staff and ideal location....so we now will only stay here if we're visiting  NYC! The rooms are equipped with a fridge, coffee maker and couch. The view from our room overlooked the lights and crowds of Times Square, yet offered a nice calm refuge after the busy site seeing, shopping and nightlife.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Very nice hotel and friendly staff.  Comfy beds and clean rooms with competitive rates for the location.  Great views and centrally located to fun stuff so definitely a hotel I would stay in again when I come to NYC again.
Renaissance are a nice addition to the Marriott brand

title: In the Heart of New York
text:
Excellent location in the heart of Times Square as long as you don't mind the crowds. Great service, good bar and restaurant but you'll be out of the hotel most of the time.

Excellent area to base yourself, close to Subway and walking distance to Broadway and Rockefeller Centre.

title: excelente localização, na cara da Times square
text: Fica na cara da Times Square, tem um bar que tem uma visão privilegiada do Times Square, mas acho estranho ter que trocar de elevador para subir nos quartos, mas o quarto é ótimo, cama e banheiro ótimos

title: Si quieres estar en pleno Times Square, este es tu hotel
text:
Nos hospedamos 2 adultos, del 18 al 22 de marzo, 2016. Ya hemos viajado varias veces en NY y este era un hotel por conocer. Famoso por su ubicación en pleno Times Square, detrás de las gradas y enfrente de los rótulos luminosos. El restaurante tiene la vista privilegiada en esa área, la comida es buena y la ambientación es buena.
Las habitaciones, demuestran el paso del tiempo y sí, mi sugerencia en renovarlas.
Dado que está en pleno Times Square, te puede parecer bullicioso.

title: High school girlfriends group trip
text: Great hotel, convenient location, friendly helpful staff! Bar overlooking Times Square is a great place to meet friends, grab a snack, or watch a game. This hotel is a quiet oasis in a busy part of NYC. Convenient location to Broadway shows and restaurants. Easy to get a taxi or subway.

title: Location, location, location
text:
The Renaissance Times Square is a great hotel to stay to visit New York. The hotel is at Times Square and has one of he best morning breakfast views in the morning of time square on weekends.The breakfast was really good along with service. During lounge hours the "poutine fries" are one of the best I have had.
City pass office is right next to it, walking distance to restaurants row on 46th street, Rockefeller building, 5th avenue, and is the start of both uptown and downtown tour buses.  Central Park is about a good 20 min walk if your from LA. :)
Hotel staff is great and hotel room is quite but can get noisy if on lower floors.  I highly suggest hotel for your New York visit. 
Thank you Marriott for a great stay.

title: Good hotel, great location
text:
Smack right in the heart of Time Square, between the M&M store and The Olive Garden is the Renaissance Hotel. The location is both a blessing and a curse – on the one hand you're very much in the thick of it. On the other hand, the last ½ mile from JFK  took us 30  minutes and if we’d picked something a tiny bit further out, we’d have avoided a lengthy taxi ride. I should add that a subway station is next to the hotel (on 49th) so getting around once you've arrived is easy.

The ground floor of the hotel consists of a modest reception, staffed but a rotation of wonderfully helpful staff. The lift takes you to a lounge, the bar and restaurant and further lifts that take you to the rooms.

The rooms themselves comfortably fit two double beds and are clean and do the job although lack a wow factor. The beds are wonderful. Despite the location, our room was quiet. The view from the bedroom consisted of a massive flashing billboard, which was blacked out when the curtains were drawn.

My wife cut her foot on the floor – nothing serious. The hotel responded with free breakfasts and fixed the floor immediately.

We were delighted with the free breakfasts – nothing special about the breakfasts per se, but the restaurant has a view of Time Square as good as any you will get. Worth checking out.

So all in all, great location, great staff, good service, rooms are fine. Perhaps we'd consider a hotel a little further from the action next time, but for a first trip with the kids this was ideal.

BTW, sign up to Marriott rewards (as we did) for free wifi

title: New York Vacation
text:
Great location in the heart of times square close to M&M's World.
No in room dining, we arrived after along flight and we wanted to have something to eat but there were no in room dining. Although we were tired we had to go out to eat.
Small room
Good hospitality
Helpful Staff

title: Life Savers
text: My wife is disabled and we needed a totally wheelchair accessible room for last weekend.. We made  arrangements in advance with another hotel that said could meet her needs. Sadly, when we arrived all of the rooms they stated were accessible were not. They made no attempt to assist us, so we walked around hoping against hope that we would find another hotel. We walked in to the Renaissance and asked if there were any accessible rooms, and if there was any chance there were any availabilities at the last minute. We were met by two very nice receptionists, one by the name of Fleridana. They immediately looked for availability and incredibly they not only found one but Fleridana  took us upstairs to insure that it was acceptable. The room was not ready but they assured us it would be ready in an hour. The head of housekeeping was in the room and showed my wife all of the accommodations. Fleridana was with us the entire time and came down to make the reservation. We were blown away by the first class customer service. The other hotel workers in the lobby were very friendly and helpful. The experience could not have been better for the two nights that we stayed. I would highly recommend staying in this hotel.

title: Nice Spot!
text:
Great location....beautiful property...friendly staff.

Although there really isn't a concierge level for the evenings this hotel is a classy place! The breakfast buffet was fabulous and it overlooked times square which was fun place to people watch in the morning.  

Rooms are modern and the bathrooms were clean and had quality linens and products.

title: Great location for shows and TKTS booth
text: Had a 4 night stay during end of Easter break.  Room with 2 queens.  Had breakfast (as a Gold) which was the typical and was fine.  This location does not have an executive lounge and therefore has no water, coffee, etc with which many frequent travelers are accustomed.  Room and bath were decent size by NY standards.  $279 nightly rate seemed reasonable as well.  TKTS booth is 20 feet away, as are several shows, including An American in Paris.  Fun to have a drink and an app while overlooking the bustle of Times Square.

title: perfecta ubicacion para pocos dias en N Y
text: Hotel muy bien situado en Times square,tienes  casi todo lo importante para ver y los teatros a tu alrededor, habitaciones suficientemente amplias y con todo lo necesario en el baño, servicio amable, el bar del loby da a times square con una vista espectacular

title: Amazing!
text: Excellent Hotel! All the staff were extremely helpful and the hotel is located in a prime location, in order to see all the main attractions. The hotel room was nice and spacious and the view of times square is amazing - can't go wrong with this hotel, I highlty recommend

title: excellent hotel
text:
.great location in the heart of New York and in the middle of Times Square
Marriott its our prefer hotel in the world and once again we have a great experience in this hotel
large rooms lovely hotel and avove all nice and kind service

title: Good value for NYC, appreciated a smaller hotel on Times Square
text:
The check in and arrivals lobby is at Street Level on 57th Street,1/4 block from the famous TKTS booth.  Just slightly quieter than being directly on the Square.  Check in was efficient.  Elevator to main lobby on 3rd floor which was truly unique.  Not really a lobby - more a restaurant/bar.  There really is not much of any lobby space anywhere to meet folks, 

Room was fine, King size, comfortable, great stall shower and a side view onto Times Square and can just see the JW.

Breakfast buffet at $29 was somewhat expensive even for New York. Service was OK, I sat at a table that jutted out and looked right at the square - very impressive. 

What did I like most?  That this was a small hotel in a big city, and the room was never far from the elevator after a long day.  Would stay here again.

title: Der Hammer
text:
Top Hotel an bester Lage direkt am Time Square.
Im einen Restaurant hat man den Blick direkt auf den Time-Square. Wunderschöne Zimmer mit allem Komfort.
Sehr freundliches Personal und die Concierges sind fast "zum Verlieben"!

title: Great location just a step to Times Square
text:
Arrived at hotel early (11.30 am) so we had to wait until 3 pm for room to be ready. But that was no big deal as one step outside the hotel we're already at Times Square!
Not much space at reception desk area but larger area could be found at second floor. We had to use different elevator from lobby area to second floor and from second floor to room floor. The room was as expected with comfortable bed but the view from window was cool to see the street and the buildings and stores...
After all, location the number one for this hotel....

title: Girls Weekend
text: This hotel is situated in the heart of Times Square. The decor is very hip and modern and the staff is incredibly hospitable. We dined in the R Lounge which has a magnificent view of Times Square and wonderful food. The gym is spacious and nicely equipped. The rooms are. The beds are totally comfy. This is a great place to stay for a fun trip to Times Square.

title: Brill Hotel In Fantastic Location!
text: This was my 1st visit to this amazing city and I wasn't disappointed. My friend who I travelled with had been twice before and suggested we stay near Times Square for easy access to all the tourist attractions..you couldn't get a better location with this hotel,just steps away from all the bright lights of Times Square. We stayed 3 nights in a room with 2 double beds,the best nights sleep I have ever had in a hotel! Don't get me wrong there is nothing plush about the rooms,bathroom is basic with a crazy shower that hits the wall more than it hits you plus 1 of the lifts was constantly out of order which other reviewers have mentioned but put that aside and I wouldn't hesitate staying here again..Its all about the location.

title: Room with a View
text:
For all the craziness outside in the Square this is a quiet place to stay. We'll sorta. Depending on who your neighbors are you can be kept awake by noisy, inconsiderate people shouting in the corridors. It's not the hotel's fault. Just get a room furthest away from the elevators. 

Good location if you want to be in the center if things for either business or for fun. Rooms are pretty decent although the bathroom was are swabbed out with strong bleach solution which follows yoy into the bedroom. Just keep the door closed.

The view of Times Square from the restaurant is pretty spectacular, especially watching the sun come up over breakfast.

Bottom line, if you don't like crowds, this location is not for you.

title: Birthday surprise 🎂
text:
A super hotel in the best location on time square, spacious room & a super king bed.Amazing rooms with huge bathrooms & super quiet considering your on time square. Bedding immaculate & towels changed daily & toiletries supplied. 
 The staff are all so happy & obliging nothing is too much trouble. 
 The R lounge is the out of this world  the view the atmosphere & the staff are so welcoming & never felt rushed to vacate. 
Thank you Renaissance you helped create a very happy 50th birthday 🎂

title: Great well located hotel
text: Stayed here for 4 days, hotel was very well presented with contemporary furnishings and modern technologies, service was exceptional in reception and consierge, also ate in the restaurant and food service both excellent. Definitely recommend

title: What a view
text: When I stayed at the Renaissance I felt that the rooms were comfortable and the food was also very good. I had an amazing view from my room of time square. The dining at the Renaissance was nice. The best part would be the view from sitting in the restaurant. You look out right on time square!! It was amazing and I sometimes just go eat there when I am in NYC. This is definitly  a place to come back to which I have.

title: Excellemment positionné
text:
L'Hotel est situé à quelques mètres de la place Times Square, il demeure ainsi un choix privilégié pour visiter Manhattan et parcourir ses moindres recoins sans avoir besoin de voiture
En plus, il permet de savourer l'ambiance nocturne de NEW YORK qui ne dort jamais 
Je le recommande vivement

title: topligging maar beetje lawaaierig
text:
We verbleven 3 nachten in dit hotel. Het is fantastisch gelegen op Times Square maar dat maakt ook dat er enige lawaaihinder is.  The city that never sleeps wordt hier zeer duidelijk; overdag en 's nachts bruist het leven daar.  Een venster open laten is dan ook onmogelijk.
Het hotel is ietwat gedateerd, wat je merkt in de kamer aan diverse details.  Wat verouderd interieur, bedhoofd dat schade vertoonde, vloerbekleding dit wat afgesleten is... 
De kamers zijn echter ruim, en wij hadden een groot en zeer goed liggend tweepersoonsbed.  Voldoende kast en bergruimte, safe, flatscreen, koelkastje.  De badkamer is in orde, met een douche.  
Ook op de gang hoor je vaak lawaai en de aangrenzende kamer was ondermaats geïsoleerd, in die mate dat we midden in de nacht mochten meegenieten van het liefdesspel van onze buren... ;-)
Het ontbijt is zeer goed en voldoende uitgebreid.  Prima naar Amerikaanse normen! 
De bar biedt een ruime kaart, maar zoals overal in NY zijn de prijzen werkelijk astronomisch hoog.  Voor een glaasje witte wijn ben je snel 20 dollar armer...
Een belangrijk MINPUNT was de betalende Wifi op de kamer!  Niet meer van deze tijd.
in de Lobby (nabij de bar..) was er wel gratis Wifi
Wij hebben genoten van NY en het hotel!

title: Great hotel in fab location
text: If your wanting to be in the heart of the action this is a good choice the bar has an awesome view over Times Square you really could not be better located for everything. The rooms are very comfortable and a good size we spent 5 nights here in March and we're delighted with it

title: Right in the middle of it all
text:
I really enjoyed this hotel. The decor, the people, the room, everything met our expectations. Like all NYC hotel rooms, it is a bit small as compared to other hotels in the country, but that is to be expected in NYC. The bathroom was quite large, the bed was very firm, but quite comfortable, and it was fairly quiet, despite overlooking a very busy avenue.

Everyone at the hotel was super friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again if I had to be in NYC.

title: Right in Time Square
text: This hotel is right in Time Square so very centrally located to Broadway & surrounding areas, perfect actually.  The Hop on Hop off Bus is literally right at the door.  Staff were very friendly & helpful, Wifi only free in Lobby & very expensive to buy.  The room was clean but in need of an update.  Shower good but again bathroom in need of renovation.  We were on the 8th floor so could hear sirens etc but wasn't too bad just added to the New York experience.

title: Great choice.
text:
Location is excellent. Right by time square. Views from the room are vintage and Bright with the square signs. Loved that. 

Staff was wonderful 

Bed and bedding perfect. 

The only thing and unfortunately it's my per peeve is the shower. Uncomfortable and stingy shower head that is not adjustable to water flow. Holiday inn had a better one so I would have expected this one to be wonderful for a nice shower before bed time. 

Restaurant is excellent. 

Regardless it's a great hotel

title: Ótima localização
text: O hotel está situado no coração de Nova York. Logo q chegamos sentimos q estávamos num ótimo ponto da cidade, Mas quando começamos a caminhar tivemos a certeza de q tínhamos escolhido o hotel certo para a nossa primeira viagem à Nova york. Fica próximo ao top of the rock, a algumas quadras do central park, próximo aos teatros da brodway. O quarto q ficamos era amplo, com frigobar. Enfim, nossa escolha foi acertada.

title: Local excelente, encravado na Times Square, confortavel, quarto excelente
text: Perto de tudo que pode ser turístico em New York. Ao lado de todos os teatros, várias opções de restaurantes, metro. Caminhando chega em qualquer lugar. A equipe do hotel e atenciosa, so o local do café da manhã que é pequeno, mas como nos Estados Unidos, os hotéis dificilmente oferecem café da manha incluído na diária, vale a pena ir para as centenas de opções próximas.

title: Fantastic Location. Highly Recommended!
text:
We stayed the weekend in NYC and chose this hotel, using Marriott points. We loved it. The staff were great- always kind and quick to answer questions with a smile.  

The location is pretty amazing. It's literally right on Times Square. The Lounge, the 3rd floor restaurant/night area, overlooks Times Square and it's so great for pictures and just people watching.

The room we stayed in had a king-sized bed. The sheets were clean, and everything seemed to work fine. If I had one complaint, it would be a very small one, in that the bathroom didn't have a locking door. That's a very minor complaint, but can be a slight annoyance.

We did have a very interesting happen second night. Someone tried to open our door after a quick knock, and scared my wife and I. I quickly jumped up and ran to the door, and looked through the people to see who it was. It looked like a hotel employee. He knocked on the door across from ours, opened it, and went in- and then came right back out after looking. A little freaked out we called the front desk, whereby they apologized, offered an explanation, and then then a free breakfast for my wife and I. It seems that the night staff made a mistake while checking rooms. There was an explanation, and it sounded like a fair one so we let it go. I only put it here in case somebody else goes to the hotel and has the same issue.

The breakfast was simple but tasty with excellent service.

Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

(Typed with my iPhone. Please pardon any typos.)

title: Great Location, Large Rooms
text: Although I am from the NYC area my company put me in a room here for a trade show we were doing at the Javits Center. The hotel room was beautiful and spacious. The lobby had a very stylish bar and restaurant. The hotel is on the northern side of Times Square within walking distance to everything. The cab ride to the Javits was $10-12. The staff was very friendly as well. I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family when they come to visit.

title: Really DISAPPOINTED
text: Am a Marriott Silver Elite member but that would not allow me to have breakfast seated near a window, only "Gold" elite members even allowed to enter the best area of the hotel for breakfast.  That area is a lounge overlooking Times Square. When my daughter, home for spring break and I (I am from NYC and live in NJ), went for 2 nights and "dared" to sit at the window at 8:15 pm for a glass of wine, we were actually asked to leave at 8:45 for a private party.  I was speechless, it is the lounge they promote on their website.  It is the nicest part of this dark hotel and its only lounge.  We were sent to the dark empty lobby with our drinks in hand and their "private" group showed up at 9:15.  This group were not there for food just drinks. Guess it took 25 minutes to have an empty table.  This on top of its entrance which is a dark dingy check in which requires a very slow (1 elevator out of service for my entire 2 day stay) up to the dark lobby to cross to the elevator to the rooms.  Absolutely, no coffee in the lobby for guests, unless eating $29 per person buffet breakfast in the dark lobby (other than the golden people who can enter the windowed area).  No water in the lobby anytime either. Only basic tv channels and definitely not high definition so small picture on a large set and every channel had "snow" on the screen.  Despite requesting tv reception and a shower faucet, that 50% of the water leaked through the top so no pressure in shower head, be repaired, nothing was done.  All this for over $325 per night.  Only plus was the location but there are a number of hotel options same area.  The staff was friendly and pleasant, except when we were refused entry or kicked out of the lounge. Never experienced this in any Marriott before.  I have stayed at the Marquis and should have again.  Go at your own risk, not worth any points you may ear, except if it gets you into the lounge for being special!

title: Nice hotel in Time Square
text: As a platinum member of the hotel i stayed for 3 nights at the hotel i must stay that its a great hotel. would recommend this hotel to other its close to most of the main attraction in new york. Very friendly staff at the hotel. only downside there wasn't turndown service after 9 pm and neither room service. but everything else was perfect

title: Birthday treat
text:
On arrival Dayna at reception quickly greeted us and informed us that we had a high floor room as repute stead and as it was my daughters birthday on 29 th February we could enjoy breakfast for free. The bellman Louis was also very friendly and took our luggage for us and explained how everything worked in the room.
Room was very clean bathroom very clean also lots of clean towels with a great shower and a deep bathtub.View out unto Broadway .
The location was great close to lots of restaurants,shows and 5 th avenue.
All staff we came across were very friendly our room was cleaned every day to a very high standard, Would not hesitate to stay here again 
Thank you Renaissance for a great stay

title: Worn down
text:
Hotel is old, rooms facing times square have noise from outside, even on higher floors. Staff friendlyness is mixed. Some are excellent, others are more like robots.
The basics like bed and shower are certainly allright, though.
All in all I would argue that this is a decent three star rather than a four star hotel, which is probably insufficient for the price or the Renaissance brand.

title: الموقع ممتاز جداً !!!!!!!!
text: المكان جيد، الموقع ممتاز جداً التايم سكوير امامك اول ماتطلع من الفندق، لكن الفندق قديم تم تجديده سنة ٢٠٠٧ ولازال قديم .. الصور التي موضوعه في الدسبلي شكل والحقيقه شكل اخر .. لم اتوقع ان الى هذه الدرجه قديم البناء. بشكل عام الموظفين متساعدين ودوم مبتسمين وليس هناج فطور مجاني .. انترنت سريع ومجاني في كل مكان في الفندق. اذا كنت تريد الموقع فهذا الموقع ممتاز جداً.

title: Solid Option for Work or Play
text:
Chose this hotel #1 I'm a Marriott member #2 quick 5 minute walk to my office #3 price was reasonable for Time Square. 

Location: Center of time square, if you don't want to be around tourists then find somewhere else. Otherwise perfect location for anything you want to do in the city... including eat at good restaurants. Prime view of time square from the restaurant/lounge area.

Rooms: clean, spacious, wonderful shower and really comfortable beds. Didn't hear much noise from my neighbors or on the floor in general.

Service: everyone I encountered was friendly and helpful. One note: they don't have room service. You can however get food in the lounge and take it back to your room. I liked hanging out in the lounge area so no bother but just a FYI. 

General: the decor while contemporary is a little weird. My team and I often joked about different things it reminded us of, made for great breakfast and even drinks conversations. 

If you are an elite member the buffet breakfast in the lounge is free, wifi is free and you'll get a free appetizer cards for every night you stay. The appetizers are SO good!

There's nothing over the top wow about this hotel but it's definitely a great solid option especially in NYC where there are a sea of hotels that can be a little suspect.

title: Great view on Times Square
text: Отлично расположенный отель сети Marriott. Достойное обслуживание. Особенно выделяет местоположение. Пегая доступность от мьюзик холл'ов; вид из окна на Times Square; прямо у входа останавливается sight seen автобус Hop on/ Hop off.

title: Great location, great service
text: This was my first trip to New York City and didn't know what to expect.  Chose the Renaissance Time Square Hotel hoping it would be a good experience.  I would go back in a New York minute.  The hotel was clean.  The staff was friendly, professional and exceeded my expectations.  Great views, great location, good work out center if you feel like burning off some calories from all the eating you'll do.  I wouldn't hesitate to go back to the Renaissance and would recommend it to anyone.

title: Location,Location,Location
text: There was no grand hotel lobby but the staff was very helpful and friendly.  The room was very nice with an updated bathroom. The bed was a little too firm for me but acceptable. It had a fantastic view of times square.  The room next to me was a little noisy.  They had a baby that was crying at 12:30am.  I requested a later check out time and it was given with no problem.  This hotel was in such a great location - steps from Times Square.  I would definitely stay here again!!!

title: Good location, but dirty bedsheets, and slow internet
text:
After a long set of flights, my son and I checked in at Renaissance Times Square in the late afternoon, and went out for dinner. After returning, we were tired due to jetlag, and were ready to go to bed. My son fell asleep almost immediately, and when I was about to go to bed I discovered that the bedsheets had multiple nasty looking stains. I suspect housekeeping had just re-made the bed after a previous guest without changing the bedsheets.

The next morning, I needed to use the internet to transfer a few files, and signed up for their $20/day "enhanced high speed internet" package. This turned out to be extremely slow; at times it was down to 5kbps download speeds.

Renaissance Times Square have a good location, and I guess that's what drives sales/bookings for them. Service and maintenance apparently comes further down the list for them...

title: Great location
text: Great location.  Awesome bar that over looks Times Square.  Friendly and polite staff.  Nice sized bed which was very comfortable.  Quiet considering location in the heart of NYC!  Room had a great view overlooking the corner of Times Square!

title: Long Weekend
text: It was a below zero weekend in NYC.  As it was Times Square, you have to enter the small lower lobby to check in and then proceed up the elevator to the main lobby.  We are a Platinum Marriott card holder and checked in early at 1:30.  The Front desk associate was very accommodating by getting a King and two doubles close in location for our children, high marks for her.  However only one elevator was working to get guests up to the main lobby from the FREEZING lower lobby.  The rooms were nice and bathrooms updated which is nice for the price in NYC.  The lounges were our biggest frustration!!  We of course wanted to sit near a window and peer out over the square, as one does in a tourist hotel in Times Square.  This is no secret to the hotel staff.  However, we were rudely spoken to from the host and manager of the lobby bar.  We were told there was not enough servers to accommodate the guests.  Really?  No, I don't accept this when we are paying a huge surplus to be in that hotel.  Get someone from another department or call in staff.  Or, here's a thought how about the manager help out!!  He did nothing but tell people, "no, you can't sit in that room."  Then they closed early on a long weekend and never gave us a last call.  Not impressed with the service.

title: AWESOME HOTEL
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here on our weekend getaway to NYC. This place is amazing. Matt in the concierge was amazing too. He put some things out in our room for a surprise for my boyfriend while we were out to dinner. ABSOLUTELY have to stay here!!

title: Good hotel...if the elevators worked
text: Frequent business traveler (150-175 nights/year) finishing up a trip to the Renaissance Times square. Have stayed here approximately 25 times in the past year, and it is a good hotel but will never come back. You enter the hotel from the street level and take an elevator to the 4th floor before transferring to other elevators to your room which is usually not a problem. But, for the past two days, the elevators have been broken and you now have to walk down four flights of stairs, go through the working areas (kitchen/laundry room/innards of the hotel) before being dumped out of the loading dock. When inquiring on when they would fix it got an attitude and a front desk employee who said "yeah they don't work" and walked away. Not something I would expect from a $300 a night establishment. Makes me wonder if I should keep frequenting if that is the attitude.

title: Great location
text:
The hotels location was just perfect.,

The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. 

The public areas were amazing and the view from breakfast was right onto times square.

i would recommend this hotel..

title: Stunning cocktail lounge
text: We visited the stunning R lounge, sampled some small plates and cocktails and watched the throng through the picture window on to Times Square. What's not to like about any of that. Cocktail waiter was lovely. Definitely worth a visit you won't be disappointed.

title: Couldn't ask for more.
text:
So I've stayed in 8 hotels in Manhattan. This being the most recent and only arrived back home yesterday. 
I made my mind up the moment we arrived. It's my favourite by far!
The holiday was booked as a birthday surprise for 1 of my 4 daughters. From the moment I booked I'd been liasing with a with a lovely lady named Michelle. 
She looked after us with a complimentary room upgrade, balloons & banners in our room, along with an invite to the r lounge, where, amongst the finest views over Times Square, we were delivered the most amazing cake & the staff sang happy birthday!! Wow. A birthday to remember forever!!

The location is hard to beat. It's nestled between m&m world & the red steps. The views are hard to beat. The food is very good. Service second to none and the ambiance incredible. 

The beds are divine, staff amazing & you'll find yourself right in amongst the hustle and bustle that's hard to forget in Manhattan! 

Around a 30 minute transfer from Newark, I have some advice for UK visitors. If you're planning on getting a shared shuttle to and from the airport, do it when you arrive at the airport. It's $20 per person each way-that's virtually half the price the I paid in advance. (Through travel republic). 

I'd like to thank all at the Renaissance for such a personable stay-I truly can't wait to return!!

title: La atención, la ubicación en el corazón de TSquare inigualable, los detalles en general, Si lo puedo pagar volveré.....
text: La habitación bien todo en general, ascensores también, accesos igual, desayuno y wifi para mi era de pago, no sé en otras reservaciones, el R Lounge con las vistas a time square inigualables, en NY siempre hay algo que ver y visitar así que en tu próxima visita puedes considerar al Renaissance.  He estado en otros hoteles y si no quieres sorpresas tienes que usar uno de una cadena, en otro caso si tuve malas experiencias.  mejor a lo seguro.

title: In the center of it all
text: It doesn't get better than this location wise.  This hotel is in the heart of Times Square and pretty much any room you stay in will have a view of the area surrounding Times Square. The rooms are also a good size and very cozy. If you can visit the concierge lounge then that is the ultimate experience when it comes to this hotel as you are overlooking Times Square and all the madness of people walking around and the big jumbo screens. The staff is friendly considering it is NYC and overall have enjoyed my stays at this hotel through the years.

title: Perfect location
text: I stayed in the Renaissance Times Square for 4 nights and cannot fault the hotel. Extremely comfortable rooms, lovely lobby and bar (every evening we skipped restaurant deserts for a cookie skillet overlooking Times Square !). You really should book this hotel if you want the perfect central location, comfort and reasonable value.

title: Great place to stay at reasonable NY pricing
text: Have been staying in this hotel for weeks and will be for several more weeks while I work and transition to moving into the area. They are working with me on pricing, the rooms are large and nice, the restaurant has good food and breakfast is free...full breakfast.

title: Renaissance TS
text: A localização é fantástica. O hotel fica muito perto da sede da empresa em NY mas, ainda mais interessante, é a proximidade da Times Square e Rockefeller center. Sentí falta apenas de um frigobar com opções de consumo mas entendo que um frigobar vazio no quarto pode ser muito útil para a maioria dos visitantes que estão passeando na cidade.

title: Amazing Experience in the Heart of Times Square
text:
It has been several years since I have stayed at the Renaissance Times Square and, although I have always had memorable experiences here, this was my best visit yet.  I was very impressed with how my traveler preferences (to include a quiet room, which is hard to achieve in Times Square) were perfectly met in Room 2618, a corner location on the highest floor of the hotel. The décor definitely gave the property the feel of a boutique hotel and I was thrilled with the amenities and housekeeping.  And, of course, the hotel is literally in the heart of Times Square, within steps of the TKTS booth (which I highly recommend for discounted Broadway tickets).  

On this visit to NYC, I was traveling with a student group and I was especially grateful that each member of our group also had such a wonderful experience.  In fact, one of our NYC site visits was cancelled so Katie Barnes quickly offered to arrange for us to meet with Kewanna and the marketing staff at Marriott to discuss how they seek to promote this beautiful property to travelers from around the world.  Honestly, I was overwhelmed with their generosity and willingness to spend time with our students.  Their kind professionalism far exceeded expectations and we are already looking forward to a return visit next year!

title: Where to start
text: So central location hotel with ideas well above its station. On a practical level whilst being central it does mean if you take a cab you spend a lot of time sitting in a cab going nowhere fast and you also get pestered by the city tour bus operators and comedy central sellers constantly.  The hotel is split - you enter at reception - not enormously friendly and take a lift to the lobby/concierge area where you then take a second set of lifts to the rooms.  One of the two lifts at reception level didn't work for our entire stay and on one evening both lifts failed...service stairs it is.....if you're thinking of booking because there is a gym - don't....the gym is out of action (they don't tell you when you book) so you end up on a running machine in a spare hotel room - weird.  Breakfast - $30 for a buffet breakfast....we didn't partake on the basis that breakfast would have cost us just under $100 a day - very good diner around the corner.....now the bar....their much advertised bar....nice bar but on our first evening as hotel guests turned away as we didn't have a reservation - the bar wasn't full.....asked if we needed to book for the following evening - told no - turned up - do you have a reservation?  No you told us we didn't need to book...eventually found a table - bar empty....very limited cocktail and wine list...and for a bar that thinks its great for its views, having a TV on one side of its glassed wall blocking the view is a bit odd.  The one evening the bar came alive it was for a private party which as a hotel  guest coming back after an evening out and wanting a nightcap I had to go through several layers of hotel security before then getting a drink.  Don't even mention this bar/hotel at lunchtime- bar closed and a fridge full of pre-prepared sandwiches and nothing more....this hotel is budget in what it offers but expensive in price....thank goodness we are only here for half our week in New York

title: El mejor hotel con la mejor ubicación!!
text: El hotel es perfecto. La ubicación es inmejorable ya que salís y estás en medio de Times Square. Muy Limpio, con habitaciones bastante amplias con vistas a la ciudad. El R Lounge tiene un ventanal gigante que da a TS. Wifi pago. La atención del personal es muy buena. Excelente opción si quieres estar cerca de todo!!

title: Great location...costly everything else
text: Check in was easy but our room was/is very small.  It is obvious one is paying for the location.  I much prefer the Marriott Marquis.  Much more comfortable surroundings.  At least it is cheaper than the Waldorf which has even small and out dated rooms.  Staying in the city is a learning experience.  Our favorite hotel is still the Salisbury.

title: Perfect Location for a  December Weekend - or anytime!
text:
I went to New York City with my sister (a Marriott Rewards member) in December for a weekend of Christmas markets, shopping and good food.  She used points to get us a beautiful room at the Renaissance and it was well worth it.  We had a good sized room (two double beds) with a street, city view and a well appointed bathroom.  Everything is in your room - safe, minibar, free bottles of water, robes, upscale toiletries, spacious closet and drawers - we had it all.  But the best part is their newly refurbished lounge and bar area.  The "living room" and the R bar are beautiful - offer small areas for quieter chats or working on a laptop as well as magnificent views over the city.  We had the breakfast buffet in the R lounge and it was substantial - but looking out over Times Square was the biggest perk.  You are literally sitting right behind the bleachers at the Half Price Tickets booth.  

The other benefit offered by the hotel is its proximity to transportation (two subway lines are within minutes of walking distance) and Central Park is only a little more than a ten minute walk.  Times Square, Rockefeller Center and the theater district are at your front door.  

Check in service, maid service and service in the bar were always prompt and no question went unanswered from the Concierge desk in the lounge.  In short it is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location for a weekend stay anytime of the year - putting you right in the heart of the Big Apple!

title: Proximity to the theaters is the best thing about this hotel - and Omar!
text:
I'm in New York all of the time for work and usually avoid the Times Square area like the plague. I booked here for the weekend because I brought my adult daughter up and she wanted to see a show, A few days before arrival I called to get help booking theater tickets and Omar was amazingly helpful. Thanks, Omar. The Broadway theaters are within walking distance.
It takes 2 elevators to get to the rooms from the street which is quite inconvenient and off-putting. It would be great to know that from the website. The hotel also doesn't treat status members any differently than anyone else which is disappointing.

title: Not up to par
text: The hotel needs some serious maintenance.  The location is great, literally in Times Square.  However, they have a strange elevated lobby and the elevators to get you there are past their prime.  We got brought up on the freight elevator and then marched through the kitchens.  The hotel is also dinged up around the edges everywhere. For the price and for the brand, not up to par.

title: The bar with the best view of Times Square
text: This hotel bar has to have the best view of Times Square. The atmosphere is perfect for a nice meal and drinks. The prices are not bad for the quality and the views that is included. The service is top notch! We cannot wait to return on our next visit to NYC!!!

title: In the heart of the action
text: This hotel decror is very unique.  Service and restaurant food is good. The rooms are small but comfortable.  The bar overlooks Times Square with a great view.  I recommend eating breakfast.  A short walk to Times Square Attractions like M and M store.  A little pricey but you will save on cab fare because you can walk everywhere.

title: Roomy and the Bar is FAB
text:
Great location, right on Time Square. Very large rooms for NY.
Style of hotel is sensual and relaxing. We will stay here again.
The bar overlooks the Square, go in after your show and grab a seat by the windows and enjoy the lights.
Beds were comfy and very spacious. Ask to be on a higher floor and of course upgrade to see the lights!

title: Great time, great people.
text: Great place and great people. Right at the center of Time Square; we stayed  at the Renaissance for my birthday and the Superbowl, the  concierge was on hand for advice and sorted tickets you the Tonic bar for Superbowl celebrations. The wait staff were attentive and polite  always ready with a smile and the room service was great (considering we stayed during snow and rain, so our clothes often ended up on the floor),our room was always fresh and clean. This really is location, location, location as we were able to get from the top to the bottom of Manhattan without any trouble.

title: Wonderful Hotel for a Quick Getaway to New York
text: My husband and I wanted a quick getaway to New York. What better place than the Renaissance Times Square? The location is fantastic and the staff is great. Flaridana and Kayla at the front desk made check in a breeze.Rafael in the restaurant made our breakfast so enjoyable!

title: Great location, helpful staff
text: The hotel is convenient to public transport, half price ticket office, Broadway, Hell's Kitchen restaurants, Easy walking to many attractions. The concierge was friendly and helpful and provided excellent suggestions for eating places - and phoned ahead for us. Rooms were quiet and well appointed. The ability to open windows for fresh air was a bonus.Being so close to the half price ticket office was convenient. Vouchers provided by the concierge for cut price theatre tickets were a real bonus.

title: Surprisingly calm for time square - try to get an upper floor
text: Surprisingly calm for time square - try to get an upper floor. With a room on level 7 or much higher on the east side to Broadway you can have a calm stay, even dor time square. Short walks to shows, nice time square view from breakfast room.   Would do it again.

title: Very centrally located but....
text:
Location great, slap bang in the middle of Times Square. This has its obvious advantage as you can go anywhere in foot very easily. Disadvantage.... If you hail a cab you don't move for ages with traffic..... Not helpful when trying to get to the airport. 
The bar in the hotel has the most amazing views of Times Square. Definitely worth a visit. Food was good too. 
Staff helpful although during the day there's very little on offer with regards food. On two occasions during my stay the bar was booked for a private function so you couldn't get in for lunch or afternoon cocktails. 
The rooms were fine.... Mine had a great view but they are dated and worn. It's getting time for a revamp!

title: Great Location...
text:
...great suite.  The staff at the Renaissance was not only helpful, but friendly and gracious.  We stayed in a suite on the concierge level - my husband and I, and three adult kids.  They quickly supplied us a roll-out when they discovered we were going to be short a bed.  The maid service was thorough - our room was spotless, with plenty of towels and bathing supplies for both bathrooms.

It is a stone's throw from Times Square and the theaters, Radio City Music Hall, the Diamond District, Herald Square, and many fine restaurants.

title: In the heart of the action!
text: This hotel is where you want to be on your first visit to Manhattan! Clean, modern comfortable rooms.  The R Lounge has a perfect view of time square however the service leaves a little to be desired. Overall a great hotel!

title: What a beautiful Times Square weekend!!!!
text: This place is so convenient but spectacular to Times Square!!!!!  We had a king size bed on the 6th floor with a beautiful view of Broadway!!!!   We went all around Times Square at night and a bus tour!!!!  We had a drink in the lounge before going out!!!  It is beautiful!!!!!  We ate breakfast in the hotel overlooking Times Square!!!  The view was amazing and the food was great!!!!  We loved everything about this place!!!! We would definitely return!!!

title: Great location, wonderful staff
text:
This is a great hotel located 50 steps from Times Square. The rooms are well laid out with comfortable beds and a great pillow menu. The staff are extremely helpful, friendly and knowledgeable about the area. After checking you will take the elevator up one floor to a chic little lobby area. There is a great bookshelf and activities like a giant connect four game and some adult coloring sheets to keep you occupied during your downtime. There is also a restaurant and a lounge in the lobby area. Once you cross through the lobby head over to the elevators that will take you up to your room. 
The only issue we had was the buffet for breakfast was overpriced for what you got. The hot meal items were lukewarm at best. Save your money  and walk a few blocks to Juniors.
Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to couples and those interested in seeing the sights of Manhattan. You are in close proximity to all the major attractions.

title: Super
text: Sehr schönes Hotel habe gut geschlafen bette sind sehr gut. Ambiente sehr gut. Sehr freundliches Personal sehr hilfsbereit  . Super Lage hat mir sehr gut  gefallen. Ich war leider nur 2 Tage dort und war sehr im Stress .  Ich komme wieder mit meiner Familie . Danke

title: Goed hotel, perfecte locatie
text:
Mijn man en ik hebben hier 2 nachten verbleven in januari. De kamer is mooi, fijn bed en douche én we hadden een schitterend uitzicht. Hotel is dichtbij metro. 

Minpunten waren: Geen gratis wifi op de kamer (wel in lounge) en de minibar was niet gevuld. 

Zou hier zeker weer verblijven, maar voor een hotel in deze prijsklasse zou complimentary wifi wel inbegrepen mogen zijn.

title: Work
text: Good location central to all parts of the city. Easy to get about with the underground. Friendly staff at hotel. Comfortable and clean rooms. Breakfast available but no room service. Fridge in room. This hotel is all about location if you like to experience the hustle and bustle of this awesome city.

title: USA 1st Stop
text:
My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in January. Reception staff were friendly and our room was nice, a little small, but very clean. 
The bar has an amazing view over TimeSquare, so every guest should take time out to relax and have a drink in there. Although it's not open late afternoon which is a shame. (After 5 or 5.30 I think) 
Location is fabulous!! Easy route to where ever you need to go in NYC and the front desk is always there to help you out - Central Park, Macy's, Century 21 downtown, Empire State, Brooklyn...
Ask for a quick direction to the Italian on The Avenues, 3-5 mins walk & simply delicious!

title: Muito bem localizado
text:
Hotel muito bem localizado, no meio da Times Square, o que nao significa que seus quartos sejam barulhentos, muito pelo contrario. O isolamento acustico é nota 10, check in/out agil e eficiente, cafe da manha pago mas muito bom, vista do restaurante nota 10, direto para a Times square e funcionarios muito gentis.
Melhor lugar para ficar em NYC.

title: Great locations, great hotel
text: One of the best locations, you can stay in New York City, very friendly staff, large comfortable bad, actually room is truly awesome. Everything works perfectly. You can't make a mistake with Renaissance NYC by Mariott.

title: Centro de NY
text: Ficamos hospedados na Times Square, próximo a tudo, centro de Manhattan, apesar de estarmos no centro, o hotel era bem silencioso e não se escutava o barulho esterno. A internet no hotel era paga, mas conseguíamos acessar via WiFi da Times Square, afinal de contas todo local em NY tem acesso WiFi grátis.

title: A melhor opção em Times Square
text: O Renaissance New York Hotel Times Square é um dos melhores hotéis da rede Marriott na cidade, perdendo apenas para o Ritz-Carlton e Essex House. Vale ficar aqui se o motivo da sua viagem incluir diversas idas aos teatros da Broadway. Localizado no coração de Times Square, este hotel possui quartos amplos e ótimas vistas da cidade. Excelente café da manhã e funcionários atenciosos.

title: On the red stairs, perfect location
text: Stayed here with my son, we both liked the bed. Cleaning, eating, sleaping good and well informed staff. Very good location if you want to see NY center monuments and feel the city from in side and feel comfortable to com back after a day trip around the city.

title: Lovely hotel, great location
text: I stayed at the Renaissance for two days on a business trip.  The hotel is well appointed, with lovely views of Times Square from the lobby area lounge.  The rooms were spacious by NYC standards and the furnishings comfortable.  A little more wear and tear on the couch than I would have expected.  The gym was nothing special, but in good shape with sufficient equipment.

title: Great location!
text: If you're looking to be in the center of it all, this is the hotel for you! My boyfriend and I stayed here for a weekend getaway to NYC, and the placement in Times Square was perfect.  You can walk to so many things, there's a metro stop right next to the hotel, and Broadway shows are at your doorstep.  Great views from the hotel rooms, and it's very clean. I would stay here again!

title: Friendly staff but many issues
text: First, all the staff, except the bartenders were very friendly and service oriented. Room was nice as well. However you have to take an elevator to the lobby, which is small, and from there take another elevator bank to your rooms. Every day I was here the lobby to street elevator had electrical issues, so guests had to walk through the kitchen and down service stairs. I also went to get a bite to eat when I arrived and the bar menu was really limited. I ordered 3 sliders which were ok, but they didn't give me silverware or condiments. When I asked, the woman grunted and slid some silverware my way and two McDonald ketchup pouches! Really, I mean first they don't have ketchup in a bottle and second they could give me 3 ketchups. That and the fact it's right in an area I normally wouldn't stay, I can say I will not one back here again.

title: Good Location, but pricey compared to some of the other hotels in the area
text: Good Location, but Pricey compared to some of the other hotels in the area.  Parking is also $65.00 a night.  Easily 400+ a night or higher.  Room are average size which is big for city hotels and more importantly VERY clean.  A little disappointed in the amenities for Elite members.  Woke up a late due to being on west coast time and just wanted a cup of tea.  Received a lukewarm cup of tea for $6.00 from a coffee dispenser.
